original: @1b # // tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: @1b # // tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu gnyis pa /
translated: Book Twelve

original: slob dpon gyis tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos bshad pa'i rgyu rjes su dpag pa rnam par bzhag nas /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos bshad pa'i rgyu rjes su dpag pa rnam par bzhag nas /
translated: Having presented the inference of the cause of the treatise on the definition of valid knowledge,

original: skabs su bab pa tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyag 'tshal ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i bshad pa mdzad par rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyag 'tshal ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i bshad pa mdzad par rtsom pa'o //
translated: the master begins the explanation of the verse of homage, beginning with Valid knowledge, and so on.

original: tshad mar gyur ba zhes bya ba ni tshad mar 'khrungs pa'o //
analyzed: tshad mar gyur ba zhes bya ba ni tshad mar 'khrungs pa'o //
translated: Having become valid means having arisen as valid.

original: tshad ma dang 'dra bas na tshad ma ste bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: tshad ma dang 'dra bas na tshad ma ste bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Valid is similar to valid knowledge, referring to the BhagavƒÅn.

original: tshad ma'i ngo bo de ci zhig yin na /
analyzed: tshad ma'i ngo bo de ci zhig yin na /
translated: What is the nature of valid knowledge?

original: gang gis de dang 'dra bar dam bca' bar byed ce na /
analyzed: gang gis de dang 'dra bar dam bca' bar byed ce na /
translated: By what is it to be asserted as such?

original: tshad ma slu med can shes pa //
analyzed: tshad ma slu med can shes pa //
translated: Valid knowledge is non-deceptive cognition.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is stated.

original: slu bar byed pas na slu ba'o //
analyzed: slu bar byed pas na slu ba'o //
translated: Deceptive means that which deceives.

original: shes pa gang la de yod pa de ni slu ba can no //
analyzed: shes pa gang la de yod pa de ni slu ba can no //
translated: That which has that is deceptive.

original: slu ba yod pa ma yin pa can ni slu ba med pa can te /
analyzed: slu ba yod pa ma yin pa can ni slu ba med pa can te /
translated: That which does not have deception is non-deceptive.

original: gang la slu ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: gang la slu ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnon-deceptive‚Äù is that which does not deceive.

original: mi slu ba de yang don yongs su bcad nas 'jug pa na don gyi rang gi nus pa grub pas /
analyzed: mi slu ba de yang don yongs su bcad nas 'jug pa na don gyi rang gi nus pa grub pas /
translated: And that non-deceptive cognition, when it engages by determining the object, is established by the power of the object itself.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i don de lta bu'i ngo bo'i mi slu ba ni yul gyi chos dang / de'i de lta bur gyur pa rtogs pa na shes pa'i mi slu ba ni yul can gyi chos yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i don de lta bu'i ngo bo'i mi slu ba ni yul gyi chos dang / de'i de lta bur gyur pa rtogs pa na shes pa'i mi slu ba ni yul can gyi chos yin no //
translated: The non-deceptiveness of the object in the form of the desired object is the property of the object, and the non-deceptiveness of the cognition in the form of realizing that object is the property of the subject.

original: de gang @2a * //
analyzed: de gang @2a * //
translated: What is that?

original: la yod pa de ni slu ba med pa can gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: la yod pa de ni slu ba med pa can gyi shes pa'o //
translated: That is the cognition that is non-deceptive.

original: rjes su dpag pas don gyi rnag gi ngo bo yongs su ma bcad pa'i phyir khyab pa med pas na de ni mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas don gyi rnag gi ngo bo yongs su ma bcad pa'i phyir khyab pa med pas na de ni mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: Because inference does not determine the nature of the object, there is no pervasion, so that is not reasonable.

original: skyes bu ma bslus pas na mi slu ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don dang phrad par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'i khyad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu ma bslus pas na mi slu ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don dang phrad par byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'i khyad par byed pa yin no //
translated: Non-deceptiveness, which is not deceiving a person, is the characteristic of direct perception and inference that brings about the attainment of the desired object.

original: de nyid rnam par 'grel pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par 'grel pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to explain that very point,üîΩhe says:

original: don byed nus par gnas pa ni //
analyzed: don byed nus par gnas pa ni //
translated: The means of valid knowledge is that which is non-deceptive with regard to the object which is to be established by the object which is ascertained by the means of valid knowledge.üîΩJust as one engages in the activity of burning, cooking, etc. with regard to fire, having ascertained it by means of perception, and just as one engages in the activity of going, etc. with regard to a man, having ascertained him by means of perception, in the same way one engages in the activity of inferring fire, having ascertained smoke as the sign of fire.üîΩThe author of the Nyayabindu says:

original: mi slu yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi slu yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The means of valid knowledge is that which is non-deceptive.

original: tshad mas yongs su nges pa'i don gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshad mas yongs su nges pa'i don gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The means of valid knowledge is that which is non-deceptive with regard to the object which is to be established by the object which is ascertained by the means of valid knowledge.

original: ji ltar mngon sum gyis shes nas mes sreg pa dang / 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i nus pa la 'jug pa de'i dro ba'i reg pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi mngon sum dang ji ltar 'ga' zhig gi tshe mi nyid la rnam pa mtshungs pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis 'khrul pa du ba las me nges par
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum gyis shes nas mes sreg pa dang / 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i nus pa la 'jug pa de'i dro ba'i reg pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi mngon sum dang ji ltar 'ga' zhig gi tshe mi nyid la rnam pa mtshungs pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis 'khrul pa du ba las me nges par
translated: Just as one engages in the activity of burning, cooking, etc. with regard to fire, having ascertained it by means of perception, and just as one engages in the activity of going, etc. with regard to a man, having ascertained him by means of perception, in the same way one engages in the activity of inferring fire, having ascertained smoke as the sign of fire.üîΩThe author of the Nyayabindu says:

original: byas pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i 'jug pa mi slu ba yin no //
analyzed: byas pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i 'jug pa mi slu ba yin no //
translated: The means of valid knowledge is that which is non-deceptive.üîΩThe means of valid knowledge is that which is non-deceptive with regard to the object which is to be established by the object which is ascertained by the means of valid knowledge.

original: mngon sum nyid la 'khrul pa'i rgyu sna tshogs pa nyid kyis slu ba srid pa'i phyir de'i don gyi don byed pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma phyi ma 'jug pas tshad ma nyid du rtogs par bya'i /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid la 'khrul pa'i rgyu sna tshogs pa nyid kyis slu ba srid pa'i phyir de'i don gyi don byed pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma phyi ma 'jug pas tshad ma nyid du rtogs par bya'i /
translated: Just as one engages in the activity of burning, cooking, etc. with regard to fire, having ascertained it by means of perception, and just as one engages in the activity of going, etc. with regard to a man, having ascertained him by means of perception, in the same way one engages in the activity of inferring fire, having ascertained smoke as the sign of fire.üîΩThe author of the Nyayabindu says:

original: rjes su dpag pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The means of valid knowledge is that which is non-deceptive.üîΩThe means of valid knowledge is that which is non-deceptive with regard to the object which is to be established by the object which is ascertained by the means of valid knowledge.üîΩJust as one engages in the activity of burning, cooking

original: de ltar de'i rang bzhin can nam /
analyzed: de ltar de'i rang bzhin can nam /
translated: Thus, it is the nature of that.üîΩ

original: 'bras bu'i rtags dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid @2b dang / dngos po'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa ni rtags can gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin pas na /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid @2b dang / dngos po'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa ni rtags can gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin pas na /
translated: Thus, the sign of the nature of the thing itself or the sign of the effect of the thing itself is the cause of the cognition of the one possessing the sign.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po med par rjes su dpag pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po med par rjes su dpag pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since there is no inference of a non-existent thing,

original: phyis kyi tshad ma'i 'jug pa la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyis kyi tshad ma'i 'jug pa la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: it does not depend on the later engagement of valid knowledge.

original: gzhan dag tu mi mngon sum dang der snang ba dag skye ba'i tshe khyad par nges pa med na de ni phyis kyi tshad ma 'jug pas mi slu bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag tu mi mngon sum dang der snang ba dag skye ba'i tshe khyad par nges pa med na de ni phyis kyi tshad ma 'jug pas mi slu bar rig par bya'o //
translated: In other cases, if there is no ascertainment of the difference between the non-appearance and the appearance, then later valid knowledge engages it and it should be known to be non-deceptive.

original: gal te phyis kyi mngon sum yang mngon sum snga ma dang khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te phyis kyi mngon sum yang mngon sum snga ma dang khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: If the later direct perception is also not different from the earlier direct perception,

original: dngos po la 'jug pa ma yin par the tshom za bas mi 'khrul par nges par nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po la 'jug pa ma yin par the tshom za bas mi 'khrul par nges par nus pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then since it is doubted that it does not engage the thing, it is not able to ascertain non-deceptiveness.

original: ma yin te gnyis ka dngos po med par mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te gnyis ka dngos po med par mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because both do not engage the non-existent thing.

original: me med pa la me 'dzin pa can gyi 'jug par byed pa las /
analyzed: me med pa la me 'dzin pa can gyi 'jug par byed pa las /
translated: In the absence of fire, one who apprehends fire is engaged.

original: 'jug pa'i sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi phyis kyi shes pa skye ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi phyis kyi shes pa skye ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But when there is no fire, the subsequent cognition that is the subject of the object of engaging in burning and cooking, etc. does not arise from the engagement that apprehends fire,

original: de ni dngos po'i rten can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po'i rten can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is based on an entity.

original: skye na yang mi slu ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: skye na yang mi slu ba kho na yin te /
translated: Even if it arises, it is nondeceptive,

original: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa bzhin du don byed pa thob pa'i phyir dang / dngos po ni de tsam gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa bzhin du don byed pa thob pa'i phyir dang / dngos po ni de tsam gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it obtains the object‚Äôs functioning as desired and because the entity is the cause of just that.

original: de ltar na phyi ma dngos po'i yul can nyid yin na /
analyzed: de ltar na phyi ma dngos po'i yul can nyid yin na /
translated: Thus, if the latter is the subject of an entity,

original: snga ma de la mi slu ba can yin no //
analyzed: snga ma de la mi slu ba can yin no //
translated: the former is nondeceptive with regard to it.

original: gal te sngar bzung ba'i don phyis kyi tshad mas rtogs pa ma yin na /üîΩde ji ltar na des yongs su bcad pa'i don byed pa'i yul can gang gis na /
analyzed: gal te sngar bzung ba'i don phyis kyi tshad mas rtogs pa ma yin na / de ji ltar na des yongs su bcad pa'i don byed pa'i yul can gang gis na /
translated: If the object apprehended earlier is not realized by the valid knowledge that arises later,

original: de'i don byed pa de las mi slu ba'i phyir de la tshad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i don byed pa de las mi slu ba'i phyir de la tshad ma yin zhe na /
translated: how can the object that is the object of the functioning of the object that is delimited by that valid knowledge be nondeceptive with regard to that object?üîΩHow can that valid knowledge be valid with regard to it?

original: ma yin te tha snyad 'dogs pa po dag tha dad pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir tha snyad kyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: ma yin te tha snyad 'dogs pa po dag tha dad pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir tha snyad kyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: No, because the users of conventions are not different.üîΩ

original: dus snga phyir 'byung ba can la gcig tu 'jug par brjod do //
analyzed: dus snga phyir 'byung ba can la gcig tu 'jug par brjod do //
translated: No, because the users of the designations are not different, we follow the designations and say that they apply to things that occur earlier and later.

original: dngos su ni tha dad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dngos su ni tha dad pa nyid yin no //
translated: In reality, they are different.

original: de ltar na phyis kyi tshad ma'i yul gyi dngos po ni /
analyzed: de ltar na phyis kyi tshad ma'i yul gyi dngos po ni /
translated: Thus, the object of the later valid cognition

original: tshad ma snga ma'i yul med na med pa'i phyir de yang de'i yul can nyid yin no zhes nye bar brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma snga ma'i yul med na med pa'i phyir de yang de'i yul can nyid yin no zhes nye bar brtags pa yin no //
translated: is the object of the earlier valid cognition, because it does not exist if the earlier valid cognition does not exist.

original: de bas na sngar dngos po grub pa'i phyir dang po nyid tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sngar dngos po grub pa'i phyir dang po nyid tshad ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the earlier one is valid cognition, because the object is established by it.

original: de las don byed pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las don byed pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it engages in the performance of the object‚Äôs function.

original: gang gis phyi rol gyi don med pa de'i tshad mas yongs su bcad pa'i don gyi yul ni tshad ma phyi ma de'i rgyu nyid yin par mi slu ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gis phyi rol gyi don med pa de'i tshad mas yongs su bcad pa'i don gyi yul ni tshad ma phyi ma de'i rgyu nyid yin par mi slu ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The object of the later valid cognition is not the cause of the later valid cognition, because the object of the later valid cognition is not the object of the earlier valid cognition.

original: 'on kyang ji ltar 'dod pa'i don byed par snang ba can gyi shes pa rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar 'dod pa'i don byed par snang ba can gyi shes pa rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: But the cause is the cognition that appears to perform the function desired.

original: gang la de med pa de ni tshad ma @3a * //
analyzed: gang la de med pa de ni tshad ma @3a * //
translated: That which does not have that is not a valid cognition.

original: ma yin pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: ma yin pa de ltar na 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus there is no contradiction.

original: phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin na yang de ltar snang ba can gyi shes pa skye ba can nyid ni skyes bu'i don yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin na yang de ltar snang ba can gyi shes pa skye ba can nyid ni skyes bu'i don yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Even though external objects do not exist, the arising of a cognition that appears as such is the purpose of a person.

original: phyi rol gyi don yod pa dang / cig shos smra ba dag gi don dam par mi slu ba la bye brag ci yang med do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yod pa dang / cig shos smra ba dag gi don dam par mi slu ba la bye brag ci yang med do //
translated: Thus, whether external objects exist or not, there is no difference in the ultimate nondeceptiveness of the other proponents of objects.

original: mi slu ba de dang de nges pa gang yin pa de ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi slu ba de dang de nges pa gang yin pa de ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that nondeceptiveness and the ascertainment of that are valid knowledge,

original: the tshom za ba'i shes pa la sogs pa ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i shes pa la sogs pa ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: doubtful consciousness and so on are not valid knowledge.

original: gal te skyes bu'i 'jug pa la yang gags yod pas /
analyzed: gal te skyes bu'i 'jug pa la yang gags yod pas /
translated: If you say that even engagement by a person is obstructed,

original: tshad ma yang slu ba srid pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma yang slu ba srid pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and because it is possible that valid knowledge is deceptive, it is not valid knowledge,

original: de ni tshad mas nges par 'dod pa'i don dang phrad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshad mas nges par 'dod pa'i don dang phrad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it has contact with the object that is ascertained by the valid cognition.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: de las mngon par 'dod pa nyid dang phrad pa yin no //
analyzed: de las mngon par 'dod pa nyid dang phrad pa yin no //
translated: It is that it has contact with the object that is desired.

original: 'jug pa yod na tshad ma phrag par byed pa nyid yin pa de ltar na phrad par nus pa tshad ma nyid yin gyi phrad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa yod na tshad ma phrag par byed pa nyid yin pa de ltar na phrad par nus pa tshad ma nyid yin gyi phrad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: When there is engagement, it is the valid cognition that makes contact. In that case, that which is able to make contact is the valid cognition, but it is not that it makes contact.

original: nus pa de nyid 'di'i mi slu ba yin par brjod pa'i phyir skyon yod pa ma yin no//
analyzed: nus pa de nyid 'di'i mi slu ba yin par brjod pa'i phyir skyon yod pa ma yin no//
translated: Since we say that that very ability is its nondeceptiveness, there is no fault.

original: gal te 'di ltar mi slu ba tshad ma nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar mi slu ba tshad ma nyid yin na /
translated: If nondeceptiveness is valid knowledge,

original: de dang de spra las byung ba la med pa'i phyir tshad mar mi 'gyur na yang 'dod pa des na khyab pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dang de spra las byung ba la med pa'i phyir tshad mar mi 'gyur na yang 'dod pa des na khyab pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then since it does not exist in that which arises from a sense object, it would not be valid knowledge. Since that is asserted, the fault of the definition being too narrow would arise.

original: khyab pa med pa de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa med pa de ni ma yin no //
translated: That is not the case.

original: de ltar na gang la 'di'i 'khrul pa rab tu ston pa de la tshad mar 'dod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sgra 'byung yang bsam pa dag ni ston phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gang la 'di'i 'khrul pa rab tu ston pa de la tshad mar 'dod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang sgra 'byung yang bsam pa dag ni ston phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is not that what reveals its error is not accepted as valid cognition, but rather that sound is produced in order to reveal the pure intention.

original: mi slu ba yin te zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug go //üîΩskyes bu'i bsam pa ston par byed pa de ltar na de ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi slu ba yin te zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug go // skyes bu'i bsam pa ston par byed pa de ltar na de ston pa'i phyir /
translated: The word non-deceptive is applied.

original: 'di ni tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: The revealing of the person's intention is like that. Therefore, it is said: Because it reveals that, it is valid cognition.

original: 'chad pa po'i byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: 'chad pa po'i byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid 'chad par byed de /
translated: The word revealing is explained by the activity of the speaker, etc.

original: 'chad pa po'i byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'chad pa po'i byed pa ste /
translated: The activity of the speaker is the activity of the one who speaks.

original: yang dag par 'dod pa dang brjod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dod pa dang brjod par 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Up to the desire to express what is correctly intended.

original: de'i yul gyi don gang yin pa rab tu gsal zhing so sor snang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i yul gyi don gang yin pa rab tu gsal zhing so sor snang ba'o //
translated: The object of that is the object that is clearly and individually apparent.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: rnam par rtog pa'i blo la'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blo la'o //
translated: In the conceptual mind.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i yul gyi don de la sgra 'di ni tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i yul gyi don de la sgra 'di ni tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: That sound is valid cognition with regard to the object that is the intended meaning to be expressed.

original: 'chad pa po don der snang ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa sgra las rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'chad pa po don der snang ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa sgra las rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The speaker is understood from the sound, in the aspect of the appearance of that object.

original: don de shes pa na 'di ni tshad ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don de shes pa na 'di ni tshad ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When that object is known, it is valid knowledge.

original: don gyi de nyid rgyu can min tshad ma nyid kyang ma yin na gang gis na khyab pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur gal te gang gis @3b shes nas 'jug par 'gyur ba'i don byed par mi slu ba de ni de la tshad ma nyid yin pa
analyzed: don gyi de nyid rgyu can min tshad ma nyid kyang ma yin na gang gis na khyab pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur gal te gang gis @3b shes nas 'jug par 'gyur ba'i don byed par mi slu ba de ni de la tshad ma nyid yin pa
translated: If the object's reality is not the cause, it is not valid knowledge. By what is the definition of non-pervasion? If it is the non-deceptive engagement with the object that is known, that is valid knowledge.üîΩAt that time,

original: de'i tshe / bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa las //
analyzed: de'i tshe / bum pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa las //
translated: the conceptual consciousness of a pot,

original: bum pa la 'jug pa de'i don byed par mi slu bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: bum pa la 'jug pa de'i don byed par mi slu bar 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: the engagement with a pot, is non-deceptive with regard to the function of that object.

original: de yang tshad mar gyur na mi 'dod pa de bas na mtshan nyid zhugs pa yin no zhe na skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang tshad mar gyur na mi 'dod pa de bas na mtshan nyid zhugs pa yin no zhe na skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If that were valid knowledge, it would not be accepted. Therefore, the definition is included.

original: bzung ba 'dzin phyir kun rdzob ni //
analyzed: bzung ba 'dzin phyir kun rdzob ni //
translated: The fault does not exist, because the conventional is grasped by grasping.

original: mi 'dod 'di ltar bum pa dang yod pa nyid dang / grangs dang 'degs pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi kun rdzob kyi shes pa ni tshad ma nyid du mi 'dod de /üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'dod 'di ltar bum pa dang yod pa nyid dang / grangs dang 'degs pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi kun rdzob kyi shes pa ni tshad ma nyid du mi 'dod de / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: We do not accept that consciousnesses that apprehend objects such as pots, existence, number, lifting, and so on are valid cognitions.üîΩWhy?

original: gzung ba 'dzin pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba 'dzin pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are causes apprehending the apprehended.

original: de la dang por mthong ba nyid tshad ma nyid de 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dang por mthong ba nyid tshad ma nyid de 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: First, seeing itself is valid knowledge because it engages its object.

original: de'i mthu las 'byung ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa phyi ma ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su bzung ba'i don gyi yul can /
analyzed: de'i mthu las 'byung ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa phyi ma ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su bzung ba'i don gyi yul can /
translated: A subsequent conceptual consciousness that arises from the power of that and apprehends its object as it was previously perceived

original: dran bzhin du skye ba de ltar na des don byed pa sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po cung zad kyang shes pa med pa de bas na gang las shes nas 'jug par byed par 'gyur /üîΩgal te ci'i phyir de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyid tshad mar 'dod kyi /
analyzed: dran bzhin du skye ba de ltar na des don byed pa sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po cung zad kyang shes pa med pa de bas na gang las shes nas 'jug par byed par 'gyur / gal te ci'i phyir de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyid tshad mar 'dod kyi /
translated: arises as memory. In that way, it does not know the object that is established as the thing that performs a function in the slightest. Therefore, how could it be valid knowledge?

original: dbang po la sogs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, why do we assert that a consciousness that has that aspect is valid knowledge but not the sense faculties and so on,üîΩwe respond as follows.

original: mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar tshad ma'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshad ma'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Thus, the result of valid knowledge is twofold:

original: skyes bu'i don zhes bya ba chod pa dang khyad par can chod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don zhes bya ba chod pa dang khyad par can chod pa med pa'o //
translated: the object of a person, which is the object of attainment, and the object of abandonment, which is the object of removal.

original: shes pas blang bar bya'i don shes nas de sgrub par byed pa nan tan du byed pas mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mjug pa skyes bus thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pas blang bar bya'i don shes nas de sgrub par byed pa nan tan du byed pas mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mjug pa skyes bus thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having understood the object of attainment, which is to be taken up by consciousness, one practices it and thereby attains it, which is characterized by direct perception.

original: de bzhin du dor bar bya ba shes nas de sgrub par byed pa nan tan du mi byed pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du dor bar bya ba shes nas de sgrub par byed pa nan tan du mi byed pas /
translated: Similarly, having understood the object of abandonment, one does not practice it and

original: de mngon sum du mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'jug pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de mngon sum du mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'jug pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: thereby does not attain it, which is characterized by non-manifestation.

original: blo ni tshad ma nyid /üîΩblang dang dor bya'i dngos po yi //
analyzed: blo ni tshad ma nyid / blang dang dor bya'i dngos po yi //
translated: The mind is valid knowledge.üîΩThe engagement in the object of attainment and the object of abandonmentüîΩis the principal characteristic of valid knowledge.

original: 'jug la de gtso nyid phyir dang // blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i dngos po'i yul can dang / skyes bu'i don zhes bya ba can gyi 'jug pa de la /
analyzed: 'jug la de gtso nyid phyir dang // blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i dngos po'i yul can dang / skyes bu'i don zhes bya ba can gyi 'jug pa de la /
translated: The engagement in the object of attainment and the object of abandonment, which are the objects of a person,üîΩis the principal characteristic of valid knowledge.

original: de gtso bo nyid kyi phyir te shes pa gtso bo nyid yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: de gtso bo nyid kyi phyir te shes pa gtso bo nyid yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
translated: because it is the principal factor, i.e., because consciousness is the principal cause.

original: blo ni tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: blo ni tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: The intellect is valid cognition.

original: blo tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa ni dbang po la sogs pa yang 'jug pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtog pa dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa ni dbang po la sogs pa yang 'jug pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtog pa dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The assertion that the intellect is valid cognition is in order to preclude the notion that the sense faculties, etc., are the cause of engagement.

original: de ltar na dbang po la sogs pa yod pa'i skyes bu la 'jug pa'i yod pa ma yin no //üîΩde @4a * //
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po la sogs pa yod pa'i skyes bu la 'jug pa'i yod pa ma yin no // de @4a * //
translated: Thus, the existence of the person who has the sense faculties, etc., is not engaged.

original: lta ma yin na de yod pa tsam gyis 'jug par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ma yin na de yod pa tsam gyis 'jug par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that the person would be engaged merely by his existence.

original: 'di ltar blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba shes nas rtogs pa po 'dis ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba shes nas rtogs pa po 'dis ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, having understood what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected, this cognizer will teach in accordance with what is correct.

original: gang las brtsams nas bsam pa sngon du gtong ba can gyi 'jug par byed pa dang po de ni 'dod pa'i don la 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gang las brtsams nas bsam pa sngon du gtong ba can gyi 'jug par byed pa dang po de ni 'dod pa'i don la 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: That which is the first engagement, which is preceded by the thought, From what shall I begin?, is the cause of engaging in the desired goal.

original: de las gzhan du gyur pa de'i stobs las byung ba can dang de'i yul can dag yin pa'i phyir de nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan du gyur pa de'i stobs las byung ba can dang de'i yul can dag yin pa'i phyir de nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Because they are born from the power of that and they have that as their object, that itself is valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma'i 'bras bu ma chod pa yang don rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma'i 'bras bu ma chod pa yang don rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The result of valid knowledge is the realization of the object.

original: de yang rgyu thams cad nye ba na yan gang las chod pa med par rtogs pa'i tha snyad thob pa na de tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rgyu thams cad nye ba na yan gang las chod pa med par rtogs pa'i tha snyad thob pa na de tshad ma yin no //
translated: And when that is obtained without any obstruction from the presence of all the causes, then that is valid knowledge.

original: mchod pa de yang yul dang 'dra ba las gzhan la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mchod pa de yang yul dang 'dra ba las gzhan la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And that realization is not in anything other than what is similar to the object.

original: des na blo ni nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du tha dad pa med du zin kyang de don so so la tha dad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na blo ni nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid du tha dad pa med du zin kyang de don so so la tha dad par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, although the cognition is not different in terms of its nature of being an experience, it is what makes the difference in the individual objects.

original: de ltar na yul rnams can ni tha dad phyir te zhes pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na yul rnams can ni tha dad phyir te zhes pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because of the difference in the objects, the cognition is different.

original: blo rtogs pa tha dad pa yin pas te rgyu de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo rtogs pa tha dad pa yin pas te rgyu de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that cause, the realization of the cognition is different.

original: de yod na ste lam gyi rnam pa can yod na 'bras bu 'di yod phyir /
analyzed: de yod na ste lam gyi rnam pa can yod na 'bras bu 'di yod phyir /
translated: Because of the existence of that, that is, because of the existence of the result that has the aspect of the path,

original: blo ni tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: blo ni tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: The cognition is the valid cognition.

original: gang yod pa nyid yin na gang 'gyur ba de ni de'i shin tu sgrub par byed pa yin par rigs so //
analyzed: gang yod pa nyid yin na gang 'gyur ba de ni de'i shin tu sgrub par byed pa yin par rigs so //
translated: If it exists, then it is reasonable that it is the valid cognition.

original: de yod na yang 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'bras bu med pa yin na ni /
analyzed: de yod na yang 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'bras bu med pa yin na ni /
translated: But if, even when it exists, the effect is not sometimes produced,

original: ltos par bya ba gzhan 'di la yod do zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltos par bya ba gzhan 'di la yod do zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is understood that there is some other factor to be considered.

original: de'i tshe snga ma de nyid ltos par bya ba gzhan des chod pa'i phyir phul du byung ba can gyi byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe snga ma de nyid ltos par bya ba gzhan des chod pa'i phyir phul du byung ba can gyi byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the former [cognition] is obstructed by that other factor to be considered, and so it is not the unique producer.

original: de bas na byed pa nyid du ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na byed pa nyid du ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the producer.

original: dbang po la sogs pa yod pa la yang bya ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa yod pa la yang bya ba med pa yin te /
translated: Even when the sense faculty, etc. exist, there is no activity,

original: yul dang 'dra bas chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang 'dra bas chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are obstructed by the object, which is similar [to the sense faculty].

original: 'dra ba nyid yod na ni gdon mi za bar de rtogs te /
analyzed: 'dra ba nyid yod na ni gdon mi za bar de rtogs te /
translated: If there is similarity, then there is no doubt that it is cognized.

original: de'i de ni 'ga' zhig gis kyang chod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i de ni 'ga' zhig gis kyang chod pa ma yin no //
translated: That [cognition] is not obstructed by anything.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan la ltos pa med pa can gyi 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa'i rten yin pa de ltar na 'bras bu rnam pa gnyi ga'i yang yul dang 'dra ba nyid rgyu yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan la ltos pa med pa can gyi 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa'i rten yin pa de ltar na 'bras bu rnam pa gnyi ga'i yang yul dang 'dra ba nyid rgyu yin no //
translated: Because it is the nature of consciousness, it is the basis for positing an effect that does not depend on another. Thus, the cause is like the object of both effects.

original: de yang shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because it becomes the nature of consciousness,

original: shes pa nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: consciousness itself is the valid cognition.

original: brjod pa'i yul la tshad ma gzhan mi 'jug pas brjod pa tshad ma nyid ma yin par ma gyur cig snyam pas /
analyzed: brjod pa'i yul la tshad ma gzhan mi 'jug pas brjod pa tshad ma nyid ma yin par ma gyur cig snyam pas /
translated: One might think, ‚ÄúLet us not say that expression is not a valid cognition because another valid cognition does not engage its object.‚Äù

original: tshad ma rnams rang nyid kyis tshad ma nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: tshad ma rnams rang nyid kyis tshad ma nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, valid cognitions are valid cognitions by themselves.üîΩThey are not dependent on another valid cognition.

original: @4b tshad ma gzhan gyi dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes gzhan smra ste /
analyzed: @4b tshad ma gzhan gyi dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes gzhan smra ste /
translated: This is what others say.

original: de dang de mi rigs so //
analyzed: de dang de mi rigs so //
translated: That is illogical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di ltar de skad du brjod pa 'di'i don 'ga' zhig kyang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar de skad du brjod pa 'di'i don 'ga' zhig kyang mi rung ngo //
translated: Because in that case, the meaning of the statement would be impossible.

original: de ltar na tshad ma rnams rang nyid kyis tshad ma nyid grub pa yin no zhes bya ba mngon par gsal ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar na tshad ma rnams rang nyid kyis tshad ma nyid grub pa yin no zhes bya ba mngon par gsal ba'am /
translated: Thus, it is clear that the valid cognitions establish their own validity.

original: skye ba tshad ma nyid yin par brjod grang na /
analyzed: skye ba tshad ma nyid yin par brjod grang na /
translated: If you say that arising is a valid cognition,

original: grub pa ni rnam pa gnyis la mthong ste /
analyzed: grub pa ni rnam pa gnyis la mthong ste /
translated: then establishment is seen in two ways.

original: dper na sgra grub pa dang 'bras bu can grub pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra grub pa dang 'bras bu can grub pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the establishment of sound and the establishment of the result.

original: re zhig skye ba ma yin te //
analyzed: re zhig skye ba ma yin te //
translated: First, arising is not a valid cognition.

original: skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs dag la shes pa ni tshad ma nyid la byed pa po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs dag la shes pa ni tshad ma nyid la byed pa po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because a cognition in the state of having arisen or not having arisen is not a valid cognition.

original: ma skyes pa ni med pa yin te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni med pa yin te /
translated: That which has not arisen is nonexistent.

original: med pa'i bya ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i bya ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because an action of a nonexistent is not tenable.

original: skyes pa yin na yang de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid kyang de'i tshe skyes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa yin na yang de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid kyang de'i tshe skyes pa nyid yin no //
translated: Even if it has arisen, it is a valid cognition because it is by nature a valid cognition.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu med pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since there is no result,

original: gang gang las 'gyur zhing gang gis na tshad ma nyid rang las skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gang las 'gyur zhing gang gis na tshad ma nyid rang las skye bar 'gyur /
translated: from what would it arise? By what would a valid cognition arise from itself?

original: dbang po la sogs pa don gzhan du gyur pa dag las shes pa tshad ma'i ngo bo can skyes pa de ltar na /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa don gzhan du gyur pa dag las shes pa tshad ma'i ngo bo can skyes pa de ltar na /
translated: If a cognition that is the nature of valid knowledge arises from sense faculties and so on that are different objects,

original: rang las skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang las skye ba ma yin no //
translated: then it is not self-arisen.

original: ci ste 'di ni tshad ma yin no zhes nges pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshad ma'i mngon par gsal ba rang las 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di ni tshad ma yin no zhes nges pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshad ma'i mngon par gsal ba rang las 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: If the manifestation of valid knowledge, which has the defining characteristic of ascertaining this is valid knowledge, arises from itself, then

original: rang las grub pa yin pa de ni rigs pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rang las grub pa yin pa de ni rigs pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: it is self-established. That is not reasonable.

original: 'di ltar tshad ma dang der snang ba dag skye ba'i dus na khyad par nges par bzung ba med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshad ma dang der snang ba dag skye ba'i dus na khyad par nges par bzung ba med de /
translated: Thus, when valid knowledge and what appears as that arise, there is no ascertainment of a difference,

original: 'jig rten na tshad ma dang cig shos dag la the tshom za ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na tshad ma dang cig shos dag la the tshom za ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because in the world one sees doubt regarding valid knowledge and what is other than that.

original: gal te tshad ma rang nyid las grub pa yin par 'gyur na bstan bcos byed pa dag gis phan tshun 'gal ba can gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tshad ma rang nyid las grub pa yin par 'gyur na bstan bcos byed pa dag gis phan tshun 'gal ba can gyi tshad ma'i mtshan nyid byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If valid knowledge were established from itself, those who compose treatises would not compose definitions of valid knowledge that are mutually contradictory.

original: tshad ma skyes pa nyid na tshad ma dang / tshad ma ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i rnam par dbye ba grub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gcig pa can nyid byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma skyes pa nyid na tshad ma dang / tshad ma ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i rnam par dbye ba grub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gcig pa can nyid byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the valid cognition itself has arisen, the distinction between valid cognition and non-valid cognition is established, so it would be the same defining characteristic.

original: gzhan yang bdag nyid tshad na dang der snang ba'i ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag nyid tshad na dang der snang ba'i ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, when the self is valid, because the nature that appears as that is ascertained,

original: 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig la 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig la 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: some are mistaken about some.

original: de skad du brjod pa des kyang mtshan nyid de ltar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de skad du brjod pa des kyang mtshan nyid de ltar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Even though it is said in that way, it is not to be defined in that way.

original: byed na rang nyid kyi brjod pa la gnod par byed do //
analyzed: byed na rang nyid kyi brjod pa la gnod par byed do //
translated: If it were, it would contradict one's own statement.

original: ngo bo des gzhan gyis tshad ma rig par bya ba'i phyir mtshan nyid byed pa yin na /
analyzed: ngo bo des gzhan gyis tshad ma rig par bya ba'i phyir mtshan nyid byed pa yin na /
translated: If it is defined as the valid cognition of others because of that nature,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: that is also unreasonable.
Here,

original: rang gi rtogs pa dang 'gal ba yang yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rtogs pa dang 'gal ba yang yin no //
translated: it also contradicts one's own understanding.

original: ji ltar brjod pa'i log pa'i don can nyid kyi rgyu med pa kun nas bstan pas skyes bus ma byas pa nyid tshad ma nyid du grub par ston pa de ltar na rang las grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar brjod pa'i log pa'i don can nyid kyi rgyu med pa kun nas bstan pas skyes bus ma byas pa nyid tshad ma nyid du grub par ston pa de ltar na rang las grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it has been shown that the reason for the unreliability of the statement is the absence of a cause, it is established that the statement is not produced by a person. Thus, it is not established from itself.

original: gzhan yang shes pa yod pa nyid kyis tshad ma nyid kyi nges pa 'dod pa des shes pas rang gi ngo bo rig pa'i phyir rang rig pa 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang shes pa yod pa nyid kyis tshad ma nyid kyi nges pa 'dod pa des shes pas rang gi ngo bo rig pa'i phyir rang rig pa 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since you assert that the validity of a cognition is due to the existence of the cognition itself, you must assert that the cognition is reflexive awareness.

original: skyon de bsal bar 'dod pas shes pa gzhan las grub par 'dod pa na rang las grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyon de bsal bar 'dod pas shes pa gzhan las grub par 'dod pa na rang las grub pa ma yin no //
translated: If you assert that the cognition is established from another cognition, you cannot avoid the fault that the cognition is not established from itself.

original: ci ste de'i mtshan nyid gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin no zhes sems na yang /
analyzed: ci ste de'i mtshan nyid gzhan gyis byas pa ma yin no zhes sems na yang /
translated: If you think that the nature of the cognition is not produced by another,

original: de ni 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: then that is precisely what we assert.

original: de ltar na rang gi rgyu las de lta bur gyur pa nyid du skyes pa de ni tshad ma gzhan nam gzhan gyis kyang 'di'i tshad ma nyid kyi rang bzhin byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi rgyu las de lta bur gyur pa nyid du skyes pa de ni tshad ma gzhan nam gzhan gyis kyang 'di'i tshad ma nyid kyi rang bzhin byas pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the cognition is produced from its own cause in such a way that it is not the case that its validity is produced by another cognition or by another cognition.

original: 'on gal te khyod cag gi tshad ma nyid ji ltar grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on gal te khyod cag gi tshad ma nyid ji ltar grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: But if you ask, ‚ÄúHow is your valid cognition itself established?‚Äù

original: kho bo cag gi ni rang las rang gi ngo bor rtogs /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ni rang las rang gi ngo bor rtogs /
translated: We understand that it is established from itself.

original: rang rig pa las tshad ma zhes bya ba'i shes pa de'i shes pa yod pa nyid grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang rig pa las tshad ma zhes bya ba'i shes pa de'i shes pa yod pa nyid grub pa yin gyi /
translated: The cognition called ‚Äúvalid cognition‚Äù is established as the existence of that cognition.

original: tshad ma nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not established as valid cognition.

original: gal te shes pa yod pa nyid las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid kyang bzung ba nyid yin no zhen bden te /
analyzed: gal te shes pa yod pa nyid las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid kyang bzung ba nyid yin no zhen bden te /
translated: If you say that because it is not different from the existence of cognition, valid cognition is also apprehended, that is true.

original: mngon sum de ni tshad skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum de ni tshad skye ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But direct perception is not the arising of valid cognition.

original: de yang bzung ba nyid ni yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de yang bzung ba nyid ni yin mod kyi /
translated: And it is indeed apprehended.

original: 'on kyang bzung ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa dag la yang nges pa skyed par byed pa de la /
analyzed: 'on kyang bzung ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa dag la yang nges pa skyed par byed pa de la /
translated: But that which generates certainty in the aspects that are apprehended

original: 'jug par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid du 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid du 'dod kyi /
translated: is asserted to be valid cognition because it engages those aspects.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not asserted to be valid cognition in any other way.

original: mthong ba las khyad par med na yang /
analyzed: mthong ba las khyad par med na yang /
translated: Even though it is not different from seeing,

original: rnam pa gang don du gnyer ba dang / goms pa dang skabs la sogs pa nges pa'i rgyu yod na de nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa gang don du gnyer ba dang / goms pa dang skabs la sogs pa nges pa'i rgyu yod na de nges pa yin gyi /
translated: If there is a cause for ascertaining a particular aspect, such as the one sought, the one familiar, or the one in the field of vision, then there is ascertainment.

original: gzhan chod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan chod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But there is no ascertainment of anything else.

original: des na shes pa yod pa nyid dmigs pa na tshad ma nyid bzung du zin kyang ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: des na shes pa yod pa nyid dmigs pa na tshad ma nyid bzung du zin kyang ma bzung ba dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, even when the existence of consciousness is apprehended, the valid cognition is not ascertained, as if it were not apprehended.

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no ascertainment.

original: 'o na ji ltar tshad ma nyid nges par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar tshad ma nyid nges par bya zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is valid cognition ascertained?

original: tha snyad kyis ni tshad ma nyid dus phyis 'byung ba can gyi don byed pa'i yul can gyi shes pas so //
analyzed: tha snyad kyis ni tshad ma nyid dus phyis 'byung ba can gyi don byed pa'i yul can gyi shes pas so //
translated: By convention, valid cognition is ascertained by a subsequent cognition that has an object that performs a function.

original: gal te tha snyad kyis tshad ma nyid rtogs pa yin pa de'i tshe bstan bcos don med pa can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te tha snyad kyis tshad ma nyid rtogs pa yin pa de'i tshe bstan bcos don med pa can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If valid cognition is understood by convention, then since the treatise would be pointless,

original: brtsam par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtsam par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be something to be undertaken.

original: don med pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: don med pa can ma yin te /
translated: It is not pointless,

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: because

original: bstan @5b bcos rmongs pa zlog byed yin //
analyzed: bstan @5b bcos rmongs pa zlog byed yin //
translated: the treatise is for the purpose of countering confusion.

original: 'jug par byed pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid mi shes par 'jug pa na slu ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid mi shes par 'jug pa na slu ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one engages in an object without knowing the definition of the valid cognition that engages it, one can be deceived.

original: 'jug par 'dod pas 'jug pa las sngar tshad ma dang der snang ba dag gi mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jug par 'dod pas 'jug pa las sngar tshad ma dang der snang ba dag gi mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, one who wishes to engage in an object should first understand the definition of valid cognition and the definition of the appearance of that object.

original: de yang bdag nyid kyis mi rig pa gang yin pa de yang dag pa'i shes pa nye bar mtshon par gyur pa'i chos ston pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de yang bdag nyid kyis mi rig pa gang yin pa de yang dag pa'i shes pa nye bar mtshon par gyur pa'i chos ston pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bstan bcos las /
translated: Moreover, one who does not know that by oneself should understand it from a treatise that has the characteristic of teaching the Dharma, which is characterized by the presence of correct knowledge.

original: ji skad du bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mi slu ba rig par byas nas rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mi slu ba rig par byas nas rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Having understood it through the definition as taught, one will engage in some way.

original: bstan bcos byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, one composes a treatise.

original: rtogs pa po'i tshad ma dang / cig shos mi shes pa ldog par byed pa yin pa de ltar na don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa po'i tshad ma dang / cig shos mi shes pa ldog par byed pa yin pa de ltar na don med pa ma yin no //
translated: If one does not know the valid cognition of the one who understands and the opposite of the one who does not understand, then it is pointless.üîΩIf it is well-known valid cognition and also a convention,

original: tshad ma rab tu grags pa nyid dang tha snyad kyang yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: tshad ma rab tu grags pa nyid dang tha snyad kyang yin pa de ltar na /
translated: then

original: bstan bcos ni ci yang mi rung ngo zhes smra ba gang yin pa de'i yang /
analyzed: bstan bcos ni ci yang mi rung ngo zhes smra ba gang yin pa de'i yang /
translated: But that is not so, because it is not reasonable to say that a treatise is not valid.

original: de skad du brjod pa nyid rigs pa nyid ma yin no//
analyzed: de skad du brjod pa nyid rigs pa nyid ma yin no//
translated: It is not reasonable to say that.

original: de ltar na tshad ma dag ni rab tu grags pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na tshad ma dag ni rab tu grags pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Thus, valid cognitions are not well known,

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid byed pas mkhas pa snyam sems pa dag gi yang log par rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid byed pas mkhas pa snyam sems pa dag gi yang log par rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: because it is seen that those who think they are wise make definitions that are mutually contradictory.

original: 'jig rten ni smos kyang ci dgos so //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni smos kyang ci dgos so //
translated: What need is there to mention the world?

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma med pa sngon du sod ba can gyi 'jug pa na 'di slu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma med pa sngon du sod ba can gyi 'jug pa na 'di slu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when one engages in something without first establishing valid cognition, one is deceived.üîΩAnd when something is not deceptive at some times, that is like the crow and the palm tree.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe mi slu bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang bya rog dang / ta la'i tshul gyis yin pa de ltar na de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe mi slu bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang bya rog dang / ta la'i tshul gyis yin pa de ltar na de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is not reasonable in any way.

original: de bas na de ltar tshad ma'i mtshan nyid mi slu ba gcig cig bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar tshad ma'i mtshan nyid mi slu ba gcig cig bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the definition of valid cognition is explained as being nondeceptive.

original: mi shes don gyi gsal byed kyang //
analyzed: mi shes don gyi gsal byed kyang //
translated: It is also the illuminator of the meaning that is not known.

original: gzhan mtshan nyid gnyis pa yin no //üîΩrtogs pa po'i mi shes pa'i don gyi dngos po'i de kho na nyid kyi gsal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan mtshan nyid gnyis pa yin no // rtogs pa po'i mi shes pa'i don gyi dngos po'i de kho na nyid kyi gsal bar byed pa ste /
translated: The other is the second characteristic.üîΩThe cognition that illuminates the reality of the object that is not known by the cognizer is also valid knowledge,

original: mngon par gsal bar byed pa'i shes pa yang tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par gsal bar byed pa'i shes pa yang tshad ma yin no //
translated: because it illuminates the object that is not known.

original: don byed par mi slu ba nyid kyi phyir de dang de rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: don byed par mi slu ba nyid kyi phyir de dang de rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Because it is nondeceptive with regard to the object, it should be understood as valid knowledge.

original: don smos pas ni zla ba gnyis la sogs par snang ba tshad ma nyid ma yin par bshad de /
analyzed: don smos pas ni zla ba gnyis la sogs par snang ba tshad ma nyid ma yin par bshad de /
translated: By mentioning the object, it is explained that the appearance of two moons and so on are not valid knowledge,

original: mi shes pa de bzung du zin kyang de'i don ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa de bzung du zin kyang de'i don ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though they apprehend the object, they are not the object.

original: gal te 'o na ji ltar na ldog pa'i yul can gyis mi dmigs pa tshad ma nyid yin zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'o na ji ltar na ldog pa'i yul can gyis mi dmigs pa tshad ma nyid yin zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow then is nonapprehension by a cognition that has an absent object a valid knowledge?‚Äù it is not.

original: 'dir yang rang gi mtshan nyid med pa nyid du gsal @6a * //üîΩpar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang rang gi mtshan nyid med pa nyid du gsal @6a * // par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because here also it illuminates the absence of its own characteristic.

original: don smos pas kyang dngos po yod pa dang med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid yin par bzhed do //
analyzed: don smos pas kyang dngos po yod pa dang med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi de kho na nyid yin par bzhed do //
translated: By mentioning the object, it is accepted that the reality that has the characteristic of the existence and nonexistence of things is the object.

original: gal te don ma rtogs pa gsal bar byed pa tshad ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te don ma rtogs pa gsal bar byed pa tshad ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If valid knowledge is that which causes the understanding of an object that was not previously understood,

original: rang gi ngo bo rtogs 'og tu //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rtogs 'og tu //
translated: then after the understanding of its own nature,

original: spyi yi rnam par shes pa thob //
analyzed: spyi yi rnam par shes pa thob //
translated: the cognition of a universal is obtained.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid khong du chud pa las dus phyis spyi'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de mngon sum gyis ma bzung ba nyid kyi spyi yul nyid du bdag gir byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid khong du chud pa las dus phyis spyi'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de mngon sum gyis ma bzung ba nyid kyi spyi yul nyid du bdag gir byed pa'i phyir /
translated: After the comprehension of its own characteristics, the cognition of a universal is obtained, because it is the apprehension of a universal that is not apprehended by perception.

original: de yang tshad ma nyid thob na mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang tshad ma nyid thob na mi 'dod do //
translated: But it is not accepted that it obtains the status of valid knowledge.

original: de bas na mtshan nyid 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na mtshan nyid 'khrul pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore its characteristics are mistaken.

original: skyon de ni med de 'di ltar mngon sum gyi shes pas de dang de las log pa'i ngo bo can gyi sngon po la sogs pa'i yul la 'dzin pa na /
analyzed: skyon de ni med de 'di ltar mngon sum gyi shes pas de dang de las log pa'i ngo bo can gyi sngon po la sogs pa'i yul la 'dzin pa na /
translated: That fault does not exist. In this way, when the consciousness of direct perception apprehends an object such as blue that has an essence that is the opposite of that,

original: ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i khyad par gyi yul can nyid kyi dran pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i khyad par gyi yul can nyid kyi dran pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: it is like the memory consciousness that arises that has as its object the specific thing that was seen.

original: don ma rtogs pa rtogs par byed pa po ma yin na /
analyzed: don ma rtogs pa rtogs par byed pa po ma yin na /
translated: If it does not understand an object that was not previously understood,üîΩthen it is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: gang gis na 'di tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid 'khrul par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na 'di tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir mtshan nyid 'khrul par 'gyur /
translated: How could the definition be mistaken because it is valid cognition?

original: ma rtogs pa spyi shes pa'i shes pas rtogs pa yang bla ste /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa spyi shes pa'i shes pas rtogs pa yang bla ste /
translated: It is better to understand the object that is the general characteristic through the cognition that does not understand the object that is the particular characteristic.

original: de ltar na yang /
analyzed: de ltar na yang /
translated: However, it is said:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes pa //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes pa //
translated: The cognition that does not understand the particular characteristic

original: shes pa gang yin zhes dgongs phyir //
analyzed: shes pa gang yin zhes dgongs phyir //
translated: is not valid cognition, because it is intended to be so.

original: 'khrul pa med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa kho na yin no //
translated: It is only non-mistaken.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa rtogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de ni tshad ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa rtogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa gang yin pa de ni tshad ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: The cognition that is the subject that understands the object that does not understand the particular characteristic is valid cognition.

original: khyad par dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pas spyi shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang bcas pa'i mtshan nyid bshad pas spyi shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: However, the cognition that understands the general characteristic is not valid cognition, because the definition is explained to have a distinction.

original: gal te 'o na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin pa thob ste /
analyzed: gal te 'o na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin pa thob ste /
translated: If it is argued that inference is not established as valid cognition,

original: sgra'i rang bzhin gyi mi rtag pa nyid mthong ba shes pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te thams cad las ldog pa'i sgra'i bdag nyid thun mong ma yin pa bzung du zin kyang /
analyzed: sgra'i rang bzhin gyi mi rtag pa nyid mthong ba shes pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te thams cad las ldog pa'i sgra'i bdag nyid thun mong ma yin pa bzung du zin kyang /
translated: because the cognition that sees impermanence, which is the nature of sound, is not valid cognition, that is not so. Even if the uncommon nature of sound that is the opposite of everything is apprehended,

original: rnam par gang la mngon gsum des nges pa la sogs pa rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa de nyid tha snyad du rung ba bzung ba yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa de ltar na ma bzung ba nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni
analyzed: rnam par gang la mngon gsum des nges pa la sogs pa rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa de nyid tha snyad du rung ba bzung ba yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa de ltar na ma bzung ba nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni
translated: The direct perception that ascertains the object and generates its own result is conventionally accepted as valid cognition, not any other. Thus, since it engages what is not yet ascertained, inference is

original: tshad ma yin no zhes de sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: tshad ma yin no zhes de sngar bstan zin to //
translated: valid cognition. This has already been explained above.

original: ci'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de tshad mar 'dod kyi gzhan ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de tshad mar 'dod kyi gzhan ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that only the cognition that understands the object's own characteristic is accepted as valid cognition, not any other?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dpyad phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dpyad phyir ro //
translated: Because it examines the object's own characteristic.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na don gyi bya ba byed @6b pa de ltar na de'i don du skyes bu rang gi mtshan nyid don byed pa'i rten 'dod pa yul de nyid la tshad ma tshol bar byed kyi /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na don gyi bya ba byed @6b pa de ltar na de'i don du skyes bu rang gi mtshan nyid don byed pa'i rten 'dod pa yul de nyid la tshad ma tshol bar byed kyi /
translated: Only the object's own characteristic performs the function of the object. Thus, people who desire the basis for the performance of the function of the object seek valid cognition in that very object, the object's own characteristic.

original: don byed pa ma yin pa'i yul gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don byed pa ma yin pa'i yul gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not seek it in other objects that do not perform a function.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par grub pas don byed pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par grub pas don byed pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the establishment of the object's performance of a function is not established by such a mode.

original: gal te don byed par mi nus pa med pa'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don byed par mi nus pa med pa'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that it is not valid cognition when the object is not nonexistent and not able to perform a function,

original: 'di la yang rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa la mi shes pa'i don gyi yul can nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la yang rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pa la mi shes pa'i don gyi yul can nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then in this case also, the object is not known because its own characteristic is not understood.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is understood that only its own characteristic does not exist.

original: bum pa la sogs pa don gyi bya ba byed pa dgag par bya ba med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa don gyi bya ba byed pa dgag par bya ba med pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because it is understood that the object, such as a pot, which performs a function, does not exist.

original: phyogs la sogs pa des dben pa'i yul de ltar des dben pa'i ngo bor shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs la sogs pa des dben pa'i yul de ltar des dben pa'i ngo bor shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Or because the object, such as a direction, is known to be of the nature of being devoid of that, being devoid of that object.

original: don dam par mi dmigs pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rten can nyid yin no //
analyzed: don dam par mi dmigs pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rten can nyid yin no //
translated: Nonapprehension ultimately is also based on its own characteristic.

original: gang du nam mkha' la sogs pa rnam par gcod pa na phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rten med pa de la yang nam mkha'i rgyus stong pa de'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo nyid rten yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: gang du nam mkha' la sogs pa rnam par gcod pa na phyi rol gyi dngos po'i rten med pa de la yang nam mkha'i rgyus stong pa de'i rnam par rtog pa'i blo nyid rten yin pa de ltar na /
translated: When space, etc. are discriminated, the cause of space, i.e., the absence of an external basis, is the basis of the cognition that discriminates it.

original: thams cad du dngos po la reg pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du dngos po la reg pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in all cases, it is the cognition that touches the object.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis brten pa'i ngo bo can gang yin pa de ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis brten pa'i ngo bo can gang yin pa de ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: That which has the nature of the two kinds of characteristics as explained is valid knowledge.

original: de bzhin bcom ldan tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin bcom ldan tshad ma nyid //
translated: The Bhagavat is also valid knowledge.

original: 'di tshad ma dang yang ci zhig mtshungs na /
analyzed: 'di tshad ma dang yang ci zhig mtshungs na /
translated: In what way is he similar to valid knowledge?

original: gang gis na tshang ma dang 'dra bas tshad ma nyid yin tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis nyid dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis na tshang ma dang 'dra bas tshad ma nyid yin tshad ma'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyis nyid dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Because he is like valid knowledge, he is valid knowledge. He is similar to the two kinds of characteristics of valid knowledge.

original: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba'i don la mi slu ba'i phyir dang / mi shes pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba'i don la mi slu ba'i phyir dang / mi shes pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: He is valid knowledge because he is non-deceptive with regard to the object to be accomplished as desired and because he illuminates the object that is not known.

original: de ltar ni bcom ldan 'das kyang nges par legs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi skyes bu'i don la mi slu bar mdzad pa dang / rtogs pa pos skyes bu'i don bsgrub par bya ba mi shes pa ston par mdzad pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni bcom ldan 'das kyang nges par legs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi skyes bu'i don la mi slu bar mdzad pa dang / rtogs pa pos skyes bu'i don bsgrub par bya ba mi shes pa ston par mdzad pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavat is a valid cognition because he is non-deceptive with regard to the purpose of a person, which has the characteristic of definite goodness, and because he teaches the knower of the purpose of a person that is to be accomplished.

original: tshad ma nyid kyi chos mthun pa nyid can 'chad par 'gyur par byas nas dper byas pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid kyi chos mthun pa nyid can 'chad par 'gyur par byas nas dper byas pa yin no //
translated: Having made the similarity of the property of being a valid cognition, he gives an example.

original: gal te de ltar na tshad ma nyid la zhes byas pas chog mod kyi ci'i phyir gyur pa brjod ce na ma skyes pa ni bzlog pa'i phyir gyur brjod /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na tshad ma nyid la zhes byas pas chog mod kyi ci'i phyir gyur pa brjod ce na ma skyes pa ni bzlog pa'i phyir gyur brjod /
translated: If that is so, it is sufficient to say ‚Äúwith regard to valid cognition,‚Äù why is ‚Äúhaving become‚Äù stated? ‚ÄúHaving become‚Äù is stated in order to exclude the non-arisen.

original: ma skyes pa rtag pa'i @7a * //
analyzed: ma skyes pa rtag pa'i @7a * //
translated: The characteristic of the non-arisen is permanent,

original: mtshan nyid ni yod pa ma yin no zhes ma skyes pa bzlog pa'i don du gyur pa brjod do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni yod pa ma yin no zhes ma skyes pa bzlog pa'i don du gyur pa brjod do //
translated: and it does not exist. ‚Äú Having become‚Äù is stated in order to exclude the non-arisen.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ye shes gang yin pa de dang de ni skyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ye shes gang yin pa de dang de ni skyes pa yin gyi /
translated: The Bhagavat said, ‚ÄúThat which is knowledge is arisen,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not established by way of its own nature.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe de skye ba yin pa de'i tshe yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyi nges par mi rung ba'i phyir de ni glo bur bar rigs pa yin no zhes don gyi rang gi rgyu ston par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de skye ba yin pa de'i tshe yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyi nges par mi rung ba'i phyir de ni glo bur bar rigs pa yin no zhes don gyi rang gi rgyu ston par byed do //
translated: The Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.üîΩThe Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.üîΩThe Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.üîΩThe Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.üîΩThe Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.üîΩThe Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.üîΩThe Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.üîΩThe Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.

original: tshad ma de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sgrub byed la ltos pa /üîΩgang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das tshad ma nyid du bzhugs pa dang / de'i sgrub par byed pa dag 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sgrub byed la ltos pa / gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das tshad ma nyid du bzhugs pa dang / de'i sgrub par byed pa dag 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.üîΩThe Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.

original: de'i sgrub par byed pa nan tan du byed pa las kyang tshad ma nyid yod par gyur pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i sgrub par byed pa nan tan du byed pa las kyang tshad ma nyid yod par gyur pa de'i phyir /
translated: The Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.üîΩThe Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.üîΩThe Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.üîΩThe Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni tshad ma nyid yin par rigs so //üîΩsbyor ba ni gang gis sgrub par byed pa gang phyin ci ma log par nan tan du byas pa de ni de thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni tshad ma nyid yin par rigs so // sbyor ba ni gang gis sgrub par byed pa gang phyin ci ma log par nan tan du byas pa de ni de thob par 'gyur te /
translated: The Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.

original: dper na nad pas nad med pa sgrub par byed pa phyin ci ma log pa nan tan du byas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nad pas nad med pa sgrub par byed pa phyin ci ma log pa nan tan du byas pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.üîΩThe Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.üîΩThe Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.üîΩThe Lord is a valid cognition, because he is the one who teaches the means of accomplishing the goal.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa phyin ci ma log pa nan tan mdzad pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa phyin ci ma log pa nan tan mdzad pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is the one who performs the unerring proof of valid knowledge. This is a natural argument.

original: ma skyes pa rtag pa'i tshad ma nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya pa de gang las yin /
analyzed: ma skyes pa rtag pa'i tshad ma nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bya pa de gang las yin /
translated: How could there be a permanent valid knowledge that is unarisen?

original: de ltar na nam mkha' la sogs pa khyad par byed pa nyid yin pa bzhin du dbang phyug nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa'i shes pa rtag pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na nam mkha' la sogs pa khyad par byed pa nyid yin pa bzhin du dbang phyug nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa'i shes pa rtag pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na de ni ma yin te /
translated: In that case, just as space and so on are the differentiators, the permanent consciousness that is the nature of ƒ™≈õvara, which is asserted to be the creator, would be established by its nature.üîΩBut that is not so, because:

original: 'di ltar / tshad ma rtag pa nyid yod min //
analyzed: 'di ltar / tshad ma rtag pa nyid yod min //
translated: There is no permanent valid knowledge.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause it is the valid knowledge that understands things that exist.

original: dngos yod rtogs pa tshad phyir dang // dngos po yang de yin la yod pa yang yin pas na dngos po yod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos yod rtogs pa tshad phyir dang // dngos po yang de yin la yod pa yang yin pas na dngos po yod pa'o //
translated: Things are that and they exist, and therefore they are things that exist.

original: dngos po yod pa de rtogs pa ni shes pa'o //üîΩde nyid tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa de rtogs pa ni shes pa'o //üîΩde nyid tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The understanding of those things that exist is consciousness.üîΩThat is valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma'i yul gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad du yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na de'i yul gyi rtogs pa yang thams cad du 'gyur pa ma yin no //üîΩshes bya mi rtag pa nyid kyis //
