analyzed: tshad ma'i yul gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad du yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na de'i yul gyi rtogs pa yang thams cad du 'gyur pa ma yin no // shes bya mi rtag pa nyid kyis //
translated: Whatever is the object of valid cognition is not present everywhere, because it is impermanent. In the same way, the cognition of its object is not present everywhere.üîΩBecause the object of valid cognition is impermanent,

original: tshad ma'i yul gyi don mi rtag pa nyid kyi rgyus de'i yul can gyi dngos po yod pa rtogs pa /
analyzed: tshad ma'i yul gyi don mi rtag pa nyid kyi rgyus de'i yul can gyi dngos po yod pa rtogs pa /
translated: the cognition of the existence of the object of valid cognition is impermanent, because of the impermanence of the object of valid cognition.

original: de ni mi brtan nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi brtan nyid phyir ro //
translated: That is not stable.

original: @7b tshad ma nyid rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @7b tshad ma nyid rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: Valid cognition is not permanent.

original: sbyor ba ni yul can gyi shes pa gang yin pa'i yul yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni yul can gyi shes pa gang yin pa'i yul yod pa ma yin na /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is the cognition of the object does not exist,

original: de'i bdag nyid kyang yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyang yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: because its nature does not exist.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva mthong ba yul med pa can yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva mthong ba yul med pa can yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the seeing of the horn of a rabbit is without an object.

original: dngos po'i snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa'i gnas skabs kyi mthong ba'i yul yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa'i gnas skabs kyi mthong ba'i yul yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of seeing is not present in the state of the nonexistence of a thing prior to its existence or after its cessation. This is the nonapprehension of a cause.

original: shes pa gang mi rtag pa'i yul can yin pa de ni bdag nyid kyang mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gang mi rtag pa'i yul can yin pa de ni bdag nyid kyang mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: Any cognition that has an impermanent object must itself be impermanent.

original: dper na lha sbyin gyis me mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin gyis me mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, Devadatta‚Äôs seeing of fire.

original: mngon par 'dod pa skyes bu'i dngos po mi rtag pa mthong ba yang mi rtag pa'i yul can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa skyes bu'i dngos po mi rtag pa mthong ba yang mi rtag pa'i yul can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The seeing of the impermanent object, the human person, who is the desired object, is also an impermanent cognition. This is a natural inference.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na /
translated: If this is the case,

original: mi rtag pa'i yul can gyi shes pa mi rtag pa nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i yul can gyi shes pa mi rtag pa nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: then the cognition that has an impermanent object must be impermanent.

original: 'on kyang shes pa de gang gis yin pa'i shes pa po de rtag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa de gang gis yin pa'i shes pa po de rtag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But the cognition that is the cognizer of that cognition is permanent.

original: de'i shes pa yang /
analyzed: de'i shes pa yang /
translated: The cognition of that cognition

original: rim bzhin skye ba can dag ni //
analyzed: rim bzhin skye ba can dag ni //
translated: arises in sequence.

original: shes pa po nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa po nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is accepted as the cognizer.

original: rtag las skye mi rung phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag las skye mi rung phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable to arise from a permanent thing.

original: skye ba mi rung ba'i phyir de phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: skye ba mi rung ba'i phyir de phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Because it is not suitable to arise, it is not a benefactor. Thus,

original: de dang 'brel pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa can ma yin no //
translated: it is not related to that.

original: ci'i phyir rtag pa las kyang rim bzhin du shes pa mi skye zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtag pa las kyang rim bzhin du shes pa mi skye zhe na /
translated: Why does consciousness not arise in sequence from a permanent thing?

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin gang gis rgyu yin pa de ni gcig la ltos pa yod pa'i phyir de tsam gyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can ni rim bzhin du 'gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin gang gis rgyu yin pa de ni gcig la ltos pa yod pa'i phyir de tsam gyis 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can ni rim bzhin du 'gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Because that which is a cause by virtue of its intrinsic reality does not have the nature of arising in sequence, since it exists in dependence on the other.

original: ci ste nus na yang lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas shol bar byed par 'gyur ba de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: ci ste nus na yang lhan cig byed pa la ltos nas shol bar byed par 'gyur ba de ni mi rigs so //
translated: If it were possible, then it would be the case that it would arise in dependence on the cooperative conditions. But that is not tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ltos pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ltos pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because it is not tenable that it depends on the other.

original: de gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam 'gas phan 'dogs mod phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam 'gas phan 'dogs mod phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible to benefit the other in any way.

original: rtag pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan dag gis khyad par du bya ba med pa la ltos pa ci zhig yod ces mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan dag gis khyad par du bya ba med pa la ltos pa ci zhig yod ces mang du bshad zin to //
translated: Because it is permanent, it is not benefited by the other. What dependence does it have on the other? This has been explained many times.

original: de bas na shes pa dang shes pa po dag las phan gdags par bya ba phan 'dogs par byed pa'i ngo bo cung zad kyang med pa des na /
analyzed: de bas na shes pa dang shes pa po dag las phan gdags par bya ba phan 'dogs par byed pa'i ngo bo cung zad kyang med pa des na /
translated: Therefore, since consciousness and the conscious one do not have the nature of being the benefited and the benefactor in the least,

original: shes pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not associated with consciousness.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang dang lhan cig phan 'dogs par bya bar dang phan 'dogs par byed pa'i ngo bo med pa de ni de dang ldan pa nyid du tha snyad bya bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang dang lhan cig phan 'dogs par bya bar dang phan 'dogs par byed pa'i ngo bo med pa de ni de dang ldan pa nyid du tha snyad bya bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: that which is not the nature of something to be benefited and a benefactor in association with something else is not suitable to be described as associated with it.

original: dper na gzhan 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzhan 'ga' zhig dang 'brel pa med pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like some other thing that is not related.

original: dngos po'i de kho na @8a * //
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na @8a * //
translated: The non-observation of a property of the thing itself is as follows:üîΩThe cognition of the reality of things is not the nature of something to be benefited and a benefactor in association with the thing that is always asserted to exist.

original: nyid shes pa yang rtag par mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po dang lhan cig phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa'i ngo bor yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: nyid shes pa yang rtag par mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po dang lhan cig phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa'i ngo bor yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the non-observation of a property of the thing itself.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na rtag pa nyid ni ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang mi rtag pa ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa nyid tshad ma nyid dang dus thams cad du yod pa can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na rtag pa nyid ni ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang mi rtag pa ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa nyid tshad ma nyid dang dus thams cad du yod pa can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it were like that, it would not be permanent, but still, it would be impermanent, and the establishment of its nature would be valid cognition and it would exist at all times.

original: mi rtag na yang 'dod na tshad med can snyam du sems pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i chad ma nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rtag na yang 'dod na tshad med can snyam du sems pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i chad ma nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is impermanent, then it is not tenable to think that it is limitless.

original: yod pa'i tha snyad du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod pa'i tha snyad du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not suitable to designate it as existent.

original: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang yod par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin pa de ni de'i don yong pa rtog pa dang ldan pas nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang yod par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin pa de ni de'i don yong pa rtog pa dang ldan pas nges pa ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not a valid cognition that establishes the existence of something is not ascertained by a person who conceives of its object as existent,

original: dper na tshad ma med pa can gyi don can 'ga' zhig gi lta bu'o //üîΩmngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bu mi rtag pa ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa'i tshad ma nyid can la yang de yod pa'i sgrub par byed pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper na tshad ma med pa can gyi don can 'ga' zhig gi lta bu'o // mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes bu mi rtag pa ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa'i tshad ma nyid can la yang de yod pa'i sgrub par byed pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: like, for example, the object of a non-existent valid cognition.

original: yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa'i mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa'i mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The non-existence of a valid cognition that establishes the existence of an inherently existent impermanent person who is the object of your desire is the non-observation that refutes the designation of existence.

original: gal te khyed cag mngon par 'dod pa'i tshad mar gyur pa'i tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyed cag mngon par 'dod pa'i tshad mar gyur pa'i tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the valid cognition that establishes the existence of the valid cognition that you desire?‚Äù

original: de'i tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa nan tan du mdzad pa /
analyzed: de'i tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa nan tan du mdzad pa /
translated: The proof of its validity is discussed at length.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin rigs zhes bya ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma nyid yin rigs zhes bya ba bshad zin to //
translated: Therefore, it is said, It is reasonable that it be a valid cognition.

original: 'o na 'di la yang sgrub par byed pa yod pa nyid yin te sdod nas 'jug pa'i phyir dang / dbyibs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir dang / don byed par nus pa nyid kyi phyir lus dang gnas dang / byed pa dag ni phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i blo can gyi skyes bu sngon du song ba can yin no //
analyzed: 'o na 'di la yang sgrub par byed pa yod pa nyid yin te sdod nas 'jug pa'i phyir dang / dbyibs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir dang / don byed par nus pa nyid kyi phyir lus dang gnas dang / byed pa dag ni phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i blo can gyi skyes bu sngon du song ba can yin no //
translated: Now, in this case, there is a proof, because it engages after resting, because it possesses a special shape, and because it is able to perform a function, the body, the abode, and the action are preceded by a person who possesses a superior mind.

original: des na gang zhig gang yod pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gang zhig gang yod pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the syllogism, Because it does not exist, the valid cognition that proves its existence does not exist, and so forth, is not established.

original: gang dang gang sdod nas 'jug pa de dang de ni phul du 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i blo can gyi skyes bus byin gyis brlabs pa sngon du song ba can yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang sdod nas 'jug pa de dang de ni phul du 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i blo can gyi skyes bus byin gyis brlabs pa sngon du song ba can yin te /
translated: Whatever engages after resting is preceded by the blessing of a person who possesses a superior mind.

original: dper na ste'u la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ste'u la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a winnowing fan, etc.

original: 'jig rten gyi lus dang gnas dang byed pa dag kyang 'dug nas 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi lus dang gnas dang byed pa dag kyang 'dug nas 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: The body, abode, and activity of the world are also so, because they are engaged in by one who is seated.

original: gang la log par rtogs pa yod pa dag la yin no //üîΩgang dbyibs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa de ni phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i blo can gyi skyes bu sngon du song ba can yin te /
analyzed: gang la log par rtogs pa yod pa dag la yin no // gang dbyibs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa de ni phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i blo can gyi skyes bu sngon du song ba can yin te /
translated: They are only for one who has a false conception.

original: @8b dper na gzhal yas khang la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: @8b dper na gzhal yas khang la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: That which has a special shape is preceded by a person who has a special mind, for example, a palace, etc.

original: lus dang gnas la sogs pa yang dbyibs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa yin no //üîΩgang don byed par nus pa de ni phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i blo can gyi skyes bus byin gyis brlabs pa sngon du song ba can don byed pa'i bdag nyid la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: lus dang gnas la sogs pa yang dbyibs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa yin no // gang don byed par nus pa de ni phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i blo can gyi skyes bus byin gyis brlabs pa sngon du song ba can don byed pa'i bdag nyid la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The body, abode, etc. have a special shape.

original: dper na dgra sta la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dgra sta la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: That which is able to perform a function is engaged in the performance of its function, preceded by a person who has a special mind, for example, an axe, etc.

original: lus dang gnas dang byed pa dag la yang la lar don byed par nus pa yod do zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: lus dang gnas dang byed pa dag la yang la lar don byed par nus pa yod do zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The application is as follows: ‚ÄúIn some cases, the body, the place, and the action are capable of performing a function.‚Äù

original: de ni sdod 'jug dbyibs kyi khyad par dang / don byed pa la sogs pa dag /'bras bu'i gtan tshigs nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i sgrub par byed pa de dag la'o //
analyzed: de ni sdod 'jug dbyibs kyi khyad par dang / don byed pa la sogs pa dag /'bras bu'i gtan tshigs nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i sgrub par byed pa de dag la'o //
translated: The proof is that the reason is the effect of those things, such as the shape of the body, the place, and the action, which are accepted as the reason for the existence of the soul.

original: sogs pa smos pas de dag sgrub par byed pa gzhan dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas de dag sgrub par byed pa gzhan dag kyang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to other proofs of the soul.

original: 'dod pa sgrub pa'am dngos sam brgyud pas phan tshun phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed par gyur pa'i sems can thams cad kyi lus dang gnas dang byed pa la sogs pa dag gi blo'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems pa'i khyad par las mngon par grub pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa sgrub pa'am dngos sam brgyud pas phan tshun phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs par byed par gyur pa'i sems can thams cad kyi lus dang gnas dang byed pa la sogs pa dag gi blo'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems pa'i khyad par las mngon par grub pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: The proof is that the body, the place, and the action, etc., of all sentient beings who are mutually helpful, either directly or indirectly, are established from the special volition that has the nature of the mind.

original: ci ste de las gzhan pa'i phan 'dogs par byed pa la ltos pa med pa'i skyes bu gcig gi khyad par gyi blos byin gyis brlabs pa sngon du song ba can nyid sgrub pa de'i tshe dpe ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste de las gzhan pa'i phan 'dogs par byed pa la ltos pa med pa'i skyes bu gcig gi khyad par gyi blos byin gyis brlabs pa sngon du song ba can nyid sgrub pa de'i tshe dpe ma grub pa yin te /
translated: But if you maintain that the activity of the axe, etc. is due to the prior consecration of a special person who is not dependent on any other person to assist him, then your example is not established.

original: dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bu byin gyis brlabs pa'i dbang gis ste'u la sogs pa'i 'jug pa 'am /
analyzed: dpe bsgrub par bya bas stong pa zhes bya ba'i don to // de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bu byin gyis brlabs pa'i dbang gis ste'u la sogs pa'i 'jug pa 'am /
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúthe example is devoid of the probandum‚Äù is that the example is not established.üîΩThe activity of the axe, etc. is due to the power of the consecration of such a person.

original: de bzhin du gzhal yas khang la sogs pa grub pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhal yas khang la sogs pa grub pa'am /
translated: Or, the establishment of the celestial mansion, etc. is due to the power of the consecration of such a person.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bus byin gyis brlabs pa'i dgra sta la sogs pa dag gis rang gi don byed pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bus byin gyis brlabs pa'i dgra sta la sogs pa dag gis rang gi don byed pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: But we do not see that the axe, etc. consecrated by such a person perform their own functions.

original: thams cad du dngos sam brgyud pas sems can du ma nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du dngos sam brgyud pas sems can du ma nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because many sentient beings are directly or indirectly employed in the activity.

original: nye bar sbyor bdag la yang thams cad de la nye bar sbyor ba na gcig med pa na yang 'bras bu med pas /
analyzed: nye bar sbyor bdag la yang thams cad de la nye bar sbyor ba na gcig med pa na yang 'bras bu med pas /
translated: And in the case of the activity of the consecration, when all of them are employed in the activity, the result is not absent even when one of them is absent.

original: yon tan gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyi nges pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyi nges pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is no certainty that the qualities are primary.

original: yon tan gtso bor gyur pa'i khyad par med do //
analyzed: yon tan gtso bor gyur pa'i khyad par med do //
translated: There is no difference in the primary quality.

original: sdod nas 'jug pa'i phyir dang / don byed par nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sdod nas 'jug pa'i phyir dang / don byed par nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di dag ni /
translated: The reasons ‚Äúbecause it abides‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause it is able to perform a function‚Äù

original: yang na the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: are either doubtful or

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi skyes bu de nyid kyis ma nges pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi skyes bu de nyid kyis ma nges pa yang yin no //
translated: uncertain, because of the person who is of that type.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi skyes bu @9a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi skyes bu @9a * //
translated: The person who is of that type

original: gzhan gyis byin gyis brlabs pa de ni sdod cing /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byin gyis brlabs pa de ni sdod cing /
translated: is empowered by another person who is of that type.üîΩIf that person abides and,

original: sdod nas lus la sogs pa dag la 'jug par byed na /
analyzed: sdod nas lus la sogs pa dag la 'jug par byed na /
translated: having abided, causes the body and so on to engage in action,

original: thug pa med pa thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med pa thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then there would be the fault of an infinite regress.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi skyes bus byin gyis brlabs pas don gyis bya ba byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi skyes bus byin gyis brlabs pas don gyis bya ba byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the person who is of that type is not empowered by another person who is of that type to perform the function of the object.

original: de ni sdod nas 'jug par byed pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni sdod nas 'jug par byed pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical to say that it is not the case that the shape of the parts is the shape of the whole.

original: de'i 'bras bu can thams cad la cig car 'dug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu can thams cad la cig car 'dug par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that all things that have effects would be simultaneous.

original: don byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not a creator,

original: rang bzhin nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its nature would be impaired.

original: gzhan yang ma grub pa dang khyab pa med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang ma grub pa dang khyab pa med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no //
translated: Moreover, the reason is indeterminate because it is not established and there is no pervasion.

original: de ltar na khang bzangs dang / steng khang dang sgo khang la sogs ba'i khyad par dag gi rjes su 'jug pa can gyi dbyibs ci 'dra ba blo sngon du song ba can gyis mthong zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na khang bzangs dang / steng khang dang sgo khang la sogs ba'i khyad par dag gi rjes su 'jug pa can gyi dbyibs ci 'dra ba blo sngon du song ba can gyis mthong zhing /
translated: Thus, when one sees a shape that is associated with the distinctions of a mansion, an upper story, a gateway, and so on, one has the idea of a shape that is preceded by an awareness.

original: gang mthong ba las de'i byed pa ma mthong du zin kyang byas pa'i blo 'gyur ba de dang 'dra bar gal te ri bo la sogs pa dag la 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang mthong ba las de'i byed pa ma mthong du zin kyang byas pa'i blo 'gyur ba de dang 'dra bar gal te ri bo la sogs pa dag la 'gyur na /
translated: Even though one does not see the activity of that shape, if one sees a shape that is similar to the one that was seen, one has the idea that it is a product. If that were the case with mountains and so on,

original: der 'gyur te /
analyzed: der 'gyur te /
translated: then that would be so.

original: gang las yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not so.

original: de skad du sdong nas 'jug pa la sogs pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de skad du sdong nas 'jug pa la sogs pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same argument applies to the case of the creation of the world by God.

original: byin rlob yod med rjes 'jug can //üîΩbkod sogs ci 'dra ba grub pa /
analyzed: byin rlob yod med rjes 'jug can // bkod sogs ci 'dra ba grub pa /
translated: The creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.

original: byin gyis rlob pa po yod na yod pa ngang med na med pa gang la yod pa de ni yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'jug pa can gyi bkod pa la sogs pa'o //üîΩsogs pa'i sgra smos pas ni sdod nas 'jug pa bzung ngo //üîΩbkod pa de las byin gyis rlob pa po'i khyad par gyi blo sngon du song ba can nyid rjes su dpog pa gang yin /üîΩde ni rigs pa nyid yin no //üîΩdngos tha dad la dbyibs kyi khyad par la sogs pa tha dad pa la /
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa po yod na yod pa ngang med na med pa gang la yod pa de ni yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'jug pa can gyi bkod pa la sogs pa'o // sogs pa'i sgra smos pas ni sdod nas 'jug pa bzung ngo // bkod pa de las byin gyis rlob pa po'i khyad par gyi blo sngon du song ba can nyid rjes su dpog pa gang yin / de ni rigs pa nyid yin no // dngos tha dad la dbyibs kyi khyad par la sogs pa tha dad pa la /
translated: The creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.

original: skyes bu skyed pa po nyid du rab tu grub pa dbyibs kyi khyad par med pa ni tha dad med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar tha dad pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu skyed pa po nyid du rab tu grub pa dbyibs kyi khyad par med pa ni tha dad med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar tha dad pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: The creation of the world is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of God.üîΩThe creation

original: 'di ltar 'di yang dbyibs kyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin no zhes sgra mtshungs pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di yang dbyibs kyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin no zhes sgra mtshungs pas so //
translated: In this way, the word ‚Äúshape‚Äù is also the referent of the word ‚Äúlong.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du sdod nas 'jug pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgra la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdod nas 'jug pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgra la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the words ‚Äústanding,‚Äù ‚Äúsitting,‚Äù and so on.

original: de 'dra ba'i sgra tsam du tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i sgra tsam du tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no difference in the mere words,

original: khyad par can gyi blo dang ldan pa sngon du song ba can nyid kyi /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi blo dang ldan pa sngon du song ba can nyid kyi /
translated: the cognition of the qualifier is not preceded by the cognition of the qualified.

original: rjes dpog rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes dpog rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the inference is not valid.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rdzas sngon po las me bzhin no //
analyzed: rdzas sngon po las me bzhin no //
translated: It is like the substance blue in relation to fire.

original: ji ltar me las skye ba'i chos can rdzas @9b sngon po'i khyad par la khyad par yongs su bor nas //
analyzed: ji ltar me las skye ba'i chos can rdzas @9b sngon po'i khyad par la khyad par yongs su bor nas //
translated: Just as the substance blue, which has the property of being produced from fire, is not cognized as fire, having abandoned its particularity,

original: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo'i 'brel pa can ma mthong pa /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo'i 'brel pa can ma mthong pa /
translated: because the relation of the nature of the produced and the producer is not seen,

original: sngon po'i rdzas spyi las me rtogs pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po'i rdzas spyi las me rtogs pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: the substance blue in general is not cognized as fire.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang dbyibs kyi khyad par ni skyes bu'i 'bras bu nyid du mthong ba de bor nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang dbyibs kyi khyad par ni skyes bu'i 'bras bu nyid du mthong ba de bor nas /
translated: In the same way, here, the specific shape is seen as the effect of a person.

original: spyis rjes su dpog pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyis rjes su dpog pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Having discarded that, it is not logical to infer the general shape.

original: de bas na spyi de 'dra ba skyes bu'i byed pas ma khyab pa de ltar na ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na spyi de 'dra ba skyes bu'i byed pas ma khyab pa de ltar na ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, if such a general shape is not pervaded by the activity of a person, it is inconclusive.

original: ci ste yang dbyibs kyi khyad par de nyid ri bo la sogs pa dag la gtan tshigs nye bar sbyar nas smras pa /
analyzed: ci ste yang dbyibs kyi khyad par de nyid ri bo la sogs pa dag la gtan tshigs nye bar sbyar nas smras pa /
translated: But if you apply the specific shape as the reason to mountains, etc.,

original: de ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de ma grub pa yin te /
translated: that is not established.

original: skyes bu blo sngon du song ba can gyi nye bar sbyar ba de'i 'bras bu nyid du grub pa de ni ri la sogs pa dag la med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: skyes bu blo sngon du song ba can gyi nye bar sbyar ba de'i 'bras bu nyid du grub pa de ni ri la sogs pa dag la med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because the application that precedes the mind of a person, which is established as its effect, does not exist in mountains, etc.

original: khang bzangs la sogs pa'i khyad par dag gi rang gi bye brag dag la rjes su 'jug pa rten cing de las gzhan pa dag las ldog pa gang mthong ba'i phyir byed pa ma mthong ba'i 'jig rten yang byas pa'i blor 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni
analyzed: khang bzangs la sogs pa'i khyad par dag gi rang gi bye brag dag la rjes su 'jug pa rten cing de las gzhan pa dag las ldog pa gang mthong ba'i phyir byed pa ma mthong ba'i 'jig rten yang byas pa'i blor 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni
translated: Because the world, which does not see an agent, has seen that the particulars of such things as houses are dependent on their own specific features, and are excluded from what is other than that, it is understood that they are produced.

original: ri bo la sogs pa dag la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ri bo la sogs pa dag la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case with mountains, etc.

original: de bzhin du sdod nas 'jug pa la sogs pa'i khyad par ste'u la sogs pa yang yin la de ltar na gtan tshigs rnams ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdod nas 'jug pa la sogs pa'i khyad par ste'u la sogs pa yang yin la de ltar na gtan tshigs rnams ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the particulars of such things as a yoke being yoked, etc., are also the axe, etc. Thus the reasons are not established.

original: de ltar mi nan bsgrub par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i dbyibs la sogs pa ci 'dra ba de bor nas /
analyzed: de ltar mi nan bsgrub par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'i dbyibs la sogs pa ci 'dra ba de bor nas /
translated: Thus, having abandoned the shape, etc., which is similar to that which is to be established,

original: cung zad tsam chos mthun pa nyid can gyis de nyid du sgro btags pas /
analyzed: cung zad tsam chos mthun pa nyid can gyis de nyid du sgro btags pas /
translated: by the mere similarity of a few things, it is imputed to be that.

original: spyi 'brel pa med pa las gang gi tshe rjes su dpog pa byed pa de'i tshe rdza mkhan gyis /
analyzed: spyi 'brel pa med pa las gang gi tshe rjes su dpog pa byed pa de'i tshe rdza mkhan gyis /
translated: When an inference is made from that which is unrelated,

original: bum pa la sogs 'jim pa yi /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs 'jim pa yi /
translated: the potter‚Äôs wheel, etc.,üîΩare not the cause of the production of pots, etc.

original: 'gyur pa 'ga' zhig byed pa'i rgyu'i phyir grog mkhar yang des byas te rdza mkhan gyis byas par grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur pa 'ga' zhig byed pa'i rgyu'i phyir grog mkhar yang des byas te rdza mkhan gyis byas par grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: and since it is the cause of some transformation, an anthill is also made by him, and it is established that it is made by a potter.

original: dper na grog mkhar yang 'jim pa'i 'gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rdza mkhan gyis byas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dper na grog mkhar yang 'jim pa'i 'gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rdza mkhan gyis byas pa nyid yin te /
translated: For example, an anthill is made by a potter, because it is a transformation of clay,

original: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a pot, etc.

original: de yang 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de bas na gzhan la yang grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan la yang grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not established for the other party.

original: gal te spyi gtan tshigs la khyad par kun du brtags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te spyi gtan tshigs la khyad par kun du brtags pa'i phyir /
translated: If the universal is imagined to be the reason, because of the superimposition of all particulars,

original: de ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa ma yin nam zhe na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa ma yin nam zhe na de ni ma yin te /
translated: is it not similar to the effect? No, it is not.

original: 'di ltar byas pa nyid kyi spyi mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyis khyab pa nyid la 'bras bu dang mtshungs par brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar byas pa nyid kyi spyi mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyis khyab pa nyid la 'bras bu dang mtshungs par brtags pa yin no //
translated: For in this way, the universal of being produced is pervaded by the universal of impermanence, and it is imagined to be similar to the effect.

original: bsgrub bya'i rjes 'gro phyir 'bras bu byas pa nyid du spyis kyang grub par byed pa @10a * //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i rjes 'gro phyir 'bras bu byas pa nyid du spyis kyang grub par byed pa @10a * //
translated: Because it follows the probandum, the universal of being produced is also established by the universal of being an effect.

original: yin na'o // ci byas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs 'di smra ba'i ngo bo can nam 'on te bum pa'i ngo bo can du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: yin na'o // ci byas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs 'di smra ba'i ngo bo can nam 'on te bum pa'i ngo bo can du 'gyur grang na /
translated: But what is the reason for this? Is it the nature of sound or the nature of a pot?

original: gal te bum pa'i yin na de ni sgra la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma grub pa yin la sgra'i byas pa nyid gtan tshigs yin na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa'i yin na de ni sgra la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma grub pa yin la sgra'i byas pa nyid gtan tshigs yin na /
translated: If it is the nature of a pot, then it is not established because it does not exist in sound. If the reason is the productness of sound,

original: dpe sgrub par byed pas stong pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: dpe sgrub par byed pas stong pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: then it is empty of establishing the example.

original: 'brel ba can ni tha dad phyir //
analyzed: 'brel ba can ni tha dad phyir //
translated: Because the related is different,

original: de ltar 'brel pa can ni tha dad pas tha snyad brjod pa skyon gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu mtshungs 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar 'brel pa can ni tha dad pas tha snyad brjod pa skyon gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu mtshungs 'dod do //
translated: Thus, because the related is different, whatever fault there is in verbal expression, that is accepted as the same for the effect.

original: de ltar na 'dir bsgrub par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba khyad par can ma yin pa dbyibs la sogs pa'i spyi ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir bsgrub par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba khyad par can ma yin pa dbyibs la sogs pa'i spyi ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, here the non-distinctive concomitance with the probandum is not a universal such as shape and so on.

original: de bas na ltag chod ma yin no des na spyi gtan tshigs yin na khyab pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na ltag chod ma yin no des na spyi gtan tshigs yin na khyab pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is not a reductio. Thus, if the universal is the reason, there is no pervasion.

original: the tshom za ba dang khyad par yin na ni ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: the tshom za ba dang khyad par yin na ni ma grub pa yin no //
translated: If you mean that it is different from the doubt, then your reason is unestablished.

original: rigs kyi khyad par ni rigs kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: rigs kyi khyad par ni rigs kyi bye brag go //
translated: The difference of type is the difference of species.

original: de la ji ltar khang bzangs la sogs pa'i bye brag gi rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyi dbyibs la /
analyzed: de la ji ltar khang bzangs la sogs pa'i bye brag gi rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyi dbyibs la /
translated: In that case, you see that the cognition of the shape of a mansion, etc.

original: blo sngon du song ba can nyid mthong zhing /
analyzed: blo sngon du song ba can nyid mthong zhing /
translated: is preceded by the cognition of the parts,

original: ri bo la sogs pa'i dbyibs la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ri bo la sogs pa'i dbyibs la ni ma yin no //
translated: but you do not see that in the case of the shape of a mountain, etc.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi bsgrub par bya bar /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi bsgrub par bya bar /
translated: The universal of shape is seen in the example you cite,

original: rab grags pa de ni sgra'i spyi ni mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrigs kyi khyad par de yongs su btang nas /
analyzed: rab grags pa de ni sgra'i spyi ni mthong ba'i phyir ro // rigs kyi khyad par de yongs su btang nas /
translated: and the universal of shape is seen in the probandum.üîΩTherefore, the reason is inconclusive, because the shape of the mansion, etc.

original: rigs kyi spyi bzung ba'i phyir ji ltar de yang dbyibs kyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin pa de bzhin du de yang yin pa de ltar na sgrub byed mi rigs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi spyi bzung ba'i phyir ji ltar de yang dbyibs kyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin pa de bzhin du de yang yin pa de ltar na sgrub byed mi rigs so //
translated: is the probandum, just as the shape of the mountain, etc. is.

original: ci dang 'dra bzhed na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bzhed na /
translated: What is the example of the inconclusive reason?

original: ngag la sogs go nyid phyir rva can bzhin /
analyzed: ngag la sogs go nyid phyir rva can bzhin /
translated: The horns of a rabbit, because of the word.

original: go zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni ngag la sogs pa dag tu grags pa dang 'brel pa can yin pa de tsam gyis ni ngag la sogs pa la ba lang nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis rva yod pa nyid sgrub pa ma yin pa
analyzed: go zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni ngag la sogs pa dag tu grags pa dang 'brel pa can yin pa de tsam gyis ni ngag la sogs pa la ba lang nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyis rva yod pa nyid sgrub pa ma yin pa
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is connected with the words ‚Äúfame‚Äù and so on. By that alone, the reason ‚Äúbecause of being a cow‚Äù does not prove the existence of horns in the words and so on.

original: lta bu'o // de ltar na rva can nyid kyis ni khra mo la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba khyad par can gyi ba lang nyid la khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: lta bu'o // de ltar na rva can nyid kyis ni khra mo la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba khyad par can gyi ba lang nyid la khyab pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the possession of horns pervades the particular cow that is the object of the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù and so on.

original: khra mo la sogs pa dag la rva can nyid rigs kyi /
analyzed: khra mo la sogs pa dag la rva can nyid rigs kyi /
translated: The possession of horns is appropriate for cows such as the cow ‚Äúcow,‚Äù

original: ngag la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngag la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not for words and so on.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang phyir //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang phyir //
translated: because of the dependence on what is desired to be expressed,

original: sgra rnams gang la'ang med ma yin //
analyzed: sgra rnams gang la'ang med ma yin //
translated: the words are not nonexistent in anything at all.

original: thams cad la yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad la yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: They exist in everything.

original: de yod pas ni sgra yod pa tsam gyis don grub na ni'o //
analyzed: de yod pas ni sgra yod pa tsam gyis don grub na ni'o //
translated: If the mere existence of the words were established by the existence of the object,

original: thams cad ni ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'o dngos po'am skyes bu thams cad kyi grub 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad ni ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'o dngos po'am skyes bu thams cad kyi grub 'gyur ro //
translated: then everything would be established, just as it is desired, as a thing or as a person.

original: gal te sgra mi 'jug pa de ltar na @10b yang gang gi tshe 'jug par 'gyur pa de nyid kyi tshe 'gyur pa de ltar na sgra yod pa'i phyir don grub na ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sgra mi 'jug pa de ltar na @10b yang gang gi tshe 'jug par 'gyur pa de nyid kyi tshe 'gyur pa de ltar na sgra yod pa'i phyir don grub na ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the word is not applied, then when would it be applied? If it is applied because the object exists, then how could the object that is desired be established?

original: de thams cad kyis ni gzhan gyis rab tu sbyar ba'i sgrub par byed pa dag ni ma grub pa nyid dang ma nges pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: de thams cad kyis ni gzhan gyis rab tu sbyar ba'i sgrub par byed pa dag ni ma grub pa nyid dang ma nges pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: All of these arguments establish that the proofs employed by others are not established and are uncertain.

original: ma grub pa sgrub pa'i don du sgra'i spyis rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin par bstan ma thag pa des mi rtag la sogs phyir yang /
analyzed: ma grub pa sgrub pa'i don du sgra'i spyis rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin par bstan ma thag pa des mi rtag la sogs phyir yang /
translated: The following verse is stated to show that the inference based on the general property of sound is not a proof of non-existence.

original: ser skya la sogs kyi blo dang bde ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: ser skya la sogs kyi blo dang bde ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The intellect and so on of Kapila and so on, and pleasure and so on,

original: sems med sogs te sems med par bsgrub par bya ba /
analyzed: sems med sogs te sems med par bsgrub par bya ba /
translated: are established as being without mind and so on.

original: ji ltar gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes dpyad pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes dpyad pa yin no //
translated: Just as the reason is not established, so the proof is not established.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni skye ba bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni skye ba bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes origination.

original: yang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is to be applied to the other alternatives.

original: shun lpags bshus pas 'chi ba'i phyir shun lpags thams cad bshus na 'chi ba'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir /
analyzed: shun lpags bshus pas 'chi ba'i phyir shun lpags thams cad bshus na 'chi ba'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir /
translated: Because the bark of trees is removed and they die, the reason is established that if all the bark were removed, the trees would die.

original: shing rnams sems dang ldan pa yang ngo mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shing rnams sems dang ldan pa yang ngo mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub pa ma yin te /
translated: But the intended meaning is not established, because the trees are sentient.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is not established.

original: ci'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyang ma grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid kyang ma grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is impermanence not established?

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa rang gi rang bzhin las 'pho bo med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi nus pa'i mi rtag pa nyid mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa rang gi rang bzhin las 'pho bo med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi nus pa'i mi rtag pa nyid mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because Buddhists and others do not accept that the nature of things is to be impermanent in the sense of having the potential to change from their intrinsic nature.

original: rang dang gzhan gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i mi rtag pa'i don gtan tshigs nyid du brjod pa na ci rigs par bdag dang gzhan la ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i mi rtag pa'i don gtan tshigs nyid du brjod pa na ci rigs par bdag dang gzhan la ma grub pa yin no //
translated: When the meaning of impermanence, which is accepted by ourselves and others, is stated as the reason, it is not established for either ourselves or others.

original: 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa'i ltag chod kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa'i ltag chod kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a reductio ad absurdum that is similar to the conclusion.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i don gyi spyi nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba'i don gyi spyi nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the universal of the referent object expressed by the word impermanence is not established.

original: de grub na ni 'gyur te /
analyzed: de grub na ni 'gyur te /
translated: If it were established, it would be so,

original: dper na byas pa nyid la sogs pa lta bu'o //üîΩji ltar grub pa ma yin pa de ltar yang /
analyzed: dper na byas pa nyid la sogs pa lta bu'o // ji ltar grub pa ma yin pa de ltar yang /
translated: like the universal of the referent object expressed by the word produced.

original: tshad ma rnam par nges pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: tshad ma rnam par nges pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: How it is not established should be understood as it is explained in the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika.

original: shing rnams la rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang / tshe 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'chi ba yang grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shing rnams la rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang / tshe 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'chi ba yang grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Death, which has the characteristic of the cessation of consciousness, faculties, and life, is not established in trees.

original: 'chi ba'i sgra 'jug pa tsam gyis sems dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /üîΩmar dang 'bru mar dang shing kun la sogs pa dag la yang 'chi ba'i sgra 'jug tu zin kyang sems med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sgra 'jug pa tsam gyis sems dang ldan pa yang ma yin te / mar dang 'bru mar dang shing kun la sogs pa dag la yang 'chi ba'i sgra 'jug tu zin kyang sems med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it that the word death is applied to them merely because they possess consciousness,üîΩbecause the word death is applied to butter, oil, wood, and so forth, but they are not conscious.üîΩEven though the word death, which means to dry up, is applied to trees, it is not certain that it means to dry up,

original: shing dag la skams pa'i don can gyi 'chi ba'i sgra brjod du zin kyang sha skam la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir /üîΩskams pa ni ma nges @11a * //
analyzed: shing dag la skams pa'i don can gyi 'chi ba'i sgra brjod du zin kyang sha skam la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir /üîΩskams pa ni ma nges @11a * //
translated: because it is applied to such things as dried meat.

original: pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the very essence of the ultimate.üîΩ

original: mi 'jug na yang khyab pa med pa'i phyir the tshom za bar byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi 'jug na yang khyab pa med pa'i phyir the tshom za bar byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: and if it does not engage, then there is no pervasion, and so there is doubt.

original: dngos rang bzhin /
analyzed: dngos rang bzhin /
translated: The nature of the thing itself is the reason.

original: gtan tshigs su grub min la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs su grub min la /
translated: It is not established as a reason.üîΩThis is the reasoning that has the characteristic of stating the non-establishment as explained.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i ma grub pa brjod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rigs pa 'di yin no spyir dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo gtan tshigs su grub na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i ma grub pa brjod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rigs pa 'di yin no spyir dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo gtan tshigs su grub na /
translated: In general, if the nature of the thing itself is established as the reason,

original: ji ltar byas pa'i 'brel pa can tha dad pa'i rten gyis khyad par du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni gnod pa can yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pa'i 'brel pa can tha dad pa'i rten gyis khyad par du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni gnod pa can yin te /
translated: then any distinction that is related to it in a certain way and is based on something different is not a fault,

original: nyes par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyes par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not a mistake.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: khyad par ma grub na yang ngo //
analyzed: khyad par ma grub na yang ngo //
translated: Even if the distinction is not established.

original: de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo grub na yang khyad par gnod pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo grub na yang khyad par gnod pa can ma yin no //
translated: Thus, even if the nature of the subject to be established is established, the distinction is not a fault.

original: sgra yi nam mkha' rten yin bzhin //
analyzed: sgra yi nam mkha' rten yin bzhin //
translated: Like sound and space being the basis.

original: dper na gang rdzi mo'i bar la rab tu grags pa'i chos can sgra la /
analyzed: dper na gang rdzi mo'i bar la rab tu grags pa'i chos can sgra la /
translated: For example, in the case of the subject sound, which is well-known as being between the lips,

original: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa ma grub tu zin kyang gtan tshigs byas pa nyid la sogs pa chos can sgra la ma grub par 'dren par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa ma grub tu zin kyang gtan tshigs byas pa nyid la sogs pa chos can sgra la ma grub par 'dren par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Even though the qualities of space are not established, the reason, being produced, is not drawn out as not established with respect to the subject, sound.

original: de bas na 'di ltar gang la sgra tsam grub pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar gang la sgra tsam grub pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, in this way, although mere sound is established,

original: bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos rjes su 'gro ba'i don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos rjes su 'gro ba'i don ni ma yin no //
translated: the meaning that is concordant with the property to be established is not.

original: de ni sgra la gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni sgra la gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not a reason that is not established with respect to sound.

original: gang la don ni grub la /
analyzed: gang la don ni grub la /
translated: How is it when the meaning is established,

original: sgra ma yin pa de la yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sgra ma yin pa de la yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: but the sound is not?

original: de la sgra ma grub kyang dngos po ni grub na /
analyzed: de la sgra ma grub kyang dngos po ni grub na /
translated: Even though the sound is not established, if the thing is established,

original: dngos por gyur pa'i rtags grub pa yin na /
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa'i rtags grub pa yin na /
translated: then the sign that is a thing is established.

original: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa 'gyur ro //
translated: How is it that the desired meaning is established?

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /üîΩdper na / 'ug pa pa la sangs rgyas pas //
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na / dper na / 'ug pa pa la sangs rgyas pas //
translated: What is it like?üîΩFor example, it is like the explanation by the owl

original: lus sogs sgrub byed bshad pa bzhin //
analyzed: lus sogs sgrub byed bshad pa bzhin //
translated: BuddhapƒÅlita of the proof of the body, and so on.

original: dper na bye brag pa la sangs rgyas pas rdul phra rab ni lus can yin pa'i phyir mi rtag ste bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes byas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bye brag pa la sangs rgyas pas rdul phra rab ni lus can yin pa'i phyir mi rtag ste bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes byas pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a Buddhist might say to a Vaise~ika: The subtle particle is impermanent because it has a body, like a pot, and so on.

original: de la yul can gyi sgra sangs rgyas pa la reg bya dang ldan par grags kyi /
analyzed: de la yul can gyi sgra sangs rgyas pa la reg bya dang ldan par grags kyi /
translated: In this case, the word body is known to the Buddhist to have the meaning of possessing tactility.

original: bye brag pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bye brag pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not known to have that meaning for the Vaise~ika.

original: 'di'i yang rdzas thams cad du 'gro ba ma yin pa'i tshad ni lus can yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i yang rdzas thams cad du 'gro ba ma yin pa'i tshad ni lus can yin la /
translated: And the measure of the non-ubiquity of substance in this case is having a body.

original: de yang sangs rgyas pa la ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas pa la ma grub pa yin te /
translated: And that is not established for the Buddhist.

original: sangs rgyas pa ni tshad ces bya ba cung zad kyang mi 'dod na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa ni tshad ces bya ba cung zad kyang mi 'dod na /
translated: For the Buddhist does not accept anything called a measure,

original: gang gis na de la yang lus can gyi sgra khas len par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na de la yang lus can gyi sgra khas len par 'gyur /
translated: so how could he accept the word body in that context?

original: de bas na 'di ltar gnyi ga dag gi yang phan tshun mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la sgra ma grub pa yin gyi don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar gnyi ga dag gi yang phan tshun mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la sgra ma grub pa yin gyi don ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, in this case, the word is not established for both parties in the context of a mutually acceptable object, but the meaning is.

original: gnyi gas rdul phra rab dang bum pa @11b dag la reg bya khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyi gas rdul phra rab dang bum pa @11b dag la reg bya khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: For both parties accept that both the subtle particle and the pot have tactility.

original: grub par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: grub par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the proof itself.

original: de bas ni dngos po de nyid 'khrul pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas ni dngos po de nyid 'khrul pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, that very thing is the error, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni ma grub pa dang 'gal ba bzung ngo //üîΩsgra ni 'khrul pa med na yang //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni ma grub pa dang 'gal ba bzung ngo // sgra ni 'khrul pa med na yang //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the unestablished and the contradictory.üîΩEven if the word is not erroneous,

original: sgra 'khrul pa med du zin kyang /
analyzed: sgra 'khrul pa med du zin kyang /
translated: even if the word is not erroneous,

original: sgrub byed skyon ldan shes bya ste //
analyzed: sgrub byed skyon ldan shes bya ste //
translated: the proof is known to be faulty.

original: sgra 'khrul pa med pa tsam gyis grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra 'khrul pa med pa tsam gyis grub pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not established by the mere non-error of the word.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos las dngos po grub phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos las dngos po grub phyir ro //
translated: Because the thing is established from the thing.

original: dngos po nyid ni rag lus pa yod pa'i phyir dngos po'i go bar byed pa yin gyi sgra ni ma yin no //üîΩdper na khra mo'am /
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni rag lus pa yod pa'i phyir dngos po'i go bar byed pa yin gyi sgra ni ma yin no // dper na khra mo'am /
translated: The thing itself is the proof because it is dependent, not the word.

original: glang po che'i phru gu'i khyad par /üîΩglang phrug rva can ba lang nyid //
analyzed: glang po che'i phru gu'i khyad par / glang phrug rva can ba lang nyid //
translated: For example, ‚Äúblack‚Äù or ‚Äúelephant calf‚Äù are distinctions.üîΩThe difference of the elephant calf is

original: lag can nyid phyir zhes grub byed /
analyzed: lag can nyid phyir zhes grub byed /
translated: the cow with tusks, because of having hands.

original: 'gro ba'i phyir ram lag pa dang 'brel pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don to //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i phyir ram lag pa dang 'brel pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of the reason is ‚Äúbecause of going‚Äù or ‚Äúbecause of being connected with hands.‚Äù

original: ba lang gi sgra la sogs pa'i brjod par bya ba nyid grags pa brjod par 'dod pa ma yin pa'am ba lang gi rigs sam /üîΩglang po che'i rigs kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ba lang gi sgra la sogs pa'i brjod par bya ba nyid grags pa brjod par 'dod pa ma yin pa'am ba lang gi rigs sam / glang po che'i rigs kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is not a name that is used to refer to the class of cows, nor is it used to refer to the class of elephants.

original: de ltar na yang grags pas nges pa nyid kyi phyir ba lang dang glang po'i sgra ni de'i rigs la 'khrul pa ma yin no //üîΩbrjod par 'dod pa'i don yang 'khrul par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na yang grags pas nges pa nyid kyi phyir ba lang dang glang po'i sgra ni de'i rigs la 'khrul pa ma yin no // brjod par 'dod pa'i don yang 'khrul par byed do //
translated: But even so, the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is not mistaken with regard to the class of cows, because the meaning is ascertained by way of the word‚Äôs use.üîΩThe word also does not cause error with regard to the object that is intended.

original: de brjod par 'dod pas sgra sbyor bar byed pa'i 'khrul pa med pa can yin na'ang de la sgra ni gtan tshigs ma yin no //
analyzed: de brjod par 'dod pas sgra sbyor bar byed pa'i 'khrul pa med pa can yin na'ang de la sgra ni gtan tshigs ma yin no //
translated: Even if the person who intends to speak does not err, the word is not a reason.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: don nyid do //
analyzed: don nyid do //
translated: The object itself.

original: de yang 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir de 'dra ba'i rnam pa ni de 'dra ba'i brjod par 'dod pa la gtan tshigs ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir de 'dra ba'i rnam pa ni de 'dra ba'i brjod par 'dod pa la gtan tshigs ma yin no //
translated: But if the object is mistaken, then the word that has that form is not a reason for the object that is intended.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i don yang yod pa yin na /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i don yang yod pa yin na /
translated: But if the object that is intended exists,

original: de ltar na yang ba lang gi sgra dang / glang po'i sgra ni skyes bu la yod pa ma yin zhing 'di 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang ba lang gi sgra dang / glang po'i sgra ni skyes bu la yod pa ma yin zhing 'di 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But the words ‚Äúcow‚Äù and ‚Äúelephant‚Äù do not exist in the man, nor does he accept them.

original: de ni tshig la mkhas pa med pa'i phyir de skad du brjod na yang /
analyzed: de ni tshig la mkhas pa med pa'i phyir de skad du brjod na yang /
translated: And although he speaks in this way,

original: de ni de'i rjod par byed par grags pa ma yin pa'i phyir sgra ni 'khrul pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i rjod par byed par grags pa ma yin pa'i phyir sgra ni 'khrul pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: it is not that the word is not mistaken, because it is not known to be the expresser of that.

original: de bas na 'di ltar brjod par 'dod pa'i skyes bu'i blo sngon du song ba can nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa dag ni skyon dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar brjod par 'dod pa'i skyes bu'i blo sngon du song ba can nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa dag ni skyon dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the proofs that are preceded by the intention to speak of a person are faulty.

original: gang zhig gang yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang yod pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la grub pa yin no //
translated: And the syllogism ‚ÄúThe valid cognition that proves the existence of something does not exist‚Äù and so on is established.

original: gzhan yang dbang phyug ni ril gyis rgyu yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dad pas go bar bya ba yin no//
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang phyug ni ril gyis rgyu yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dad pas go bar bya ba yin no//
translated: Moreover, the statement ‚ÄúGod is the cause of everything‚Äù is to be understood through faith.

original: @12a * // de ltar ni ji ltar rang bzhin gang gis 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i dus na /
analyzed: @12a * // de ltar ni ji ltar rang bzhin gang gis 'bras bu'i rgyu yin pa'i dus na /
translated: In that case, at the time when the cause of the effect is the nature of the effect,üîΩ

original: dbang phyug ces bya ba'i dngos de rgyu yin par 'dod pa'o rang bzhin de nyid kyis de ltar de nyid gang gi tshe /
analyzed: dbang phyug ces bya ba'i dngos de rgyu yin par 'dod pa'o rang bzhin de nyid kyis de ltar de nyid gang gi tshe /
translated: In that case, the entity called ‚Äúƒ™≈õvara‚Äù is asserted to be the cause of effects by virtue of his nature.üîΩBy virtue of that very nature, he is not a noncause, that is, he is not in a state of nonactivity.

original: rgyu min byed pa po'i gnas skabs ma yin pa de'i tshe byed pa po'i rang bzhin las 'phos pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu min byed pa po'i gnas skabs ma yin pa de'i tshe byed pa po'i rang bzhin las 'phos pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: At that time, he does not move from the nature of an agent.

original: de ni khyad par gang gis rgyur 'dod la /
analyzed: de ni khyad par gang gis rgyur 'dod la /
translated: By virtue of what difference is he asserted to be a cause?

original: rgyu ma yin par mi 'dod /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin par mi 'dod /
translated: He is not asserted to be a noncause.

original: byed pa por mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs kyang byed pa po nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa por mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs kyang byed pa po nyid ma yin te /
translated: The state of being asserted to be an agent is also not an agent.

original: byed pa po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byed pa po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is because there is no difference in terms of the nature of a nonagent.üîΩWhatever is an agent is not different from the state of being a nonagent.

original: sbyor ba gang dang gang byed pa po ma yin pa'i gnas skabs las khyad par du byar med pa de ni byed pa po ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba gang dang gang byed pa po ma yin pa'i gnas skabs las khyad par du byar med pa de ni byed pa po ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is a nonagent is not different from the state of being an agent.

original: dper na de nyid byed pa po'i gnas skabs ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na de nyid byed pa po'i gnas skabs ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is not the case that the state of being an agent is not the state of being an agent.

original: dbang phyug gi byed pa po nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i skabs kyang byed pa po ma yin pa'i gnas skabs las khyad par du bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi byed pa po nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i skabs kyang byed pa po ma yin pa'i gnas skabs las khyad par du bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And it is not the case that the state of being an agent is not distinguished from the state of not being an agent, in the context of the desire to be an agent of ƒ™≈õvara. This is the nonobservation of a property of things that are different.

original: ci ste yang byed pa po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las khyad par can gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bya ba'i phul du byung ba med par 'bras bu 'ga' zhig gi dbang phyug byed pa po nyid yin par rtogs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste yang byed pa po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las khyad par can gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bya ba'i phul du byung ba med par 'bras bu 'ga' zhig gi dbang phyug byed pa po nyid yin par rtogs pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if one understands that ƒ™≈õvara is the agent of some effect, without a special activity that is a transformation from a state of not being an agent to a state that is an agent,

original: mtshon cha dang 'brel pa las nag pa'i rma dang / rma de sman dang 'brel pa las 'drub pa yin na'o //
analyzed: mtshon cha dang 'brel pa las nag pa'i rma dang / rma de sman dang 'brel pa las 'drub pa yin na'o //
translated: then a wound on the body of K·πõ·π£·πáa from contact with a weapon and the healing of that wound from contact with medicine would be the activity of ƒ™≈õvara.

original: rma mi byed pa'i phyir dang mi 'drub pa'i phyir byed pa nyid du /
analyzed: rma mi byed pa'i phyir dang mi 'drub pa'i phyir byed pa nyid du /
translated: Because he does not make the wound and he does not heal it, he is not the agent.

original: 'brel med sdong dum ci yi phyir //
analyzed: 'brel med sdong dum ci yi phyir //
translated: Why is a stump that is not connected

original: rgyu nyid du ni rtog mi byed //
analyzed: rgyu nyid du ni rtog mi byed //
translated: not imagined to be the cause?

original: ji ltar sdong dum rma byed pa dang 'drub ba'i byed pa po yin no zhes mi rtog pa de ltar dbang phyug kyang mi 'gyur ro //üîΩsbyor ba ni gang zhig 'bras bu dag gi khyad par skyed pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar sdong dum rma byed pa dang 'drub ba'i byed pa po yin no zhes mi rtog pa de ltar dbang phyug kyang mi 'gyur ro // sbyor ba ni gang zhig 'bras bu dag gi khyad par skyed pa na /
translated: Just as one does not conceive that a stump is the agent of the action of dancing or weaving, so also one does not conceive that God is the agent.üîΩThe syllogism is:

original: de mi skyed pa'i gnas skabs las khyad par can gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bya ba'i phul du byung ba yod pa ma yin pa de ni de'i byed pa po ma yin te /
analyzed: de mi skyed pa'i gnas skabs las khyad par can gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bya ba'i phul du byung ba yod pa ma yin pa de ni de'i byed pa po ma yin te /
translated: When something produces a particular effect, it does not exist at that time as a special kind of activity that is not productive of that effect, because it is not the agent of that effect,

original: dper na mtshon cha dang sman gyi 'brel pas nag pa'i rma dang 'drub pa'i gnas skabs las rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bya ba'i phul du byung ba can ma thob pa'i sdong dum ni de dag gi byed pa po ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mtshon cha dang sman gyi 'brel pas nag pa'i rma dang 'drub pa'i gnas skabs las rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bya ba'i phul du byung ba can ma thob pa'i sdong dum ni de dag gi byed pa po ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as, for example, a stump, which does not have a special kind of activity that is productive of a wound or of weaving, is not the agent of the action of wounding or weaving, respectively, by virtue of its relation to a sword or to a shuttle.

original: dbang phyug kyang dngos po rnams kyi 'bras bu'i bye brag skyed pa na mi skyed pa'i gnas skabs las khyad par can gyi rang bzhin gyis bya ba'i phul du byung @12b ba dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug kyang dngos po rnams kyi 'bras bu'i bye brag skyed pa na mi skyed pa'i gnas skabs las khyad par can gyi rang bzhin gyis bya ba'i phul du byung @12b ba dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Also, when God produces the various effects of things, he is devoid of the excellence of activity due to a special nature that is not a non-producer. This is the non-observation of a pervader.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te //
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te //
translated: Nor is it unestablished.

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin khyad par med par ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin khyad par med par ni /
translated: Because without a special nature,

original: byed par yang ni mi rung ngo snga ma'i rang bzhin las rang bzhin gzhan skyed pa med pa gang yin pa de ni bya ba phul du byung ba dang ldan pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byed par yang ni mi rung ngo snga ma'i rang bzhin las rang bzhin gzhan skyed pa med pa gang yin pa de ni bya ba phul du byung ba dang ldan pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not tenable that he is an agent. That which is the non-production of a nature different from the previous nature does not have the excellence of activity.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir gang las ma grub pa yin /
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir gang las ma grub pa yin /
translated: For example, it is like the horns of a rabbit, etc. From what is it unestablished?üîΩMoreover, God

original: gzhan yang dbang phyug / rtag la ldog pa nyid med phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang phyug / rtag la ldog pa nyid med phyir //
translated: Because the permanent has no cessation,

original: nus pa nyid kyang rtogs par dka' //
analyzed: nus pa nyid kyang rtogs par dka' //
translated: it is difficult to understand his potency.

original: ril byed pa ni khong du chud par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: ril byed pa ni khong du chud par dka' ba yin no //
translated: It is difficult to understand the creator.

original: dngos po la yod ba tsam gyi rgyu nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang /
analyzed: dngos po la yod ba tsam gyi rgyu nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang /
translated: It is not just the mere presence of a thing that is the cause, but rather

original: dper na 'di ni 'di yod na 'gyur la /
analyzed: dper na 'di ni 'di yod na 'gyur la /
translated: that when this exists, that arises.

original: de las gzhan pa'i nus pa de'i rgyu dag yod du zin kyang de med na med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i nus pa de'i rgyu dag yod du zin kyang de med na med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Even if the other potential causes of that effect exist, if that does not exist, it does not arise.

original: de ltar na the tshom med par de'i 'bras bu nyid du bstan par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar na the tshom med par de'i 'bras bu nyid du bstan par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: Thus, when it is taught without doubt that it is the effect of that,

original: de'i rgyur grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyur grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is established as its cause.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i ldog pa ni rtag pa nyid kyi phyir dbang phyug la yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na dngos po rnams la de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa grub pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar na rgyu yin /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i ldog pa ni rtag pa nyid kyi phyir dbang phyug la yod pa ma yin pa de ltar na dngos po rnams la de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa grub pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar na rgyu yin /
translated: Since such a reversal does not exist for ƒ™≈õvara because he is permanent, in that case, since it is not established that things conform to his going and coming, how could he be the cause?

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang dang lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa grub pa med pa de ni de'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang dang lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa grub pa med pa de ni de'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is not established as the invariable concomitance of the presence and absence of something else, with regard to the establishment of the state of cause and effect with that, is not the effect of that.

original: dper na 'bigs byed dang gangs can lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'bigs byed dang gangs can lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the Vindhya and Himalaya mountains.

original: dbang phyug la yang ril dang rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo po'i sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa grub pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug la yang ril dang rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo po'i sgrub par byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa grub pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And with regard to God, the invariable concomitance of the presence and absence of the establishment of the state of cause and effect is not established. This is the non-apprehension of the pervasion.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te //
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te //
translated: Nor is it unestablished.

original: rtag pa nyid kyi phyir dbang phyug gi ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu yang de log pa na ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyi phyir dbang phyug gi ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu yang de log pa na ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of permanence, the absence of God is not established, and because the effect does not cease when he ceases.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i rgyu sa bon la sogs pa dag yod pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i rgyu sa bon la sogs pa dag yod pa na /
translated: Therefore, when the seed and so on, which are the causes as they are perceived, exist,

original: gdon mi za bar myu gu la sogs pa de tsam gyi rgyu can 'byung ba mthong bas de las bzlog pa dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu la ltos pa can las khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar myu gu la sogs pa de tsam gyi rgyu can 'byung ba mthong bas de las bzlog pa dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu la ltos pa can las khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not accept that the effect is dependent on a cause such as God, because it is seen that such things as sprouts arise from just those causes.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyur mngon par 'dod pa gang dag yod na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyur mngon par 'dod pa gang dag yod na /
translated: If it were otherwise, then when those things that are asserted to be causes exist,

original: 'bras bu gang yin pa yong pa @13a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang yin pa yong pa @13a * //
translated: the effect would also exist.üîΩBut if the effect were to arise from a cause that is seen to be potent, then the cause would not be different from the effect.üîΩIf the effect were to arise from a cause that is seen to be impotent, then the cause would not be different from the non-cause.üîΩIf the effect were to arise from a cause that is both seen and unseen to be potent, then the cause would be both seen and unseen to be potent.

original: nyid du 'gyur na nus pa mthong ba can gyi rgyu de dag las gzhan nus pa mthong ba med pa can rtogs par byed pa ni de rgyu de nyid du ste ci ltar yongs su mthong ba bzhin du byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi 'bras bu de'i rgyuüîΩnyid du 'bras bu thams cad la rgyu rnams thug pa med par 'gyur /
