analyzed: nyid du 'gyur na nus pa mthong ba can gyi rgyu de dag las gzhan nus pa mthong ba med pa can rtogs par byed pa ni de rgyu de nyid du ste ci ltar yongs su mthong ba bzhin du byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi 'bras bu de'i rgyu nyid du 'bras bu thams cad la rgyu rnams thug pa med par 'gyur /
translated: If the effect were to arise from a cause that is both seen and unseen to be impotent, then the cause would be both seen and unseen to be impotent.üîΩIf the effect were to arise from a cause that is neither seen nor unseen to be potent, then the cause would be neither seen nor unseen to be potent.üîΩIf the effect were to arise from a cause that is neither seen nor unseen to be impotent, then the cause would be neither seen nor unseen to be impotent.

original: nus pa ma mthong ba can gcig po de rtag par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nus pa ma mthong ba can gcig po de rtag par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: If the effect were to arise from a cause that is both seen and unseen to be potent, then the cause would be both seen and unseen to be potent.üîΩIf the effect were to arise from a cause that is both seen and unseen to be impotent, then the cause would be both seen and unseen to be impotent.üîΩIf the effect were to arise from a cause that is neither seen nor unseen to be potent, then the cause would be neither seen nor unseen to be potent.

original: gzhan dang gzhan yang ma yin pa de ltar na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan yang ma yin pa de ltar na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the effect were to arise from a cause that is neither seen nor unseen to be impotent, then the cause would be neither seen nor unseen to be impotent.üîΩIf the effect were to arise from a cause that is both seen and unseen to be potent, then the cause would be both seen and unseen to be potent.üîΩIf the effect were to arise from a cause that is both seen and unseen to be impotent, then the cause would be both seen and unseen to be impotent.üîΩIf the effect were to arise from a cause that is neither seen nor unseen to be potent, then the cause would be neither seen nor unseen to be potent.üîΩIf the effect were to arise from a cause that is neither seen nor unseen to be impotent, then the cause would be neither seen nor unseen to be impotent

original: gal te sa la sogs pa dag ljang bu mi skyed pa'i gnas skabs las khyad par can gyi rang bzhin skyed pa med pa de lta na yang myu gu'i rgyu dag yin no ;
analyzed: gal te sa la sogs pa dag ljang bu mi skyed pa'i gnas skabs las khyad par can gyi rang bzhin skyed pa med pa de lta na yang myu gu'i rgyu dag yin no ;
translated: If, in the case of earth and so on, there is no production of a special nature from a state in which it does not produce a sprout, still, they are the causes of the sprout.

original: ; des na gang zhig 'bras bu gang gi khyad par skyed pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la ma nges pa yin no zhe na de ni ma nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ; des na gang zhig 'bras bu gang gi khyad par skyed pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la ma nges pa yin no zhe na de ni ma nges pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the argument that ‚Äúwhen something produces a special effect of some other thing‚Äù and so on is not definite.

original: 'di ltar sa la sogs pa thams cad ni myu gu thams cad kyi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa la sogs pa thams cad ni myu gu thams cad kyi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: But that is not indefinite, because not all earth and so on are the causes of all sprouts.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig kho na'i yin no //
translated: Some are the causes of some.

original: myu gu skyed la sogs pa de //üîΩrang bzhin yongs su gyur nas ni //
analyzed: myu gu skyed la sogs pa de // rang bzhin yongs su gyur nas ni //
translated: The production of the sprout and so onüîΩis the transformation of the nature of the cause.

original: sngar skyed par byed pa po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las khyad par can skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin skyed pa nyid ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sngar skyed par byed pa po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las khyad par can skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin skyed pa nyid ni rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause is the production of a special nature that is a producer, from a previous nature that is not a producer.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: Of what?

original: myu gu skyed la'o //
analyzed: myu gu skyed la'o //
translated: Of the production of the sprout and so on.

original: gal te sa la sogs pa phul du byung ba skyes na mthong par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sa la sogs pa phul du byung ba skyes na mthong par 'gyur na /
translated: If the earth and so on were generated in an excellent way, it would be seen.

original: ma mthong ba ji ltar yid ches par bya ba yin zhen /
analyzed: ma mthong ba ji ltar yid ches par bya ba yin zhen /
translated: But since it is not seen, how can one believe in it?

original: sa la sogs pa de legs par byas pa na /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa de legs par byas pa na /
translated: When the earth and so on are well cultivated,

original: de'i khyad par mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i khyad par mthong phyir ro //
translated: its special features are seen.

original: de'i bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the special features of the effect that is to be generated are seen.

original: zhing gnyis smos pa dag gi nang nas gcig thong lcags lhag bas mngon par 'dus byas pas 'bras bu mang du mthong ngo //
analyzed: zhing gnyis smos pa dag gi nang nas gcig thong lcags lhag bas mngon par 'dus byas pas 'bras bu mang du mthong ngo //
translated: From among the two fields mentioned, one should remove the iron and copper that are manifestly accumulated, and see the many effects.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyu khyad par can ma yin pa las 'bras bu yang mtshungs pa mthong bar 'gyur na khyad par yang snang ngo //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyu khyad par can ma yin pa las 'bras bu yang mtshungs pa mthong bar 'gyur na khyad par yang snang ngo //
translated: Otherwise, if the effect were seen to be the same as the cause, even though the cause is not special, the special features would appear.

original: de yang glo bur ba rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang glo bur ba rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And that is not reasonable, because it is adventitious.

original: rang bzhin phul du byung ba skyed pa yod pa nyid yin pa de ltar na ma nges pa ma yin no /
analyzed: rang bzhin phul du byung ba skyed pa yod pa nyid yin pa de ltar na ma nges pa ma yin no /
translated: Therefore, if the generation of an excellent nature exists, it is not indeterminate.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po bcu gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu gsum pa /
translated: Book Thirteen

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas yang ma nges pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas yang ma nges pa'i dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: The response to the qualm about indeterminacy is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúJust as . . .‚Äù

original: gal te ji ltar yul dbang po'i //
analyzed: gal te ji ltar yul dbang po'i //
translated: If the collection of sense faculty and object

original: tshogs pa khyad med blo rgyu yin //
analyzed: tshogs pa khyad med blo rgyu yin //
translated: is the cause of cognition,

original: ji ltar dbang @13b po dang yul dag so sor khyad par med par lhan cig pa na yang de dag gzugs nyid yin pa de ltar na yang rnam par shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //üîΩde ltar dbang phyug la sogs pa 'di yang rgyur 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang @13b po dang yul dag so sor khyad par med par lhan cig pa na yang de dag gzugs nyid yin pa de ltar na yang rnam par shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro // de ltar dbang phyug la sogs pa 'di yang rgyur 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: just as the sense faculty and the object are not different from each other, even when they are together, they are still form. In the same way, ƒ™≈õvara and so on would be the cause of consciousness.

original: de ltar min no //
analyzed: de ltar min no //
translated: That is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbang po dang yul tshogs pa /
analyzed: dbang po dang yul tshogs pa /
translated: Because the collection of sense faculty and object

original: de la'ang khyad par yod phyir ro //
analyzed: de la'ang khyad par yod phyir ro //
translated: is not the cause of consciousness.

original: dbang po la sogs pa gang zhig byed pa po ma yin pa de las gzhan nyid byed pa po'i tha mar gyur pa gzhan gang yin pa rnam par shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa gang zhig byed pa po ma yin pa de las gzhan nyid byed pa po'i tha mar gyur pa gzhan gang yin pa rnam par shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The collection of sense faculty and object is not the cause of consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: so so so sor nus med rnams //
analyzed: so so so sor nus med rnams //
translated: Because the collection of sense faculty and objectüîΩis not the cause of consciousness.üîΩBecause the collection of sense faculty and objectüîΩis not the cause of consciousness.üîΩBecause the collection of sense faculty and objectüîΩis not the cause of consciousness.üîΩBecause the collection of sense faculty and objectüîΩis not the cause of consciousness.üîΩBecause the collection of sense faculty and objectüîΩis not the cause of consciousness.

original: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams 'bras bu'i dus su /
analyzed: rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams 'bras bu'i dus su /
translated: Things that are asserted to be causes at the time of the effect

original: rang bzhin phul byung med pa na //
analyzed: rang bzhin phul byung med pa na //
translated: do not have a superior nature.

original: sngar byed pa po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa'i phul du byung ba ma skyes na'o //
analyzed: sngar byed pa po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin las tha dad pa'i phul du byung ba ma skyes na'o //
translated: If a prior nature that is not a creator does not generate a superior nature that is different,

original: de dag gi tshogs pa yod na yang nus med 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag gi tshogs pa yod na yang nus med 'gyur /
translated: even if their assemblage exists, they will be powerless.

original: 'bras bu skyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed pa'o //
translated: They generate the effect.

original: de ltar na phyis kyang de dang de dag nus pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na phyis kyang de dang de dag nus pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, later also, because they are powerless,

original: de dag las 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag las 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the effect will not arise from them.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang phul du byung ba skyed pas nus pa rnams mi skyed pa de ni de ltar yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang phul du byung ba skyed pas nus pa rnams mi skyed pa de ni de ltar yin te /
translated: That is so, but still, because they generate a superior nature, the powerless ones do not generate it.

original: 'on kyang lhan cig pa dag gis ldan pa skyed par byed cing ldan pa las 'bras bu 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang lhan cig pa dag gis ldan pa skyed par byed cing ldan pa las 'bras bu 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: However, the simultaneous ones generate the possessor, and the effect arises from the possessor.

original: de dang de ni rigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: de dang de ni rigs pa ma yin te //
translated: That is not logical,

original: ji ltar de dag gis 'bras bu skyed par mi nus pa de ltar ldan pa skyed par yang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar de dag gis 'bras bu skyed par mi nus pa de ltar ldan pa skyed par yang ngo //
translated: because just as they are powerless to generate the effect, so they are also powerless to generate the possessor.

original: so sor nus pa med pa rnams ni lhan cig pa na yang nus pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: so sor nus pa med pa rnams ni lhan cig pa na yang nus pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: But when they are not capable of producing it separately, they are not capable of producing it jointly.

original: nus pa yod na yang sngar ci'i phyir skyed par mi byed /
analyzed: nus pa yod na yang sngar ci'i phyir skyed par mi byed /
translated: If they are capable of producing it jointly, why do they not produce it previously?

original: gal te de skyed pa'i las med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de skyed pa'i las med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say: because they do not have the activity of producing it,

original: ldan pa skyed par byed pa'i las de nyid ci'i phyir mi byed /
analyzed: ldan pa skyed par byed pa'i las de nyid ci'i phyir mi byed /
translated: why do they not perform that activity of producing it when they are joined?

original: de'i rgyu 'phen pa la sogs pa yang brgal cing brtag pa mtshungs pa yin pa de ltar na /üîΩtshogs su zin kyang nus pa med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i rgyu 'phen pa la sogs pa yang brgal cing brtag pa mtshungs pa yin pa de ltar na / tshogs su zin kyang nus pa med par 'gyur na /
translated: The same objection applies to the cause of their joining, etc.üîΩThus, even when they are joined, they are not capable of producing it.

original: tshogs pa rnams la nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa rnams la nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But when they are not capable of producing it when joined, they are not capable of producing it when not joined.

original: de phyir phul byung grub pa yin //
analyzed: de phyir phul byung grub pa yin //
translated: Therefore, the effect is produced by the assemblage.

original: yul dang dbang po dag gi'o //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dag gi'o //
translated: The activity of the object and the sense facultyüîΩis the activity of the assemblage.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig byed pa dang gang zhig mi byed pa de nyid ni tha dad pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig byed pa dang gang zhig mi byed pa de nyid ni tha dad pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
translated: That which is active and that which is not active have different natures.

original: dper na nas kyi myu gu'i byed pa po dang / byed pa po ma yin pa nas dang s'a lu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nas kyi myu gu'i byed pa po dang / byed pa po ma yin pa nas dang s'a lu lta bu'o //
translated: For example, barley is the active agent of the sprout of barley, but not of the sprout of rice.

original: rnam par shes pa skyed pa dang mi skyed pa dag gi dbang po dang yul gyi @14a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyed pa dang mi skyed pa dag gi dbang po dang yul gyi @14a * //
translated: The condition of the sense faculty and object is such that sometimes consciousness is produced and sometimes it is not.

original: gnas skabs dag dang / byed pa po dang byed pa po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs dag dang / byed pa po dang byed pa po ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of an intrinsic nature that is contradictory.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa //
translated: Because it is like this,

original: de phyir so sor gang nus med //
analyzed: de phyir so sor gang nus med //
translated: therefore each is not capable.

original: 'bras bu 'ga' zhig la'o //üîΩphyis tshogs pa la yon tan srid 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'ga' zhig la'o // phyis tshogs pa la yon tan srid 'gyur ba'i //
translated: With regard to some effect.

original: 'bras bu mi skyed pa'i gnas skabs la khyad par can gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bya ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi skyed pa'i gnas skabs la khyad par can gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'i bya ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi'o //
translated: The condition of not producing an effect is characterized by activity that has a special intrinsic nature, in which a quality is possible later in the assemblage.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu de'i //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu de'i //
translated: That effect is the one that is desired.

original: de dag rgyu yin dbang phyug sogs //
analyzed: de dag rgyu yin dbang phyug sogs //
translated: Those are its causes, not God and so on,

original: ma yin khyad par med phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin khyad par med phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different.

original: bshad pa las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi'o //
analyzed: bshad pa las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi'o //
translated: The opposite of what was explained.

original: sogs pa smos pa ji tsam brtan pa'i bdag nyid can rgyu nyid du 'dod pa de dag ni rgyu ma yin no zhes spyir bstan pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ji tsam brtan pa'i bdag nyid can rgyu nyid du 'dod pa de dag ni rgyu ma yin no zhes spyir bstan pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicates that the other characteristics that are asserted to be causes are also not causes.

original: de bas na rtag pa nyid tshad ma ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de bas na rtag pa nyid tshad ma ma yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, permanence is not a valid means of cognition.

original: mi rtag pa nyid yin na yang de dang ldan pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar gnas so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid yin na yang de dang ldan pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar gnas so //
translated: And even if it were impermanent, it would not possess that characteristic.

original: tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang zhig gang gis sgrub par byed pa phyin ci ma log par nan tan du byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la ma grub par dogs pa bsub yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang zhig gang gis sgrub par byed pa phyin ci ma log par nan tan du byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la ma grub par dogs pa bsub yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa valid means of cognition‚Äù and so on is a response to the doubt that the application of the term ‚Äúvalid means of cognition‚Äù and so on to the person who is engaged in the unerring practice of what is to be accomplished and what is to be abandoned is not established.

original: tshad ma zhes bya ba yang ci la brjod ce na /
analyzed: tshad ma zhes bya ba yang ci la brjod ce na /
translated: What is a valid means of cognition?

original: lkog gyur don shes yin te /
analyzed: lkog gyur don shes yin te /
translated: It is the knowledge of a hidden object.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba'o //
translated: It is the seeing of an object that is beyond the senses.

original: gal te tshad ma de 'dra ba de sgrub byed cung zad yod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma de 'dra ba de sgrub byed cung zad yod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: If there were any such valid means of cognition that is to be accomplished,

original: de nan tan du byas pa las skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis tshad ma nyid kyang thob par gyur na /
analyzed: de nan tan du byas pa las skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis tshad ma nyid kyang thob par gyur na /
translated: And some people, through assiduous practice of that, attain valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar tshad ma nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshad ma nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, there is no proof by valid cognition.

original: med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid kyis sgrub par byed de 'ga' zhig gis kyang nan tan byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid kyis sgrub par byed de 'ga' zhig gis kyang nan tan byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no proof by valid cognition, there is no assiduous practice of it by anyone.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang tshad ma nyid kyi phyin ci ma log pa can gyi sgrub par byed pa nan tan du mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshig sa ma grub pa yin no zhes rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa rab tu brjod do zhes bya
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang tshad ma nyid kyi phyin ci ma log pa can gyi sgrub par byed pa nan tan du mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gtan tshig sa ma grub pa yin no zhes rgyal dpog pa la sogs pa rab tu brjod do zhes bya
translated: The Jaina say: The Lord Buddha himself assiduously practiced the proof by valid cognition that is free from error.

original: ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
analyzed: ba ni phyogs snga ma'o //
translated: This is the opponent's position.

original: sbyor bar yang skyes bu gang zhig gang gi sgrub par byed pa med pa de ni de thob pa'i phyir nge sgrub par byed pa nan tan du byed nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor bar yang skyes bu gang zhig gang gi sgrub par byed pa med pa de ni de thob pa'i phyir nge sgrub par byed pa nan tan du byed nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever person does not have a proof of something is not able to assiduously practice that proof in order to attain it,üîΩas is the case, for example, with a person who has no proof of the existence of a ghost.

original: dper na ri rab thob par byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa med pa can gyi rkang zha la de'i sgrub par byed pa nan tan du @14b byed pa med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ri rab thob par byed pa'i sgrub par byed pa med pa can gyi rkang zha la de'i sgrub par byed pa nan tan du @14b byed pa med pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the leg of a lame man who is without the means to attain Mount Meru, and who is without the means to attain it through striving.

original: skyes bu thams cad la yang tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa yong pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu thams cad la yang tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa yong pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that everyone has a means to attain valid cognition. This is the observation of a contradictory property of the subject.

original: des bshad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: des bshad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'gog par byed do //
translated: As for the statement because it is explained by him, this is a refutation.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don thams cad kyi yul can gyi shes pa ni tshad ma nyid du mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don thams cad kyi yul can gyi shes pa ni tshad ma nyid du mi 'dod kyi /
translated: We do not accept that a consciousness that has as its object all hidden objects is valid cognition.

original: 'on kyang rtogs pa pos skyes bu'i don nan tan du bya ba'i yul can gyi ye shes dang / nan tan du bya ba'i yul nyid la de mkhyen pa can ston par mdzad pa dang 'jug par mdzad pa na tshad mar gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtogs pa pos skyes bu'i don nan tan du bya ba'i yul can gyi ye shes dang / nan tan du bya ba'i yul nyid la de mkhyen pa can ston par mdzad pa dang 'jug par mdzad pa na tshad mar gyur ba yin no //
translated: However, when the Teacher, who has the wisdom that has as its object the object of striving of the one who understands, and who knows that very object of striving, teaches and engages in that, he is valid cognition.

original: de lta ma yin na dngos sam brgyud pas nye par mkho ba ma yin pa ston pa na slu ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir nan tan du bya ba'i yul can tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dngos sam brgyud pas nye par mkho ba ma yin pa ston pa na slu ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir nan tan du bya ba'i yul can tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
translated: If it were not so, then when one teaches what is not useful, either directly or indirectly, it would be deceptive, and the subject matter of earnest practice would not be valid cognition.

original: sgrub pa po rtog pa dang ldan pas ston pa'i ye shes gzhan du dpyod par mi byed do //
analyzed: sgrub pa po rtog pa dang ldan pas ston pa'i ye shes gzhan du dpyod par mi byed do //
translated: The practitioner who has understanding does not analyze the wisdom of the teacher elsewhere.

original: de ltar na des bshad nan tan bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na des bshad nan tan bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to practice what he has explained,

original: skyes bu shes ldan la la tshol bar byed /üîΩshes ldan de nyid kyis brtan pa de thob nas nan tan du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu shes ldan la la tshol bar byed / shes ldan de nyid kyis brtan pa de thob nas nan tan du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: a wise person seeks.üîΩHaving obtained that stability through the wise one himself, in order to practice,

original: yul de la ye shes can tshol par byed kyi /
analyzed: yul de la ye shes can tshol par byed kyi /
translated: the wise one seeks that object,

original: dgos pa med pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: not because of the absence of a purpose.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa gang zhig gang gis bshad pa nan tan du byed par mi 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa gang zhig gang gis bshad pa nan tan du byed par mi 'dod pa de ni /
translated: One who has understanding and does not wish to practice what is explained

original: de'i yul can gyi shes pa tshol bar mi byed pa'am tshol bar byed na rtog pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi shes pa tshol bar mi byed pa'am tshol bar byed na rtog pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: does not seek the knowledge of that object, or if he seeks it, he is not one who has understanding.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gis bshad pa nan tan du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gis bshad pa nan tan du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Application is the earnest practice of what is to be explained by whom.üîΩ

original: mi 'dod pa rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can des de'i yul can gyi shes pa tshol bar mi byed de /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can des de'i yul can gyi shes pa tshol bar mi byed de /
translated: The application is that, in order to make a practice of what is explained, one does not seek the knowledge of the one who is the object of the explanation, having first conceived of him as undesirable.

original: dper na bdag nyid nad yod pa can ma yin pa nad med pas sman pa'i shes pa tshol par mi byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bdag nyid nad yod pa can ma yin pa nad med pas sman pa'i shes pa tshol par mi byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, one who is not himself sick does not seek the knowledge of a physician.

original: skyes bu 'di yang 'chad pa pos bshad pa nan tan du bya ba'i phyir mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu 'di yang 'chad pa pos bshad pa nan tan du bya ba'i phyir mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This person also does not desire the explanation of the expounder, in order to make a practice of it. This is the non-apprehension of a cause.

original: de bas na nan tan du byed par 'dod pa dag gis 'ga' zhig gi ye shes btsal bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na nan tan du byed par 'dod pa dag gis 'ga' zhig gi ye shes btsal bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, those who desire to make a practice of it should seek the knowledge of someone.

original: des bshad pa nan tan du byed pa dag gis kyang ci'i phyir ye shes btsal bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: des bshad pa nan tan du byed pa dag gis kyang ci'i phyir ye shes btsal bar bya zhe na /
translated: But why should those who make a practice of what is explained by him seek his knowledge?

original: mi shes ston par byed pa las //
analyzed: mi shes ston par byed pa las //
translated: Because the teacher is not known.

original: 'khrul bar 'dogs pa can rnams kyis //
analyzed: 'khrul bar 'dogs pa can rnams kyis //
translated: Those who are attached to errorüîΩare not able to understand the teaching of the Dharma.

original: sdug bsngal gang zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to pacify the suffering of those who are attached to error,

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa ston pa po gang las bstan pa 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag ni de'i yul can gyi ye shes de yod dam med @15a * //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa ston pa po gang las bstan pa 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag ni de'i yul can gyi ye shes de yod dam med @15a * //
translated: Those who assert that the teacher is in accord with that and from whom the teaching is obtained have that wisdom that has that as its object, whether it exists or not.

original: ces tshol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces tshol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are in accord with that, who are teachers, and from whom the teaching is desired, they will seek to know whether or not they have that gnosis that has that as its object.üîΩIf one is not a teacher, one should not teach.

original: mi shes pa nyid ston par ma byed cig snyam pas mi shes pa ston par byed pa yod na /
analyzed: mi shes pa nyid ston par ma byed cig snyam pas mi shes pa ston par byed pa yod na /
translated: Thinking, ‚ÄúDo not teach what is not known,‚Äù if there is a teacher who teaches what is not known,

original: 'khrul par dogs pas na 'dis ni nan tan du bya ba ma yin pa nyid bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar /
analyzed: 'khrul par dogs pas na 'dis ni nan tan du bya ba ma yin pa nyid bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar /
translated: because of the fear of error, this would teach that it is not to be earnestly undertaken.

original: 'khrul par dogs pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa po rnams kyis so //
analyzed: 'khrul par dogs pa dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa po rnams kyis so //
translated: The practitioners who have the fear of error.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi sdug bsngal zhi bar byed pa'i thabs ston par mdzad pa'i ye shes btsal bar bya ba yin pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi sdug bsngal zhi bar byed pa'i thabs ston par mdzad pa'i ye shes btsal bar bya ba yin pa /
translated: Because the gnosis that teaches the means of pacifying one‚Äôs own suffering is to be sought,

original: de phyir de yi bsgrub bya ru //
analyzed: de phyir de yi bsgrub bya ru //
translated: therefore, the gnosis that is to be accomplished by that

original: gyur ba'i ye shes rnam dpyad bya'i //
analyzed: gyur ba'i ye shes rnam dpyad bya'i //
translated: should be analyzed.

original: kho bo cag gis tshad ma nyid du bshad pa'i bcom ldan 'das 'di 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byed pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i ye shes dpyad par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis tshad ma nyid du bshad pa'i bcom ldan 'das 'di 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byed pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i ye shes dpyad par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: We explain that the Lord is a valid cognition, and we analyze the wisdom that is the means of pacifying the sufferings of cyclic existence.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i yul can ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i yul can ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: It is not that he is not the object of a valid cognition that is to be established. This is our thesis.

original: de ltar na skyes bu'i don gyi yul can gyi tshad ma nyid 'dod do zhes bstan to //üîΩnye bar mkho ba ma yin pa'i don la yang tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar na skyes bu'i don gyi yul can gyi tshad ma nyid 'dod do zhes bstan to // nye bar mkho ba ma yin pa'i don la yang tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Thus we assert that he is a valid cognition whose object is the purpose of persons.üîΩIt may be that he is a valid cognition even with respect to a matter that is not needed,

original: mi 'gyur yang bla ste /
analyzed: mi 'gyur yang bla ste /
translated: or it may not be.

original: de la kho bos dpyad pa nyid ma byas la byas na yang rigs pa ma yin no //üîΩde ltar na de re zhig gang gis kho bo don du gnyer ba de la ye shes phyin ci ma log pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de la kho bos dpyad pa nyid ma byas la byas na yang rigs pa ma yin no // de ltar na de re zhig gang gis kho bo don du gnyer ba de la ye shes phyin ci ma log pa yin mod kyi /
translated: We have not analyzed this, and if we did, it would not be proper.üîΩThus, for the time being, we say that he is unmistaken with respect to that which we seek.

original: 'on kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la khas blang bar bya ba'i tshad ma nyid ston par mdzad pa po //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la khas blang bar bya ba'i tshad ma nyid ston par mdzad pa po //
translated: However, we must show that he is a valid cognition whose object is the desired object.

original: de'i srin grangs ni yongs mkhyen pa /
analyzed: de'i srin grangs ni yongs mkhyen pa /
translated: The number of its bacteria is known to all.

original: bdag cag gi ste /üîΩkho bo'i gang la nyer mkho min //
analyzed: bdag cag gi ste / kho bo'i gang la nyer mkho min //
translated: Ours,üîΩis not needed by him.

original: skyes bu'i don 'ga' zhig la nye bar mkho ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don 'ga' zhig la nye bar mkho ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: It is not needed by him, by that person, for some purpose of his. This is the second proposition.

original: sbyor ba yang gang zhig sdug bsngal gang gis gdungs pa na rtog pa sngon du gtong pa can des sdug bsngal de rab tu zhi ba'i thabs mkhyen pa gzhan gyi ye shes btsal bar bya ba yin gyi de la nye bar mkho ba can ma yin pa'i yeüîΩshes ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang zhig sdug bsngal gang gis gdungs pa na rtog pa sngon du gtong pa can des sdug bsngal de rab tu zhi ba'i thabs mkhyen pa gzhan gyi ye shes btsal bar bya ba yin gyi de la nye bar mkho ba can ma yin pa'i ye shes ni ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: When someone is tormented by some suffering, he who is disposed to reflect first will seek the knowledge of another who knows the means of completely alleviating that suffering. He will not seek knowledge that is not needed for that.

original: dper na tsha bas rab tu gdungs pa'i nad pas tsha ba rab tu zhi ba'i thabs shes pa'i shes pa btsal bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na tsha bas rab tu gdungs pa'i nad pas tsha ba rab tu zhi ba'i thabs shes pa'i shes pa btsal bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: For example, a patient tormented by a fever will seek the knowledge of someone who knows the means of completely alleviating the fever.

original: gzhan ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: He will not seek the knowledge of someone who does not have that knowledge.

original: skyes bu 'di yad 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skyes bu 'di yad 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This person is tormented by the suffering of cyclic existence. This is a natural inference.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: and with respect to the second thing to be established, it is the observation of an inconsistency with the pervasion.

original: yul gang la @15b tshad ma nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: yul gang la @15b tshad ma nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is a valid cognition with respect to a certain object

original: blang dang dor bya'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: blang dang dor bya'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston par byed do //
translated: teaches the ‚Äúacceptable‚Äù and the ‚Äúunacceptable,‚Äù etc.

original: dor bya'i de kho na nyid thabs dang bcas pa rig mdzad pa zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: dor bya'i de kho na nyid thabs dang bcas pa rig mdzad pa zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The one who knows the reality of the unacceptable together with the means is called the ‚Äúknower of the means.‚ÄùüîΩThe one who knows the reality of the acceptable together with the means is called the ‚Äúknower of the means.‚ÄùüîΩThe one who knows the reality of the unacceptable together with the means is called the ‚Äúknower of the means.‚ÄùüîΩThe one who knows the reality of of the means.‚ÄùüîΩThe one who knows the reality of the acceptable together with the means is called the ‚Äúknower of the means.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dang blang bya'i de kho na nyid kyi thabs dang bcas pa rig mdzad pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'gog pa dang lam gyi shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dang blang bya'i de kho na nyid kyi thabs dang bcas pa rig mdzad pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'gog pa dang lam gyi shes pa bstan to //
translated: The one who knows the reality of the acceptable together with the means is called the ‚Äúknower of the means.‚Äù

original: de ltar na yang dag pa'i skyes bu don sgrub par byed pa bden pa bzhi rig pa gang de /üîΩde 'dra ba'i tshad ma nyid du 'dod kyi nye bar mkho ba ma yin pa thams cad rig par mdzad pa yang tshad mar 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag pa'i skyes bu don sgrub par byed pa bden pa bzhi rig pa gang de /üîΩde 'dra ba'i tshad ma nyid du 'dod kyi nye bar mkho ba ma yin pa thams cad rig par mdzad pa yang tshad mar 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: The one who knows

original: de bas na gal te de 'dra ba'i tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa med pa bsgrub par bya ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: de bas na gal te de 'dra ba'i tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa med pa bsgrub par bya ba de'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, if the proof of such a valid cognition does not exist, then at that time,

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis de 'dra ba'i sgrub par byed pa yod pa de ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis de 'dra ba'i sgrub par byed pa yod pa de ltar na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: the proof of such a valid cognition exists in the way that will be explained, and thus the reason is not unestablished.

original: ci ste lkog tu gyur ba'i don thams cad kyi yul can gyi yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste lkog tu gyur ba'i don thams cad kyi yul can gyi yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if it is the object of all hidden objects, then

original: the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa yin te /
translated: it is an unestablished reason due to doubt,

original: de'i sgrub par byed pa yod du zin kyang zhes bya ba'i dbang du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgrub par byed pa yod du zin kyang zhes bya ba'i dbang du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taken as the subject of the statement ‚ÄúEven if its proof exists.‚Äù

original: yod pa la yang gnod pa can cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: yod pa la yang gnod pa can cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: And if there is not the slightest fault in its existence,

original: gang gis na med do zhes bya ba'i nges par bya bas 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na med do zhes bya ba'i nges par bya bas 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: then how could the ascertainment ‚ÄúIt does not exist‚Äù be established by the opponent?

original: kho bo ni de 'dra ba'i rnam pa can gyi tshad ma mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: kho bo ni de 'dra ba'i rnam pa can gyi tshad ma mi 'dod kyi /
translated: We do not assert a valid cognition with such an aspect.

original: 'on kyang skyes bu'i don shes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu'i don shes pa yin te /
translated: However, it is the consciousness of a person‚Äôs object.

original: de tsam nyid kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam nyid kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the purpose that is actually desired is accomplished by that alone.

original: de bas na skyes bu'i don shes pa 'dis ring por mthong ba'am /
analyzed: de bas na skyes bu'i don shes pa 'dis ring por mthong ba'am /
translated: Therefore, whether or not the one who knows the purpose of human life sees what is far away,

original: mthong ba med kyang rung ste /
analyzed: mthong ba med kyang rung ste /
translated: or does not see it,

original: nan tan du bya ba'i de nyid 'dod pa mthong ba de tsam ni gzung par bya ba'i tshig dang ba brten par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: nan tan du bya ba'i de nyid 'dod pa mthong ba de tsam ni gzung par bya ba'i tshig dang ba brten par bya ba yin te /
translated: one should accept just that much seeing of the reality of what is to be earnestly practiced, which is desired,

original: nye bar mkho ba ma yin par dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar mkho ba ma yin par dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the seeing of a purpose that is beyond the senses, which is not necessary.

original: gal te skyes bu'i don shes pa tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang thag ring por mthong ba can tshad ma nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skyes bu'i don shes pa tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang thag ring por mthong ba can tshad ma nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you do not assert that the one who knows the purpose of human life is a valid knower, but rather that the one who sees what is far away is a valid knower,

original: de'i tshe skyes bu'i don shes pa'i mkhas pa thag ring por mthong ba ma yin pa can dag dor la grol bar 'dod pa tshur shog / thag ring por mthong ba can gyi bya rgod sten par gyis /
analyzed: de'i tshe skyes bu'i don shes pa'i mkhas pa thag ring por mthong ba ma yin pa can dag dor la grol bar 'dod pa tshur shog / thag ring por mthong ba can gyi bya rgod sten par gyis /
translated: then at that time, let the one who desires liberation give up the wise one who knows the purpose of human life, who does not see what is far away, and come to me! Let him rely on the vulture who sees what is far away!

original: gal te thag ring por mthong ba can gyis tshad ma nyid thob pa de ltar na thag ring por mthong ba can gyi phag dang / dud 'gro'i @16a * //
analyzed: gal te thag ring por mthong ba can gyis tshad ma nyid thob pa de ltar na thag ring por mthong ba can gyi phag dang / dud 'gro'i @16a * //
translated: If one who sees at a distance obtains validity, then one who sees at a distance, such as a pig,

original: rigs mkha' la rgyu ba dang / gzhan gyi sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs mkha' la rgyu ba dang / gzhan gyi sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bsten par bya'o //
translated: an animal of the class that flies through the sky, or a sky-goer such as a ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´, should be relied upon.

original: de bas na la lar dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa yod pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na la lar dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa yod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, in some cases, one who has the ability to see objects beyond the senses, etc.,

original: skyes bu'i don shes pa nyid kyi sgrub bar byed pa la med pa yang gnod pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don shes pa nyid kyi sgrub bar byed pa la med pa yang gnod pa can ma yin no //
translated: is not refuted by the proof of the mere knowledge of the object by a person.

original: de bas na dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba la sogs pa med du zin kyang /
analyzed: de bas na dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba la sogs pa med du zin kyang /
translated: Thus, even if seeing objects beyond the senses, etc., does not exist,

original: skyes bu'i don shes pa nyid kyi sgo nas tshad ma nyid du 'dod kyi don thams cad shes pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don shes pa nyid kyi sgo nas tshad ma nyid du 'dod kyi don thams cad shes pas ni ma yin no //
translated: validity is asserted from the mere knowledge of the object by a person, but not from the knowledge of all objects.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das bdag nyid kyis kyang chos kyi 'khor lo la sogs pa dag la bden pa thugs su chud pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das bdag nyid kyis kyang chos kyi 'khor lo la sogs pa dag la bden pa thugs su chud pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the Bhagavat himself, in the Dharmacakra and so on, has realized the truth,

original: bdag nyid thams cad mkhyen par zhal gyis bzhes pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad mkhyen par zhal gyis bzhes pa yin no //
translated: he himself accepts omniscience.

original: tshad ma de 'dra ba nyid 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: tshad ma de 'dra ba nyid 'dod mod kyi /
translated: We do indeed accept such a valid cognition.

original: de'i sgrub par byed pa yang ci zhig yin /üîΩgang gis 'di 'grub par brjod ce na tshad ma de'i sgrub byed thugs rjes phan btags pa'i lan la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa can /
analyzed: de'i sgrub par byed pa yang ci zhig yin / gang gis 'di 'grub par brjod ce na tshad ma de'i sgrub byed thugs rjes phan btags pa'i lan la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa can /
translated: But what is its proof?

original: sems can thams cad la snyoms pa shin tu sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa can zhe sdang med pa ni thugs rje yin te de ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snyoms pa shin tu sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa can zhe sdang med pa ni thugs rje yin te de ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: By what is it established? Compassion, which is free from the need for requital of benefit, is impartial toward all sentient beings, and has the aspect of the desire to free them from suffering. That is its proof.

original: thugs rje de 'dra ba de nyid gang las skyes shing gang gis na de 'dra ba'i tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa gzhan med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: thugs rje de 'dra ba de nyid gang las skyes shing gang gis na de 'dra ba'i tshad ma nyid kyi sgrub par byed pa gzhan med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: From what does such compassion arise? By what is it established, so that it is not without proof?

original: goms las thugs rje zhes bya ba de yin no //
analyzed: goms las thugs rje zhes bya ba de yin no //
translated: This is what is called ‚Äúcompassion that arises from cultivation.‚Äù

original: yon tan la chags pa las sam /
analyzed: yon tan la chags pa las sam /
translated: It arises from attachment to good qualities,

original: sems can gyi khyad par las sam /üîΩgzhan gyi don la 'jug pa gzhan dag gi byed pa las sam /
analyzed: sems can gyi khyad par las sam / gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa gzhan dag gi byed pa las sam /
translated: from the distinction of sentient beings,üîΩfrom engaging in the welfare of others, from the activity of others,

original: de bsnyen pa las sam /
analyzed: de bsnyen pa las sam /
translated: from serving others,

original: bdag nyid 'dod pa las goms par byas nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'dod pa las goms par byas nas /
translated: from cultivating one‚Äôs own desires,

original: shi nas kyang sngon goms par byas pa'i dbang gis 'jug par 'dod pa dang / de'i bsam pa dang lhan cig ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shi nas kyang sngon goms par byas pa'i dbang gis 'jug par 'dod pa dang / de'i bsam pa dang lhan cig ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: and from the power of previous cultivation, even after death.

original: ngan song la sogs par 'gro bar gags byed pa med pa de'i tshe goms par byas shing de ltar yang dang yang goms par byas pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i thugs rje gang yin pa de 'dra ba mthar phyin pa ldog pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngan song la sogs par 'gro bar gags byed pa med pa de'i tshe goms par byas shing de ltar yang dang yang goms par byas pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i thugs rje gang yin pa de 'dra ba mthar phyin pa ldog pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is no obstacle to going to the lower realms and so on, at that time, compassion, which is the essence of that cultivation and repeated cultivation, becomes irreversible and perfected.

original: ldog pa med pa yang /
analyzed: ldog pa med pa yang /
translated: And that which is irreversible

original: rnam par 'tshe med yang dag don //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe med yang dag don //
translated: is the true meaning of nonviolence.

original: rang bzhin nyid ni bzlog pa yis //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid ni bzlog pa yis //
translated: It is by nature irreversible.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs su bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs su bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained in the section on the refutation of the self of phenomena.

original: de ltar mi 'gyur na /üîΩgal te blo ni lus brten phyir //üîΩ@16b goms pa grub pa med ce na //
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur na / gal te blo ni lus brten phyir // @16b goms pa grub pa med ce na //
translated: If you say that the mind is not like that,üîΩand that the mind is dependent on the body because it is an effect,

original: don gzhan nyid yin na blo ni lus kyi yon tan yin pa de ltar na lus la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan nyid yin na blo ni lus kyi yon tan yin pa de ltar na lus la brten pa yin te /
translated: then the mind would be a quality of the body,

original: dper na ras kyi dkar po dang bu ram gyi mngar ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ras kyi dkar po dang bu ram gyi mngar ba lta bu'o //
translated: just as, for example, the whiteness of a cloth or the sweetness of molasses is.

original: yang na lus kyi 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir lus la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na lus kyi 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir lus la brten pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the mind would be dependent on the body because it is the effect of the body,

original: dper na sgron ma la 'od lta bu'o //üîΩdon gzhan nyid ma yin na yang lus kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i nus pa yin pa de ltar na blo ni lus la brten pa nyid kyi phyir yon tan can gyi lus sam /
analyzed: dper na sgron ma la 'od lta bu'o // don gzhan nyid ma yin na yang lus kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i nus pa yin pa de ltar na blo ni lus la brten pa nyid kyi phyir yon tan can gyi lus sam /
translated: just as, for example, light is dependent on a lamp.üîΩIf the mind is not different from the body, and if the mind is a potency that is of the nature of the body, then the mind is dependent on the body.üîΩTherefore, either the mind is a quality of the body, which is the possessor of the quality,

original: 'bras bu nyid nus par 'dod pa zhig pa na blo'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos sam /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid nus par 'dod pa zhig pa na blo'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos sam /
translated: or the mind is an effect of the body, which is the cause of the effect.üîΩIf you assert that, then the mind would not exist, because there would be no phenomenon, effect, or potency that has the characteristic of the mind.

original: 'bras bu 'am nus pa med pas skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rgyun med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'am nus pa med pas skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rgyun med pa'i phyir /
translated: And because there would be no continuum of birth and death.

original: skye ba'i rgyun mang po dag tu gang las goms pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyun mang po dag tu gang las goms pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of the continuity of birth?

original: skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rgyun med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'chi ba'i rgyun med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no continuity of birth and death,

original: goms pa med do zhes de skad du brjod pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: goms pa med do zhes de skad du brjod pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not tenable to say that there is no habituation.

original: de ltar na de skad du brjod pa 'di ni 'byung ba dag rgyun 'chad pa nyid mi 'dod na gang gis na de ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar na de skad du brjod pa 'di ni 'byung ba dag rgyun 'chad pa nyid mi 'dod na gang gis na de ltar 'gyur /
translated: If you do not accept that the elements are interrupted, then how could it be that there is no habituation?

original: 'on kyang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi mtshan nyid can gyi 'byung ba chen po zhes bya ba'i sems can nyid yongs su gyur pa dag ni sems can gyi tha snyad la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi mtshan nyid can gyi 'byung ba chen po zhes bya ba'i sems can nyid yongs su gyur pa dag ni sems can gyi tha snyad la brten pa yin no //
translated: The elements that are called ‚Äúgreat‚Äù are the nature of earth, water, fire, and air. They are called ‚Äúsentient beings‚Äù because they are the basis of the conventions of sentient beings.üîΩSentient beings who are not manifest due to the absence of opposing conditions are transformed into another state, like the state of sleep, intoxication, or fainting.

original: 'gal ba'i rkyen las mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa'i sems can de dag kyang gnyid log pa dang myos pa dang brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du rnam pa gzhan du gyur cing yang rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du bya ba'i sems can dag sad
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rkyen las mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa'i sems can de dag kyang gnyid log pa dang myos pa dang brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du rnam pa gzhan du gyur cing yang rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du bya ba'i sems can dag sad
translated: When the conditions are appropriate, sentient beings are born.

original: pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du yongs su gyur ba dang / yongs su gyur pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du yongs su gyur ba dang / yongs su gyur pa 'thob bo //
translated: And the attainment of the transformation is like the state of being transformed.

original: ji ltar goms pa nyid kyis yongs sa gyur pa dag kyang gnyid kyis log pa dang sad pa bzhin du 'dus byas pa'i khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur ba de ltar na 'khor ba'i rgyun dang goms pa khyad par du bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar goms pa nyid kyis yongs sa gyur pa dag kyang gnyid kyis log pa dang sad pa bzhin du 'dus byas pa'i khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur ba de ltar na 'khor ba'i rgyun dang goms pa khyad par du bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: And just as the transformation is due to habituation, so the stream of cyclic existence and the establishment of the special habituation are like the state of being transformed, like the state of being asleep and awake.

original: ci ste bar du sems chad pa las de ltar rtog pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi rgyun chad pa yod pa kho na yin te /üîΩdper na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: ci ste bar du sems chad pa las de ltar rtog pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang de lta bu'i rnam pa can gyi rgyun chad pa yod pa kho na yin te / dper na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la zhugs pa'am /
translated: If one imagines that the stream is interrupted in this way, then in the same way, in other cases, the stream is interrupted in this way.üîΩFor example, it is like the state of one who has entered the meditative attainment of nonperception.

original: legs bar gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs lta bu'o //
analyzed: legs bar gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs lta bu'o //
translated: Or it is like the state of one who is sleeping well.

original: dus de srid du blo med pa yin gyi thams cad kyi thams cad du rgyun chad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus de srid du blo med pa yin gyi thams cad kyi thams cad du rgyun chad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For that period, there is no mind, but it is not that the stream is completely interrupted.

original: yang rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du blo skye ba nyid yin pa de ltar na @17a * //
analyzed: yang rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du blo skye ba nyid yin pa de ltar na @17a * //
translated: and the mind arises in accordance with the conditions.

original: mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind is similar to the body.

original: de ltar ma yin pa ni bla ste de lta na yang khas blangs nas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin pa ni bla ste de lta na yang khas blangs nas brjod par bya ste /
translated: If it is not so, then it is better to accept the following:

original: goms pa ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: goms pa ma grub pa yin no //
translated: The mind is not habituated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rten ni bkag phyir ro //üîΩdon gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyogs la ni 'byung ba dag nyid yin pa de lta na /
analyzed: rten ni bkag phyir ro // don gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyogs la ni 'byung ba dag nyid yin pa de lta na /
translated: Because the basis is refuted.üîΩIf the mind is not different from the body, then,

original: sems la de med ba'i phyir phyis 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems la de med ba'i phyir phyis 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: since the mind does not exist in the elements, it would be refuted later.

original: lhag ma yon tan gyi phyogs sam /üîΩ'bras bu'i phyogs la yang blo'i rten lus ma yin na gang las de zhig pa na /
analyzed: lhag ma yon tan gyi phyogs sam / 'bras bu'i phyogs la yang blo'i rten lus ma yin na gang las de zhig pa na /
translated: If the mind is not the body, which is the basis of the qualities

original: blo med pa'i phyir goms pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: blo med pa'i phyir goms pa med par 'gyur /
translated: or the basis of the results, then, since the mind would not exist when the body is destroyed, there would be no habituation.

original: gang gi tshe bya ba'i sems can du bgrang ba de dag rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa dag la 'chi ba'i tha snyad du byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bya ba'i sems can du bgrang ba de dag rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa dag la 'chi ba'i tha snyad du byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: When sentient beings are counted as agents, if they are transformed in another way, then at that time the convention of death is used.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang / dbang po dang blo rnams gtan nas rgyun chad pa dag la yang rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du skye ba yin nam /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang / dbang po dang blo rnams gtan nas rgyun chad pa dag la yang rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du skye ba yin nam /
translated: And when the in-breaths and out-breaths and the faculties and mind are completely interrupted, do they arise again in accordance with conditions?

original: 'on te 'jug pa mi gsal ba can yin pas gnyid mthug pos brgyal ba'i gnas skabs las sad ba bzhin du mtshams sbyor ba yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'on te 'jug pa mi gsal ba can yin pas gnyid mthug pos brgyal ba'i gnas skabs las sad ba bzhin du mtshams sbyor ba yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or, because they are not clear when they enter, do they link up again like one who has awakened from a deep sleep?

original: gal te shin tu rgyun 'chad pa de'i tshe lus 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can du gnas pa na yang blo la sogs pa ldog pa dang phyis 'jug pa'i phyir 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can gyi lus las tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te shin tu rgyun 'chad pa de'i tshe lus 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can du gnas pa na yang blo la sogs pa ldog pa dang phyis 'jug pa'i phyir 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can gyi lus las tha dad pa yin no //
translated: If they are completely interrupted, then when the body remains in the nature of the elements, the mind and so on ceases and later arises again, so it is different from the body that is in the nature of the elements.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gnas pa na ldog pa de ni de las tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gnas pa na ldog pa de ni de las tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever ceases when something else remains is different from it,

original: dper na chu gnas pa na me ldog pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chu gnas pa na me ldog pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the cessation of fire when water remains.

original: lus zhes bya ba'i 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can gnas pa na yang /
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba'i 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can gnas pa na yang /
translated: And when the body, which is in the nature of the elements, remains,üîΩthe mind and so on ceases and later arises again.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa dang dbang po dang blo ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa dang dbang po dang blo ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The exhalation and inhalation of breath and the reversal of the faculties and mind are natural reasons.

original: gang zhig gang sngar gnas pa na sngar de na med la phyis 'gyur ba de las shin tu tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang sngar gnas pa na sngar de na med la phyis 'gyur ba de las shin tu tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is not previously present in something and later becomes so is different from it.

original: dper na sngar sgron ma med pa phyis byas pa yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sngar sgron ma med pa phyis byas pa yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a lamp is not present before, but is made later.

original: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can sngon yod pa na yang /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid can sngon yod pa na yang /
translated: Even when the nature of the elements exists,

original: de la dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa med cing phyis 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa med cing phyis 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid yin no //
translated: exhalation and inhalation of breath are not present in it, but later become so. This is a natural reason.

original: ci ste 'jug pa mi gsal ba de'i tshe sems can rgyun 'chad pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste 'jug pa mi gsal ba de'i tshe sems can rgyun 'chad pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: If the engagement is not clear, then at that time sentient beings are not interrupted,

original: dper na gson pa'i gnas skabs na gnyid mthug po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi 'jug pa mi gsal blta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gson pa'i gnas skabs na gnyid mthug po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi 'jug pa mi gsal blta bu'o //
translated: just as in the state of being alive, the engagement in the state of deep sleep, etc. is not clear.

original: yang rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du bya ba 'jug pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du bya ba 'jug pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it becomes engaged in action according to conditions.

original: de tsam gyis ni shin @17b tu rgyun 'chad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni shin @17b tu rgyun 'chad pa ma yin no //
translated: But that does not mean that the continuum is completely severed.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gal ba med pa nyid do //üîΩci ste sems la sogs pa shin tu rgyun 'chad pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang 'gyur ba'i phyir 'gal ba med pa nyid do // ci ste sems la sogs pa shin tu rgyun 'chad pa'am /
translated: So there is no contradiction here.üîΩNow, suppose one said that the continuum of mind and so on is not completely severed,

original: 'jug pa mi gsal ba nyid ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jug pa mi gsal ba nyid ma yin mod kyi /
translated: or that it is not the case that its functioning is unclear.

original: 'on kyang nus pa'i ngo bor gnas pa yin pa de'i tshe /üîΩnus pa gang yin pa de ci sems las gzhan nyid dam /
analyzed: 'on kyang nus pa'i ngo bor gnas pa yin pa de'i tshe / nus pa gang yin pa de ci sems las gzhan nyid dam /
translated: But rather, it is the case that it abides in a state of potential.üîΩIn that case, is this potential something different from the mind or is it the mind itself?

original: 'on te sems nyid yin grang na gzhan nyid yin na ni nus pa nyid yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te sems nyid yin grang na gzhan nyid yin na ni nus pa nyid yod pa yin gyi /
translated: If it is something different, then the potential exists,

original: sems nyid ni ma yin te gzhan yod pa na gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems nyid ni ma yin te gzhan yod pa na gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: but the mind does not, because when one thing exists, the other does not.üîΩMoreover, the so-called potential is the very nature of the cause that produces the effect.

original: gzhan yang nus zhes bya ba ni dngos po rgyur gyur pa dag gi 'dras bu 'grub par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni de'i ngo bo tsam shes par 'dod pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang nus zhes bya ba ni dngos po rgyur gyur pa dag gi 'dras bu 'grub par byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni de'i ngo bo tsam shes par 'dod pa la /
translated: When one wishes to know the mere nature of that,

original: de ltar brdar byas pa'i sgras 'di ni 'di'i nus pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar brdar byas pa'i sgras 'di ni 'di'i nus pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: the term potential is used.

original: myos par byed pa'i myos pa'i nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: myos par byed pa'i myos pa'i nus pa bzhin no //
translated: like the intoxicating power of alcohol.

original: de bas na nus pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na nus pa ni /
translated: Therefore, potency

original: rgyu las gzhan du cung zad kyang med kyi rgyu nyid yod pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rgyu las gzhan du cung zad kyang med kyi rgyu nyid yod pa de ltar na /
translated: is not the slightest bit different from the cause.

original: sems nyid kyi rgyu yod pa yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sems nyid kyi rgyu yod pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The cause itself exists, and thus the cause of mind exists.

original: de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, this should be analyzed in terms of the relation of cause and effect.

original: gal te de ltar ni yin na ji ltar na sa bon gyi nus pa zhes tha snyad du byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar ni yin na ji ltar na sa bon gyi nus pa zhes tha snyad du byed ce na /
translated: If this is so, then how can one conventionally speak of the potency of the seed?

original: de la yang nus pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi myu gu skyed par rung ba nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa brjod pa yin no //üîΩ'di'i nus pa zhes bya ba tha dad pa 'brel ba'i ngang tshul can gyi tha snyad pa gang yin pa de ni myu gu skyed pa'i rang bzhin gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yang nus pa zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi myu gu skyed par rung ba nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa brjod pa yin no // 'di'i nus pa zhes bya ba tha dad pa 'brel ba'i ngang tshul can gyi tha snyad pa gang yin pa de ni myu gu skyed pa'i rang bzhin gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, potency is said to be the seed‚Äôs own nature, which is the capacity to produce the sprout.üîΩThe conventional expression ‚Äúthe potency of this‚Äù is a different expression that has the nature of a relation.

original: ji ltar 'di'i nus pa 'di yin no zhes bya bar tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di'i nus pa 'di yin no zhes bya bar tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
translated: In order to make the nature of the production of the sprout clear, one conventionally says, ‚ÄúThis is its potency.‚Äù

original: de ltar nus pa ni rgyu nyid yin zhing sems nyid ni 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar nus pa ni rgyu nyid yin zhing sems nyid ni 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind itself is the effect.

original: ci ste gzhan nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe sems nyid yod pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan nyid ma yin pa de'i tshe sems nyid yod pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If it is not different, then the mind itself exists.

original: rgyun chad pa nyid ma yin pa de yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa nyid ma yin pa de yang mi 'dod do //
translated: But you do not accept that the mind is not interrupted.

original: de bas na 'dis dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa shin tu rgyun chad pa zhes bya ba dang / phyis 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yan gar pa gyur pa las yang dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa yod pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa shin tu rgyun chad pa zhes bya ba dang / phyis 'byung ba'i bdag nyid yan gar pa gyur pa las yang dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa yod pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should say that the in-breath, etc., are not interrupted, and that the in-breath, etc., exist again from the isolated self that arises later.

original: de'i tshe yang skye ba yongs su len pa na /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang skye ba yongs su len pa na /
translated: When that is so,

original: skye ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i dus na'o //
translated: at the time of birth.

original: rang gi rigs la ltos pa med pa can /
analyzed: rang gi rigs la ltos pa med pa can /
translated: Not depending on its own type,

original: ris mthun pa'i rgyun la ltos pa med can dag gi //
analyzed: ris mthun pa'i rgyun la ltos pa med can dag gi //
translated: not depending on the continuum of a homogeneous collection,üîΩthe in-breath, out-breath, and the mind

original: 'byung rngub dbang po blo dag ni //üîΩyan gar ba'i lus nyid @18a * //
analyzed: 'byung rngub dbang po blo dag ni // yan gar ba'i lus nyid @18a * //
translated: arise from the isolated body itself.

original: las ni skye ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: las ni skye ba mi rigs so //
translated: It is not logical that they arise from the body.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thal 'gyur phyir rdo dang chu la sogs pa dag la yang thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thal 'gyur phyir rdo dang chu la sogs pa dag la yang thal par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the absurd consequence would follow that even stones, water, etc.

original: gal te 'byung ba tsam yan gar ba las sems nyid mngon par gsal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba tsam yan gar ba las sems nyid mngon par gsal bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the mind itself were to manifest from the mere elements alone,

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: it would not be so.

original: rdo la sogs pa dag la yang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub ba dang sems dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / rtog dpyod dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo la sogs pa dag la yang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub ba dang sems dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / rtog dpyod dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: because even stones, etc. would have inhalation and exhalation and would have mind and would have investigation and analysis.

original: de bas na lus yan gar ba las ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na lus yan gar ba las ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not from the mere body alone,

original: de las tha dad pa'i ris mthun pa'i rgyu las zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i ris mthun pa'i rgyu las zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: but it should be understood that it is from a cause that is a homogeneous type that is different from that.

original: dper na da ltar ba'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na da ltar ba'i lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the present.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i nus par ldan //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i nus par ldan //
translated: It has the capacity to connect.

original: dbang po la sogs pa rang gi rigs la ltos pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa rang gi rigs la ltos pa dang bcas pa /
translated: The faculties, etc. that are seen in dependence on their own type,

original: mthong ba gang yin pa de las nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu gzhan lhag pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: mthong ba gang yin pa de las nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu gzhan lhag pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur /
translated: what other additional cause of connection is there?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba yongs su len pa na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba yongs su len pa na /
translated: When one takes up a future birth,

original: gang med pa yin rgyu gang gis na yang dbang po la sogs pa mtshams sbyor ldan med yin te /
analyzed: gang med pa yin rgyu gang gis na yang dbang po la sogs pa mtshams sbyor ldan med yin te /
translated: what is absent? What is the cause of the absence of the sense faculties, etc.?

original: phyis kyang dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa la sogs pa dag gis mtshams sbyor ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: phyis kyang dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa la sogs pa dag gis mtshams sbyor ba kho na yin no //
translated: Later, they are connected only by the exhalation and inhalation of breath, etc.

original: tshogs pa gegs byed pa med pa'i rgyu can nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: tshogs pa gegs byed pa med pa'i rgyu can nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is: because the collection is the cause of the absence of obstruction.

original: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang yod na rgyu dang bral ba ma yin bde ni mi 'gyur ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang zhig gang yod na rgyu dang bral ba ma yin bde ni mi 'gyur ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: What is the application? If something is not separated from its cause when something exists, then it is not unchanging.

original: dper na myu gu rang gi bdag nyid thob par bya ba la rgyu dang ma bral ba rkyen yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na myu gu rang gi bdag nyid thob par bya ba la rgyu dang ma bral ba rkyen yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a sprout is a condition for the attainment of its own nature, but it is not separated from its cause.

original: 'chi ba las dus phyis dbang po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo la yang /
analyzed: 'chi ba las dus phyis dbang po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo la yang /
translated: Later than death, the nature of the sense faculties, etc.

original: rgyu dang bral ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang bral ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: is not separated from its cause. This is the observation of a contradiction with a pervasion.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te //
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te //
translated: Nor is it unestablished.

original: lus yan gar pa las skye na thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / ris mthun pa'i rgyu can nyid yod pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus yan gar pa las skye na thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / ris mthun pa'i rgyu can nyid yod pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the body would arise from the body, and because it is established that it has a cause that is homogeneous.

original: lus yan gar ba las dbang po la sogs pa skye na thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus yan gar ba las dbang po la sogs pa skye na thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The body does not arise from the body alone.

original: de ltar na 'byung ba 'ga' zhig rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar gyur pas sems nyid rtsom pa yin gyi rnam pa thams cad du ni ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'byung ba 'ga' zhig rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar gyur pas sems nyid rtsom pa yin gyi rnam pa thams cad du ni ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Thus, the elements are the mind itself in some way, but not in every way.

original: rdo dang chu la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'byung ba dag sems tsam pa dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin du gyur par gnas pa dag yin pas na rgyu @18b med pa nyid kyi phyir sems nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rdo dang chu la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'byung ba dag sems tsam pa dang 'gal ba'i rang bzhin du gyur par gnas pa dag yin pas na rgyu @18b med pa nyid kyi phyir sems nyid ma yin no //
translated: Since the elements, which have the nature of earth, water, and so on, exist in a way that is incompatible with the mind only school, they are not the mind itself, because they are causeless.

original: sbyor ba ni gang la gang gi sa bon yod pa ma yin ba de ni de las skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang la gang gi sa bon yod pa ma yin ba de ni de las skye ba ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever does not have the seed of something else does not arise from that,

original: dper na chu la gzung bar bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chu la gzung bar bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: like a pot does not arise from water.

original: rdo dang chu la sogs pa dag la yang sems nyid la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa'i sa bon yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo dang chu la sogs pa dag la yang sems nyid la sogs pa gzhan du gyur pa'i sa bon yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And in regard to stones, water, etc., the seed of the transformation of mind, etc. does not exist. This is the non-apprehension of the distinction.

original: gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs ma grub pa rjod par byed de yan lag / gang la drod gsher las skyes pa'i //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs ma grub pa rjod par byed de yan lag / gang la drod gsher las skyes pa'i //
translated: He states the unestablished reason in the verse beginning with ‚Äúwhere.‚Äù

original: skye bo skyed par mi 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: skye bo skyed par mi 'gyur ba'i //
translated: Where there is no production of beings from heat and moisture,

original: sa sogs cha ste yan lag de 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sa sogs cha ste yan lag de 'ga' zhig yod pa ma yin te /
translated: there is no part of earth, etc.üîΩThat is, there is no part of earth, etc., where there is no production of beings from heat and moisture.

original: thams cad nyid las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad nyid las 'gyur ro //
translated: For, it is from all of it that there is production.

original: de phyir kun sa bon dag yin //
analyzed: de phyir kun sa bon dag yin //
translated: Therefore, all is the seed.

original: de ltar na ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is unestablished.

original: dgongs pa ni gang gi tshes la sogs pa'i cha thams cad las skye bo skye ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni gang gi tshes la sogs pa'i cha thams cad las skye bo skye ba de'i tshe /
translated: The intended sense is this: When beings are produced from all parts, such as the earth, etc.,

original: sa la sogs pa de dag ji ltar yongs su mthong ba bzhin du /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa de dag ji ltar yongs su mthong ba bzhin du /
translated: then, just as the earth, etc. are seen,

original: mtshungs pa'i rgyu can yin pa dang mtshungs par gyur pa can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i rgyu can yin pa dang mtshungs par gyur pa can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: they are the cause of similarity and they are similar.

original: ji ltar yan lag gcig srog chags nyid du gyur pa de ltar thams cad la yang khyad par med pas srog chags nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar yan lag gcig srog chags nyid du gyur pa de ltar thams cad la yang khyad par med pas srog chags nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: Just as one part of the body is a living being, so too is the whole body, since there is no difference.

original: 'gro ba thams cad cig car srog chags kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad cig car srog chags kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, all living beings would be living beings simultaneously.

original: mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa'i sems pa can gyi 'byung ba gzhan 'ga' zhig tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa'i sems pa can gyi 'byung ba gzhan 'ga' zhig tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And there would be no other elements that are not manifest but have the nature of being living beings.
