original: gal te ma yin na gcig kyang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: gal te ma yin na gcig kyang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: If not, then not even one would be a living being.

original: gal te khyed cag la yang skyon de mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyed cag la yang skyon de mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the same fault applies to us,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: kho bos la sogs pa yan gar ba las srog chags rnams 'byung bar mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: kho bos la sogs pa yan gar ba las srog chags rnams 'byung bar mi 'dod kyi /
translated: We do not assert that living beings arise from the individual parts such as the head.

original: 'on kyang rgyu ma mthong du zin kyang dbugs 'byung rngub la sogs pa yod pa de ltar na gang la de yod pa de la skye bo skye ba'i gzhan la ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu ma mthong du zin kyang dbugs 'byung rngub la sogs pa yod pa de ltar na gang la de yod pa de la skye bo skye ba'i gzhan la ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But even though we do not see the cause, we say that living beings arise from the body because breathing and so on exist in the body and not in other things.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na ji ltar sa'i khams khyad par can ma yin pa bzhus pa las cung zad gser du 'gyur zhing cung zad dri mar 'gyur ba de bzhin dus la sogs pa khyad par can ma yin pa las cung zad srog chags dang /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na ji ltar sa'i khams khyad par can ma yin pa bzhus pa las cung zad gser du 'gyur zhing cung zad dri mar 'gyur ba de bzhin dus la sogs pa khyad par can ma yin pa las cung zad srog chags dang /
translated: If that were so, then just as a special earth element is melted and some becomes gold and some becomes impurities, in the same way, a special time element would be melted and some would become living beings and some would become the elements.

original: gzhan ni 'byung ba yan gar ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan ni 'byung ba yan gar ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the elements are not special, then they would be separate elements.

original: de ni 'dir yang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dir yang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: This is the same here.

original: de ltar na sa'i khams khyad par med pa can ci'i phyir thams cad gser du mi 'gyur la /üîΩgang gis @19a * //
analyzed: de ltar na sa'i khams khyad par med pa can ci'i phyir thams cad gser du mi 'gyur la / gang gis @19a * //
translated: If the earth element is not special, why doesn‚Äôt everything become gold?

original: na gzhan dri mar 'gyur de la de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na gzhan dri mar 'gyur de la de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: Why does it become something else, an impurity?

original: de la mngon par mi gsal ba'i ngo bo can rdul phra mo 'ga' zhig gser gyi bdag nyid can gang yin pa bzhus pa na /
analyzed: de la mngon par mi gsal ba'i ngo bo can rdul phra mo 'ga' zhig gser gyi bdag nyid can gang yin pa bzhus pa na /
translated: In that case, some subtle particles that have an unclear nature, which are the nature of gold, when melted,

original: gser gyi mdog gsal bar byed par 'gyur ba dang / de'i tha snyad kyang thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gser gyi mdog gsal bar byed par 'gyur ba dang / de'i tha snyad kyang thob par 'gyur la /
translated: will clarify the color of gold and obtain the name gold.

original: de las gzhan bdag gi de las bzlog pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar na rigs pa mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan bdag gi de las bzlog pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar na rigs pa mthong ba yin no //
translated: But if it were otherwise, the opposite would be true.

original: de bzhin du 'di la yang srog chags dang / srog chags ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la yang srog chags dang / srog chags ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni /
translated: In the same way, here, the nature of living beings and the nature of non-living beings

original: srog chags dang srog chags ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'byung ba'i ngo bo tha dad pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: srog chags dang srog chags ma yin pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'byung ba'i ngo bo tha dad pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: are different natures of the elements that have the nature of living beings and the nature of non-living beings.

original: 'khor bar 'khor ba'i sems can grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor bar 'khor ba'i sems can grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, living beings who cycle in samsara are established.

original: ci ste ji ltar tshogs pa mtshungs pa can lcags su gyur pa'i rang bzhin can du khyad par med pa'i ltar tsher bzhus pa na rim gyis lcags su 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ci ste ji ltar tshogs pa mtshungs pa can lcags su gyur pa'i rang bzhin can du khyad par med pa'i ltar tsher bzhus pa na rim gyis lcags su 'gyur gyi /
translated: But if it is argued that just as iron that has the nature of a similar collection becomes iron without distinction when heated,

original: cig car ma yin pa de ltar sa la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i rgyu can du mtshungs pa dang gyur pa'i rgyu can du mtshungs pa dag rim bzhin du srog chags nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: cig car ma yin pa de ltar sa la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i rgyu can du mtshungs pa dang gyur pa'i rgyu can du mtshungs pa dag rim bzhin du srog chags nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: it gradually becomes iron, not all at once, in the same way, earth and so on, which are similar in having the same cause, the elements, gradually obtain the nature of living beings,

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: 'di ltar lhang tsher bzhus pa de la yang yan lag gang dag la me shin tu mang po zhugs pa de dag nyid lcags su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar lhang tsher bzhus pa de la yang yan lag gang dag la me shin tu mang po zhugs pa de dag nyid lcags su 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the parts of the lump of iron that are in contact with the most intense heat become iron.

original: me shin tu mang po yang rlung dang rjes su 'brel pa can yin pa'i phyir rim bzhin du lcags su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me shin tu mang po yang rlung dang rjes su 'brel pa can yin pa'i phyir rim bzhin du lcags su 'gyur ro //
translated: And the most intense heat, being in contact with the wind, becomes iron in turn.

original: de lta ma yin na rlung mtshungs pas sbyar ba'i me'i khyad par dang 'dres pas rim bzhin ma yin par yang ngo //üîΩkhyad par can ma yin pa'i rang bzhin mthong ba tsam gyur pa'i rkyen gyi sa la sogs pa la de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rlung mtshungs pas sbyar ba'i me'i khyad par dang 'dres pas rim bzhin ma yin par yang ngo // khyad par can ma yin pa'i rang bzhin mthong ba tsam gyur pa'i rkyen gyi sa la sogs pa la de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, the iron would not be in contact with the wind, and the heat would not be in contact with the iron.üîΩBut this is not the case for the elements earth, etc., which are not specific to the effect.

original: ji ste ji ltar chu de'i yan lag rgyu mtshungs pa can gang yin pa 'ga' zhig ni srog chags kyi 'bras bu byed la /üîΩgzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes de ltar rtogs na /
analyzed: ji ste ji ltar chu de'i yan lag rgyu mtshungs pa can gang yin pa 'ga' zhig ni srog chags kyi 'bras bu byed la / gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes de ltar rtogs na /
translated: If you say that the water is not the cause of the effect in its entirety, but only of the part of the effect that is similar to it, we would reply that it is not possible to distinguish the part of the effect that is similar to the cause.

original: de ni ma yin te rang bzhin la sogs pa khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te rang bzhin la sogs pa khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say that the water is the cause of the part of the effect that is similar to it, and not of the part that is not similar to it, we would reply that it is not possible to distinguish the part that is similar and the part that is not similar, since the water is not different.

original: chu yongs su btsags nas gzhag bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: chu yongs su btsags nas gzhag bar 'gyur ba /
translated: The water will be left behind when the mud has settled.

original: ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i rten la sogs pa rgyu mtshungs pa can gang yin pa de ni thams cad srog chags kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i rten la sogs pa rgyu mtshungs pa can gang yin pa de ni thams cad srog chags kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If the cause, such as the support, is the same in all cases, then either all will be living beings or none at all will be.

original: cung zad kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: cung zad kyang ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case.

original: gzhan ma mthong ba'i rgyu 'ga' zhig kyang mi 'dod @19b na gang gis na thams cad mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan ma mthong ba'i rgyu 'ga' zhig kyang mi 'dod @19b na gang gis na thams cad mi 'gyur /
translated: Nor do we accept that there is some other cause that is not seen, by virtue of which not all are living beings.

original: de ltar na gang de ni ci yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na gang de ni ci yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is not possible to say anything about this.

original: gang yang ci ltar dar ba la sogs pa'i rten la sogs pa mtshungs pa la steng nyid na bris ma srid pa yin gyi thams cad lam yin no //üîΩde lta bur gyur pa'i yan lag 'ga' zhig la yang skye bo 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang yang ci ltar dar ba la sogs pa'i rten la sogs pa mtshungs pa la steng nyid na bris ma srid pa yin gyi thams cad lam yin no // de lta bur gyur pa'i yan lag 'ga' zhig la yang skye bo 'gyur gyi /
translated: But if you say that a painting can be a living being only when the support, such as the canvas, is the same as that of a living being, but not when the support is different,üîΩthen we reply that it is not possible for a living being to arise in any of the parts of the body,

original: thams cad dag la ma yin no zhes rtog na de yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad dag la ma yin no zhes rtog na de yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: but it is possible for a living being to arise in the body as a whole.

original: 'di ltar bris ma ni rigs mthun pa'i dar ba'i yan lag la brten pa dang rigs mthun pa la brten pa'i rlung dang drod la sogs pa rgyu 'og na med pa'i phyir /üîΩmi 'gyur ba de ltar chu la sogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bris ma ni rigs mthun pa'i dar ba'i yan lag la brten pa dang rigs mthun pa la brten pa'i rlung dang drod la sogs pa rgyu 'og na med pa'i phyir / mi 'gyur ba de ltar chu la sogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, a written letter is not impermanent because it is based on the branches of a tree of the same type, and because the wind, heat, etc. of the same type are not its cause.

original: steng dang bar dang 'og gi cha dag la srog chags gang dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: steng dang bar dang 'og gi cha dag la srog chags gang dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Water, etc. are not like that, because they are impermanent, since they have upper, middle, and lower parts, and because they are inhabited by living beings.

original: chur khyad par med na yang lhag ma srog chags dang ldan pa srog chags kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa de ltar na /
analyzed: chur khyad par med na yang lhag ma srog chags dang ldan pa srog chags kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa de ltar na /
translated: Even though there is no difference in water, etc., the remainder is inhabited by living beings, and has the nature of living beings.

original: nye bar bkod pa mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar bkod pa mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the example is not similar.

original: de phyir dbang sogs rang rigs la //
analyzed: de phyir dbang sogs rang rigs la //
translated: Therefore, the sense faculties, etc.

original: ltos med rnams ni sogs pa'i sgras dbugs 'byung rngub dang blo dag bzung ngo //
analyzed: ltos med rnams ni sogs pa'i sgras dbugs 'byung rngub dang blo dag bzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúetc.‚Äù include the inbreath and outbreath and the mind.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung yan gar bdag las 'byung ba yin na khas len na'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung yan gar bdag las 'byung ba yin na khas len na'o //
translated: If you accept that earth, water, fire, and air arise from self alone,

original: ji ltar gcig ni gyur pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar gcig ni gyur pa yin /
translated: how can they be one?

original: sa la sogs pa'i yan lag srog chags nyid du gyur pa de ltar de las lhag ma kun gyur par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i yan lag srog chags nyid du gyur pa de ltar de las lhag ma kun gyur par 'gyur ro //
translated: The parts such as earth, etc., become living beings, and the rest become non-living beings.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because there is no difference.

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu can nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir dang gyur pa'i rgyu can nyid du mtshungs ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu can nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir dang gyur pa'i rgyu can nyid du mtshungs ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because they are similar in being caused by appropriation, and because they are similar in being caused by transformation.

original: 'gyur ba yang ma yin na //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang ma yin na //
translated: Nor is there transformation.

original: de bas na gang la ma mthong ba'i rgyu yod pa de nyid la srog chags yod kyi /
analyzed: de bas na gang la ma mthong ba'i rgyu yod pa de nyid la srog chags yod kyi /
translated: Therefore, where there is a cause for non-perception, there is a living being.

original: thams cad la ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad la ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But not in everything.

original: 'byung ba 'ga' zhig ni sems can du bgrang ba yin la /
analyzed: 'byung ba 'ga' zhig ni sems can du bgrang ba yin la /
translated: Thus, it is tenable that some elements are counted as sentient beings,

original: gzhan ni sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa de ltar 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan ni sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa de ltar 'thad do //
translated: and others are not counted as sentient beings.

original: de bas na de ltar zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs par byas nas dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas rten 'gog pa'i skabs dang sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de ltar zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs par byas nas dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas rten 'gog pa'i skabs dang sbyar ba yin te /
translated: Thus, having completed this digression, he connects it with the context of refuting the basis with the words sense faculties, etc.

original: de la phyogs gsum po'i nang nas nus pa'i phyogs la blo'i rten lus ma yin pa /
analyzed: de la phyogs gsum po'i nang nas nus pa'i phyogs la blo'i rten lus ma yin pa /
translated: Among the three possibilities, the potential is not the body, which is the support of the mind.

original: de ltar na nus pa zhes bya ba gzhan cung bad ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na nus pa zhes bya ba gzhan cung bad ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, apart from the body, there is no other so-called potential.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?üîΩIt is the nature that is able to produce an effect that is concordant with itself.

original: rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'grub par nus pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes de bstan zin to des na 'byung ba dag @20a * //
analyzed: rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'grub par nus pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes de bstan zin to des na 'byung ba dag @20a * //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: nyid nus pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: nyid nus pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Thus, since the elements are the potential,

original: gang gang gi rten yin //
analyzed: gang gang gi rten yin //
translated: what is the support of what?

original: gzhan yang myos pa'i nus pa dang // sems nyid kyi nus pa ci zhig mtshungs na /
analyzed: gzhan yang myos pa'i nus pa dang // sems nyid kyi nus pa ci zhig mtshungs na /
translated: Moreover, what is similar between the potential for intoxication and the potential of the mind?

original: gang gis na de dpe de nyid du bzung ba nyid yin /
analyzed: gang gis na de dpe de nyid du bzung ba nyid yin /
translated: By what is it that they are taken to be the same example?

original: de la myos pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu don gzhan du gyur pa skyes bu'i chos yin zhing de'i nus pa ni 'bras bu de byed pa'i ngang tshul can gyi chang nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de la myos pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu don gzhan du gyur pa skyes bu'i chos yin zhing de'i nus pa ni 'bras bu de byed pa'i ngang tshul can gyi chang nyid yin gyi /
translated: In this regard, the so-called effect of intoxication is a quality of the person that is a different object from the potential. The potential is the nature of the beer itself, which has the character of producing that effect.

original: sems nyid kyi 'bras bu cung zad kyang ma yin na /
analyzed: sems nyid kyi 'bras bu cung zad kyang ma yin na /
translated: It is not the slightest bit the effect of the mind.

original: gang la ltos nas de nus pa zhes bya bar brjod de /
analyzed: gang la ltos nas de nus pa zhes bya bar brjod de /
translated: What is it that is called ‚Äúpotential‚Äù?

original: ci ste sems nyid kyi rgyu gyur pa'i nus pa yod pa de'i tshe /üîΩmyos pa dang 'dra bar sems nyid 'byung ba las don gzhan nyid du gyur pa nyid kyis yon tan gyi phyogs sam /
analyzed: ci ste sems nyid kyi rgyu gyur pa'i nus pa yod pa de'i tshe / myos pa dang 'dra bar sems nyid 'byung ba las don gzhan nyid du gyur pa nyid kyis yon tan gyi phyogs sam /
translated: If the mind itself is the cause of potential,üîΩthen the mind itself would be the result, just like the intoxicating substance.

original: 'bras bu'i phyogs yin pa de ltar na nus pa'i phyogs ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i phyogs yin pa de ltar na nus pa'i phyogs ma yin no //
translated: If the mind itself is the result, then it is not the potential.üîΩIf the elements are the nature of the mind itself,üîΩthen what is the point of saying that the mind itself is dependent on the elements?

original: ci ste 'byung ba rnams kyi sems nyid kyi bdag nyid can nus pa yin pa de'i tshe /üîΩ'byung ba dag la de rag lus pa ci zhig yong na /
analyzed: ci ste 'byung ba rnams kyi sems nyid kyi bdag nyid can nus pa yin pa de'i tshe / 'byung ba dag la de rag lus pa ci zhig yong na /
translated: If the elements are the potential of the mind itself,üîΩthen just as sound is conventionally said to be impermanent,

original: gang gis na 'byung ba rnams kyi sems nyid nus pa yin zhes tha snyad du byed /
analyzed: gang gis na 'byung ba rnams kyi sems nyid nus pa yin zhes tha snyad du byed /
translated: the elements would be conventionally said to be the potential of the mind itself.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na /üîΩji ltar sgra byas pa nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa tha snyad du byed pa de ltar 'byung ba rnams nyid de ltar nus pa yin par tha snyad du byed pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na /üîΩji ltar sgra byas pa nyid kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa tha snyad du byed pa de ltar 'byung ba rnams nyid de ltar nus pa yin par tha snyad du byed pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But this is not so.

original: byas pa nyid kyi sgra nyid kyis ni chos gzhan spong ba'i sgo nas de tsam shes par 'dod pa la /
analyzed: byas pa nyid kyi sgra nyid kyis ni chos gzhan spong ba'i sgo nas de tsam shes par 'dod pa la /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúconsciousness only‚Äù is intended to reject other dharmas.

original: de'i rang bzhin brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is stated in order to indicate the nature of consciousness only.

original: de ltar 'byung ba rnams la sems nyid ces bya ba'i rang bzhin du brjod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'byung ba rnams la sems nyid ces bya ba'i rang bzhin du brjod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the elements are not said to be of the nature of mind only.

original: de ni blo tha dad bas gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni blo tha dad bas gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are perceived by a different kind of awareness.

original: de ltar na nus pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang 'og nas dgag par bya ba'o zhes bya ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar na nus pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang 'og nas dgag par bya ba'o zhes bya ba bshad zin to //
translated: Thus, the statement that consciousness only is not a conceptual discrimination possessing efficacy will be refuted later.

original: don gzhan gyi phyogs kyi yon tan la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin na /
analyzed: don gzhan gyi phyogs kyi yon tan la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin na /
translated: If the nature of the qualities, etc., of other objects is the support of consciousness,

original: blo'i ci lus rten du 'gyur na dbang po dang bcas par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: blo'i ci lus rten du 'gyur na dbang po dang bcas par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: then consciousness would have a body, or it would have sense organs.

original: skra dang sen mo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can dbang po med pa can du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: skra dang sen mo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can dbang po med pa can du 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or, it would have the characteristics of hair, nails, etc., and would be devoid of sense organs.

original: re zhig dbang po med pa can ni 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig dbang po med pa can ni 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not maintained that consciousness is devoid of sense organs.

original: shi ba'i lus kyi skra dang sen mo la sogs pa dag la yang sems nyid yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shi ba'i lus kyi skra dang sen mo la sogs pa dag la yang sems nyid yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It follows that the mind would exist in the hair, nails, and so on, of a dead body.

original: de'i phyir @20b dbang po dang bcas pa can kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir @20b dbang po dang bcas pa can kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mind is only associated with the faculties.

original: da ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i bdag nyid can nyid kyis lnga yin te /
analyzed: da ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i bdag nyid can nyid kyis lnga yin te /
translated: Now, the mind is fivefold by way of being the nature of the eye faculty and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga lus kyi ming can de dag ni yid kyi blo'i rten ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga lus kyi ming can de dag ni yid kyi blo'i rten ma yin no //
translated: The five faculties of eye and so on, which are called the body, are not the basis of mental cognition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩmig la sogs pa'i dbang rnam re re la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / mig la sogs pa'i dbang rnam re re la /
translated: Why is that?

original: rkyan ji lta ba bzhin du gnod na yang /
analyzed: rkyan ji lta ba bzhin du gnod na yang /
translated: If any one of the faculties of eye and so on is impaired in accordance with the conditions,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa de dag la gnod pa yod pa ci 'dra ba yid blo'i gnod pa yod ma yin /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa de dag la gnod pa yod pa ci 'dra ba yid blo'i gnod pa yod ma yin /
translated: the impairment of those cognitions of eye and so on is not the impairment of mental cognition.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The characteristics of the clarity and unclarity of mental cognition and so on are different.

original: mig la gnod pa na yid gdung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gang yin pa de yang bu la sogs dang / 'brel ba can gyi dbang po la gnod pa na yang /
analyzed: mig la gnod pa na yid gdung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gang yin pa de yang bu la sogs dang / 'brel ba can gyi dbang po la gnod pa na yang /
translated: When the eye is harmed, the mind is harmed, and so on.üîΩWhen the sense faculty that is related to the son and so on is harmed, the mental cognition exists.

original: yid kyi blo yod pa de ltar na rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ni mig la sogs pa 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid kyi blo yod pa de ltar na rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa ni mig la sogs pa 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In that case, the conceptual cognition is not of the nature of conforming to the change of the eye and so on.

original: de la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not based on that.

original: sbyor ba ni gang mig 'gyur ba'i rjes su mi byed pa de ni mig la rten par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang mig 'gyur ba'i rjes su mi byed pa de ni mig la rten par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is: That which does not conform to the change of the eye is not based on the eye.

original: dper na rna ba'i rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rna ba'i rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like the ear consciousness.

original: nges par rtogs pa'i shes pa yang mig gi 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: nges par rtogs pa'i shes pa yang mig gi 'gyur ba'i rjes su byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The cognition of ascertainment is also not in conformity with the change of the eye. This is the non-observation of a property of the thing.

original: de bzhin du lus kyi dbang po la gnod na yang yid kyi blo'i gnod pa yod pa ma nyin no zhes bya'i bar du /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyi dbang po la gnod na yang yid kyi blo'i gnod pa yod pa ma nyin no zhes bya'i bar du /
translated: Similarly, when the body faculty is harmed, there is harm to the mental cognition.

original: phyogs kyi chos spong ba byas nas rna ba'i dbang po la sogs pa rten yin pa bkag pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos spong ba byas nas rna ba'i dbang po la sogs pa rten yin pa bkag pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having refuted the property of the position, it should be said that the sense faculty of the ear and so on are not the basis.

original: 'dis kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa'i rten can ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa'i rten can ma yin te /
translated: This also shows that mental consciousness is not supported by the eye and so on,

original: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa dang 'dra bar de'i don rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ra //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa dang 'dra bar de'i don rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ra //
translated: because it does not cognize its object in the way that consciousnesses such as the eye consciousness do.

original: yid las byung ba'i shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin du gzugs gsal por snang ba can gyi rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir mig la brten ma yin no //
analyzed: yid las byung ba'i shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin du gzugs gsal por snang ba can gyi rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir mig la brten ma yin no //
translated: Mental consciousness is not supported by the eye because it is not a cognition that clearly perceives form, like eye consciousness.

original: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the remaining sense faculties.

original: gzhan yang rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa de 'gyur ba'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa de 'gyur ba'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because that conceptual consciousness does not conform to the change of the sense faculty,

original: dbang po dang bcas pa can gyi yul gyi chos ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa can gyi yul gyi chos ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: it is not a property of the object that possesses the sense faculty.

original: 'on kyang lus dbang po dang bcas pa can nyid kyi yid kyi shes pa @21a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang lus dbang po dang bcas pa can nyid kyi yid kyi shes pa @21a * //
translated: However, the mental consciousness that possesses the sense faculty of the body

original: rten yin no //
analyzed: rten yin no //
translated: is the basis.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar yad kyi blo 'di 'jig na ni rnam par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar yad kyi blo 'di 'jig na ni rnam par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Why?

original: rnam par 'jig pa na mig la sogs pa de dag gis 'jigs pa dag kyang rnam par 'gyur ba'am zhig pa dag kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa na mig la sogs pa de dag gis 'jigs pa dag kyang rnam par 'gyur ba'am zhig pa dag kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because when the mind is happy, the eyes and so on are seen to change or transform, and when the mind is unhappy, the eyes and so on are seen to change or transform.

original: 'dod pa dang mya ngan dang 'jigs pa la sogs pas yid la gnod pa na mig la sogs pa la gnod pa mthong ba dang / dga' ba la sogs pas yid bde ba can gyi sems dang ldan pa can gyi yongs su rgyas pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mya ngan dang 'jigs pa la sogs pas yid la gnod pa na mig la sogs pa la gnod pa mthong ba dang / dga' ba la sogs pas yid bde ba can gyi sems dang ldan pa can gyi yongs su rgyas pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When the mind is afflicted by desire, sorrow, fear, and so on, the eyes and so on are seen to be afflicted, and when the mind is happy with joy and so on, the eyes and so on are seen to be happy.

original: de ltar na dbang po rnams ni yid kyi phan pa dang gnod pa'i rjes su byed ba can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po rnams ni yid kyi phan pa dang gnod pa'i rjes su byed ba can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since the faculties are seen to follow the happiness and suffering of the mind,

original: de la brten pa nyid du rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la brten pa nyid du rigs pa yin no //
translated: it is logical that they are based on the mind.

original: ji ltar dbang po yod na yod pa'i ngang tshul can nyid ni /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po yod na yod pa'i ngang tshul can nyid ni /
translated: The fact that the faculties exist when the mind existsüîΩis the reason for their being based on the mind.

original: yid kyi blo'i rten yin pa de ltar yid yod na yod pa'i ngang tshul nyid kyang dbang po rnams la yod pa yin pa'i phyir /üîΩde ci'i phyir rten ma yin gzhan yang tshor ba med pa la sogs pa'i dus na lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa med na yang blo yod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: yid kyi blo'i rten yin pa de ltar yid yod na yod pa'i ngang tshul nyid kyang dbang po rnams la yod pa yin pa'i phyir / de ci'i phyir rten ma yin gzhan yang tshor ba med pa la sogs pa'i dus na lus kyi dbang po la sogs pa med na yang blo yod pa nyid yin la /
translated: Just as the mental faculty is the basis of mental consciousness, the faculties also exist when the mental faculty exists.üîΩMoreover, when there is no feeling and so on, the body faculty and so on do not exist, but the mental faculty exists.

original: de med pa na yang dbang po rnams mi mthong ba de ltar na lus kyi rgyu ni yid kho na yin pa'i phyir blo'i rten lus ma yin na gang gis na lus zhig pa'i phyir goms pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: de med pa na yang dbang po rnams mi mthong ba de ltar na lus kyi rgyu ni yid kho na yin pa'i phyir blo'i rten lus ma yin na gang gis na lus zhig pa'i phyir goms pa med par 'gyur /
translated: When the mental faculty does not exist, the faculties are not seen. Thus the cause of the body is the mental faculty alone. If the body is not the basis of the mental faculty, then why would the body be destroyed and the mental faculty not be habituated?

original: gang gi phyir yid kyi rgyu lus ma yin gyi de'i rgyu yin /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yid kyi rgyu lus ma yin gyi de'i rgyu yin /
translated: The body is not the cause of the mental faculty, but it is the cause of the body.

original: de'i phyir blo gnas pa'i rten 'ga' zhig rigs mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo gnas pa'i rten 'ga' zhig rigs mthun pa'o //
translated: Therefore the basis of the mental faculty is a body of similar type.

original: de yang blo nyid la brten pa yin gyi lus la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang blo nyid la brten pa yin gyi lus la ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the mental faculty itself that is the basis, not the body.

original: de nyid kyi dbang po rnams ni rgyu mtshan yin rgyu de'i phyir yid kyi blo las dbang po yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dbang po rnams ni rgyu mtshan yin rgyu de'i phyir yid kyi blo las dbang po yin gyi /
translated: The faculties are the reason for that, and therefore the mind is the faculty in relation to the faculties.

original: de dag las yid kyi blo ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de dag las yid kyi blo ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The mind is not the faculty in relation to the mind. This is the conclusion.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po ma lus pa dang re re la gnod na yang yid kyi blo la gnod pa med pa de'i phyir dbang po rnams rten ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po ma lus pa dang re re la gnod na yang yid kyi blo la gnod pa med pa de'i phyir dbang po rnams rten ma yin no //
translated: Since the mind is not impaired when all the faculties and each of them is impaired, the faculties are not its basis.

original: dbang po thams cad log pas yid kyi shes pa ldog tu zin kyang de'i rten du rtogs pa ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dbang po thams cad log pas yid kyi shes pa ldog tu zin kyang de'i rten du rtogs pa ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Even though the mental consciousness ceases when all the faculties cease, it is not tenable that they are its basis.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten la gnod pa'i rjes su byed pa gang yin pa de ni rten pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten la gnod pa'i rjes su byed pa gang yin pa de ni rten pa'i chos yin no //
translated: Thus, that which conforms to the world is the quality that is based on something else.

original: de lta ma yin na ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni /
translated: Otherwise,

original: de log tu zin kyang ldog pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba de ltar na gang las rten gyi ngo bo yin /
analyzed: de log tu zin kyang ldog pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba de ltar na gang las rten gyi ngo bo yin /
translated: even though it ceases, it would not cease. In that case, how could it be the nature of something based on something else?

original: dbang po rnams kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir de ni @21b rten yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir de ni @21b rten yin no //
translated: The faculties are its basis because they conform to the mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi blo de'i yid dbang po dang bcas pa can gyi lus las gzhan rten ma yin zhing glo bur ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid kyi blo de'i yid dbang po dang bcas pa can gyi lus las gzhan rten ma yin zhing glo bur ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The mind of the later consciousness is not a different support from the body that possesses the mental faculty, nor is it adventitious.

original: phyis kyi blo de 'grub par nus pa'i mtshan nyid can bag chags kyi ngo bo can las kyi ming can gyi blo snga ma ni rten yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: phyis kyi blo de 'grub par nus pa'i mtshan nyid can bag chags kyi ngo bo can las kyi ming can gyi blo snga ma ni rten yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the earlier consciousness, which has the nature of latent potentialities, and is called karma, is the support that has the characteristic of being able to produce the later consciousness.

original: de'i phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa can gyi skye ba yongs su len pa'i dus na dbang po la sogs pa'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa can gyi skye ba yongs su len pa'i dus na dbang po la sogs pa'i /
translated: Therefore, when one who possesses the grasping of self and so on takes birth, the projecting cause is the latent potentialities of the consciousness that possesses the grasping of self and so on.

original: ci 'dra'i 'phen byed yod gyur na //
analyzed: ci 'dra'i 'phen byed yod gyur na //
translated: What kind of projecting cause is there?

original: phyis kyang 'chi ba'i gnas skabs na yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur /
analyzed: phyis kyang 'chi ba'i gnas skabs na yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur /
translated: Also, at the time of death, it is similar.

original: rgyu thams cad ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir de 'dra la 'phen par byed ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu thams cad ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir de 'dra la 'phen par byed ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because all the causes are complete, it is the projecting cause.

original: de ltar na gegs byed pa med pa can gyi rgyu'i ngo bo tshogs pa can gyi yang srid pa gzhan du nying mtshams sbyor ba gang gis bzlog pa nyid du nus /
analyzed: de ltar na gegs byed pa med pa can gyi rgyu'i ngo bo tshogs pa can gyi yang srid pa gzhan du nying mtshams sbyor ba gang gis bzlog pa nyid du nus /
translated: Thus, how could you stop the connection to another existence of the collection of causes that is not devoid of the obstruction?

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rgyu'i ngo bo'i gnas skabs mtshang ba med pa de ni de'i byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rgyu'i ngo bo'i gnas skabs mtshang ba med pa de ni de'i byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: That which is not devoid of the state of being the cause of something is the activity of that.

original: dper na dbang po rnams kyi sngar gyi gnas skabs kyi blo de nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dbang po rnams kyi sngar gyi gnas skabs kyi blo de nyid lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is just like the state of the prior cognition of the sense faculties.

original: phyis kyang blo ni dbang po rgyu'i ngo bo'i gnas skabs ma tshang ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: phyis kyang blo ni dbang po rgyu'i ngo bo'i gnas skabs ma tshang ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The later cognition is not devoid of the state of being the cause of the sense faculties. This is a natural inference.

original: gang zhig gnas skabs gang la skyed pa'i rgyu yod pa de ni skyed pa'i rgyun chad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gnas skabs gang la skyed pa'i rgyu yod pa de ni skyed pa'i rgyun chad pa ma yin te /
translated: That which has a cause of generation in a certain state is not devoid of the cause of generation.

original: blo de nyid kyi snga ma'i gnas skabs lta bu'o //
analyzed: blo de nyid kyi snga ma'i gnas skabs lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is just like the prior state of that cognition.

original: tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi blo la yang skyed pa'i rgyu yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi blo la yang skyed pa'i rgyu yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished.

original: blo sngon du byung ba las kyis mngon par 'du byas pa ni ji srid bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i chos rnams yod par gyur pa /
analyzed: blo sngon du byung ba las kyis mngon par 'du byas pa ni ji srid bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i chos rnams yod par gyur pa /
translated: The mind that is formed by karma that has arisen previously exists as long as the phenomena of the self and mine exist.

original: gnod pa med par 'jug pa can de dag thams cad phyis 'byung ba can la yod pa'i phyis ma grub pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gnod pa med par 'jug pa can de dag thams cad phyis 'byung ba can la yod pa'i phyis ma grub pa ci zhig yod /
translated: Since it is engaged without harm, what is unestablished later on in all that arise later?

original: gal te dbang po rnams ni rnam par shes pa la brten pa nyid yin gyi de yang de la brten pa ma yin no zhes sgrub par byed pas lus dang sems dag ni phan tshun rjes su byed pa can nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mthas
analyzed: gal te dbang po rnams ni rnam par shes pa la brten pa nyid yin gyi de yang de la brten pa ma yin no zhes sgrub par byed pas lus dang sems dag ni phan tshun rjes su byed pa can nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mthas
translated: If you prove that the faculties are dependent on consciousness, but consciousness is not dependent on them, then the philosophical theory that the body and mind are mutually dependent is undermined.

original: rjes su dpag pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: This is the fault of your inference.

original: ma yin te dgongs pa mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te dgongs pa mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because you do not understand the intention.

original: lus kyis dngos su yid kyi 'gyur ba cung zhig byed pa de ltar na rten du bshad pa ma yin @22a * //
analyzed: lus kyis dngos su yid kyi 'gyur ba cung zhig byed pa de ltar na rten du bshad pa ma yin @22a * //
translated: The body is not called a basis because it slightly modifies the mental faculty.

original: no 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: no 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: lus la brten pa'i yul dag gis phan 'dogs par byed pa 'am /
analyzed: lus la brten pa'i yul dag gis phan 'dogs par byed pa 'am /
translated: The body is a basis because it benefits the mental faculty through the objects that are related to the body.üîΩOr, others benefit or harm the body consciousness,üîΩand through the condition as the antecedent, they benefit or harm the mental faculty.

original: gzhan dag gis lus kyi rnam par shes pa la gnod pa 'am phan btags pa dag ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis lus kyi rnam par shes pa la gnod pa 'am phan btags pa dag ni /
translated: The mental faculty is a basis because it benefits the body consciousness.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said that the mental faculty is a basis because the body consciousness benefits the mental consciousness.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi sgo nas yid kyi shes pa la gnod pa'am /üîΩphan 'dogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi sgo nas yid kyi shes pa la gnod pa'am / phan 'dogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The body consciousness is a basis because it benefits the mental consciousness.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said that the mental faculty is a basis because it benefits the body consciousness.üîΩThe body consciousness is a basis because it benefits the mental faculty.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said that the mental faculty is a basis because the body consciousness benefits the mental faculty.

original: de shes pa yis nyer byed phyir //
analyzed: de shes pa yis nyer byed phyir //
translated: The body consciousness is a basis because it benefits the mental faculty.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said that the mental faculty is a basis because the body consciousness benefits the mental faculty.üîΩThe body consciousness is a basis because it benefits the mental faculty.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said that the mental faculty is a basis because the body consciousness benefits the mental faculty.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa la phan gdags par bya ba yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa la phan gdags par bya ba yin pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
translated: The body consciousness is a basis because it benefits the mental faculty.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said that the mental faculty is a basis because the body consciousness benefits the mental faculty.üîΩThe body consciousness is a basis because it benefits the mental faculty.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said that the mental faculty is a basis because the body consciousness benefits the mental faculty.üîΩThe body consciousness is a basis because it benefits the mental faculty.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said that the mental faculty is a basis because the body consciousness benefits the mental faculty.üîΩThe body consciousness is a basis because it benefits the mental faculty.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said that the mental faculty is a basis because the body consciousness benefits the mental faculty.üîΩThe body consciousness is a basis because it benefits the mental faculty.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said that the mental faculty is a basis because the body consciousness benefits the mental faculty.üîΩThe body consciousness is a basis because it benefits the mental faculty.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn said that the mental faculty is a basis because the body consciousness benefits the mental faculty.üîΩThe body consciousness is a basis because it benefits the mental faculty.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yid ni lus la brten par bshad /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yid ni lus la brten par bshad /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said that the mental faculty is a basis because the body consciousness benefits the mental faculty.

original: de tsam gyis ni de'i rnam par shes pa lus nyid la brten pa ma yin no //üîΩde ltar na yul gyi sgo nas kyang dbang po'i shes pa 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni de'i rnam par shes pa lus nyid la brten pa ma yin no //üîΩde ltar na yul gyi sgo nas kyang dbang po'i shes pa 'gyur ba na /
translated: The body consciousness is a basis because it benefits the

original: yid rnams par 'gyur mod kyi de yang de rten ma yin no //
analyzed: yid rnams par 'gyur mod kyi de yang de rten ma yin no //
translated: The mind changes, but it is not the support of the mind.

original: gang yang de la brten nas 'jug pa de ni de la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa dngos su rjes su byed de /
analyzed: gang yang de la brten nas 'jug pa de ni de la phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa dngos su rjes su byed de /
translated: The mind that is produced in dependence on the sense faculty is the cause of the benefit or harm of the sense faculty, just as the mind is the cause of the benefit or harm of the sense faculty.

original: dper na dbang po'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dbang po'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the sense faculty is the cause of the mind, and the mind is the cause of the sense faculty.

original: de ltar na yid kyi blo'i lus rten ma yin no //üîΩci ste dbang po med par blo med pa'i phyir de dag ni rten nyid du 'gyur ro zhes nges par 'dzin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar na yid kyi blo'i lus rten ma yin no // ci ste dbang po med par blo med pa'i phyir de dag ni rten nyid du 'gyur ro zhes nges par 'dzin pa de'i tshe /
translated: Thus, the mind is not the support of the body.üîΩIf you think that the sense faculties are the support of the mind because the mind does not exist without the sense faculties,

original: ji ltar dbang po med blo min //
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po med blo min //
translated: then how can the sense faculties be the support of the mind?

original: de ltar blo de med par ni /
analyzed: de ltar blo de med par ni /
translated: The mind does not exist without the sense faculties.

original: dbang po de rnams kyang ma mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po de rnams kyang ma mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: The sense faculties are not seen without the mind.

original: dbang po rnams 'ba' zhig blo'i rgyur mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams 'ba' zhig blo'i rgyur mi 'gyur te /
translated: The sense faculties are not the cause of the mind alone.

original: blo yang de dag gi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo yang de dag gi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind is also the cause of the sense faculties.

original: khyod kyis rten sgrub par byed pa'i rnam par nye bar dgod pa /
analyzed: khyod kyis rten sgrub par byed pa'i rnam par nye bar dgod pa /
translated: You have established the sense faculties as the support of the mind.

original: de ltar na yang phan tshun rgyu nyid yin par sngar skye ba yongs su len pa na grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang phan tshun rgyu nyid yin par sngar skye ba yongs su len pa na grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is established that they are the mutual cause, as they are accepted as arising in sequence.

original: gal te ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are not,

original: blo dang dbang po dag las cig kyang rgyu mtshan med par 'jug par mi rung ste /
analyzed: blo dang dbang po dag las cig kyang rgyu mtshan med par 'jug par mi rung ste /
translated: then it is not reasonable that either the mind or the sense faculties operate without a cause,

original: glo bur pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glo bur pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that they would be adventitious.

original: de bas na ji ltar sngar phan tshun rgyu nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar sngar phan tshun rgyu nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, just as they were previously the reciprocal causes of each other,

original: phan tshun rgyu nyid yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir de bzhin du phyis kyang shi ba'i 'og tu dbang po rnam par shes pa phan tshun rgyu can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun rgyu nyid yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir de bzhin du phyis kyang shi ba'i 'og tu dbang po rnam par shes pa phan tshun rgyu can du 'gyur ro //
translated: so they are later as well, after death, because the reason, namely, that they are reciprocal causes, is the same.üîΩFrom the sense faculties there is consciousness, and from consciousness there is the sense faculties.

original: dbang po las rnam par shes pa dang rnam par shes pas yang dbang po zhes bya ba ma tshang ba med na rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dbang po las rnam par shes pa dang rnam par shes pas yang dbang po zhes bya ba ma tshang ba med na rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid yin no //
translated: When there is no deficiency, there is no interruption.

original: gzhan yang gang gi che lus yid kyi blo dang dbang po rnams dang / dbugs 'byung rngub dag gi rten yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi che lus yid kyi blo dang dbang po rnams dang / dbugs 'byung rngub dag gi rten yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, when the body is the support of the mind, the sense faculties, and the inhalation and exhalation of breath,

original: skad cig ma re rer 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can ma @22b yin pa'i lus las /
analyzed: skad cig ma re rer 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can ma @22b yin pa'i lus las /
translated: then the body is not a continuum that is not subject to momentariness.

original: thams cad du dbang po dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de rnams yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du dbang po dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de rnams yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In all cases, those faculties, consciousnesses, etc. do not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhen 'di ltar rim can min las /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen 'di ltar rim can min las /
translated: Why is it so? Because of the non-sequential arising.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i lus las rim can go rims bzhin du 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi 'bras bu yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pa yin no //üîΩde ltar na rten gyi rim pa'am /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i lus las rim can go rims bzhin du 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi 'bras bu yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pa yin no // de ltar na rten gyi rim pa'am /
translated: The mental consciousness, which is the effect of the body as explained, does not arise in a sequential order.üîΩThus, the mental consciousness would arise in a sequential order from the sequential order of the basis,

original: yul gyi rim pa las rim pa dang ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: yul gyi rim pa las rim pa dang ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'gyur grang na /
translated: or from the sequential order of the object.

original: re zhig yul gyi rim pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig yul gyi rim pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it does not arise from the sequential order of the object,

original: yul med du zin kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul med du zin kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists even when the object does not exist.

original: de ltar na yul thag nye ba nyid la ltos pa med pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yul thag nye ba nyid la ltos pa med pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, a conceptual consciousness would arise without depending on the proximity of the object.

original: lus dbang po dang bcas pa can nye bar len pa'i rgyu lhag par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: lus dbang po dang bcas pa can nye bar len pa'i rgyu lhag par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The body with its faculties would be the predominant cause of appropriation.

original: gzhan mi 'dod pa'i phyir dang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan mi 'dod pa'i phyir dang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the other is not desired and is not seen.

original: de yang go rims can ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de yang go rims can ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: And that is not sequential.

original: de yod na 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can yid kyi blo thams cad cig car 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir go rims can ma yin pa las shes pa go rims dang ldan pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yod na 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can yid kyi blo thams cad cig car 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir go rims can ma yin pa las shes pa go rims dang ldan pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If it exists, all mental cognitions that have the nature of transformation would simultaneously engage, and therefore, a sequential cognition does not exist from a nonsequential cause.

original: go rims dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni rgyu'i go rims kyis byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo ni rgyu'i go rims kyis byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because the nature of a sequential effect is produced by the sequence of its cause.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyu med pa can nyid du thal ba'i phyir dang / gzhan la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgang yang rtag pa go rims bzhin du byed pa'i ngang tshul can du 'dod pa de'i yang lhan cig byed pa cung zhig la ltos nas /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyu med pa can nyid du thal ba'i phyir dang / gzhan la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // gang yang rtag pa go rims bzhin du byed pa'i ngang tshul can du 'dod pa de'i yang lhan cig byed pa cung zhig la ltos nas /
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that it would be causeless, and it would follow that it would exist elsewhere.

original: go rims bzhin du 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can byed pa de ltar na /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul can byed pa de ltar na /
translated: Also, for those who assert that a permanent thing has the nature of sequential activity, that which has the nature of sequential activity is produced in dependence on some cooperating condition.üîΩIf that were so,

original: 'bras bu'i go rims bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur na yang /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i go rims bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur na yang /
translated: Although they occur in the order of the result,üîΩ

original: rgol ba 'di nyid kyi yang ma yin te ltos par bya ba gzhan mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgol ba 'di nyid kyi yang ma yin te ltos par bya ba gzhan mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But this is not so for the opponent, because he does not accept any other object of dependence.

original: 'gyur ba med par khyad par can min /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med par khyad par can min /
translated: The mind does not change without a special reason.

original: lus 'di nyid la ltos pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus 'di nyid la ltos pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This body is not dependent on anything else.

original: de ltar na ji ltar go rims dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu yin /
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar go rims dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu yin /
translated: So how can it be an effect that has a definite order?

original: ci ste skyon 'dis ma gyur cig snyam nas blo go rims dang ldan pa la ltos nas byed pa de ltar na go rims byed pa de nyid yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste skyon 'dis ma gyur cig snyam nas blo go rims dang ldan pa la ltos nas byed pa de ltar na go rims byed pa de nyid yin na de'i tshe /
translated: But if you think, ‚ÄúLet us avoid this error by positing a definite order in the mind,‚Äù then the mind that has a definite order is the one that posits the order.

original: go rims dang ldan pa'i blos rjes su bzung ba'i go rims med pa'i bdag nyid can gyi lus las blo 'gyur bar 'dod na /
analyzed: go rims dang ldan pa'i blos rjes su bzung ba'i go rims med pa'i bdag nyid can gyi lus las blo 'gyur bar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the mind changes from a body that has no definite order because it is grasped by a mind that has a definite order,

original: blo yang nges par blo'i rgyu yin pa de ltar na /üîΩblo thams @23a * //
analyzed: blo yang nges par blo'i rgyu yin pa de ltar na / blo thams @23a * //
translated: then the mind would definitely be the cause of the mind.üîΩIn that case,

original: cad blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir blo'i rgyu thog ma med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cad blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir blo'i rgyu thog ma med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: because all minds are the cause of the mind, the cause of the mind would be without beginning.

original: de yang 'di ltar lus las rim bzhin blo 'gyur na /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar lus las rim bzhin blo 'gyur na /
translated: In the same way, when the mind changes gradually in relation to the body,

original: lus de'ang rim pa gsal bar byed //
analyzed: lus de'ang rim pa gsal bar byed //
translated: the body is gradually clarified.

original: rjes su dpog par byed do //
analyzed: rjes su dpog par byed do //
translated: It is inferred.

original: ji ltar zhe na blo skad cig mas skad cig ma re re la phan 'dogs par byed pa ni rnam pa gzhan du skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na blo skad cig mas skad cig ma re re la phan 'dogs par byed pa ni rnam pa gzhan du skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How so? The mind, in each moment, is helpful in each moment, because it arises in a different form.

original: de ltar na lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs ni skad cig re re la gzhan yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs ni skad cig re re la gzhan yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Thus, the collection of body, faculties, and mind is different in each moment.

original: skad cig snga ma snga ma ni /
analyzed: skad cig snga ma snga ma ni /
translated: In that case, the previous moment

original: 'gog pa thob pa skad cig re re la sngar med de'i /
analyzed: 'gog pa thob pa skad cig re re la sngar med de'i /
translated: is not present in the later moment.

original: skye bar 'dod pa tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bar 'dod pa tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The collection of causes is asserted to be the cause of arising.

original: gang gi phyir tshogs pa'i gnas skabs gcig gi tshe snga ma phyi ma'i rgyur mthong ba'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir na snga ma snga ma phyi ma phyi ma'i rgyu yin par /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshogs pa'i gnas skabs gcig gi tshe snga ma phyi ma'i rgyur mthong ba'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir na snga ma snga ma phyi ma phyi ma'i rgyu yin par /
translated: Because the reason that the previous moment is seen as the cause of the later moment at the time of the collection is seen, therefore the previous moment is the cause of the later moment.

original: thams cad du ni mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad du ni mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: It is seen in all cases.

original: phyis kyang 'chi ba'i 'og tu nyid mtshams sbyor bar yang nus pa yin te /
analyzed: phyis kyang 'chi ba'i 'og tu nyid mtshams sbyor bar yang nus pa yin te /
translated: and later, after death, it is also able to link with a new existence.

original: phyis kyang ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis kyang ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because later on, too, the conditions are not incomplete.

original: rgyu mtshan cis kyang srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba med cing gang gis na chad par 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan cis kyang srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba med cing gang gis na chad par 'gyur /
translated: By what reason is there no linking with a new existence and by what reason would there be annihilation?

original: rgyu mtshan gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod do //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod do //
translated: There is a valid reason for the refutation, namely,

original: de yang gang zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na smras pa /
translated: What is that?

original: lam po che'i skyes bu la sogs pa'i sems ni 'chi ba'i sems nyid yin pa'i phyir sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: lam po che'i skyes bu la sogs pa'i sems ni 'chi ba'i sems nyid yin pa'i phyir sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: The mind of a person on the highway, etc., is not linked with another mind because it is the mind of death.

original: skyes bu dgra bcom par 'dod pa'i 'chi ba'i sems bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes bu dgra bcom par 'dod pa'i 'chi ba'i sems bzhin no //
translated: It is like the mind of death of a person who is an arhat and who is thought to be a non-arhat.

original: mi dmigs pa ni dgag pa'i dbang du byed pa'i phyir de ni 'gal ba dmigs pa ltar bcos pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni dgag pa'i dbang du byed pa'i phyir de ni 'gal ba dmigs pa ltar bcos pa yin no //
translated: Non-apprehension is a substitute for the apprehension of something incompatible.

original: tha ma'i sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma nges pa yin par ston te /
analyzed: tha ma'i sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma nges pa yin par ston te /
translated: He shows that the reason is inconclusive with the words, ‚ÄúThe final mind, etc.‚Äù

original: tha ma'i sems te /
analyzed: tha ma'i sems te /
translated: The final mind,

original: 'chi ba'i sems ni sems gzhan dang // mtshams sbyor ba la 'gal ci yod /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sems ni sems gzhan dang // mtshams sbyor ba la 'gal ci yod /
translated: What is the contradiction in the mind at death being the mind that produces the next existence?

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag la 'gal ba rnam par gnyi ga yang yod pa ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag la 'gal ba rnam par gnyi ga yang yod pa ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: There is no contradiction in the object to be established and the means of establishing it.

original: de ltar na 'chi ba'i sems nyid yin pa dang / ma tshams sbyor bar nus par 'gyur ba'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'chi ba'i sems nyid yin pa dang / ma tshams sbyor bar nus par 'gyur ba'i phyir spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind at death is not to be abandoned, because it is the mind at death and because it is capable of producing the next existence.

original: dgra bcom sems gang yin de la //
analyzed: dgra bcom sems gang yin de la //
translated: What is the mind of an arhat?

original: dpe nyid du brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dpe nyid du brjod pa ni /
translated: The example is stated:

original: gang las mtshams sbyor med par 'dod //
analyzed: gang las mtshams sbyor med par 'dod //
translated: What is it that you think is not produced?

original: tshad ma cis grub na gang gis na dper 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshad ma cis grub na gang gis na dper 'gyur te /
translated: By what valid cognition is it established that it is an example?

original: dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos nyid la the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos nyid la the tshom za ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: An example is something that is doubted in regard to the property to be established.

original: de ltar ni @23b 'gyur na de ni khyod kyi grub pa'i mtha' yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar ni @23b 'gyur na de ni khyod kyi grub pa'i mtha' yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If it is as you say, then that is your tenet.

original: grub pa'i mtha' las grags pa de'i phyir de dpe de nyid du brjod par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' las grags pa de'i phyir de dpe de nyid du brjod par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, that example should be stated.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / tshad mas ma grub don can gyi //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te / 'di ltar / tshad mas ma grub don can gyi //
translated: That is not logical.üîΩBecause:üîΩHow could one understand a meaning

original: grub mtha'i rjes su rtogs sam ci 'dzin tam mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: grub mtha'i rjes su rtogs sam ci 'dzin tam mi 'dzin to //
translated: that is not established by valid knowledge?

original: grub pa'i mtha' glo bur du bzung ba las kyang dngos po rnams de bzhin gyi ngo bo ma yin na /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' glo bur du bzung ba las kyang dngos po rnams de bzhin gyi ngo bo ma yin na /
translated: If one grasps a philosophical position, then things are not of that nature.

original: gang gis na des grub mtha' dpe'i sgrub par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na des grub mtha' dpe'i sgrub par byed par 'gyur /
translated: By what means would that philosophical position be established by an example?

original: gal te bstan par bya ba'i grub pa'i mthas dpe nyid du brjod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bstan par bya ba'i grub pa'i mthas dpe nyid du brjod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the example is stated by the philosophical position that is to be demonstrated,

original: ma yin te bstan par bya ba mi shes pa la yang tshad mas ma mthong ba ma grub pa nyid yin no //üîΩdes rtogs pa'i ngor byas nas gzhan gyis khas blangs pa sems gzhan nying mtshams sbyor ba yang /
analyzed: ma yin te bstan par bya ba mi shes pa la yang tshad mas ma mthong ba ma grub pa nyid yin no // des rtogs pa'i ngor byas nas gzhan gyis khas blangs pa sems gzhan nying mtshams sbyor ba yang /
translated: that is not so, because for one who does not understand what is to be demonstrated, that which is not seen by valid knowledge is not established.

original: ci'i phyir rjes su mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rjes su mi 'dzin te /
translated: From the perspective of that understanding, why would another‚Äôs assertion not be accepted?

original: gal te de rgyu bral yin na de ltar ni 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de rgyu bral yin na de ltar ni 'gyur na /
translated: If it were free from causes, that would be so.

original: skyes bu dgra bcom par 'dod pa'i 'chi ba'i sems dang gzhan gyi rgyur gyur pa dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag 'chi ba'i dus na med cing rten du 'gyur ba'i dbang po rnams kyang ldog pa de lta na /
analyzed: skyes bu dgra bcom par 'dod pa'i 'chi ba'i sems dang gzhan gyi rgyur gyur pa dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag 'chi ba'i dus na med cing rten du 'gyur ba'i dbang po rnams kyang ldog pa de lta na /
translated: But at the time of death, the mind of a person who is an Arhat and the other causes, the exhalation and inhalation of breath, do not exist, and the faculties that serve as the basis also cease.

original: de rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi 'dod do zhe'o //
analyzed: de rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi 'dod do zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is free from causes, it is not accepted that there is rebirth.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi 'bras bu yin pa de ni de med na mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi 'bras bu yin pa de ni de med na mi 'gyur te /
translated: The application is this: if something is the result of something else, it does not occur when the other is absent.

original: dper na sa bon la sogs pa med pa'i myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //üîΩyid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dbugs 'byung ba dar /
analyzed: dper na sa bon la sogs pa med pa'i myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o // yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dbugs 'byung ba dar /
translated: For example, a sprout, etc., does not occur when a seed, etc., is absent.üîΩThe mental consciousness is the result of exhalation and inhalation and the faculties.

original: rngub pa dang / dbang po rnams kyi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rngub pa dang / dbang po rnams kyi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: yang na rgyu dang bral ba can gang yin pa de ni yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na rgyu dang bral ba can gang yin pa de ni yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Or, the application is this: that which is free from causes does not exist.

original: dper na rgyu dang bral ba can gyi myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyu dang bral ba can gyi myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like a sprout that is devoid of a cause.üîΩThe state of the mental consciousness is also without a cause.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tha ba'i gnas skabs kyang rgyu med pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tha ba'i gnas skabs kyang rgyu med pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradiction with a pervader.

original: gang de ni dgra bcom pa'i sems dpe nyid du brjod pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa la sgrub par byed par smras pa /
analyzed: gang de ni dgra bcom pa'i sems dpe nyid du brjod pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa la sgrub par byed par smras pa /
translated: The opponent says that the mind of an arhat is an example of a mind that is not linked to another life.

original: de nyid 'dir lam po che'i skyes bu'i 'chi ba'i sems nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa la cis mi brjod /
analyzed: de nyid 'dir lam po che'i skyes bu'i 'chi ba'i sems nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa la cis mi brjod /
translated: Why is it not said that the mind of death of a person on the main road is not linked to another life?

original: gang gis na 'chi ba'i sems nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i rtags brjod /üîΩgal te thams @24a * //
analyzed: gang gis na 'chi ba'i sems nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i rtags brjod / gal te thams @24a * //
translated: Why is a reason that is not understood, because it is the mind of death, stated?

original: cad la khyad par med par sgrub par byed pa yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: cad la khyad par med par sgrub par byed pa yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is established without any distinction,

original: yin na ni bla ste de ltar na yang gtan tshigs 'di ni ma grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yin na ni bla ste de ltar na yang gtan tshigs 'di ni ma grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: then it is fine, but even so, this reason is unestablished.

original: 'di ltar dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag las yid kyi blo ma yin zhes 'gog par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩyid kyi rnam par shes pa lus las 'gyur na dbang po dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag las yid kyi blo ma yin zhes 'gog par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro // yid kyi rnam par shes pa lus las 'gyur na dbang po dang bcas pa'am /
translated: In this way, the mental consciousness is refuted as arising from the exhalation and inhalation of the breath.üîΩIf the mental consciousness arises from the body, does it arise from the body together with the sense faculties or from the body without the sense faculties?

original: dbang po med pa can las 'gyur grang na re zhig dbang po bcas las yid shes min no //
analyzed: dbang po med pa can las 'gyur grang na re zhig dbang po bcas las yid shes min no //
translated: First, the mental consciousness does not arise from the body together with the sense faculties.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de blo bzhin 'dzin thob phyir ro //
analyzed: de blo bzhin 'dzin thob phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be like the mind and because it would be obtained through grasping.

original: gal te ji ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa /
translated: If, like the eye consciousness and so on,

original: mig gi dbang bo la sogs pa'i rten gyis skyed pa na /
analyzed: mig gi dbang bo la sogs pa'i rten gyis skyed pa na /
translated: the mental consciousness is generated by the support of the eye faculty and so on,

original: gzugs la sogs pa la gsal por snang ba can yin pa de ltar na yid kyi shes pa yang de'i 'bras bu yin na 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la gsal por snang ba can yin pa de ltar na yid kyi shes pa yang de'i 'bras bu yin na 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be clear in its appearance of form and so on, just as the mental consciousness is the result of that.

original: gang gi phyir snang ba mi gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snang ba mi gsal ba yin no //
translated: But that is not the case, because it is unclear.

original: dbang po re re'i 'gyur ba dang nyams pa dag la yang yod pa'i phyir dbang po re re las ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po re re'i 'gyur ba dang nyams pa dag la yang yod pa'i phyir dbang po re re las ma yin no //
translated: Also, it would not arise from each sense faculty because it exists when each sense faculty changes or is impaired.

original: tshogs pa kun las 'gyur grang na //
analyzed: tshogs pa kun las 'gyur grang na //
translated: If you say that it arises from the collection of all the sense faculties,

original: kun las kyang ni ma yin te //
analyzed: kun las kyang ni ma yin te //
translated: then it does not arise from all of them,

original: dbang po kun las so //
analyzed: dbang po kun las so //
translated: because it arises from all the sense faculties.

original: kyang gi sgras ni dbang bo gcig med na yang 'di med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni dbang bo gcig med na yang 'di med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that if one sense faculty is absent, it follows that it is also absent.

original: lhan cig byed pa gcig med na myu gu la sogs pa mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa gcig med na myu gu la sogs pa mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is just like the fact that if one of the cooperating causes is absent, the sprout, etc. do not arise.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: shes skyed nus pa tha dad phyir ro //
analyzed: shes skyed nus pa tha dad phyir ro //
translated: Because the power to generate consciousness is different.

original: de skad du gal te dbang po'i 'bras bur yid kyi rnam par shes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: de skad du gal te dbang po'i 'bras bur yid kyi rnam par shes par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: Thus, if the mental consciousness is the result of the sense faculties, then at that time,

original: de ni don thams cad 'dzin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de ni don thams cad 'dzin pa de ltar na /
translated: it would grasp all objects,

original: rten dbang po gcig gis bskyed pas yul thams cad kyi tha snyad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rten dbang po gcig gis bskyed pas yul thams cad kyi tha snyad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
translated: because the complete conventional designation of all objects is generated by one sense faculty as a basis.

original: dbang po gzhan rnams don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan rnams don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the other sense faculties would be meaningless.

original: de dag kyang don thams cad 'dzin pa can gyi shes pa gcig skyed pa ma yin pa de ltar na dbang po du ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang don thams cad 'dzin pa can gyi shes pa gcig skyed pa ma yin pa de ltar na dbang po du ma yin te /
translated: If they do not generate a single consciousness that grasps all objects, then there would be many sense faculties.

original: dbang po de dag gi rang gi yul la shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa tha dad pa yang mthong ngo zhes bstan par gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po de dag gi rang gi yul la shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa tha dad pa yang mthong ngo zhes bstan par gyur ro //
translated: It is also seen that the power of these faculties to generate consciousness of their objects is different.

original: ci ste 'gyur na yang rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa de gcig nyid yin pa ni bla ste gzhan rnams ni med pa yin no zhe na de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste 'gyur na yang rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa de gcig nyid yin pa ni bla ste gzhan rnams ni med pa yin no zhe na de'i tshe /
translated: But if it were, it would be better to say that the conceptual consciousness is one and the others do not exist.

original: de thams cad kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de thams cad kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, because it is the object of all of them,

original: de'i blo dang 'dra bar 'dzin pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i blo dang 'dra bar 'dzin pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be apprehended as similar to their cognition.

original: gzhan yang dbang po ma @24b chod pa la sogs pa la los pa dang bcas pas rang gi rnam par shes pas skyed par byed cing yid kyi rnam par shes pa de la ltos pa med pa srog chags thams cad kya rang rig pa yang skye bar 'gyur
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang po ma @24b chod pa la sogs pa la los pa dang bcas pas rang gi rnam par shes pas skyed par byed cing yid kyi rnam par shes pa de la ltos pa med pa srog chags thams cad kya rang rig pa yang skye bar 'gyur
translated: Moreover, the mental consciousness that is generated by its own faculty, which is not obstructed and so on, would arise in all living beings as reflexive awareness, without relying on the mental consciousness.

original: bas na / ji ltar na de'i 'bras bu yin te ma yin no //
analyzed: bas na / ji ltar na de'i 'bras bu yin te ma yin no //
translated: So how could it be its result? It could not be.

original: de ltar na de dbang po dang bcas pa can las ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dbang po dang bcas pa can las ma yin no //
translated: Thus it is not the result of the faculty.

original: dbang po med pa can gzhan las kyang min no //
analyzed: dbang po med pa can gzhan las kyang min no //
translated: Nor can it be from another body that is devoid of sense faculties.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems nyid med phyir skra dang / sen mo'i rtse mo la sogs pa ni sems med pa yin na /
analyzed: sems nyid med phyir skra dang / sen mo'i rtse mo la sogs pa ni sems med pa yin na /
translated: Because there is no mind. The tips of the hair and nails, etc., are devoid of mind.

original: gang gis na de dag la blor 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na de dag la blor 'gyur /
translated: How can they be mind?

original: de rgyu nyid yin na yang lus las 'phos pa rnams kyang blo'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba dang 'chi ba'i lus kyang ngo //
analyzed: de rgyu nyid yin na yang lus las 'phos pa rnams kyang blo'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba dang 'chi ba'i lus kyang ngo //
translated: Even if they were the cause, the body parts that are separated from the body would be the cause of mind, and so would the body at the time of death.
