original: sbyor ba ni gang sems med pa de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang sems med pa de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: That which is devoid of mind is not the basis of mental consciousness,

original: dper na dri la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dri la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like smell, etc.üîΩThe body parts that are devoid of sense faculties are devoid of mind.

original: dbang po med pa can gyi lus kyi yan lag kyang sems med pa yin no zhes bya ba na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po med pa can gyi lus kyi yan lag kyang sems med pa yin no zhes bya ba na khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The contradiction of the pervader is observed.üîΩIf it were so, if the body were not the basis of mental consciousness,

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na gal te yid kyi blo'i lus rten du mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na gal te yid kyi blo'i lus rten du mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: then

original: 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta bzhin du so sor 'gyur zhing lhan cig gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta bzhin du so sor 'gyur zhing lhan cig gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are unrelated, they would be separate, like a cow and a horse, and would not coexist.

original: lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir yang rten zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir yang rten zhes bya'o //
translated: They are also called ‚Äúbases‚Äù because they coexist.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang dang lhan cig gnas par nges pa de dag ni phan tshun rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang dang lhan cig gnas par nges pa de dag ni phan tshun rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: That which is definitely concomitant with something is mutually the basis and the based on that,

original: dper na sgron ma dang 'do dmar ras dang dkar po nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgron ma dang 'do dmar ras dang dkar po nyid lta bu'o //
translated: like a lamp and its red or white color.

original: dbang po dang bcas pa can gyi lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag la yang lhan cig gnas pa'i nges pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par sems so //
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa can gyi lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dag la yang lhan cig gnas pa'i nges pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par sems so //
translated: The body and the mental consciousness, along with the sense faculties, are definitely concomitant. This is the natural reason.

original: rgyu tha dad pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma nges pa nyid ston par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma nges pa nyid ston par byed do //
translated: He shows that this reason is inconclusive with the words ‚Äúbecause there is no difference in their causes,‚Äù and so on.

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir lhan cig gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir lhan cig gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not concomitant because they are the basis and the based on.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: rgyu tha dad pa med pa dbang po dang bcas pa can gyi lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun dag gi rgyu ming dang gzugs kyi 'phen par byed pa'i sngon gyi las ni tha mi dad pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa med pa dbang po dang bcas pa can gyi lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun dag gi rgyu ming dang gzugs kyi 'phen par byed pa'i sngon gyi las ni tha mi dad pa yin te /
translated: The cause of the body and the continuum of the mental consciousness, which are not separate, is the previous karma that projects name-and-form.

original: de las lhan cig gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de las lhan cig gnas pa yin no //
translated: They are simultaneous because of that.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na dbang bzhin te dper na dbang po rnams lhan cig gnas par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na dbang bzhin te dper na dbang po rnams lhan cig gnas par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: What is it like? Like the sense faculties. For example, the sense faculties do not exist simultaneously.

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos por ni med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos por ni med pa lta bu'o //
translated: They do not have the relationship of support and supported.

original: gzugs dang ro bzhin @25a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang ro bzhin @25a * //
translated: Like form and taste.

original: te / gzugs dang ro tshogs pa gcig la rag lus pa dag ni lhan cig gnas pa yin na yang //
analyzed: te / gzugs dang ro tshogs pa gcig la rag lus pa dag ni lhan cig gnas pa yin na yang //
translated: Although form and taste that depend on the same collection exist simultaneously,

original: phan tshun rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
translated: they do not have the relationship of support and supported.

original: gcig 'gyur ba na yang gzhan 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir /üîΩmngal na lhan cig gnas pa can gyi tshe /
analyzed: gcig 'gyur ba na yang gzhan 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir / mngal na lhan cig gnas pa can gyi tshe /
translated: Because when one changes, the other does not change.

original: ma dag dang rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: ma dag dang rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
translated: When they are in the womb, they do not have the relationship of support and supported.üîΩThe mother and the fetus are not the same.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na dbang po la sogs pa dag la lhan cig gnas pa nges pa can ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na dbang po la sogs pa dag la lhan cig gnas pa nges pa can ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If that were so, then it would be uncertain that the sense faculties and so on definitely coexist.üîΩ

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then the sense faculties, etc. would not be the support and the supported, because they do not definitely coexist.

original: de ni gzhan la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: de ni gzhan la yang mtshungs te /
translated: This is the same for the other.

original: dbang po dang bcas pa can gyi lus med par yang gzugs med pa'i khams na /
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa can gyi lus med par yang gzugs med pa'i khams na /
translated: Even without a body that possesses the sense faculties, in the formless realm,

original: yang yid kyi rnams par shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang yid kyi rnams par shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the mental consciousness exists.

original: de ltar na 'di la yang dbang po'i 'gyur ba dang / ma tshang ba dag yod du zin kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di la yang dbang po'i 'gyur ba dang / ma tshang ba dag yod du zin kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa yod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, even though the sense faculties are transformed and incomplete in this realm, the reason is not established because the mental consciousness exists.

original: ci ste yang gang zhig gang 'gyur ba na rnam par 'gyur ba de ni de la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang gang zhig gang 'gyur ba na rnam par 'gyur ba de ni de la brten pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, that which is transformed when something is transformed is the support of that,üîΩjust as the eye consciousness is transformed when the eye is transformed.

original: dper na mig 'gyur pa na mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam par 'gyur ba lta bu'o // dbang po dang bcas pa can gyi yul 'gyur ba na yang /
analyzed: dper na mig 'gyur pa na mig gi rnam par shes pa rnam par 'gyur ba lta bu'o // dbang po dang bcas pa can gyi yul 'gyur ba na yang /
translated: When the object of the sense faculties is transformed,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par 'gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su brjod do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par 'gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su brjod do //
translated: The mental consciousness is a transformation of the mind. This is a reason based on the nature of things.

original: de yang gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no //
translated: But that reason is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag gis dngos su 'di phan gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag gis dngos su 'di phan gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin zhes bshad zin to //
translated: Because we have already explained that it is not directly to be benefited.

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa zhes bya ba nyid kyis ni rten ma yin pa de ltar na ma nges pa yang yin no //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa zhes bya ba nyid kyis ni rten ma yin pa de ltar na ma nges pa yang yin no //
translated: And it is not a basis because it is not a benefit. Thus, it is not established.

original: de ltar na don gyi sgo nas kyang shes par 'gyur pa mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na don gyi sgo nas kyang shes par 'gyur pa mthong ba yin te /
translated: Thus, it is seen that the mind is understood by means of its object.

original: dper na gzhan gyi khrag mthong ba las kyang brgyal ba lta bu yin na gzhan gyi khrag kyang rten ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na gzhan gyi khrag mthong ba las kyang brgyal ba lta bu yin na gzhan gyi khrag kyang rten ma yin no //
translated: For example, one faints upon seeing the blood of another, but the blood of another is not a basis of fainting.

original: so btang ba las skyes pa'i yon tan me las byung ba'i tshos pa las skyes pa'i yon tan lta bu yin pas na de yang brten pa ma yin pa de ltar na ma nges pa nyid yin no /
analyzed: so btang ba las skyes pa'i yon tan me las byung ba'i tshos pa las skyes pa'i yon tan lta bu yin pas na de yang brten pa ma yin pa de ltar na ma nges pa nyid yin no /
translated: And the qualities that arise from the giving of teeth are not qualities that arise from the burning of teeth. Thus, it is not a basis. Thus, it is not established.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Cognition

original: bam po bcu bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu bzhi pa /
translated: Fourteenth chapter

original: de ltar na dngos su dbang po dang bcas pa can gyi lus kyis blo phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa grub pa'i phyir rten ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos su dbang po dang bcas pa can gyi lus kyis blo phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa grub pa'i phyir rten ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since it is established that the body with the sense faculties is not something to be benefited by the mind, it is not the basis.

original: gzhan yang yang rnams pa 'ga' zhig gis phan gdags par bya ba de @25b tsam gyis phan 'dogs par byed pa po phan 'dogs par bya ba 'grub par byed pa ma yin na gang gis na lus ldog pas blo ldog par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang yang rnams pa 'ga' zhig gis phan gdags par bya ba de @25b tsam gyis phan 'dogs par byed pa po phan 'dogs par bya ba 'grub par byed pa ma yin na gang gis na lus ldog pas blo ldog par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if something to be benefited is not benefited by some means, then by what means would the mind be benefited by the cessation of the body? It would not be benefited.

original: de ltar na re zhig rgyu de ni 'bras bu de'i /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig rgyu de ni 'bras bu de'i /
translated: Thus, that cause is not the cause of that effect.

original: gang zhig yod nyid phan 'dogs byed //
analyzed: gang zhig yod nyid phan 'dogs byed //
translated: That which exists is benefited.

original: ces bya ba 'dis rgyu las sngar grub pa'am /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis rgyu las sngar grub pa'am /
translated: By this, that which is established prior to the cause or

original: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can ni 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can ni 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: that which has the nature of arising simultaneously with it is not the effect.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What then is it?

original: rgyu yod pa nyid nye ba las sngar yod pa nyid ma grub pa can gyi yod pa nyid nye bar 'jog pa ni 'bras bu nyid yin gyi dus snga ma can dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi yod pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu yod pa nyid nye ba las sngar yod pa nyid ma grub pa can gyi yod pa nyid nye bar 'jog pa ni 'bras bu nyid yin gyi dus snga ma can dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can gyi yod pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The existence of an existent that is not established as prior to the presence of a cause is posited as the effect, not as the existence that is prior to the time or that is simultaneous with the mode of being.

original: grub phan 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub phan 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the effect that is established.

original: de ltar na tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu can dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu can dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid kyi spyi yin no //
translated: Thus, having a cause that is different or not different is the universal characteristic of cause and effect.

original: des na phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin na yang tha dad pa'i rgyun ldog pas rgyun gzhan phan gdags par bya ba rang gi nye bar len pa la ltos pas 'jug pa can yang rgyun chad pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: des na phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin na yang tha dad pa'i rgyun ldog pas rgyun gzhan phan gdags par bya ba rang gi nye bar len pa la ltos pas 'jug pa can yang rgyun chad pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, even though it is the benefactor, the cessation of the different continuum is not the cessation of the continuum that is to be benefited, because it engages in dependence on its own appropriated aggregates.

original: dper na mkhan pos phan btags pa byas pa'i slob ma mkhan po med pa na med pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mkhan pos phan btags pa byas pa'i slob ma mkhan po med pa na med pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a student who has been benefited by his preceptor does not cease to exist when the preceptor is absent.

original: 'on kyang / gang zhig yod nyid phan 'dogs byed //
analyzed: 'on kyang / gang zhig yod nyid phan 'dogs byed //
translated: But when it is present, it is helpful.

original: rtag tu de ni rjes 'jug phyir //
analyzed: rtag tu de ni rjes 'jug phyir //
translated: Because it always follows it.

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa gang zhig bdag nyid thag nye ba na yod na /
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa gang zhig bdag nyid thag nye ba na yod na /
translated: When the helpful is present, it is close to the self.

original: 'bras bu nye bar 'jog par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu nye bar 'jog par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is the cause of the result.üîΩThis shows the difference between the cause and the appropriator.

original: des ni nye bar len pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par bstan to // de 'dra ba de rgyu yin yang bdag nyid ldog pas 'bras bu ldog par byed pa yin gyi rgyu tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des ni nye bar len pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i khyad par bstan to // de 'dra ba de rgyu yin yang bdag nyid ldog pas 'bras bu ldog par byed pa yin gyi rgyu tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though it is the cause of that, it is the cause of the cessation of the result because of the cessation of the self, but it is not the cause of the result alone.

original: gang gis rgyu'i sngar dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i dang tshul can ni 'bras bu nyid ma yin gyi phyir 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: gang gis rgyu'i sngar dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i dang tshul can ni 'bras bu nyid ma yin gyi phyir 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can yin pa de bas na /
translated: Because it is not the case that the cause is the result, since it is the cause of the prior and the simultaneous.

original: de nyid kyis don 'di gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi bdud pa brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis don 'di gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi bdud pa brjod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, he states the reason that clarifies this point.

original: dper na ci'i phyir 'di'i yang rgyu 'di yin zhes dris pa na /
analyzed: dper na ci'i phyir 'di'i yang rgyu 'di yin zhes dris pa na /
translated: For example, when asked, ‚ÄúWhy is this also the cause of that?‚Äù

original: 'di ltar 'di yod pa na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di yod pa na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, when this exists, that comes to be.

original: de de ltar na bdun pa 'dis rgyu snga na yod pa dang / 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i dang po pas 'bras bu phyis yod pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na bdun pa 'dis rgyu snga na yod pa dang / 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i dang po pas 'bras bu phyis yod pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the seventh shows that the cause exists prior to the effect, and the first shows that the effect exists later.

original: de las skyes pas zhes bya ba rgyu'i lnga pas snga na yod pa nyid dang / 'di skye zhes bya ba'i dang po pas phyis yod par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de las skyes pas zhes bya ba rgyu'i lnga pas snga na yod pa nyid dang / 'di skye zhes bya ba'i dang po pas phyis yod par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The fifth shows that the cause exists prior to the effect, and the first shows that the effect exists later.

original: de lta ma yin @26a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin @26a * //
translated: If that were not so,

original: na lhan cig 'byung ba can dag gi nang nas /
analyzed: na lhan cig 'byung ba can dag gi nang nas /
translated: then among coexistent things,

original: ci'i phyir gcig ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gcig ni rgyu yin la /
translated: why would one be a cause and the other not?

original: gzhan ni 'bras bu yin zhes dris pa na 'di ltar 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan bstan pas /
analyzed: gzhan ni 'bras bu yin zhes dris pa na 'di ltar 'di yod na 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan bstan pas /
translated: When asked this question, the reason for the convention of cause and effect is stated: ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that comes to be.‚Äù

original: phul du byung ba ci zhig bstan par 'gyur zhing gang gis na rtogs pa pos rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi mtshan nyid 'chol pa med par rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: phul du byung ba ci zhig bstan par 'gyur zhing gang gis na rtogs pa pos rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi mtshan nyid 'chol pa med par rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: What is the point of teaching something that is not a cause or an effect?

original: de bas na 'di skad du gang dag lhan cig 'byung ba yang ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na 'di skad du gang dag lhan cig 'byung ba yang ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are not even co-existent causes.

original: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa med do //
translated: Thus, there is no certainty that this is a cause and that is an effect.

original: gang la phan tshun rgyu nyid du lhan cig 'byung ba dag tu nges pa med pa de la yang gang kho nas gcig rgyu nyid yin pa de nyid kyi 'bras bu nyid ma yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la phan tshun rgyu nyid du lhan cig 'byung ba dag tu nges pa med pa de la yang gang kho nas gcig rgyu nyid yin pa de nyid kyi 'bras bu nyid ma yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And if there is no certainty that co-existent causes are mutually causal, then it is not the case that whatever is a cause of one is also an effect of that cause, because that would be contradictory.

original: de bas na rnam grangs gang gis rgyu dang / tha snyad du byed pa de ston pas ji ltar de dag gis mtshan nyid phan tshun 'chol pa med pa de ltar brjod pa na /
analyzed: de bas na rnam grangs gang gis rgyu dang / tha snyad du byed pa de ston pas ji ltar de dag gis mtshan nyid phan tshun 'chol pa med pa de ltar brjod pa na /
translated: Therefore, the teacher has stated that the definition of a cause and an effect is not mutually contradictory, if one accepts the definition of a cause and an effect in any way whatsoever.

original: de yod na yod ba can nyid 'chad pa kho na rten yin no //
analyzed: de yod na yod ba can nyid 'chad pa kho na rten yin no //
translated: The mere fact that something exists when this exists is the reason that something is a cause.

original: des kyang lhan cig yod pa tsam las lhag pa cung zad kyang bstan pa med pa de ltar na de lta bu'i tha snyad ni don cung zad kyang rnam par 'byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des kyang lhan cig yod pa tsam las lhag pa cung zad kyang bstan pa med pa de ltar na de lta bu'i tha snyad ni don cung zad kyang rnam par 'byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, such a convention does not distinguish anything at all.

original: de skad du ston pa na kho bos ni don gyi khyad par bstan pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de skad du ston pa na kho bos ni don gyi khyad par bstan pa nyid yin te /
translated: When it is taught in this way, we do teach a distinction in meaning.

original: dper na 'bras bu 'byung ba'i chos can yod na /
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu 'byung ba'i chos can yod na /
translated: For example, when there is a dharma that is the source of an effect,

original: de skyes par nus pa'i rgyu nyid snga na yod pa ni bdun pa dang / lnga pas bstan pa dang / de yod na phyis yod pa'i 'bras bu nyid ni dang po nas bstan to //
analyzed: de skyes par nus pa'i rgyu nyid snga na yod pa ni bdun pa dang / lnga pas bstan pa dang / de yod na phyis yod pa'i 'bras bu nyid ni dang po nas bstan to //
translated: the cause that is able to produce it exists prior to it, as taught in the seventh and fifth chapters, and when it exists, the effect exists later, as taught in the first chapter.

original: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ma 'chol ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ma 'chol ba yin no //
translated: Thus, cause and effect are not confused.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i nges pa de 'dra ba dag ni mngal la sogs pa dag tu lus dang sems la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i nges pa de 'dra ba dag ni mngal la sogs pa dag tu lus dang sems la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Such a certainty of concomitance does not exist for the body and mind in the womb and so on.

original: 'di la sngar lus dmigs pa yod na phyis sems dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la sngar lus dmigs pa yod na phyis sems dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, when the body is observed previously, the mind is not observed later.

original: log pa nges pa yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: log pa nges pa yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the case that there is a definite absence of error.

original: de ltar na re zhig bdag nyid kyi lus log pas rang gi blo log bar shes par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig bdag nyid kyi lus log pas rang gi blo log bar shes par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, first, one‚Äôs own mind is not known to be erroneous due to the error of one‚Äôs own body,

original: thams cad du bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan gyi lus log pas kyang de dang 'brel pa can gyi blo log par shes par 'gyur ba yang bla ste /
analyzed: thams cad du bdag nyid med pa'i phyir ro // gzhan gyi lus log pas kyang de dang 'brel pa can gyi blo log par shes par 'gyur ba yang bla ste /
translated: because there is no self at all.üîΩNor is it the case that the mind of another person is known to be erroneous due to the error of another‚Äôs body,

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te de'i blo dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa med pa nyid kyis lus log tu zin kyang blo log pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te de'i blo dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa med pa nyid kyis lus log tu zin kyang blo log pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if the body is erroneous, the error of the mind is doubted, since the mind of that person is not observed.

original: de @26b ltar ni 'gyur na gal te blo 'gyur na ci'i phyir lus de la rang gi 'bras bu rtsom par mi byed //
analyzed: de @26b ltar ni 'gyur na gal te blo 'gyur na ci'i phyir lus de la rang gi 'bras bu rtsom par mi byed //
translated: If the mind is erroneous, why does it not produce its own effect in that body?

original: rtsom pa med na yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rtsom pa med na yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it does not produce it, it does not exist.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: de ltar na gal te de dang 'brel pa can dus der grub par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de la rtsom par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te de dang 'brel pa can dus der grub par 'gyur ba de'i tshe de la rtsom par 'gyur na /
translated: Thus, if it were to be established at that time as connected with that, then it would produce it.

original: 'di ltar de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa med pas lus rten ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa med pas lus rten ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no certainty of concomitance and reversal in this way, the body is not the basis.

original: de med pa na de gzhan la 'jug pa bkag pa nyid med pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de med pa na de gzhan la 'jug pa bkag pa nyid med pa de ltar na /
translated: When that does not exist, the engagement of another is negated.

original: ji ltar 'chi ba'i lus la de 'bras bu rtsom pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar 'chi ba'i lus la de 'bras bu rtsom pa yin /
translated: In that case, how can the body at death be the beginning of the result?

original: lus dang 'brel pa can nyid yin na yang blo tsam nyid kyis ni smra ba dang / byed pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: lus dang 'brel pa can nyid yin na yang blo tsam nyid kyis ni smra ba dang / byed pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: Even if it is related to the body, mere cognition is not the result of speech, action, and so on.

original: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir rgyu med par nges pa nyid med pa de ltar na ldog pa nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir rgyu med par nges pa nyid med pa de ltar na ldog pa nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Because there is no result, there is no certainty of being without a cause. In that case, there is no certainty of reversal.

original: de ltar na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, because there is no establishment of concomitance and reversal,

original: blo ni lus la brten pa can ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blo ni lus la brten pa can ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: cognition is not based on the body.

original: gang zhig gang gi 'bras bu yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi 'bras bu yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the syllogism ‚ÄúWhatever is the result of that . . .‚Äù and so on, there is no establishment.

original: lus la brten pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: lus la brten pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Through being based on the body,

original: 'ga' zhig tshe na sems rgyun gyi //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tshe na sems rgyun gyi //
translated: at some time, the continuum of mind

original: lus phan 'dogs par byed pa'ang yin bla ste /
analyzed: lus phan 'dogs par byed pa'ang yin bla ste /
translated: It is possible that the body benefits the mind,

original: de ltar na yang de'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid du ma grub pa'i lus ldog pas sems kyi rgyun chad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang de'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu nyid du ma grub pa'i lus ldog pas sems kyi rgyun chad pa ma yin no //
translated: but even so, since the body is not established as the cause of the appropriated aggregates, the continuum of the mind is not severed.

original: ci dang 'dra par zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra par zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: bum sogs las ni me sogs bzhin /üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bum sogs las ni me sogs bzhin / zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is like fire, etc., in relation to a pot, etc.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa la me la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe phan 'dogs par byed pa na /
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa la me la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe phan 'dogs par byed pa na /
translated: For example, when fire, etc., benefits a pot, etc.,

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe /
translated: sometimes it benefits them,

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa tsam gyis /
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa tsam gyis /
translated: but just because it benefits them

original: me la sogs pa log pa na bum pa la sogs ldog pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: me la sogs pa log pa na bum pa la sogs ldog pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: sometimes, when fire, etc., ceases, the pot, etc., do not cease.

original: gtan tshigs de ltar na ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de ltar na ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no //
translated: In that case, the reason is not established.

original: gzhan yang gal te blo'i rgyu lus yin pa de'i tshe shi pa'i gnas kyi rgyur gyur pa'i lus la gnas pa yin na sems de'i 'bras bu ldog med thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te blo'i rgyu lus yin pa de'i tshe shi pa'i gnas kyi rgyur gyur pa'i lus la gnas pa yin na sems de'i 'bras bu ldog med thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if the body is the cause of the mind, then when the body exists as the cause of the state of death, it follows that the result of the mind would be unceasing.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rgyu can yin pa de ni de ma lus pa yod par 'gyur ba'am /üîΩma lus par gnas pan ldog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rgyu can yin pa de ni de ma lus pa yod par 'gyur ba'am / ma lus par gnas pan ldog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is the cause of something, it does not cease to exist without that cause existing or without that cause remaining.

original: dper na rang gi rgyu ma lus pa yod pa'am gnas pa na sgron ma yod pa'am ldog pa med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rang gi rgyu ma lus pa yod pa'am gnas pa na sgron ma yod pa'am ldog pa med pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, as long as the lamp exists or remains, its cause, the wick, does not cease to exist or remain.

original: sems kyang lus kyi rgyu can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //üîΩbsgrub par @27a * //
analyzed: sems kyang lus kyi rgyu can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so // bsgrub par @27a * //
translated: And the mind is the cause of the body. This is a natural inference.

original: bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas khyab par byed par 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas khyab par byed par 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The second thing to be established is the contradictory observation of the pervader.

original: yang na gang zhig gang gi tshe rgyu tshogs pa can yin pa de ni de'i tshe yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gang zhig gang gi tshe rgyu tshogs pa can yin pa de ni de'i tshe yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Or, whatever is the cause of something, it exists when the cause exists.

original: dper na 'ga' zhig gi tshe rgyu tshogs pa can gyi myu gu yod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig gi tshe rgyu tshogs pa can gyi myu gu yod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a sprout exists when the cause of the sprout exists.

original: shi ba'i gnas skabs kyi lus gnas pa yod pa na yang rgyu tshogs pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: shi ba'i gnas skabs kyi lus gnas pa yod pa na yang rgyu tshogs pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the body exists when the cause of the body exists, at the time of death. This is a natural inference.

original: gtan tshigs snga ma ni gson po'i lus sems kyi rgyu yin zhing /
analyzed: gtan tshigs snga ma ni gson po'i lus sems kyi rgyu yin zhing /
translated: The first reason is the cause of the living body and mind.

original: de yod na 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de yod na 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: To say that if it exists, it changes, is to prove what is already established.

original: gal te shi ba'i lus kyi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi don yin pa de'i tshe yang de'i rgyu ma yin pa de ltar na de ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te shi ba'i lus kyi 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi don yin pa de'i tshe yang de'i rgyu ma yin pa de ltar na de ma grub pa yin no //
translated: If the meaning of the reason is that the body of the dead person is the effect of the living body, then it is not the cause of the living body, and so the reason is unestablished.

original: de ltar na dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag ni sems kyi mngon par gsal bar byed pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag ni sems kyi mngon par gsal bar byed pa dag yin no //
translated: Thus, the in-breath and out-breath are the manifestations of the mind.

original: de dag ni shi ba'i lus la yod pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyi phyir gnyis pa yang ma grub pa yin no zhes gzhan dag sems so //
analyzed: de dag ni shi ba'i lus la yod pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs de nyid kyi phyir gnyis pa yang ma grub pa yin no zhes gzhan dag sems so //
translated: Since they are not present in the body of the dead person, the reason is unestablished, say others.

original: gal te sems nyid dbugs 'byung rngub kyi 'bras bu grub na /
analyzed: gal te sems nyid dbugs 'byung rngub kyi 'bras bu grub na /
translated: If the mind itself is established as the effect of the in-breath and out-breath,

original: 'di ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: then this is the case.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar sems ni lus kyi 'bras bu nyid du ma grub pa de ltar dbugs 'byung rngub dag gi 'bras bu nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar sems ni lus kyi 'bras bu nyid du ma grub pa de ltar dbugs 'byung rngub dag gi 'bras bu nyid kyang ngo //
translated: Just as the mind is not the effect of the body, so also the mind is not the effect of the in-breath and the out-breath.

original: gzhan yang bdag nyid kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i 'thad pas sems nyid kyi dbugs 'byung rngub dag gi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag nyid kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i 'thad pas sems nyid kyi dbugs 'byung rngub dag gi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Moreover, the in-breath and the out-breath are the effect of the mind, because of the logical possibility of the mind itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde yod dang zhes bya ba sems nyid yod na dbugs 'byung rngub dag yod pa'i phyir dang / sems la rag las pas de dag 'jug pa de ltar na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de yod dang zhes bya ba sems nyid yod na dbugs 'byung rngub dag yod pa'i phyir dang / sems la rag las pas de dag 'jug pa de ltar na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbang 'gyur phyir /
analyzed: dbang 'gyur phyir /
translated: Because when the mind exists, the in-breath and the out-breath exist, and because the in-breath and the out-breath occur in dependence on the mind.

original: de las 'byung rngub de ma yin /
analyzed: de las 'byung rngub de ma yin /
translated: In that case, the in-breath and the out-breath are not the effect of the mind,

original: sems de las 'byung rngub dag yin gyi de dag las sems de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems de las 'byung rngub dag yin gyi de dag las sems de ni ma yin no //
translated: because the in-breath and the out-breath are the mind, but the mind is not the in-breath and the out-breath.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig sems kyi dbang gis rang gi ngo bor 'jug pa dang / ldog pa de ni sems nyid las 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig sems kyi dbang gis rang gi ngo bor 'jug pa dang / ldog pa de ni sems nyid las 'gyur te /
translated: The application is this: that which occurs and ceases by the power of the mind is the mind itself,

original: dper na 'dod pa sngon du song ba can gyi lag pa'i brkyang bskum lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dod pa sngon du song ba can gyi lag pa'i brkyang bskum lta bu'o //
translated: like the bending and stretching of the arm, which are preceded by a desire to do so.

original: dbugs 'byung rngub dag kyang sems kyi 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa dang ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung rngub dag kyang sems kyi 'dod pa'i dbang gis 'jug pa dang ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The exhalation and inhalation of breath are also engaged and stopped by the power of the mind‚Äôs desire. This is a natural inference.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te //
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te //
translated: It is not unestablished.

original: 'di ltar rlung 'byin pa dang 'dren pa ni 'bad rtsol med par gang las yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar rlung 'byin pa dang 'dren pa ni 'bad rtsol med par gang las yin /
translated: In this way, exhalation and inhalation of breath are not without effort.

original: rlung 'byin pa dang @27b 'dren pa dag las gzhan du dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa nyid gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rlung 'byin pa dang @27b 'dren pa dag las gzhan du dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa nyid gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from exhalation and inhalation of breath, there is no other exhalation and inhalation of breath.

original: nang du 'jug pa'i rlung skyes bu'i byed pas phyi rol du 'byin pa ni 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: nang du 'jug pa'i rlung skyes bu'i byed pas phyi rol du 'byin pa ni 'byung ba'o //
translated: The wind that enters inside is exhaled by the effort of the person.

original: phyi rol du 'jug pa nang du 'dren pa ni rngub pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du 'jug pa nang du 'dren pa ni rngub pa'o //
translated: What enters outside is inhaled.

original: de dag kyang blo'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bad rtsol med par mi 'gyur ba dang de yod na 'gyur ba de ltar na blo sngon du song ba can yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang blo'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'bad rtsol med par mi 'gyur ba dang de yod na 'gyur ba de ltar na blo sngon du song ba can yin no //
translated: Those are not without the characteristic of mind and effort. When that exists, they exist. In that case, they are preceded by mind.

original: sbyor ba ni rlung 'byin pa dang 'dren pa gang yin pa de ni skyes bu'i 'bad rtsol sngon du song ba can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rlung 'byin pa dang 'dren pa gang yin pa de ni skyes bu'i 'bad rtsol sngon du song ba can yin te /
translated: The application is that exhalation and inhalation of the breath are preceded by the exertion of a person.

original: dper na skyes bu'i byed pas sdud pa'i rlung 'byin pa dang 'dren pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu'i byed pas sdud pa'i rlung 'byin pa dang 'dren pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the exhalation and inhalation of the breath that are caused by the activity of a person.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa yang rlung 'byin pa dang 'dren pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa yang rlung 'byin pa dang 'dren pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The exhalation and inhalation of the breath are the exhalation and inhalation of the wind. This is a natural inference.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na 'bad rtsol gyi dbang gis bum pa la sogs pa gnas nas gnas gzhan du bkyed ba dang len par byed pa yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na 'bad rtsol gyi dbang gis bum pa la sogs pa gnas nas gnas gzhan du bkyed ba dang len par byed pa yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were so, then a pot, etc. would be moved from one place to another by the power of exertion and would be taken up.

original: de sngon du song ba can gyi bum pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de sngon du song ba can gyi bum pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: But it is not so that a pot, etc. are preceded by that.

original: gang zhig sems nyid kyi dbang gis shes bya'i sbyor ba la ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig sems nyid kyi dbang gis shes bya'i sbyor ba la ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is not so, but rather that the application of the object of knowledge is uncertain due to the power of the mind itself,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de la yang bkye ba dang len par byed pa 'bad rtsol nyid las 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang bkye ba dang len par byed pa 'bad rtsol nyid las 'gyur ro //
translated: For, in that case, the moving and taking up would be due to exertion itself.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni rang gi nye bar len pa'i rkyen las 'gyur ba yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni rang gi nye bar len pa'i rkyen las 'gyur ba yin pa de ltar na /
translated: The nature of a thing is a transformation of its material cause.

original: skyes bu'i 'bad rtsol las bum pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'bad rtsol las bum pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the nature of a pot, etc., is not established by the exertion of a person.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag gi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyang 'bad rtsol las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag gi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyang 'bad rtsol las 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The nature of the in-breath and the out-breath also arises from exertion.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'dod pa med pa na skyes bus de'i ngo bo nyid bzlog pa med pa de'i phyir nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'dod pa med pa na skyes bus de'i ngo bo nyid bzlog pa med pa de'i phyir nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Sometimes, when there is no desire, the nature of that is not stopped by a person. Therefore, it is not certain.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For that very reason, he says, ‚Äúits nature.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa 'di ci yod par rab tu grags pa can gyi sems nyid dmigs pa'i rgyu la gsal bar byed pa zhes brjod de dper na bum pa'i mar me lta bu'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa 'di ci yod par rab tu grags pa can gyi sems nyid dmigs pa'i rgyu la gsal bar byed pa zhes brjod de dper na bum pa'i mar me lta bu'am /
translated: Moreover, is this in-breath and out-breath the mind itself, which is well known to exist, the cause of perception, and the illuminator, as, for example, a lamp is for a pot?

original: yang na 'jug par byed pa'i phyir yin grang na /
analyzed: yang na 'jug par byed pa'i phyir yin grang na /
translated: Or is it the cause of engagement?

original: de la yod par grags pa can gyi sems nyid dmigs pa'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yod par grags pa can gyi sems nyid dmigs pa'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: The mind that is known to exist is not the cause of the perception of the mind.

original: sngar 'jug pa khas len na yod pa nyid du khas blang bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar 'jug pa khas len na yod pa nyid du khas blang bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you accept that it is engaged, then it follows that it would be accepted as existing.

original: gal te de dag gis sems 'jug pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mngon par gsal ba yin ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de dag gis sems 'jug pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mngon par gsal ba yin ba de'i tshe /
translated: If they are the manifestation of the mind that is characterized by the attainment of engagement,

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag gi 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa @28a * //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag gi 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa @28a * //
translated: then the increase and decrease of the exhalation and inhalation of breath

original: dag gis sems kyang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag gis sems kyang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: would also cause the increase and decrease of the mind.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de dag phul byung 'grib pa las /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de dag phul byung 'grib pa las /
translated: From the decrease of the supreme,

original: phul byung 'grib pa 'thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: phul byung 'grib pa 'thob par 'gyur /
translated: the supreme is attained.

original: 'di ltar dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa de dag 'phel ba dang 'grib pa las sems nyid 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa de dag 'phel ba dang 'grib pa las sems nyid 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the increase and decrease of the exhalation and inhalation of breath cause the increase and decrease of the mind itself.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gis phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa dag tu mi 'gyur ba de ni 'jug pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gsal bya de'i gsal byed ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gis phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa dag tu mi 'gyur ba de ni 'jug pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gsal bya de'i gsal byed ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: that which does not increase or decrease by means of that which increases and decreases is not the clarifier of that which is to be clarified, which is characterized by the attainment of engagement.

original: dper na shing phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa dag gis rgya mtsho chen po phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa rjes su bsgrub pa med par shing gis gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa dag gis rgya mtsho chen po phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa rjes su bsgrub pa med par shing gis gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the great ocean is not clarified by trees which increase and decrease, because it does not follow that the great ocean increases and decreases by means of trees which increase and decrease.

original: sems kyi phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa yang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag gi phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa dag gis 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa yang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag gi phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa dag gis 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The increase and decrease of the mind also do not follow the increase and decrease of inhalation and exhalation. This is the observation of an encompassing contradiction.

original: gzhan yang de dag thal par mtshungs na yang ji ltar shi ba'i gnas skabs kyi lus gnas pa las sems de ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes rgol ba de ltar dbugs 'byung rngub dag kyang ci'i phyir ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag thal par mtshungs na yang ji ltar shi ba'i gnas skabs kyi lus gnas pa las sems de ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes rgol ba de ltar dbugs 'byung rngub dag kyang ci'i phyir ldog par 'gyur /
translated: Why do the inhalation and exhalation of breath cease?

original: gang gis na de med pa'i phyir sems med pa yin /
analyzed: gang gis na de med pa'i phyir sems med pa yin /
translated: Why is there no mind because it does not exist?

original: sems rgyu yin na mtshungs ma yin /
analyzed: sems rgyu yin na mtshungs ma yin /
translated: If the mind is the cause, it is not similar.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na gang gis yang lus ni sems kyi rgyu ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang sems nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na gang gis yang lus ni sems kyi rgyu ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang sems nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If that were so, then the body would not be the cause of the mind, but the mind is the cause of the body.

original: sems kyi rgyu sems nyid yin par khas len par na /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu sems nyid yin par khas len par na /
translated: If you accept that the mind is the cause of the mind,

original: blo rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid yin pas na ci'i phyir lus gnas pa de med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: blo rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid yin pas na ci'i phyir lus gnas pa de med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then since the continuum of the mind is uninterrupted, why would the body not remain without ceasing?

original: rjes su 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi rgyu ma yin na gang gis na rten de nyid la 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug par byed pa nyid kyi rgyu ma yin na gang gis na rten de nyid la 'gyur /
translated: If the mind is not the cause of the body because it does not act to engage the body, then why does the mind remain in that body?

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: rjes su 'jug par byed pa de dang las zhes bya ba ma mthong ba gzhan nas 'phel bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug par byed pa de dang las zhes bya ba ma mthong ba gzhan nas 'phel bar byed pa ni /
translated: The other, the one that engages, is the one that increases the action.

original: gang phyir rgyu ni yin par 'dod //
analyzed: gang phyir rgyu ni yin par 'dod //
translated: The cause is accepted as the cause because it increases.

original: des na 'phen par byed pa'i dbang gis gnas pa'i dus nges pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: des na 'phen par byed pa'i dbang gis gnas pa'i dus nges pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Thus, the duration of the abiding of the world is determined by the power of the projecting cause.

original: de phan chad rab tu 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de phan chad rab tu 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not similar, because it does not continue beyond that.

original: gal te sdong bu la sogs bzhin //
analyzed: gal te sdong bu la sogs bzhin //
translated: If it were like a stick, etc.

original: gang gi tshe sgron ma la sogs pa'i rgyu sdong bu la sogs pa mi mthun par byas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgron ma la sogs pa'i rgyu sdong bu la sogs pa mi mthun par byas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: When the cause of a lamp, etc., is made unfavorable, like a stick, etc.,üîΩit is not the cause of a lamp, etc.

original: sgron ma la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du rlung dang mkhris pa la sogs pa'i /
analyzed: sgron ma la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du rlung dang mkhris pa la sogs pa'i /
translated: In the same way, the body is not the cause of the humors, wind, bile, and phlegm, etc.,

original: nyes pa nus med lus @28b rgyu min //
analyzed: nyes pa nus med lus @28b rgyu min //
translated: when they are not capable of causing illness.

original: dbugs 'byung rngub dang sems dag gis ma yin no //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung rngub dang sems dag gis ma yin no //
translated: It is not the cause of inhalation and exhalation, or of the mind.

original: des na gang zhig gang rgyu tshogs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la ma grub pa yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: des na gang zhig gang rgyu tshogs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la ma grub pa yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, when you maintain that the syllogism, ‚ÄúWhatever is a collection of causes of something is not a non-producer of that, as for example, a collection of causes of a sprout, and a collection of causes of a dead body is a collection of causes of a body, ‚Äù is not established,

original: shi ba'i lus la nyes pa nyams 'gyur tshe /
analyzed: shi ba'i lus la nyes pa nyams 'gyur tshe /
translated: then at the time of the fault of the dead body,

original: rims dang dug la sogs pa'i nyes pa log pa na yang lus ma tshang ba med pa can nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: rims dang dug la sogs pa'i nyes pa log pa na yang lus ma tshang ba med pa can nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: even when the fault of fever, poison, etc. is removed, the body is not complete.

original: sems yod pas /
analyzed: sems yod pas /
translated: Since the mind exists,

original: phyir yang skye ba dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: phyir yang skye ba dag tu 'gyur //
translated: it will arise again in other births.

original: na mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It will not.

original: de bas na nyes pa med pa'i phyir nyes pa thag nye ba tsam gyis sems kyi 'jug pa gags byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na nyes pa med pa'i phyir nyes pa thag nye ba tsam gyis sems kyi 'jug pa gags byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because there is no fault, the mere proximity of the fault does not block the operation of the mind.

original: sbyor pa ni gang zhig gang zhig pa na yang mi 'gyur ba de ni de thag nye ba tsam la rag las pas 'jug pa can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor pa ni gang zhig gang zhig pa na yang mi 'gyur ba de ni de thag nye ba tsam la rag las pas 'jug pa can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: The syllogism is, ‚ÄúWhatever is not a non-producer of something, even when it is not proximate to that, does not operate in dependence on mere proximity to that,

original: dper na bum pa med na yang me ldog ma med pa ltar bya'o//
analyzed: dper na bum pa med na yang me ldog ma med pa ltar bya'o//
translated: just as, for example, fire is not blocked when a pot is not present. ‚Äù

original: rims dang dug la sogs pas 'chi ba'i sems kyang nyes pa 'khrugs pa'i ngo bo can gyi nad med pa na yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rims dang dug la sogs pas 'chi ba'i sems kyang nyes pa 'khrugs pa'i ngo bo can gyi nad med pa na yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The mind of one who dies from fever, poison, etc. is not of the nature of a fault, and it does not cease when the disease is cured. This is the observation of an inconsistency with the pervader.

original: gal te shing 'gyur pa'i rgyu me ni ldog na yang mes byas pa'i shing gi 'gyur ba sol pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can yang shing gi ngo bo thob pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: gal te shing 'gyur pa'i rgyu me ni ldog na yang mes byas pa'i shing gi 'gyur ba sol pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can yang shing gi ngo bo thob pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Even when the fire that is the cause of the transformation of wood ceases, the transformation of the wood, which is produced by fire and is characterized by ashes, etc., does not obtain the nature of wood.

original: shing gi 'gyur ba mi ldog cing //
analyzed: shing gi 'gyur ba mi ldog cing //
translated: The transformation of wood does not cease.

original: sems 'gyur ba'i rgyur rims la sogs pa log na yang /
analyzed: sems 'gyur ba'i rgyur rims la sogs pa log na yang /
translated: Even when the fever, etc. that are the cause of the transformation of the mind cease,

original: shi ba'i lus kyi gnas skabs na sems ldog pa ni med ce na /
analyzed: shi ba'i lus kyi gnas skabs na sems ldog pa ni med ce na /
translated: the mind does not cease in the state of the dead body.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni 'das ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni 'das ma thag pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du dogs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, he suspects that the immediately preceding reason is uncertain.

original: ma yin gso sbyor yod phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin gso sbyor yod phyir ro //
translated: No, because there is a remedy.

original: zhes bya bas ni lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: This is the reply.

original: skyon de yod pa ma yin te gso ba'i sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon de yod pa ma yin te gso ba'i sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That fault does not exist because there is a remedy.

original: dgos pa ni gal te shing gi 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar rims la sogs pas byas pa'i lus kyi 'gyur ba shin tu ldog pa med par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /üîΩji ltar mes shing gi 'gyur ba nyung zad byas su zin kyang ldog pa med pa de ltar rims la sogs pa dag gis nyung zad byas pa yang ldog par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na ni rims la sogs pa'i gso ba byed par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: dgos pa ni gal te shing gi 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar rims la sogs pas byas pa'i lus kyi 'gyur ba shin tu ldog pa med par 'gyur ba de'i tshe / ji ltar mes shing gi 'gyur ba nyung zad byas su zin kyang ldog pa med pa de ltar rims la sogs pa dag gis nyung zad byas pa yang ldog par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na ni rims la sogs pa'i gso ba byed par mi 'gyur na /
translated: The purpose is this: If the transformation of the body created by fever and so on were absolutely irreversible, just like the transformation of wood,üîΩthen just as fire creates a transformation of wood that is absolutely irreversible, even a little bit, so fever and so on would create a transformation that is absolutely irreversible, even a little bit, and in that case, it would be impossible to treat fever and so on.

original: gso ba yang byed pa de'i phyir rims la sogs pa ni yang mi 'gyur ba can gyi 'gyur ba rtsom pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: gso ba yang byed pa de'i phyir rims la sogs pa ni yang mi 'gyur ba can gyi 'gyur ba rtsom pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: But since it is possible to treat fever and so on, fever and so on do not create a transformation that is absolutely irreversible.

original: don 'di nyid ni yang mi @29a 'byung phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed de /
analyzed: don 'di nyid ni yang mi @29a 'byung phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed de /
translated: This point is presented by ‚ÄúBecause it does not arise again, some say‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: yang mi 'byung phyir la la la //üîΩrnam par 'gyur ba bya ba la //
analyzed: yang mi 'byung phyir la la la // rnam par 'gyur ba bya ba la //
translated: Because it does not arise again, some sayüîΩThat it creates a transformation

original: 'gyur ba cung zad skyed pa byed //
analyzed: 'gyur ba cung zad skyed pa byed //
translated: That generates a little transformation

original: cung zhig bzlog pa yin phyir dper //
analyzed: cung zhig bzlog pa yin phyir dper //
translated: Because it stops a little bit, like fire.

original: shing dang gser la me lta bu'o //
analyzed: shing dang gser la me lta bu'o //
translated: like fire in regard to wood and gold.

original: dper na shing 'gyur bar byas pa la 'gyur ba'i rgyu me yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing 'gyur bar byas pa la 'gyur ba'i rgyu me yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, fire is the cause of the transformation of wood.

original: 'gyur ba cung zad skyed pa zlog pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba cung zad skyed pa zlog pa ste /
translated: The transformation of a thing is the cessation of a previous state and the arising of another state.

original: yang 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir gser gyi 'gyur ba'i rgyu me nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir gser gyi 'gyur ba'i rgyu me nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: Fire is the cause of the transformation of gold, because the gold can revert to its former state.

original: de ltar na gser zhu bar gyur kyang yang sra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gser zhu bar gyur kyang yang sra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even though gold is melted, it can revert to its former state.

original: dang po'i chung yang ldog pa min //üîΩphyir ldog rung ba 'gyur byas gang //
analyzed: dang po'i chung yang ldog pa min // phyir ldog rung ba 'gyur byas gang //
translated: But the first transformation of wood is not reversible.

original: de ni yang 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is transformed and can revert is not transformed again.

original: mes byas pa'i shing gi 'gyur ba dang po'i tshig pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'gyur ba chung yang phyir mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mes byas pa'i shing gi 'gyur ba dang po'i tshig pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'gyur ba chung yang phyir mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The transformation of wood that is produced by fire is not reversible, even though it is slight, having the characteristic of being merely burned.

original: phyir ldog tu rung bar byas pa gang yin pa'i chung na yang 'gyur ba de ni yang 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: phyir ldog tu rung bar byas pa gang yin pa'i chung na yang 'gyur ba de ni yang 'byung ba yin te /
translated: But that which is transformed and can revert, even though slight, is transformed again,

original: snga ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: because it reverts to its former nature.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gser gyi sra ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: gser gyi sra ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: like the hardness of gold.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las 'gyur ba byas pa gso bar byed pa de ni de la yang mi 'byung ba 'gyur ba rtsom par gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las 'gyur ba byas pa gso bar byed pa de ni de la yang mi 'byung ba 'gyur ba rtsom par gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: that which is restored by the one who has made a change from something is not the one who has begun the change that does not occur again,

original: dper na gser la me lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gser la me lta bu'o //
translated: like fire in gold.

original: lus la rims la sogs pas byas pa'i 'gyur ba yang gso bar byed do zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lus la rims la sogs pas byas pa'i 'gyur ba yang gso bar byed do zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúA change made by fever, etc., in the body is restored,‚Äù is the observation of a contradiction in the making of a distinction.

original: gang zhig gang la yang 'byung ba can gyi 'gyur ba rtsom pa gang yin pa de ni de la rang dang bel ba'i dus tsam du 'byung ba tsam gyis 'gyur ba rtsom pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la yang 'byung ba can gyi 'gyur ba rtsom pa gang yin pa de ni de la rang dang bel ba'i dus tsam du 'byung ba tsam gyis 'gyur ba rtsom pa yin te /
translated: The one who begins a change that occurs in something is the one who begins the change by the mere occurrence of the time of his connection with it,

original: dper na gser la me nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gser la me nyid lta bu'o //
translated: like fire in gold.

original: lus la nad kyang yang 'byung ba can gyi 'gyur ba rtsom pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: lus la nad kyang yang 'byung ba can gyi 'gyur ba rtsom pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúA change that occurs in the body is begun by a disease,‚Äù is a natural inference.

original: gal te yang mi 'gyur ba rtsom pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang mi 'gyur ba rtsom pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: If you say that it is not so, and that the proof of the non-production of the unchangeable is a proof of the established,

original: gzhan du gyur pa na yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa na yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it occurs even when there is transformation,

original: ma yin te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'byung ba'i rang bzhin tsam las yang 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can de nyid kyi tshe yod pa'am /
analyzed: ma yin te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro // 'byung ba'i rang bzhin tsam las yang 'byung ba'i ngang tshul can de nyid kyi tshe yod pa'am /
translated: that is not so, because there is no difference.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it exists at the time of the mere nature of occurrence, or that it does not exist at any time.

original: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin las ma 'phos pa'i gyur pa'i khyad par ni mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin las ma 'phos pa'i gyur pa'i khyad par ni mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that the nature of the self of occurrence is transformed into a different state without moving from it.

original: gal te 'di ltar des byas pa'i 'gyur ba chung ba'i phyir log tu rung ba de yin pa ltar na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar des byas pa'i 'gyur ba chung ba'i phyir log tu rung ba de yin pa ltar na /
translated: If it is tenable that it is reversed because the transformation produced by it is small,

original: yang @29b 'byung ba'i 'gyur ba rtsom par byed pas thams cad phyir ldog tu rung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: yang @29b 'byung ba'i 'gyur ba rtsom par byed pas thams cad phyir ldog tu rung ba de'i tshe /
translated: then at the time of the occurrence of the transformation of production, it is tenable that everything is reversed.

original: nad 'ga' zhig gso bar bya ba ma yin ba nyid med pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: nad 'ga' zhig gso bar bya ba ma yin ba nyid med pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Then it would follow that there is no disease that cannot be cured.

original: de ni de ltar yin mod kyi 'on kyang cung zad gso ba min pa'i nyes pa'i rigs brjod cing bstan pa gang yin pa de yang dag byed nyid dka' phyir ram /
analyzed: de ni de ltar yin mod kyi 'on kyang cung zad gso ba min pa'i nyes pa'i rigs brjod cing bstan pa gang yin pa de yang dag byed nyid dka' phyir ram /
translated: That is so, but it is also said that it is not to be cured because the type of fault that is not cured is difficult to cure,

original: nyes pa de spong ba'i rgyu bcud kyis len la sogs pa rnyed dka' ba nyid kyi rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa de spong ba'i rgyu bcud kyis len la sogs pa rnyed dka' ba nyid kyi rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: or because the cause of the elixir and so on that abandons that fault is difficult to obtain.

original: tshe zad phyir te /
analyzed: tshe zad phyir te /
translated: Because life is exhausted.

original: sngon bya ba'i las kyi nus pa yongs su zad pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir gso bar bya ba ma yin par brjod do //
analyzed: sngon bya ba'i las kyi nus pa yongs su zad pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir gso bar bya ba ma yin par brjod do //
translated: It is said that it is not to be cured because it is characterized by the complete exhaustion of the potency of previous karma.

original: de ltar na las kyi nus pa las skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid can du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na las kyi nus pa las skad cig ma phyi ma phyi ma mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid can du gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it endures as the characteristic of the connection of subsequent moments from the potency of karma.

original: de'i nus pa zad pas rgyu med pa'i phyir skad cig ma phyi ma mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can 'jig pa de ltar na gso ba yod na yang gso bar bya ba nyid ma yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i nus pa zad pas rgyu med pa'i phyir skad cig ma phyi ma mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can 'jig pa de ltar na gso ba yod na yang gso bar bya ba nyid ma yin par brjod do //
translated: Since that potency is exhausted, there is no cause for the connection of subsequent moments. It is said that it is not to be cured because it is characterized by the absence of the connection of subsequent moments.

original: gang gis yang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu cung zhig kyang ma mthong ba med cing gang gi nus pa yongs su zad pa las sems mi gnas par 'gyur ba de'i rlung dang mkhris pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis nyes pa 'ba' zhig 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas nyes pa
analyzed: gang gis yang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu cung zhig kyang ma mthong ba med cing gang gi nus pa yongs su zad pa las sems mi gnas par 'gyur ba de'i rlung dang mkhris pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis nyes pa 'ba' zhig 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas nyes pa
translated: Therefore, the cause of the mind‚Äôs cessation is only a fault, such as wind or bile.

original: ni 'ba' zhig 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin na de'i gnyen po bstan pa na gso bya nad med ma yin no //
analyzed: ni 'ba' zhig 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin na de'i gnyen po bstan pa na gso bya nad med ma yin no //
translated: If the cause of the mind‚Äôs cessation is only a fault, then when the antidote to that fault is taught, the mind is not cured.

original: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: This is merely an illustration.

original: nyes pa mtshungs pa gnyen po bsten pa can dag las /
analyzed: nyes pa mtshungs pa gnyen po bsten pa can dag las /
translated: The mind is cured by relying on the antidote to a fault that is similar to the fault.

original: gcig ni yun ring po gzhan du yun mi ring ba nas nad med pa thob par 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: gcig ni yun ring po gzhan du yun mi ring ba nas nad med pa thob par 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: One of these minds is cured of the fault after a long time, and the other is cured after a short time.

original: de lta bu la sogs pas ni khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pas ni khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the mind is cured of the fault by relying on the antidote to the fault.üîΩIn this way, the mind is cured of the fault by relying on the antidote to the fault.

original: rgyu ma mthong ba ni bdag las gcig la de 'dra ba'i rnam pa can gyi las yod pa gang gis sdug bsngal nyams su myong nas rang bzhin du gnas pa thob par 'gyur ba de ltar na kha na ma tho ba med do //
analyzed: rgyu ma mthong ba ni bdag las gcig la de 'dra ba'i rnam pa can gyi las yod pa gang gis sdug bsngal nyams su myong nas rang bzhin du gnas pa thob par 'gyur ba de ltar na kha na ma tho ba med do //
translated: The non-perception of a cause is the absence of a fault in the case of someone who, having experienced suffering due to a karma of that sort in one life, attains a natural state in another life.

original: de ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyang sems can rnams la phan pa dang / gnod pa sgrub par byed pa'i las kyi bdag po nyid las /
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyang sems can rnams la phan pa dang / gnod pa sgrub par byed pa'i las kyi bdag po nyid las /
translated: Thus, external things also are causes of the increase and decrease of the welfare and harm of sentient beings, due to the karma of sentient beings.

original: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang / de bzhin du 'jig pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshungs pa dag la yang rgyun yun ring thung du gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa la sogs pa la yang khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang / de bzhin du 'jig pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshungs pa dag la yang rgyun yun ring thung du gnas pa dang / 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa la sogs pa la yang khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: And in the same way, one should understand that the causes of the destruction, etc., of the world are similar.

original: gang yang rgyu mthong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang yang rgyu mthong ba de'i tshe /
translated: And when one perceives a cause,

original: shi ba'i lus la yang dug sogs ldog @30a * //
analyzed: shi ba'i lus la yang dug sogs ldog @30a * //
translated: poison, etc., is averted even in a dead body.

original: phyir ram / sogs pa'i sgra smos pas rigs la sogs pa ldog pa'o //
analyzed: phyir ram / sogs pa'i sgra smos pas rigs la sogs pa ldog pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù indicates that the poison, etc., is averted in the case of one‚Äôs own family, etc.

original: de'i sos zin bcad pa las kyang lus la khyab par byed pa'i dug skyes bu shi ba na sos zin pa'i gnas gang yin par yang 'dus par 'gyur ba de bcad pa na skyes bu 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i sos zin bcad pa las kyang lus la khyab par byed pa'i dug skyes bu shi ba na sos zin pa'i gnas gang yin par yang 'dus par 'gyur ba de bcad pa na skyes bu 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And when the poison that had spread throughout the body is removed from the place where it had collected, the man lives.

original: skyes bu gnyi ga yang sbrul gcig bzung bdag gi sos zin pa mtshungs par bcad pa las kyang ji ltar gcig 'chi ba de ltar gzhan yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu gnyi ga yang sbrul gcig bzung bdag gi sos zin pa mtshungs par bcad pa las kyang ji ltar gcig 'chi ba de ltar gzhan yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And when the two men, who are both bitten by the same snake, cut off the bite at the same time, one dies and the other lives.

original: kyang gi sgras ni gnyen po la sogs pa'i sbyor ba las kyang ngo //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni gnyen po la sogs pa'i sbyor ba las kyang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that the same thing happens when the antidote is applied.

original: 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang bral bas na /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang bral bas na /
translated: Since the cause of the change is removed,

original: de ci slar yang 'tsho mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de ci slar yang 'tsho mi 'gyur /
translated: why does he not live again?

original: de yang 'tsho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang 'tsho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he lives again.

original: kho bo'i ni 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshungs pa dang de'i gnyen po mtshungs kyang las zad pa'i phyir bzung ba gcig nyid 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kho bo'i ni 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshungs pa dang de'i gnyen po mtshungs kyang las zad pa'i phyir bzung ba gcig nyid 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: But in my view, although the cause of the change is the same and the antidote is the same, one of the men bitten dies because his action is exhausted.

original: de nyid la de shes pas dus su bzung ba zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid la de shes pas dus su bzung ba zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Since he knows that, he shows that the bite was timely.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na gal te dus gzhan du 'tsho ba'i phyir mi 'dod pa ma yin no zhe na /üîΩ'di la ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i rgyu tshogs pas de las gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na gal te dus gzhan du 'tsho ba'i phyir mi 'dod pa ma yin no zhe na / 'di la ji ltar yongs su mthong ba'i rgyu tshogs pas de las gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: If it were so, then if it is not accepted that it does not live at another time,

original: de nyid kyi tshe ci'i phyir mi 'tsho zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe ci'i phyir mi 'tsho zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: then why does it not live at that time, since the collection of causes that are seen to be complete are not dependent on anything else?

original: gal te 'tsho ba ni gyur pa la ltos pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'tsho ba ni gyur pa la ltos pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that living is dependent on transformation,

original: ma yin te de nyid ni gyur pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: ma yin te de nyid ni gyur pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: then that is not so, because transformation is not tenable.

original: chos can las chos tha dad pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: chos can las chos tha dad pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because the property is different from the basis of the property,

original: tha dad na yang gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad na yang gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: or, if it is different, it is not transformation.

original: gzhan yang gyur pa yang ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang gyur pa yang ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because transformation is not dependent,

original: ci'i phyir thams cad nyid du mi 'gyur rtag pa'i ngo bo ni 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang ltos pa med pa yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: ci'i phyir thams cad nyid du mi 'gyur rtag pa'i ngo bo ni 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang ltos pa med pa yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: why would it not transform at all times? It has been explained that the nature of the permanent is not dependent on anything.

original: rang bzhin yod pa tsam du gyur pa ni dus gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa tsam du gyur pa ni dus gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin no //
translated: And it has been explained that the mere existence of an intrinsic reality is not dependent on another time.

original: ci ste nad la sogs pa dag gis ma tshang bar byas pa can gyi lus las mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste nad la sogs pa dag gis ma tshang bar byas pa can gyi lus las mngon par gsal ba ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the body is not manifest because it is incomplete due to illness and so on,

original: rtag tu mngon par mi gsal ba'am /üîΩde nyid kyi tshe khyad par med pa'i phyir gyur pa dang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu mngon par mi gsal ba'am / de nyid kyi tshe khyad par med pa'i phyir gyur pa dang gsal ba yin no //
translated: then it would always be unmanifest.üîΩOr, if it is manifest at that time, then it would be manifest and unmanifest at the same time, because there would be no difference.

original: gzhan yang gang de gyur pa de snga ma de nyid yin nam 'on te gzhan yin gzhan nyid yin na ni snga ma'i rang bzhin btang bas 'byung ba rnams rgyun 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang de gyur pa de snga ma de nyid yin nam 'on te gzhan yin gzhan nyid yin na ni snga ma'i rang bzhin btang bas 'byung ba rnams rgyun 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if that which is transformed is the same as the prior state, then the elements would be interrupted, because the prior nature would be relinquished.

original: gzhan nyid ma yin na ni de nyid du gnas pa 'byung ba rnams cung zhig kyang skyes pa @30b med pa de ltar na khyad par med pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ma yin na ni de nyid du gnas pa 'byung ba rnams cung zhig kyang skyes pa @30b med pa de ltar na khyad par med pa yin no //
translated: If it is not different, then the elements would not arise in the slightest, because they would remain the same.

original: gzhan nyid yin na de kho na nyid gzhan du yang 'gyur la chos ni de dang 'brel bar yang 'thad par dka' ba yin te zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na de kho na nyid gzhan du yang 'gyur la chos ni de dang 'brel bar yang 'thad par dka' ba yin te zhar la 'ongs pas chog go //
translated: If it is different, then the elements would be transformed into something else, and it would be difficult to establish that a phenomenon is related to that.

original: de bas na sems gzhan dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni rgyu mtshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na sems gzhan dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni rgyu mtshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since the mind does not link with another mind, it is not tenable that the mind is the cause of the elements.

original: 'byung ba rnams rgyu nyid yin nga dang sems dang lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir dang / de yod na yod pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir mi rigs so zhes bstan zin to //
