analyzed: 'byung ba rnams rgyu nyid yin nga dang sems dang lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir dang / de yod na yod pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir mi rigs so zhes bstan zin to //
translated: We have already explained that it is not tenable that the elements are the cause of the mind, because the elements exist without a cause and because they exist simultaneously with the mind.

original: gzhan yang phan 'dogs par byed pa zhes bya ba de log pas phan gdags par bya ba rgyun chad pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang phan 'dogs par byed pa zhes bya ba de log pas phan gdags par bya ba rgyun chad pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the cessation of the so-called benefactor does not cause the cessation of the beneficiary.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: nye bar len par gyur pa nyid log pas ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len par gyur pa nyid log pas ldog pa yin no //
translated: The cessation of the beneficiary is caused by the cessation of the appropriated aggregates.

original: de la nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa can dag gi chos ni /üîΩnyer len 'gyur ba med par ni //
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa can dag gi chos ni / nyer len 'gyur ba med par ni //
translated: The characteristics of the appropriated aggregates and the appropriator are as follows:üîΩThe appropriator cannot causeüîΩthe appropriated to change without changing itself.üîΩThe appropriator cannot cause the appropriated to change without changing itself.

original: nyer len can gyi 'gyur ba dag / byed par mi nus pa gang yin pa 'di yin mod kyi 'on kyang nye bar len pa can 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa gang yin pa des /
analyzed: nyer len can gyi 'gyur ba dag / byed par mi nus pa gang yin pa 'di yin mod kyi 'on kyang nye bar len pa can 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa gang yin pa des /
translated: However, the appropriator is not the cause of the appropriated.

original: de'i nye bar lon pa'i 'gyur ba thob pa nyid kyis de 'gyur bar byed kyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i nye bar lon pa'i 'gyur ba thob pa nyid kyis de 'gyur bar byed kyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the very fact of its being appropriated that causes it to change, and not in any other way.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: In what way?

original: dper 'ji ba /
analyzed: dper 'ji ba /
translated: For example, like clay,

original: 'gyur ba med par bum sogs bzhin //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med par bum sogs bzhin //
translated: like a pot, etc., without change.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs su bkod pa can 'ji ba'i bdag nyid can gyi bum pa la sogs pa'i nye bar len par gyur pa 'gyur ba med par bum pa la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba byed par mi nus pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs su bkod pa can 'ji ba'i bdag nyid can gyi bum pa la sogs pa'i nye bar len par gyur pa 'gyur ba med par bum pa la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba byed par mi nus pa lta bu'am /
translated: Clay, which has the nature of a pot, etc., when arranged in the shape of a pot, etc., cannot cause the change of a pot, etc., without changing itself.

original: dper na 'od kyi nye bar len par gyur pa sgron ma nus pa med par ma byas par 'od rnam pa gzhan du byed par mi nus pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'od kyi nye bar len par gyur pa sgron ma nus pa med par ma byas par 'od rnam pa gzhan du byed par mi nus pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like a lamp, which cannot cause the change of light in any other way without making the light‚Äôs appropriation ineffective.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gis nye bar len pa yin pa de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gis nye bar len pa yin pa de /
translated: The argument is this: Whatever is the appropriation of something

original: 'gyur ba med par de'i 'gyur ba byed par mi nus te /üîΩdper na 'ji ba 'gyur ba med par bum pa'am /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med par de'i 'gyur ba byed par mi nus te / dper na 'ji ba 'gyur ba med par bum pa'am /
translated: cannot cause the change of that without changing itself.üîΩFor example, clay, without changing, cannot cause the change of a pot,

original: sgron ma 'gyur ba med par 'od lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgron ma 'gyur ba med par 'od lta bu'o //
translated: or a lamp, without changing, cannot cause the change of light.

original: lus kyang sems kyi nye bar len pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyang sems kyi nye bar len pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of the contradiction of the pervader.

original: sbrul la sogs pas kyang mar me nus pa med par byas pa nyid kyis 'od mi gsal bar byed pa de ltar na /
analyzed: sbrul la sogs pas kyang mar me nus pa med par byas pa nyid kyis 'od mi gsal bar byed pa de ltar na /
translated: A snake, etc., also makes the light of a lamp dim by its powerlessness.

original: de bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not that it is devoid of the property to be established.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na chu la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba las s'a lu la sogs pa 'gyur ba 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na chu la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba las s'a lu la sogs pa 'gyur ba 'byung mod kyi /
translated: If it were so, then the transformation of rice, etc., would occur from the transformation of water, etc.

original: chu la sogs pa nye bar len @31a * //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa nye bar len @31a * //
translated: But water, etc., are not the appropriated of rice, etc.

original: pa ma yin pa de ltar na ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: pa ma yin pa de ltar na ma nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus, it is not inconclusive.

original: de la chu la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa phan 'dogs par byed pa 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: de la chu la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa phan 'dogs par byed pa 'byung ba'am /
translated: In this regard, the transformation of rice, etc., occurs from the arising of water, etc., which are cooperative conditions that assist it.üîΩOr, the activity of water, etc., which is the special quality of color, etc., arises or ceases from the arising or cessation of the transformation of rice, etc.

original: yongs su nyams pa las de'i bya ba kha dog la sogs pa'i khyad par 'byung ba'am ldog par 'gyur na rgyun nyid skye ba'am 'chad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa las de'i bya ba kha dog la sogs pa'i khyad par 'byung ba'am ldog par 'gyur na rgyun nyid skye ba'am 'chad pa ma yin no //
translated: But the continuum itself does not arise or cease.

original: me la sogs pa dag gis ni nye bar len pa 'joms par byed pa de ltar na rgyun chad pa yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: me la sogs pa dag gis ni nye bar len pa 'joms par byed pa de ltar na rgyun chad pa yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Fire and so on do not destroy the appropriated aggregates, because they are not the cause of the cessation of the continuum of the aggregates.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: dngos gang 'gyur ba med par ni //üîΩdngos po gang zhig rnam 'gyur ba //
analyzed: dngos gang 'gyur ba med par ni // dngos po gang zhig rnam 'gyur ba //
translated: That which is not transformed into something elseüîΩis not the appropriator of that which is transformed.

original: dngos po de rnam par 'gyur ba de'i nyer len mi rigs so //
analyzed: dngos po de rnam par 'gyur ba de'i nyer len mi rigs so //
translated: It is not tenable that that which is not transformed into something else is the appropriator of that which is transformed.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: In what way?

original: ba lang ba men la sogs bzhin //
analyzed: ba lang ba men la sogs bzhin //
translated: Like a cow is not the appropriator of a gayal and so on.

original: ba lang nyid 'gyur ba med par ba men la sogs pa 'gyur ba de ltar na ba men la sogs pa dag gis ba lang nye bar len pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba lang nyid 'gyur ba med par ba men la sogs pa 'gyur ba de ltar na ba men la sogs pa dag gis ba lang nye bar len pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: Just as a cow that is not transformed into something else is not the appropriator of a gayal and so on, which are transformed,

original: sogs pa smos pas ni gang zhig gang 'gyur ba med par 'gyur bar byas pa de ni de'i nye bar len pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni gang zhig gang 'gyur ba med par 'gyur bar byas pa de ni de'i nye bar len pa ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicates that that which is not transformed into something else is not the appropriator of that which is transformed.

original: dper na chu la sogs pa 'gyur ba med par me 'gyur bar byas pa can gyi chu nye bar len pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chu la sogs pa 'gyur ba med par me 'gyur bar byas pa can gyi chu nye bar len pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, water that is not transformed into something else is not the appropriator of fire, which is transformed.

original: sems dang lus kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sems dang lus kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the mind and the body.

original: 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa spyod pa la sogs pas yid mi bde ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gyur ba skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa spyod pa la sogs pas yid mi bde ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gyur ba skyed pa yin no //
translated: The mind and the body are the basis of the feeling of pleasure, etc. , because they are the basis of the feeling of pleasure, etc. , which is produced by the experience of the desirable, etc.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang 'gyur ba med par 'gyur ba thob par nus pa can de ni de'i tshe nye bar len pa'i rgyu can ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang 'gyur ba med par 'gyur ba thob par nus pa can de ni de'i tshe nye bar len pa'i rgyu can ma yin te /
translated: The application is as follows: When a certain thing is capable of producing a change without a change in itself, then it is not the cause of the appropriation of that change.

original: dper na chu la sogs pa 'gyur ba med par me 'gyur ba skye ba can lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chu la sogs pa 'gyur ba med par me 'gyur ba skye ba can lta bu'o //
translated: For example, water, etc. , are not the cause of the appropriation of the change of fire, because they are not changed by the production of the change of fire.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang lus 'gyur ba med par 'gyur ba skyed par nus pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang lus 'gyur ba med par 'gyur ba skyed par nus pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The mind is capable of producing a change in the body without a change in itself. This is the observation of an inconsistency with a pervasion.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na gang dag lhan cig gnas par nges pa de dag ni nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa can yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na gang dag lhan cig gnas par nges pa de dag ni nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa can yin te /
translated: The following is the pervasion: Those things that are necessarily simultaneous are the appropriator and the appropriated.

original: dper na sgron ma dang 'od lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgron ma dang 'od lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a lamp and its light.

original: lus dang sems dag la yang lhan cig gnas pa'i nges pa yod do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ltar 'chos pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang sems dag la yang lhan cig gnas pa'i nges pa yod do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ltar 'chos pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThere is a rule that the body and mind exist together‚Äù is a fabrication, like the argument from nature.

original: tshad ma'i lan yin par sems so //
analyzed: tshad ma'i lan yin par sems so //
translated: We think that this is the reply of the logicians.

original: de ni rgyu tha dad med lhan cig gnas zhes bya ba der /
analyzed: de ni rgyu tha dad med lhan cig gnas zhes bya ba der /
translated: In the statement ‚ÄúThere is no separate cause for their coexistence,‚Äù

original: dbang po bzhin dang gzugs dang ro bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang po bzhin dang gzugs dang ro bzhin no //
translated: the example is like the sense faculties and like form and taste.

original: 'byung ba bzhin dang tshe bzhin du ma nges pa yang @31b bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhin dang tshe bzhin du ma nges pa yang @31b bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that the example of the elements and life force is inconclusive.

original: 'dir yang ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: Here, too, it is inconclusive.

original: de rgyu can 'bras skyed pa ni lus kyi rgyu can nur nur po la sogs pa'i ming can phyi ma phyi ma'i lus kyi gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu skyed pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa lhan cig byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de rgyu can 'bras skyed pa ni lus kyi rgyu can nur nur po la sogs pa'i ming can phyi ma phyi ma'i lus kyi gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'bras bu skyed pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa lhan cig byed pa yin no //
translated: The mental consciousness that is the cause of the body, which is the result, is the cooperative cause of the body that is the result, which is characterized by the successive stages of the embryo, such as the kalala, and so on.

original: de med par lus snga ma snga ma dbang po dang bcas pa phyi ma de 'dra ba'i mtshams sbyor ba mi nus pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de med par lus snga ma snga ma dbang po dang bcas pa phyi ma de 'dra ba'i mtshams sbyor ba mi nus pa de ltar na /
translated: Without that mental consciousness, the prior body, together with its sense faculties, is incapable of linking with the subsequent body.

original: lhan cig byed phyir lus dang yid kyi rnam pa shes pa dag lhan cig gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed phyir lus dang yid kyi rnam pa shes pa dag lhan cig gnas pa yin te /
translated: Because they are coexistent causes, the body and mental consciousness are coexistent bases.üîΩ

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lus nye bar len pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lus nye bar len pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body and mental faculty are the simultaneous support of the mental consciousness, because the mental consciousness does not appropriate a body.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is the similarity?

original: me dang zangs ma'i zhu nyid bzhin //
analyzed: me dang zangs ma'i zhu nyid bzhin //
translated: Like the melted and the liquid.

original: dper na zangs ma zhu ba nyid kyi zangs ma nyid nye bar len pa yin pa de lta na yang zhu ba'i gnas skabs na me lhan cig byed pa nyid yin pas nam nges pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na zangs ma zhu ba nyid kyi zangs ma nyid nye bar len pa yin pa de lta na yang zhu ba'i gnas skabs na me lhan cig byed pa nyid yin pas nam nges pa yin no //
translated: For example, the melted state of copper is the appropriator of the copper itself, but the fire is the simultaneous support of the melted state.

original: gal te lhan cig gnas pa'i nges pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir me ni nye bar len pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lhan cig gnas pa'i nges pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir me ni nye bar len pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that fire is not the appropriator of copper because the state of being a simultaneous support does not exist in all cases,

original: lus dang sems dag la yang de skad du sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: lus dang sems dag la yang de skad du sngar bshad zin to //
translated: we have already explained that the same applies to the body and mind.

original: de de ltar na lus dang sems dag la rten dang brten pa can gyi ngo bo yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de de ltar na lus dang sems dag la rten dang brten pa can gyi ngo bo yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus the body and mind do not have the nature of support and supported.

original: 'dis kyang sems nyid dam yon tan dang spyi la sogs pa gzhan gyi rten nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis kyang sems nyid dam yon tan dang spyi la sogs pa gzhan gyi rten nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This also shows that the mind itself, or the qualities, or the universal, etc., do not exist as the basis of anything.

original: yod med dag rten med phyir ro //
analyzed: yod med dag rten med phyir ro //
translated: Because existence and nonexistence have no basis.

original: yod pa'am med pa 'ga' zhig rten du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: yod pa'am med pa 'ga' zhig rten du 'gyur grang na /
translated: If something exists or does not exist, it could be a basis.

original: re zhig yod pa'i rten du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig yod pa'i rten du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: But first, it is not the basis of existence.

original: rang gi ngo bo grub pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig gi rang bzhin de ni rten du mngon par 'dod pas bya ba nyid ma yin pas na cung zad kyang mi byed pa ni rten ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo grub pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig gi rang bzhin de ni rten du mngon par 'dod pas bya ba nyid ma yin pas na cung zad kyang mi byed pa ni rten ma yin no //
translated: Because its own nature is established, the nature of something is not asserted to be a basis. Since it does not function at all, it does not function even slightly, and so it is not a basis.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la cung zad kyang mi byed pa de ni de'i rten ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang la cung zad kyang mi byed pa de ni de'i rten ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever does not function at all as anything is not the basis of that,

original: 'bigs byed kyis gangs can lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bigs byed kyis gangs can lta bu'o //
translated: like the Vindhya mountain is not the basis of the Himalaya mountain.

original: rten du mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po yang /
analyzed: rten du mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po yang /
translated: And the thing that is asserted to be a basis

original: bdag nyid thams cad grub pa'i ngo bo la cung zad kyang mi byed do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad grub pa'i ngo bo la cung zad kyang mi byed do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: does not function at all with respect to the nature that is established in all respects. This is the observation of the contradiction with the pervasion.

original: med pa'i yang rten ma yin te de yang rang gi rgyu las skye ba yin gyi gzhan zhig rten du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i yang rten ma yin te de yang rang gi rgyu las skye ba yin gyi gzhan zhig rten du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the support of a non-existent, because that is produced from its own cause, and it is not that something else becomes its support.

original: sbyor ba ni gang med pa de la brten pa'i sgo nas gang zhig rten du 'gyur ba ma yin te dper na ri bong gi rva lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang med pa de la brten pa'i sgo nas gang zhig rten du 'gyur ba ma yin te dper na ri bong gi rva lta bu'o //
translated: The application is: that which is non-existent does not become the support of something else in the sense of being its support, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: ngo bo ma grub pa yang med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo ma grub pa yang med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: And that which is not established as an entity is non-existent. This is the observation of a contradiction with the pervader.

original: gal te ma yin rten yod pa //
analyzed: gal te ma yin rten yod pa //
translated: If you say: ‚ÄúThe existent is the support,

original: @32a * // gnas pa'i rgyu ni yin zhe na //
analyzed: @32a * // gnas pa'i rgyu ni yin zhe na //
translated: and the cause of endurance,‚Äù

original: rten du mngon par 'dod pa cung zad mi byed pa ni ma yin te //
analyzed: rten du mngon par 'dod pa cung zad mi byed pa ni ma yin te //
translated: it is not that the so-called support does not perform any function whatsoever.

original: yod pa nyid du grub pa can gyi dngos po yod na yang de ni gnas pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa nyid du grub pa can gyi dngos po yod na yang de ni gnas pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even when an existent thing is established as existent, it causes endurance.

original: de nas snga ma ma grub pa yin zhing gzhan ni grub pa sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas snga ma ma grub pa yin zhing gzhan ni grub pa sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: Then the former is not established, and the latter establishes what is to be established.

original: khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not accepted.

original: de ni rten ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rten ma yin te /
translated: That is not the support,

original: gnas pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes endurance.

original: de ltar na re zhig gnas par byed pas gnas par bya ba'i ngo bo byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig gnas par byed pas gnas par bya ba'i ngo bo byas pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, first, endurance is not the activity of that which endures,

original: grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgnas pa byed na de yang de las don gzhan nam /
analyzed: grub pa'i phyir ro // gnas pa byed na de yang de las don gzhan nam /
translated: because it is already established.üîΩIf endurance is the activity of that which endures, is it different from that which endures or not?

original: don gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i rtog pa gang du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: don gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i rtog pa gang du 'gyur grang na /
translated: What is the point of this speculation?

original: don gzhan nyid ma yin na ni gnas pa 'di'i /
analyzed: don gzhan nyid ma yin na ni gnas pa 'di'i /
translated: If it is not different, then this endurance

original: gnas pa po las tha dad med pa yi //
analyzed: gnas pa po las tha dad med pa yi //
translated: is not different from that which endures.

original: rgyu'i phyir gnas pa po'i bdag nyid gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i phyir gnas pa po'i bdag nyid gnas pa yin no //
translated: Because it is the cause of that which endures, endurance is the nature of that which endures.

original: de yang byas pa ma yin pa de ltar na cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir rten ma yan no //
analyzed: de yang byas pa ma yin pa de ltar na cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir rten ma yan no //
translated: Since it is not produced, it does not perform any function at all.

original: tha dad na yang gnas pa las gnas pa don tha dad pa'i ngo po yin na /
analyzed: tha dad na yang gnas pa las gnas pa don tha dad pa'i ngo po yin na /
translated: If it is different, if endurance is a different entity from that which endures,

original: de rgyu min gnas pa de'i gnas par byed pa mngon par 'dod pa skyed par byed pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de rgyu min gnas pa de'i gnas par byed pa mngon par 'dod pa skyed par byed pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: then it is not the cause of that which endures, and that which is asserted to be the activity of endurance would be the producer of that which endures.

original: gnas par byed pa des gnas pa po nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po ci zhig byas te /
analyzed: gnas par byed pa des gnas pa po nyid du mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po ci zhig byas te /
translated: In that case, what would that which endures do to the entity that is asserted to be that which endures?

original: cung zad kyang byas pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: cung zad kyang byas pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not perform even the slightest function.

original: rnam pa gnyi gas kyang cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyi gas kyang cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since it does not perform even the slightest function in either way,

original: de'i 'brel ba can gyi gnas par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / des phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du rtogs pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'brel ba can gyi gnas par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / des phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du rtogs pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: it is illogical to think that it is the support of endurance and that it benefits.

original: gnas par byed pa dang 'dra bar gnas pa'i rten nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas par byed pa dang 'dra bar gnas pa'i rten nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like the endurer, the support of endurance is not established.

original: gzhan yang gal te gnas par byed pa las dngos po'i gnas pa yin pa de'i tshe gnas pa po rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te gnas par byed pa las dngos po'i gnas pa yin pa de'i tshe gnas pa po rtag pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, if endurance of things is due to the endurer, then the endurer would be permanent,

original: 'jig pa med par thal bar 'gyur /üîΩgnas par byed pa 'byung ba rnams yod pas sems nyid ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa med par thal bar 'gyur / gnas par byed pa 'byung ba rnams yod pas sems nyid ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be destroyed.üîΩBecause the elements, which are the endurer, would not cease, the mind would not cease.

original: blo gzhan dang gzhan 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyir 'byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: blo gzhan dang gzhan 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyir 'byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The elements are not the endurer because the mind would not cease, since the mind would not cease due to the elements.

original: bye brag pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi yang gnas par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi yang gnas par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is also a substrate.

original: sngo bsangs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can so btang ba las skyes pa'i yon tan phyi ma phyi ma ldog pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngo bsangs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can so btang ba las skyes pa'i yon tan phyi ma phyi ma ldog pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The qualities of whiteness, etc., which arise from the action of the potter, would not be successive.

original: gal te de 'jig rgyu las 'dod //
analyzed: gal te de 'jig rgyu las 'dod //
translated: If you maintain that destruction is caused by a cause,

original: de ltar ni gyur @32b na gnas par byed pas gnas par bya ba gnas par byed mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni gyur @32b na gnas par byed pas gnas par bya ba gnas par byed mod kyi /
translated: then, in that case, the substrate is the cause of the endurance of the thing that is to be endured.

original: 'on kyang 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas 'jig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas 'jig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But when it comes in contact with the cause of destruction, it is destroyed.

original: de'i tshe de la'ang thal ba mtshungs pa yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe de la'ang thal ba mtshungs pa yin /
translated: In that case, the same reductio would apply to that cause of destruction.

original: de ni 'jig pa'i rgyu la yang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'jig pa'i rgyu la yang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: It is the same with regard to the cause of destruction.

original: ci dngos po las 'jig pa don gzhan du gyur pa 'jig pa'i rgyus byed dam /
analyzed: ci dngos po las 'jig pa don gzhan du gyur pa 'jig pa'i rgyus byed dam /
translated: Is destruction, which is different from the thing, caused by the cause of destruction?

original: 'on te dngos po nyid yin dngos po byed pa ni ma yin te grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te dngos po nyid yin dngos po byed pa ni ma yin te grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or is it the thing itself? It is not caused by the cause of destruction, because it is already established.üîΩIf it is caused by another, it is not the thing itself.

original: gzhan la byed na dngos po la cung zad kyang ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: gzhan la byed na dngos po la cung zad kyang ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: In that case,

original: de'i gnas skabs can nyid yin pa'i phyir gang las 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs can nyid yin pa'i phyir gang las 'jig pa yin te /
translated: Because it is the state of that which is enduring, from what would it disintegrate?

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid yin no//
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid yin no//
translated: The cause of disintegration does not do anything at all.

original: gzhan yang gal te 'jig pa'i rgyus yod pa na dngos po 'jig par 'gyur gyi /üîΩgzhan gyi tshe ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'jig pa'i rgyus yod pa na dngos po 'jig par 'gyur gyi / gzhan gyi tshe ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, if disintegration occurs due to the cause of disintegration when an entity exists,

original: gnas pa'i rgyus kyang ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyus kyang ci zhig bya /
translated: but not at another time, then what would the cause of endurance do?

original: gnas pa'i rgyur rtogs pa cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyur rtogs pa cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable for anything to be recognized as the cause of endurance.

original: de ltar 'di ltar gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu'i nus pa 'joms par byed pa las 'di'i gnas par byed pa'i nus thar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ltar gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu'i nus pa 'joms par byed pa las 'di'i gnas par byed pa'i nus thar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, if the power of the cause of disintegration were to destroy the power of endurance, then the power of endurance would not occur.

original: de ltar ma yin na 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa na /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa na /
translated: If that is not so, then without the cause of disintegration,

original: de las 'jig pa'i chos can de bdag nyid 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na gnas pa'i rgyus ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de las 'jig pa'i chos can de bdag nyid 'jig par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na gnas pa'i rgyus ci zhig bya /
translated: that which has the property of disintegration would not disintegrate by itself. In that case, what would the cause of endurance do?

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na /
translated: If that were to occur,

original: ji srid 'jig rgyu ma phrad par gnas yin no //
analyzed: ji srid 'jig rgyu ma phrad par gnas yin no //
translated: it would endure as long as it does not encounter the cause of disintegration.

original: ji srid 'jig pa'i rgyu dang ma phrad pa de srid du ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa'i rang bzhin 'di gnas par byed pa med par mi gnas pa de ltar na /
analyzed: ji srid 'jig pa'i rgyu dang ma phrad pa de srid du ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa'i rang bzhin 'di gnas par byed pa med par mi gnas pa de ltar na /
translated: For as long as it does not encounter the cause of destruction, it endures by its own intrinsic nature, and without an agent of endurance, it does not endure.

original: dus de srid du gnas par byed pas yongs su bzung bas gnas pa po gnas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dus de srid du gnas par byed pas yongs su bzung bas gnas pa po gnas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In that case, it endures by being taken up by the agent of endurance, which endures for that long.

original: 'jig pa dngos chos nyid 'gyur na //
analyzed: 'jig pa dngos chos nyid 'gyur na //
translated: If destruction were the reality of things,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can de ni 'jig par byed pa med par gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can de ni 'jig par byed pa med par gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: it would not endure without an agent of destruction, since it has the nature of intrinsically disintegrating.

original: de'i tshe 'jig pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'jig pa ni dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, destruction would be the reality of things.

original: de lta yin na 'jig pa 'di la gnod med na /
analyzed: de lta yin na 'jig pa 'di la gnod med na /
translated: If that were the case, this destruction would not be impaired.

original: 'di la gnod pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la gnod pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthis would not be impaired‚Äù should be applied here.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin rnam par gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa de ltar na /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin rnam par gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa de ltar na /
translated: Since the reality of things cannot be made otherwise,

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would intrinsically disintegrate.

original: rnam pa gzhan byed pa na yang gnas par byed pas bdag nyid 'jig pa'i chos can de 'jig par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan byed pa na yang gnas par byed pas bdag nyid 'jig pa'i chos can de 'jig par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If it is the case that it is the self-isolate of endurance, then it would be contradictory for it to be the self-isolate of arising and disintegration.üîΩIf it is the case that it is the self-isolate of arising, then it would be contradictory for it to be the self-isolate of endurance and disintegration.

original: gzhan skyed pa de ltar na de de'i ji ltar na gnas par byed pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan skyed pa de ltar na de de'i ji ltar na gnas par byed pa yin /
translated: If it is the case that it is the self-isolate of disintegration, then it would be contradictory for it to be the self-isolate of arising and endurance.

original: rang bzhin las gzhan nyid ma yin na yang /
analyzed: rang bzhin las gzhan nyid ma yin na yang /
translated: If it is the case that it is the self-isolate of all three, then it would be contradictory for it to be the self-isolate of none of them.üîΩIf it is the case that it is the self-isolate of none of them, then it would be contradictory for it to be the self-isolate of all three.üîΩIf it is the case that it is the self-isolate of all three, then it would be contradictory for it to be the self-isolate of none of them.üîΩIf it is the case that it is the self-isolate of none of them, then it would be contradictory for it to be the self-isolate of all three.

original: @33a * // de ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can de'i rang bzhin yin na gnas pa med pa'i phyir na gnas rgyus ci zhig bya /
analyzed: @33a * // de ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can de'i rang bzhin yin na gnas pa med pa'i phyir na gnas rgyus ci zhig bya /
translated: If it is the case that it is the self-isolate of all three, then it would be contradictory for it to be the self-isolate of none of them.üîΩIf it is the case that it is the self-isolate of none of them, then it would be contradictory for it to be the self-isolate of all three.üîΩIf it is the case that it is the self-isolate of all three, then it would be contradictory for it to be the self-isolate of none of them.üîΩIf it is the case that it is the self-isolate of none of them, then it would be contradictory for it to be the self-isolate of all three.üîΩIf it is the case that it is the self-isolate of all three, then it would be contradictory for it to be the self-isolate of none of them.

original: nus pa med pa brtags pas so //
analyzed: nus pa med pa brtags pas so //
translated: If it is the case that it is the self-isolate of none of them, then it would be contradictory for it to be the self-isolate of all three.üîΩIf it is the case that it is the self-isolate of all three, then it would be contradictory for it to be the self-isolate of none of them.

original: gal te dper na chu sogs kyi rten bzhin zha na /üîΩde ltar ni 'gyur na yod pa nyid du grub pa can gyi chu la sogs pa ni brten pa dang / snod la sogs pa ni rten gyi ming can yin te /üîΩdper na 'di'i rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin pa de bzhin du 'dir rten gyi dngos por 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dper na chu sogs kyi rten bzhin zha na /üîΩde ltar ni 'gyur na yod pa nyid du grub pa can gyi chu la sogs pa ni brten pa dang / snod la sogs pa ni rten gyi ming can yin te /üîΩdper na 'di'i rten dang brten pa'i dngos po yin pa de bzhin du 'dir rten gyi dngos por 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is the case that it is the self-isolate of none of them, then it would be contradictory for it to

original: 'di la'ang mtshungs pa 'di la'ang snod la sogs pa rten du mngon par 'dod pa ci zhig byed pa rten yin no zhes bya ba snga ma de thams cad 'dir yang bzla bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di la'ang mtshungs pa 'di la'ang snod la sogs pa rten du mngon par 'dod pa ci zhig byed pa rten yin no zhes bya ba snga ma de thams cad 'dir yang bzla bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Here too, what is the point of asserting that the pot, etc. are the basis, since they are the basis? All of the previous arguments should be applied here.

original: gal te rten dang brten pa'i tha snyad mthong ba ji ltar na ston par nus she na /
analyzed: gal te rten dang brten pa'i tha snyad mthong ba ji ltar na ston par nus she na /
translated: If one sees the convention of basis and based, how can one be able to teach?

original: gnas pa byed pa'i phyir snod la sogs pa'i rten ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa byed pa'i phyir snod la sogs pa'i rten ni ma yin no //
translated: The basis of the pot, etc. is not the basis because it is the cause of endurance.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na dngos po rnams skad cig re re la ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na dngos po rnams skad cig re re la ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: What is it then? Things are destroyed by their intrinsic reality in each instant.

original: yul gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba'i chos can gyi dngos rnams skad cig re rer 'jig pa yin na ni dngos rgyun de ltar skye ba'i rten dang mtshungs pa'i yul du skyes pa'i snod la sogs pa rgyu nyid yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir /
analyzed: yul gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba'i chos can gyi dngos rnams skad cig re rer 'jig pa yin na ni dngos rgyun de ltar skye ba'i rten dang mtshungs pa'i yul du skyes pa'i snod la sogs pa rgyu nyid yin pa'i gtan tshigs kyi phyir /
translated: If things that have the property of arising in other and other places are destroyed in each instant, then the basis of the arising of the continuum of things is the cause of the arising of the pot, etc. in a place that is similar to the basis.

original: snod la sogs pa de rten yin //
analyzed: snod la sogs pa de rten yin //
translated: Therefore, the pot, etc. are the basis.

original: de lta min na rigs ma yin //
analyzed: de lta min na rigs ma yin //
translated: If it were not so, it would not be logical.

original: gal te de lta bur 'gyur ba'i rgyun skyes pa'i rgyu nyid du rten mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gal te de lta bur 'gyur ba'i rgyun skyes pa'i rgyu nyid du rten mi 'dod do //
translated: If you do not assert that the cause of the arising of such a continuum is the support,

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: then what is it?

original: gnas pa'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you assert that it is the cause of endurance,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is the support.

original: rten nyid yin pa mi rung ngo gzhan yang ngo bo nyid kyis 'gro ba'i chos can /üîΩ'bo ba yi ni gags byed phyir //
analyzed: rten nyid yin pa mi rung ngo gzhan yang ngo bo nyid kyis 'gro ba'i chos can / 'bo ba yi ni gags byed phyir //
translated: Moreover, if the world, which is characterized by movement,üîΩis the support of water, etc.,

original: snod la sogs pa chu sogs kyi ni rten gyur na yang /
analyzed: snod la sogs pa chu sogs kyi ni rten gyur na yang /
translated: then it would not be characterized by movement.

original: 'pho ba med ba'i chos can /
analyzed: 'pho ba med ba'i chos can /
translated: The world, which is characterized by movement,

original: 'gro ba med can yon tan spyi //
analyzed: 'gro ba med can yon tan spyi //
translated: is the support of the qualities,

original: las rnams rten gyis ci zhig dgos //
analyzed: las rnams rten gyis ci zhig dgos //
translated: but what is the use of the support of actions?

original: gang gis na de dag brten pa nyid du rtog par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis na de dag brten pa nyid du rtog par 'gyur /
translated: By what are they conceived to be supported?

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po dgag pa bshad ma thag pa des ni tha mi dad pa grub pa dag gi rten dang brten pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid can 'phrod pa 'du ba dang / bdag la sogs pa 'phrod pa 'du ba can rgyu dang /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po dgag pa bshad ma thag pa des ni tha mi dad pa grub pa dag gi rten dang brten pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid can 'phrod pa 'du ba dang / bdag la sogs pa 'phrod pa 'du ba can rgyu dang /
translated: The refutation of the nature of support and supported that was just explained refutes the characteristics of the support and supported of the established, which are the characteristics of the contact of the supported and the support and the contact of the self, etc., with the supported.

original: 'di ni 'di la yod kyi gzhan la ma yin no zhes /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di la yod kyi gzhan la ma yin no zhes /
translated: This is the way it is, but not the other way.

original: rigs la sogs pa rnam gzhag nyid //üîΩsogs pa smos pa ni chos can 'di la chos 'di gnas pa dang / 'byung ba rnams la brten nas @33b sems nyid gnas pa'am /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa rnam gzhag nyid // sogs pa smos pa ni chos can 'di la chos 'di gnas pa dang / 'byung ba rnams la brten nas @33b sems nyid gnas pa'am /
translated: The classification of family, etc.üîΩThe words ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refer to the fact that this property is present in this subject, and that the mind is present in dependence on the primary elements, or that form is derived from the primary elements.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gang cung zad rten gyi sgo nas gnas pa yin no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de thams cad btsal ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gang cung zad rten gyi sgo nas gnas pa yin no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de thams cad btsal ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Whatever is said to be present in this way by way of support should be understood as a designation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rten med phyir na ste /
analyzed: rten med phyir na ste /
translated: Because there is no support.

original: 'ga' zhig gi 'ga' zhig rten yin pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi 'ga' zhig rten yin pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not possible for one thing to be the support of another.

original: tha snyad 'di dag ni rten gyi sgo nas yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tha snyad 'di dag ni rten gyi sgo nas yin pa'i phyir /
translated: These designations are by way of support.

original: 'ga' zhig kyang 'ga' zhig la brten nas gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kyang 'ga' zhig la brten nas gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, nothing is present by way of support.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin pa'i don bsdus nas ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin pa'i don bsdus nas ston pa yin no //
translated: The verse beginning with ‚ÄúIf‚Äù summarizes the meaning of what has been explained.

original: gal te gzhan las dngos 'jig na //
analyzed: gal te gzhan las dngos 'jig na //
translated: If things were to perish through another,

original: de'i tshe ji srid 'jig pa'i rgyu nye bar mig nas pa de srid du dngos po de bdag nyid rjes su 'jug pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji srid 'jig pa'i rgyu nye bar mig nas pa de srid du dngos po de bdag nyid rjes su 'jug pa de ltar na /
translated: At that time, for as long as the cause of disintegration is not present, for that long the thing continues to exist.

original: de'i cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i gnas rgyus ci zhig bya /üîΩdngos po de gzhan med par 'jig na yang /
analyzed: de'i cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i gnas rgyus ci zhig bya / dngos po de gzhan med par 'jig na yang /
translated: In that case, what would the cause of endurance do, since it does not cause even the slightest change?üîΩIf the thing disintegrates without another thing coming into existence,

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu thag nye ba med par dngos po rang nyid 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu thag nye ba med par dngos po rang nyid 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa de ltar na /
translated: then the thing would have the nature of disintegration without the cause of disintegration being present.

original: gnas pa'i rgyu rnams nus med yin //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu rnams nus med yin //
translated: In that case, the causes of endurance would be ineffective.

original: de gnas par bya ba'i phyir gnas par byed pa 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de gnas par bya ba'i phyir gnas par byed pa 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you assert that the causes of endurance cause endurance,

original: rang bzhin ldog pa med pa nyid kyi phyir gnas par byed pa yod na yang /
analyzed: rang bzhin ldog pa med pa nyid kyi phyir gnas par byed pa yod na yang /
translated: then, because its nature cannot be reversed, even if the causes of endurance exist,

original: de nyid kyi 'jig par 'gyur ba yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'jig par 'gyur ba yin pa de ltar na /
translated: it would disintegrate by itself.

original: gnas pa'i rgyu rnams nus pa med pa yin pa'i phyir gnas pa'i rgyus ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu rnams nus pa med pa yin pa'i phyir gnas pa'i rgyus ci zhig bya /
translated: In that case, since the causes of endurance would be ineffective, what would the causes of endurance do?

original: gzhan yang dngos po 'ga' zhig rten bcas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po 'ga' zhig rten bcas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Moreover, some say that a thing is called ‚Äúenduring with support.‚Äù

original: thams cad gnas ldan dang skye ba can zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' zhig skye ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni kun rten bcas yin par 'dod pa des na /
analyzed: thams cad gnas ldan dang skye ba can zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' zhig skye ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni kun rten bcas yin par 'dod pa des na /
translated: All things that are said to be ‚Äúenduring‚Äù and ‚Äúarisen‚Äù are dependent on something else, and that which is dependent on something else is impermanent.üîΩTherefore, the self that is the basis of pleasure, etc. is permanent, and that which is permanent is the basis of pleasure, etc.

original: re zhig bdag la brten pa'i bde ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa'i rten rtag pa de dag ni rtag tu gnas par byed pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir 'jig pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: re zhig bdag la brten pa'i bde ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa'i rten rtag pa de dag ni rtag tu gnas par byed pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir 'jig pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: That which is the basis of pleasure, etc. is not destroyed, because it is not separated from that which causes it to endure permanently.

original: gang dag gi yang mi rtag pa nyid rten yin na de'i yang gzhan dang de'i yang gzhan ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: gang dag gi yang mi rtag pa nyid rten yin na de'i yang gzhan dang de'i yang gzhan ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If impermanence is the basis of pleasure, etc., then the basis of that is another, and the basis of that is another, and so on.

original: rdul phra rab rtag pa'i bar du rten yin pa'i phyir rtag tu gnas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rtag pa'i bar du rten yin pa'i phyir rtag tu gnas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, pleasure, etc. would endure permanently, because the permanent atom is the basis.

original: gang gi phyir sems la sogs pa 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyang 'byung ba rnams kyi rang bzhin 'jig pa med pa'i phyir gnas pa de ltar na 'jig pa med pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir dngos po thams cad ni 'ga' zhig gi tshe na'ang 'jig pa min /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems la sogs pa 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyang 'byung ba rnams kyi rang bzhin 'jig pa med pa'i phyir gnas pa de ltar na 'jig pa med pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir dngos po thams cad ni 'ga' zhig gi tshe na'ang 'jig pa min /
translated: Because phenomena such as mind that arise are not destroyed, they endure. In that case, they are not destroyed. Therefore, no things are ever destroyed.

original: @34a * // dngos po 'ga' zhig gang yin pa de'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: @34a * // dngos po 'ga' zhig gang yin pa de'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can gyi rang bzhin nam /
translated: Is there any thing that is by nature subject to destruction?

original: ma yin pa yin grang /
analyzed: ma yin pa yin grang /
translated: Or is there not?

original: gal te rang 'jig ngang tshul bdag yin na /üîΩde'i tshe rang bzhin bzlog pa med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gal te rang 'jig ngang tshul bdag yin na / de'i tshe rang bzhin bzlog pa med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: If it is by nature subject to destruction,üîΩthen it is impossible to reverse its nature.

original: de nyid kyis 'jig par bya ba nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis 'jig par bya ba nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: In that case,

original: de'i gnas byed gzhan gang yin //
analyzed: de'i gnas byed gzhan gang yin //
translated: what else could make it endure?

original: dngos po de gal te rang 'jig ngang tshul bdag min na de'i tshe bdag nyid gnas pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: dngos po de gal te rang 'jig ngang tshul bdag min na de'i tshe bdag nyid gnas pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: If that thing is not by nature subject to destruction, then it endures by itself. In that case,

original: de'i gnas byed gzhan gang yin //
analyzed: de'i gnas byed gzhan gang yin //
translated: what else could make it endure?

original: de ltar na rnam pa gnyi ga ltar na yang rten grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa gnyi ga ltar na yang rten grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, in both cases, the support is not established.

original: 'dis kyang lus dang sems dag nye bar len pa dang / nye bar len pa can gyi dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis kyang lus dang sems dag nye bar len pa dang / nye bar len pa can gyi dngos po ma yin te /
translated: This also shows that the body and mind are not the appropriator and that which is to be appropriated.

original: 'di ltar lus kyi phul byung 'grib pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus kyi phul byung 'grib pa ste /
translated: Thus, the body‚Äôs excellence is its lack of increase and decrease.

original: lus kyi yon tan 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med par yang blo'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis /
analyzed: lus kyi yon tan 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med par yang blo'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis /
translated: The excellence of the body is not an increase or decrease of its qualities, but rather a special activity of the mind.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis de'i yon tan 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gis /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis de'i yon tan 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gis /
translated: The excellence of the mind is an increase or decrease of its qualities, which is due to a special activity of the mental consciousness.

original: shes rab la sogs phul byung dang // 'grib pa dag tu 'ang 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs phul byung dang // 'grib pa dag tu 'ang 'gyur ba yin //
translated: Excellence and decrease of wisdom and so on

original: sogs pa smos pas ni byams pa dang snying rje dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / skyo ba dang skyo ba med pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / tig mug dang / dran pa dang / yid gzhungs pha la sogs pa dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni byams pa dang snying rje dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / skyo ba dang skyo ba med pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / tig mug dang / dran pa dang / yid gzhungs pha la sogs pa dag kyang ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root verse refers to such qualities as love, compassion, freedom from attachment, disenchantment, nonenchantment, attachment, anger, delusion, mindfulness, and intelligence.

original: lus kyi byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa la ltos pa med par blo'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i sgo nas shes ra bla sogs pa'i phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa nyams su myong ba'i chos gang yin pa /
analyzed: lus kyi byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa la ltos pa med par blo'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i sgo nas shes ra bla sogs pa'i phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa nyams su myong ba'i chos gang yin pa /
translated: But the light of a lamp, etc., is not like that, because it is not dependent on the special activity of the body, but rather on the special activity of the mind, and so it is experienced as superior or inferior in accordance with its increase or decrease.

original: 'di ni mar me'i 'od la sogs //
analyzed: 'di ni mar me'i 'od la sogs //
translated: The light of a lamp, etc.,

original: brten pa rnams la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brten pa rnams la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: does not exist in the supported.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /üîΩsgron ma la sogs pa'i byed pa 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag nyid kyis sgron ma la sogs pa de dag gi nye bar len pa can 'od la sogs pa dag gi phul du byung pa dang phul du byung ba ma yin pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na / sgron ma la sogs pa'i byed pa 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag nyid kyis sgron ma la sogs pa de dag gi nye bar len pa can 'od la sogs pa dag gi phul du byung pa dang phul du byung ba ma yin pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur
translated: What is it then?

original: gyi / de la ltos pa med pa'i don byed pas 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i rjes su 'brang ba can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gyi / de la ltos pa med pa'i don byed pas 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i rjes su 'brang ba can ni ma yin no //
translated: The light of a lamp, etc., is experienced as superior or inferior in accordance with the increase or decrease of the activity of the lamp, etc., and not in accordance with the increase or decrease of the activity of the object, because it is not dependent on that.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gis ltos pa med pa'i byed pa'i khyad par gyi @34b 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa can de la ltos pa med par phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni de'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu can dang /üîΩde las gzhan pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu can du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gis ltos pa med pa'i byed pa'i khyad par gyi @34b 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa can de la ltos pa med par phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni de'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu can dang / de las gzhan pa'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu can du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The particular action of the lamp is not dependent on the increase and decrease of the particular action of the sprout.üîΩThe particular action of the lamp is not dependent on the original: dper na sgron ma'i byed pa'i khyad par gyi 'phel pa dang 'grib pa dag gis ltos pa med pa'i myu gu byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa de la ltos pa med par sgron ma'i 'od kyis phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa nyams su
analyzed: dper na sgron ma'i byed pa'i khyad par gyi 'phel pa dang 'grib pa dag gis ltos pa med pa'i myu gu byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa de la ltos pa med par sgron ma'i 'od kyis phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa nyams su
translated: The particular action of the lamp is not dependent on the increase and decrease of the particular action of the sprout.

original: myong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: myong ba lta bu'o //
translated: The particular action

original: blo'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gi ltos pa med pa'i lus kyis byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa de la ltos pa med par shes rab la sogs pa'i phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa nyams su myong bar
analyzed: blo'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dag gi ltos pa med pa'i lus kyis byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa de la ltos pa med par shes rab la sogs pa'i phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa nyams su myong bar
translated: The experience of the excellence and decrease of wisdom, etc.

original: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The observation of the pervasion by contradiction in relation to the second probandum.

original: lus de las kyang brgyud pas shes rab la sogs pa 'di'i phul du byung ba'i khyad par 'byung bar 'gyur gyi sems phan 'dogs byed min la min /
analyzed: lus de las kyang brgyud pas shes rab la sogs pa 'di'i phul du byung ba'i khyad par 'byung bar 'gyur gyi sems phan 'dogs byed min la min /
translated: The excellence of this wisdom, etc. arises from that body, not from the mind, which is not a benefactor.

original: sems la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid kyi sgo nas shes rab la sogs pa la lus phan 'dogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems la phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid kyi sgo nas shes rab la sogs pa la lus phan 'dogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The body benefits wisdom, etc. by the very fact of benefiting the mind.

original: 'dis ni blo'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni blo'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because of the increase and decrease due to the special activity of the mind.

original: ltos pa med pa'i lus kyi byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa de la ltos pa med pa nyid ni shes rab la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don du bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i lus kyi byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa de la ltos pa med pa nyid ni shes rab la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don du bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: The special activity of the body that is independent of the mind is established as the meaning of the reason, ‚Äúindependent of the mind.‚Äù

original: gal te blo'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med par lus yan gar las kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa 'phel ba'i rgyu mtshan mthong ste /
analyzed: gal te blo'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med par lus yan gar las kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa 'phel ba'i rgyu mtshan mthong ste /
translated: If you see a reason for the increase of attachment, etc., without the special activity of the mind, then it is just as in the case of the uncertain reason.üîΩThat is not so.üîΩFor, when the body grows, attachment increases.üîΩAnd when the body is emaciated, aversion increases.

original: 'di ltar lus rgyas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'dod chags 'phel bar 'gyur zhing gdung ba las zhe sdang 'gyur ba de ltar na gtan tshigs ma nges pa kho na bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus rgyas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'dod chags 'phel bar 'gyur zhing gdung ba las zhe sdang 'gyur ba de ltar na gtan tshigs ma nges pa kho na bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Thus, the reason is uncertain.

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar rgyas sogs 'dod chags la sogs 'phel /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / 'di ltar rgyas sogs 'dod chags la sogs 'phel /
translated: That is not so.üîΩFor, when the body grows, attachment increases.

original: sogs pa dang po smos pas ni gdung ba las so //
analyzed: sogs pa dang po smos pas ni gdung ba las so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù in the first line refers to emaciation, from which aversion increases.

original: ci rigs par de ni 'ga' zhig tshe na bde sdug skye /
analyzed: ci rigs par de ni 'ga' zhig tshe na bde sdug skye /
translated: In some cases, pleasure and pain arise from the increase of attachment and aversion, respectively.

original: 'dod chags 'phel ba ni bde ba las skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags 'phel ba ni bde ba las skye ba'o //
translated: The increase of attachment arises from pleasure.

original: zhe sdang 'phel ba ni sdug bsngal las skye @35a * //
analyzed: zhe sdang 'phel ba ni sdug bsngal las skye @35a * //
translated: The increase of hatred arises from suffering.

original: pa'o // 'ga' zhig tshe zhes bya ba smos pas lus la sogs pa rgyas pa las gdon mi za bar 'dod chags la sogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa'o // 'ga' zhig tshe zhes bya ba smos pas lus la sogs pa rgyas pa las gdon mi za bar 'dod chags la sogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúsome‚Äù indicates that the increase of the body, etc. does not necessarily produce attachment, etc.

original: 'di ltar de yod du zin kyang skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa chung ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar de yod du zin kyang skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa chung ba'am /
translated: For, even when they exist, attachment, etc. are weak in a person by his very nature,

original: so sor rtogs pa la sogs pa'i dang tshul can gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa phul du byung ba med par sde shes par byed do //
analyzed: so sor rtogs pa la sogs pa'i dang tshul can gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa phul du byung ba med par sde shes par byed do //
translated: or attachment, etc. are not excessive in one who is disposed to discernment, etc.

original: gang gi tshe rgyas pa la sogs pa yod na zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du byed pa de'i tshe yang dngos su ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyas pa la sogs pa yod na zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du byed pa de'i tshe yang dngos su ma yin te /
translated: Even when the conventional expression ‚Äúwhen there is the increase, etc.‚Äù is used, it is not actually so.

original: 'di ltar lus rgyas su zin kyang ji srid skyes bu yid bde bar mi 'gyur ba de srid du /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus rgyas su zin kyang ji srid skyes bu yid bde bar mi 'gyur ba de srid du /
translated: For, even when the body is increased, as long as the person is not happy,

original: 'dod chags de dang rjes su 'brel bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'dod chags de dang rjes su 'brel bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: attachment is not connected with him.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang yang ji srid yid mi bde ba med par yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang yang ji srid yid mi bde ba med par yang ngo //
translated: Similarly, hatred is not connected with him as long as he is not unhappy.

original: yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba de yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas yin no //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba de yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas yin no //
translated: And that mental pleasure and mental pain are in terms of pleasure and pain.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal de dag kyang khams ni snyoms pa las 'byung ba yin no//
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal de dag kyang khams ni snyoms pa las 'byung ba yin no//
translated: And those pleasures and pains arise from the equilibrium of the elements.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni khams mi snyoms pa la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni khams mi snyoms pa la sogs pa las so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to the disequilibrium of the elements and so on.

original: nang gi don reg bya'i khyad par gang yin pa nye ba de'i phyir ci rigs par bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: nang gi don reg bya'i khyad par gang yin pa nye ba de'i phyir ci rigs par bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi khyad par yin no //
translated: The specific internal tactile objects that are present cause the specific pleasures and pains, as appropriate.

original: 'di skad du khams snyoms pa dang mi snyoms pa las nang gi reg bya'i khyad par rtogs par byed pa pos ci rigs par rang gi yul gyis reg bya'i rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa dang gnod par byed pa gang yin gnod par byed
analyzed: 'di skad du khams snyoms pa dang mi snyoms pa las nang gi reg bya'i khyad par rtogs par byed pa pos ci rigs par rang gi yul gyis reg bya'i rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa dang gnod par byed pa gang yin gnod par byed
translated: In other words, the equilibrium and disequilibrium of the elements cause the specific internal tactile objects to be cognized by the body sense faculty, which then benefit or harm the body sense faculty, as appropriate.

original: pa gang yin pa des de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis ngo bo phyis kyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo la phan 'dogs par byed pa dang gnod pa byed do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa gang yin pa des de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis ngo bo phyis kyi rnam par rtog pa'i blo la phan 'dogs par byed pa dang gnod pa byed do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: and that which is the object field of that consciousness is the object field of the consciousness that arises immediately after it.

original: de las 'dod chags dang zhe sdang nyid yin pa de ltar na brgyud pas lus las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'phel pa yin no //
analyzed: de las 'dod chags dang zhe sdang nyid yin pa de ltar na brgyud pas lus las 'dod chags la sogs pa 'phel pa yin no //
translated: Thus, desire and hatred increase in the body through a continuum.

original: de bzhin du bcud kyis len pa dang yid gzhungs par byed pa la sogs pa'i nye bar sbyor ba la sogs pa las dran pa dang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan yin par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcud kyis len pa dang yid gzhungs par byed pa la sogs pa'i nye bar sbyor ba la sogs pa las dran pa dang yid gzhungs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan yin par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should understand that memory, intelligence, and so on are qualities of the mind through their connection with the application of elixirs, memory enhancers, and so on.

original: des na yul lam dbang po shes pa'i rten gyi dbang po las de'i shes pa phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa'i sgo nas kyang de 'dra ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnas pa thob pa de ltar na /
analyzed: des na yul lam dbang po shes pa'i rten gyi dbang po las de'i shes pa phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed pa'i sgo nas kyang de 'dra ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnas pa thob pa de ltar na /
translated: Therefore, the object field or the sense faculty that is the basis of the consciousness is the support of that consciousness, since it benefits or harms that consciousness.

original: de tsam gyis de dag gi yul nye bar len pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de tsam gyis de dag gi yul nye bar len pa ma yin zhing /
translated: But that alone does not make it the object field of that consciousness.

original: de @35b bzhin du dbang po dang lus ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de @35b bzhin du dbang po dang lus ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, it is not indeterminate because it is not a sense faculty or the body.

original: bshad ma thag pa des ni 'dus pa la sogs pa smos pas ni sbyar ba'i dug la sogs pa'i nye bar sbyor ba las so //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa des ni 'dus pa la sogs pa smos pas ni sbyar ba'i dug la sogs pa'i nye bar sbyor ba las so //
translated: By the mention of ‚Äúetc.,‚Äù in the immediately preceding passage, it refers to the application of poison, etc.

original: dran pa nyams pa sogs bshad pa yin /
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa sogs bshad pa yin /
translated: It explains the loss of mindfulness, etc.

original: dper na de dag gis lus dngos su 'gyur ba'i rgyu ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na de dag gis lus dngos su 'gyur ba'i rgyu ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, they are not the direct cause of the transformation of the body.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni rmongs pa dang dran pa rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni rmongs pa dang dran pa rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: By the mention of ‚Äúetc.,‚Äù it includes delusion, distraction of mindfulness, and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yid kyi blos ni 'gyur bar byed phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi blos ni 'gyur bar byed phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind transforms through mental conception.

original: ni ni gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: ni ni gang gi phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù means ‚Äúfor what reason.‚Äù

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: nang don khyad par las skyes pa'i //
analyzed: nang don khyad par las skyes pa'i //
translated: It arises from a special internal object.

original: nang gi don reg bya'i khyad par las skyes pa'i blo ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: nang gi don reg bya'i khyad par las skyes pa'i blo ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: The mind that arises from a special internal object, contact, is merely an illustration.

original: dbang po yang de'i rnam par shes pa'i rten yin par bzung ngo //
analyzed: dbang po yang de'i rnam par shes pa'i rten yin par bzung ngo //
translated: The sense faculty is also taken as the basis of its consciousness.

original: rten des kyang reg bya'i rnam par shes pa 'gyur bar byed de /
analyzed: rten des kyang reg bya'i rnam par shes pa 'gyur bar byed de /
translated: And the sense-faculty causes the consciousness of touch to arise.

original: de'i sgo nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'gyur bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'gyur bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And through that, the mental consciousness also arises. This is the meaning.

original: nges bar 'dus pa la sogs pa las gdon mi za bar 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nges bar 'dus pa la sogs pa las gdon mi za bar 'byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that the mental consciousness necessarily arises from the coming together of the sense-faculty, object, and consciousness.

original: brgyud pas kyang phan 'dogs par byed pa de tsam gyis phan gdags par bya ba de'i nye bar len pa ma yin te /
analyzed: brgyud pas kyang phan 'dogs par byed pa de tsam gyis phan gdags par bya ba de'i nye bar len pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not that the mental consciousness is the appropriator of the sense-faculty, because it is not the case that the mental consciousness is the basis for the benefit and harm of the sense-faculty.

original: don gyi sgo nas kyang de ltar yid rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar zhe na /üîΩdper rgyud la la'i phul byang las /
analyzed: don gyi sgo nas kyang de ltar yid rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar zhe na / dper rgyud la la'i phul byang las /
translated: And it is not the case that the sense-faculty is the appropriator of the mental consciousness, because the mental consciousness is benefited and harmed by the mental faculty.üîΩAnd it is not the case that the mental faculty is the appropriator of the mental consciousness, because the mental faculty is benefited and harmed by the mental consciousness.

original: bsam pa med pa can gyi sems kyi rgyud la /üîΩstag nyid dang ni khrag la sogs //
analyzed: bsam pa med pa can gyi sems kyi rgyud la / stag nyid dang ni khrag la sogs //
translated: And it is not the case that the mental faculty is the appropriator of the mental consciousness, because the mental faculty is benefited and harmed by the mental consciousness.üîΩAnd it is not the case that the mental faculty is the appropriator of the mental consciousness, because the mental faculty is benefited and harmed by the mental consciousness.üîΩAnd it is not the case that the mental faculty is the appropriator of the mental consciousness, because the mental faculty is benefited and harmed by the mental consciousness.üîΩAnd it is not the case that the mental faculty is the appropriator of the mental consciousness, because the mental faculty is benefited and harmed by the mental consciousness.

original: thos pa dang ni mthong ba las //üîΩstag thos pa yi rgyu las so //üîΩsogs pa smos pas ni bu la sogs pa shi ba thos pa las so //
analyzed: thos pa dang ni mthong ba las // stag thos pa yi rgyu las so // sogs pa smos pas ni bu la sogs pa shi ba thos pa las so //
translated: And it is not the case that the mental faculty is the appropriator of the mental consciousness, because the mental faculty is benefited and harmed by the mental consciousness.üîΩAnd it is not the case that the mental faculty is the appropriator of the mental consciousness, because the mental faculty is benefited and harmed by the mental consciousness.üîΩAnd it is not the case that the mental faculty is the appropriator of the mental consciousness, because the mental faculty is benefited and harmed by the mental consciousness.üîΩAnd it is not the case that the mental faculty is the appropriator of the mental consciousness, because the mental faculty is benefited and harmed by the mental consciousness.üîΩAnd it is not the case that the mental faculty is the appropriator of the mental consciousness, because the mental faculty is benefited and harmed by the mental consciousness.

original: rmongs pa la sogs 'byung 'gyur bzhin //
analyzed: rmongs pa la sogs 'byung 'gyur bzhin //
translated: And it is not the case that the mental faculty is the appropriator of the mental consciousness, because the mental faculty is benefited and harmed by the mental consciousness.üîΩAnd it is not the case that the mental faculty is the appropriator of the

original: sogs pa'i sgra smos pas ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang shi ba la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra smos pas ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang shi ba la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include distraction, fainting, and so on.

original: de ltar na rgyud kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig la khrag la sogs pa mthong ba las kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyud kyi bye brag 'ga' zhig la khrag la sogs pa mthong ba las kyang ngo //
translated: Thus, in some specific cases, fear and fainting can occur even when one sees blood, and so on.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni gzhan yang 'jigs su rung ba'i gnas la sogs pa mthong ba las 'jigs pa dang brgyal ba dang / spu zing zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni gzhan yang 'jigs su rung ba'i gnas la sogs pa mthong ba las 'jigs pa dang brgyal ba dang / spu zing zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the occurrence of fear, fainting, the raising of the body‚Äôs hair, and so on, when one sees a terrifying place, and so on.

original: de tsam gyis ni phyi rol gyi don nges par blo'i nye bar len pa ma yin te /üîΩdon gyi 'byung ba de lta bur 'gyur ba'i rjes su mi 'jug pas blo ni de'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni phyi rol gyi don nges par blo'i nye bar len pa ma yin te / don gyi 'byung ba de lta bur 'gyur ba'i rjes su mi 'jug pas blo ni de'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But this much does not determine the external object as the object of the cognition,

original: ji ltar blo snga @36a * //
analyzed: ji ltar blo snga @36a * //
translated: because the cognition does not follow the occurrence of the object, since the cognition does not follow the occurrence of the object in that way.üîΩThe earlier cognitions do not definitely follow the later cognitions,

original: ma snga ma la blo phyi ma phyi ma nges par rjes su 'jug pa de ltar lus 'dus byas pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: ma snga ma la blo phyi ma phyi ma nges par rjes su 'jug pa de ltar lus 'dus byas pa la ma yin no //
translated: but the compounded body does.

original: de phyir rigs mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa gang zhig 'dus byas par nges par rjes su 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: de phyir rigs mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa gang zhig 'dus byas par nges par rjes su 'jug pa yin /
translated: Therefore, the consciousness that is a conceptual thought of the same type is necessarily associated with the conditioned.

original: sems ni de med min 'byung yin //
analyzed: sems ni de med min 'byung yin //
translated: The mind is not without that, and it arises.

original: de med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin pa de'i phyir sems de ni sems la brten pa'o //
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin pa de'i phyir sems de ni sems la brten pa'o //
translated: Because it does not occur without that, the mind is based on the mind.

original: rigs mthun pa'i sems nyid 'di'i nye bar len pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i sems nyid 'di'i nye bar len pa yin gyi /
translated: The mind of the same type is the appropriator of that.

original: lus nye bar len pa'am dngos su lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: lus nye bar len pa'am dngos su lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: The body is not the appropriator, nor is it the direct co-originating cause.

original: nges par de 'dus byas pa'i yang rjes su 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nges par de 'dus byas pa'i yang rjes su 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not necessarily associated with the conditioned,

original: dper na dbang bo'i shes pa de nyid kyi yul gyi rjes su 'jug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dbang bo'i shes pa de nyid kyi yul gyi rjes su 'jug pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the sense consciousness that is associated with its object.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang 'dus byas pa'i rjes su nges par 'jug pa de ni de med na mi 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang 'dus byas pa'i rjes su nges par 'jug pa de ni de med na mi 'byung ba'am /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is necessarily associated with the conditioned does not occur without that,

original: de la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: de la brten pa yin te /
translated: or it is based on that.

original: dper na 'od ni sgron ma legs bar byas pa'i rjes su nges par 'jug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'od ni sgron ma legs bar byas pa'i rjes su nges par 'jug pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, light is necessarily associated with a well-made lamp.

original: de ma thag pa'i sems kyang sems snga ma legs par byas pa'i rjes su nges par 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i sems kyang sems snga ma legs par byas pa'i rjes su nges par 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The mind that immediately follows is definitely engaged in the wake of the previous mind‚Äôs activity. This is a natural inference.

original: gang zhig 'dus byas pa'i rjes su gang nges par mi 'jug pa de ni de'i dngos su nye bar len pa'i rgyu 'am lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dus byas pa'i rjes su gang nges par mi 'jug pa de ni de'i dngos su nye bar len pa'i rgyu 'am lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is not definitely engaged in the wake of a conditioned phenomenon is not its substantial cause or cooperative cause.

original: dper na gangs can 'bigs byed legs par byas pa'i rjes su nges par mi 'jug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gangs can 'bigs byed legs par byas pa'i rjes su nges par mi 'jug pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the Himalayas are not definitely engaged in the wake of the Vindhya mountains.
