original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang lus 'dus byas pa'i rjes su nges par 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas kyang 'gal bas khyab par dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang lus 'dus byas pa'i rjes su nges par 'jug pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas kyang 'gal bas khyab par dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The mental consciousness is not definitely engaged in the wake of the body‚Äôs conditioned activity. This is a second point to be proven. It is also a case of a pervasion by contradiction.

original: gang gi phyir dngos su lus nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin zhing lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de'i phyir de log pas blo'i rgyud rgyun chad pa ma yin no //üîΩsbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rgyud gnas pa'i phyir dngos su nye ba'i rgyu'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos su lus nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin zhing lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de'i phyir de log pas blo'i rgyud rgyun chad pa ma yin no // sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rgyud gnas pa'i phyir dngos su nye ba'i rgyu'am /
translated: Because the body is not the direct cause of appropriating the mind or the cooperative condition of the mind, therefore, the continuum of the mind is not severed when the body is destroyed.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de ni de log pa na nges par de log pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de ni de log pa na nges par de log pa ma yin te /
translated: The application is this: If something is not the direct cause or the cooperative condition of the continuum of something, then when the former ceases, the latter does not definitely cease.

original: dper na ba lang dang ba men lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ba lang dang ba men lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when oxen and buffalo are yoked to a single plow, when the oxen stop, the buffalo do not stop.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyud kyi yang lus ni dngos su nye bar len pa'i rgyu'am /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyud kyi yang lus ni dngos su nye bar len pa'i rgyu'am /
translated: The body is not the direct cause of appropriating the mind or the cooperative condition of the mind.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //üîΩgzhan @36b yang ci sems nyid nus pa'am /üîΩyon tan nam 'bras bu gang yin pa de lus las don gzhan du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o // gzhan @36b yang ci sems nyid nus pa'am / yon tan nam 'bras bu gang yin pa de lus las don gzhan du gyur pa'am /
translated: This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.üîΩMoreover, is the mind itself the potency, the quality, or the effect of the body?üîΩOr is it something other than the body?

original: 'on te lus nyid yin grang na /
analyzed: 'on te lus nyid yin grang na /
translated: Or is it the body itself?

original: don gzhan nyid yin na ni lus la brten pa ma yin no zhes lan mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: don gzhan nyid yin na ni lus la brten pa ma yin no zhes lan mang du bshad zin to //
translated: If it were a different thing, it would not be based on the body.

original: tha dad pa nyid ma yin na lus nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid ma yin na lus nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If it is not different, then it is the body itself.

original: ji ltar thos sogs 'dus byas pa //
analyzed: ji ltar thos sogs 'dus byas pa //
translated: How can hearing, etc. be conditioned?

original: sogs pa'i sgra smos pas ni bzo'i las kyi man ngag nan tan du byed pa 'dus byas pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra smos pas ni bzo'i las kyi man ngag nan tan du byed pa 'dus byas pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the conditioned crafts, the conditioned skills, and the conditioned instructions.

original: byas pas sems te dus gcig gi tshe sems la nges par ma bzung ba yang sems de nyid la dus su 'dus byas pa rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas pas sems te dus gcig gi tshe sems la nges par ma bzung ba yang sems de nyid la dus su 'dus byas pa rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind is conditioned by its production. Even when the mind is not grasped as a single entity, it is conditioned in relation to that very mind, and it manifests in accordance with its conditions.

original: thos pa la sogs pa 'dus byas pa las blo'i phul du 'byung ba dang / 'dus byas pa de nyid las dus gzhan du yon tan mngon par gsal ba de ltar lus la 'ang yon tan 'gyur /üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa 'dus byas pa las blo'i phul du 'byung ba dang / 'dus byas pa de nyid las dus gzhan du yon tan mngon par gsal ba de ltar lus la 'ang yon tan 'gyur / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Just as the excellence of the mind comes from the conditioned hearing, etc., and just as the excellence of those very conditioned faculties manifests at another time, so also the body has excellence.üîΩWhy?

original: tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in their causes.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba de 'dus byas pas na /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba de 'dus byas pas na /
translated: The application is this: that which becomes the nature of something is conditioned by that.

original: de 'dus byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'dus byas par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is conditioned.

original: dper na sems 'dus byas na sems de nyid 'dus byas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sems 'dus byas na sems de nyid 'dus byas pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, if mind is conditioned, that very mind is conditioned.

original: lus sems kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: lus sems kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit becomes the nature of body and mind‚Äù is a natural inference.

original: 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa de bas na 'dus byas pa na yang 'dus byas pa skye ba med pa'i phyir de ni de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang ma yin pa de bas na 'dus byas pa na yang 'dus byas pa skye ba med pa'i phyir de ni de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since it does not become conditioned, because the arising of the conditioned does not exist, it does not become its nature.

original: bzlog pa ni gang zhig 'dus byas pa na yang gang 'dus byas par 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni gang zhig 'dus byas pa na yang gang 'dus byas par 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: The opposite is this: that which, even though conditioned, does not become conditioned does not become its nature.

original: dper na snam bu 'dus byas pas bum pa 'dus byas pa ma yin pa ni snam bu'i bdag nyid ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na snam bu 'dus byas pas bum pa 'dus byas pa ma yin pa ni snam bu'i bdag nyid ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, because cloth is conditioned, a vase is not conditioned, and is not the nature of cloth.

original: thos pa la sogs pa'i 'dus byas pas yid kyi rnam bar shes pa 'dus byas pa na yang lus kyi 'dus byas pa'i yon tan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa'i 'dus byas pas yid kyi rnam bar shes pa 'dus byas pa na yang lus kyi 'dus byas pa'i yon tan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: If the mental consciousness is produced by hearing, etc., which are produced, then it is not a quality of the body which is produced. This is a non-observation of the pervader.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te lus kyi yon tan snang ba nyid las 'dus pa byed pa dang mngon par gsal ba'i dus dag gi thos pa la sogs pa 'dus byas pa lus kyi yon tan nye bar mtshon pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te lus kyi yon tan snang ba nyid las 'dus pa byed pa dang mngon par gsal ba'i dus dag gi thos pa la sogs pa 'dus byas pa lus kyi yon tan nye bar mtshon pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it unestablished, because the produced hearing, etc., which are the qualities of the body, are not perceived at the time of the production and manifestation of the body.

original: gang gi phyir de lta ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not so,

original: sems can gzhan gyis bkri min pa /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyis bkri min pa /
translated: it is not led by other sentient beings.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa la @37a * //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa la @37a * //
translated: It is not dependent on ƒ™≈õvara, etc.

original: rag las pa med pa'i srog chags gang yin pa 'di ni /üîΩdman pa'i gnas ni yongs su len //
analyzed: rag las pa med pa'i srog chags gang yin pa 'di ni / dman pa'i gnas ni yongs su len //
translated: This living beingüîΩtakes up a lowly state.

original: mngal gyi gnas yongs su len pa ste /
analyzed: mngal gyi gnas yongs su len pa ste /
translated: It takes up a womb-state,

original: mngon par chags pa sngon du song ba'i zhen pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par chags pa sngon du song ba'i zhen pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of which is ‚Äúattachment preceded by desire.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni yongs su len pa dang bcas pa'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni yongs su len pa dang bcas pa'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: This shows the cause of the possession of a body.

original: bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa'i srog chags rnams kyi bde ba thob par 'dod pa dang / sdug bsngal dor bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o /
analyzed: bdag la chags pa dang ldan pa'i srog chags rnams kyi bde ba thob par 'dod pa dang / sdug bsngal dor bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'i 'bras bu'o /
translated: The result of the valid cognition is the desire to obtain pleasure and the desire to avoid pain of those living beings who are attached to the self.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Cognition

original: bam po bco lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po bco lnga pa /
translated: Fifteenth chapter

original: sbyor ba yang gang zhig sems can gzhan gyis bkri bar bya ba ma yin pa dman pa'i gnas yongs su len pa de ni bdag la chags pa dang ldan pas sdug bsngal dang bde ba dor ba thob par 'dod pa sngon du song ba can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang gang zhig sems can gzhan gyis bkri bar bya ba ma yin pa dman pa'i gnas yongs su len pa de ni bdag la chags pa dang ldan pas sdug bsngal dang bde ba dor ba thob par 'dod pa sngon du song ba can yin te /
translated: The application is that which is not led by other sentient beings, the possession of a lowly state, which is preceded by the desire to obtain the avoidance of pain and pleasure due to being attached to the self.

original: dper na sbrang bu dag mi gtsang ba'i gnas yongs su len pa'am /
analyzed: dper na sbrang bu dag mi gtsang ba'i gnas yongs su len pa'am /
translated: For example, like flies possessing an unclean state,

original: 'dod chags can dag bud med kyi ro'i lus la sogs pa yongs su len pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags can dag bud med kyi ro'i lus la sogs pa yongs su len pa lta bu'o //
translated: or like the lustful possessing the body of a woman's corpse, and so on.

original: sems can gzhan gyis bkri ba ma yin pa yang dman pa'i gnas yongs su len pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyis bkri ba ma yin pa yang dman pa'i gnas yongs su len pa ste /
translated: Also, that which is not led by other sentient beings is the possession of a lowly state.

original: srog chags rnams mngal la sogs pa'i gnas yongs su lan to zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: srog chags rnams mngal la sogs pa'i gnas yongs su lan to zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe living beings are born from the womb, etc.‚Äù is a syllogistic reason based on effect.

original: skyes bu gnyid log ba las ltung ba'am /üîΩbag med pa mi gtsang ba dang g-yang sa la sogs pa'i gnas su ltung ba de bdag nyid 'dod pa dang gnas de len pa dang mngon par dga' bas ma yin pa de ltar na 'dis ma nges pa yin par dgos par ma gyur cig snyam pa de
analyzed: skyes bu gnyid log ba las ltung ba'am / bag med pa mi gtsang ba dang g-yang sa la sogs pa'i gnas su ltung ba de bdag nyid 'dod pa dang gnas de len pa dang mngon par dga' bas ma yin pa de ltar na 'dis ma nges pa yin par dgos par ma gyur cig snyam pa de
translated: A man who falls asleep and falls down,üîΩor who falls down carelessly into an impure place, a ravine, etc., does not do so because he desires it, because he wants that place, or because he delights in it.

original: nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, this is not a conclusive reason.

original: yongs su len pa'i sgras mngon par chags pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su len pa'i sgras mngon par chags pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúgrasping‚Äù indicates attachment.

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is this unestablished.

original: sngar dbang phyug gsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar dbang phyug gsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Because previously the existence of God was established.

original: ci'i phyir gzhan gyis bkri ba nyid yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan gyis bkri ba nyid yin /
translated: Why is it that he is led by another?

original: gang gi phyir sman pa'i gnas la mngon bar chags pa ni sdug bsngal la bde ba blo'i mtshan nyid can yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sman pa'i gnas la mngon bar chags pa ni sdug bsngal la bde ba blo'i mtshan nyid can yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Because one who is attached to the status of a physician has a mind that regards suffering as happiness.üîΩIn that case,

original: sdug bsngal des mngal la sogs pa'i gnas la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal des mngal la sogs pa'i gnas la /
translated: by that suffering,

original: phyin ci ldog blo dang / de'i bde ba yin no zhes bya ba de'i rgyun can te /
analyzed: phyin ci ldog blo dang / de'i bde ba yin no zhes bya ba de'i rgyun can te /
translated: and the mind that is in error, and the continuum of that, is the pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal dang bde ba dor ba dang thob pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bde ba dor ba dang thob pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The characteristic of the pleasure is the attainment of pleasure and the avoidance of pain.

original: sred pa ni skye ba'i kun nas 'chi ba'i rgyu srid pa'i sgo nas bdag tu chags pa yang phangs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sred pa ni skye ba'i kun nas 'chi ba'i rgyu srid pa'i sgo nas bdag tu chags pa yang phangs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Craving is the cause of the arising of the thirst for existence, and the attachment to the self is the cause of the desire for the dear.

original: de ni lung @37b gi don ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni lung @37b gi don ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation of the meaning of the scripture.

original: srog chag gis yang yang sred pa dang phyin ci log pa blo med pa yin te /
analyzed: srog chag gis yang yang sred pa dang phyin ci log pa blo med pa yin te /
translated: The mind that is in error is the craving for existence, and the mind that is not in error is the non-craving for existence.

original: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu mngon par zhen pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The purpose of the teaching is to abandon attachment to the self.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir de'i skye ba mi 'thob po //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir de'i skye ba mi 'thob po //
translated: Because there is no cause, the arising of the mind that is in error is not obtained.

original: de'i tshe 'khor ba las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khor ba las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, one is liberated from samsara.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is the way it is.

original: gal te 'gro 'ong ma mthong na /
analyzed: gal te 'gro 'ong ma mthong na /
translated: If one does not see coming and going,

original: sems can skye ba yongs su len par byed pa'i ngang tshul can du mngon par 'dod pa 'di'i 'di nas ma 'ongs par 'gro ba mi mthong ba dang / snga ma'i gnas las mngal gyi gnas su 'gro ba mi mthong ba de ltar na /
analyzed: sems can skye ba yongs su len par byed pa'i ngang tshul can du mngon par 'dod pa 'di'i 'di nas ma 'ongs par 'gro ba mi mthong ba dang / snga ma'i gnas las mngal gyi gnas su 'gro ba mi mthong ba de ltar na /
translated: But you do not see the sentient being who is to be born coming from anywhere, nor do you see it going from the womb to a previous abode.

original: ji ltar na 'di 'ga' zhig las 'ongs nas mngal gyi gnas yongs su len pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di 'ga' zhig las 'ongs nas mngal gyi gnas yongs su len pa yin te /
translated: So how could it be that it comes from somewhere and then takes up residence in the womb?

original: sbyor ba ni 'ga' zhig gi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi mthong ba de ni 'ga' zhig las 'ongs nas 'ga' zhig du gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'ga' zhig gi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba mi mthong ba de ni 'ga' zhig las 'ongs nas 'ga' zhig du gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: You do not see the movement of someone coming or going, so you think that it does not come from anywhere and go to any place.

original: dper na 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ma mthong ba can gyi mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ma mthong ba can gyi mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
translated: But it is like the son of a barren woman, whose coming and going you do not see.üîΩYou do not see the coming and going of this sentient being in the womb, etc.

original: srog chags 'di'i mngal la sogs par 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin par sems so //
analyzed: srog chags 'di'i mngal la sogs par 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin par sems so //
translated: You think that this is a nonobservation of the omnipresent.

original: khyod kyis dbang po mi gsal ba'i rgyu'i phyir ma mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyis dbang po mi gsal ba'i rgyu'i phyir ma mthong ba yin no //
translated: We say that you do not see it because of the cause of unclear faculties.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dper na mig mi gsal ba can gyi skyes bus du ba chung du mi dmigs bzhin /
analyzed: dper na mig mi gsal ba can gyi skyes bus du ba chung du mi dmigs bzhin /
translated: For example, it is like a person with unclear vision who does not perceive a small amount of smoke.üîΩFor example, it is like a person with impaired vision who does not ascertain a subtle amount of smoke.

original: dper na mig nyams pa can gyis du ba cha phra ba nges par mi 'dzin pa de dang 'dra ba de ltar na 'dis ni spang bar bya ba dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ma yin pa ma mthong du zin kyang /
analyzed: dper na mig nyams pa can gyis du ba cha phra ba nges par mi 'dzin pa de dang 'dra ba de ltar na 'dis ni spang bar bya ba dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ma yin pa ma mthong du zin kyang /
translated: In that case, although one does not see what is characterized by the perception of what is to be abandoned,

original: med par ma grub pa'i phyir ma nges par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: med par ma grub pa'i phyir ma nges par bstan pa yin no //
translated: because nonexistence is not established, it is shown to be indeterminate.

original: ci ste gzhan dag gis kyang ma mthong ba de ltar na gtan tshigs kyi don de ni ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan dag gis kyang ma mthong ba de ltar na gtan tshigs kyi don de ni ma grub pa yin te /
translated: But if others also do not see it, then the meaning of the reason is not established,

original: de ltar na 'ga' zhig gis mthong ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'ga' zhig gis mthong ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: because in that case it would be seen by someone.

original: 'ga' zhig gis phra ba dang dri la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa med pa rnams grog sbur la sogs pa sna'i dbang po gsal ba can rnams kyis dmigs pa de ltar na rang gi mthong ba ldog pa tsam gnod pa can ma yin pa'i phyir spang bar
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis phra ba dang dri la sogs pa nye bar mtshon pa med pa rnams grog sbur la sogs pa sna'i dbang po gsal ba can rnams kyis dmigs pa de ltar na rang gi mthong ba ldog pa tsam gnod pa can ma yin pa'i phyir spang bar
translated: Some say: Those subtle particles that do not adjoin and do not possess smell and so on are observed by those with clear sense faculties, such as ants.

original: bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not to be refuted, since it is not contradictory that they are seen by some.

original: yod pa'i tha snyad la rjes su dpag pa yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: yod pa'i tha snyad la rjes su dpag pa yang bshad zin to //
translated: Inference is also explained in relation to the convention of existence.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na /
translated: If that were so,

original: srog chags lus dang ldan par 'jug pa la lus kyi rnam pa dang ldan pa @38a * //
analyzed: srog chags lus dang ldan par 'jug pa la lus kyi rnam pa dang ldan pa @38a * //
translated: then the body of an animal would not obscure the body of a human.

original: ji ltar na sgrib par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar na sgrib par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: How could it not obscure?

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang lud dang ldan pa nyid du khas len pa de ni lus gzhan la sgrib par byed pa nyid du 'dod par bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang lud dang ldan pa nyid du khas len pa de ni lus gzhan la sgrib par byed pa nyid du 'dod par bya ste /
translated: Whatever is accepted as possessing the quality of being a heap is to be accepted as obscuring another body,

original: dper na snam bu dang bum pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na snam bu dang bum pa lta bu'o //
translated: like a blanket or a pot.

original: khyod kyis sngar gyi lus kyang lus can nyid du 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par sems so //
analyzed: khyod kyis sngar gyi lus kyang lus can nyid du 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin par sems so //
translated: You admit that the former body is material. This is a natural reason.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs 'dis ni ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs 'dis ni ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Here the reason is inconclusive.

original: de ltar na rdzas 'ga' lus can dag yin yang /
analyzed: de ltar na rdzas 'ga' lus can dag yin yang /
translated: Thus, although some substances are material,

original: srab pa nyid de dang ba nyid kyi rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: srab pa nyid de dang ba nyid kyi rgyu'i phyir /
translated: they are not resistant because of their subtlety, their transparency.

original: gzugs can gzhan la lar thogs can min par mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs can gzhan la lar thogs can min par mthong ngo //
translated: We see that in some material things, although they are material, they are not resistant.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is the example?

original: chu bzhin te bum pa la sogs pa lus can la chu lus can yin du zin kyang 'dzag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: chu bzhin te bum pa la sogs pa lus can la chu lus can yin du zin kyang 'dzag pa nyid yin no //
translated: Water, for example, is material, but it is not resistant.

original: gser dang dngul chu bzhin /
analyzed: gser dang dngul chu bzhin /
translated: Gold and silver are like water.

original: dngul chu lus can yin du zin kyang gser gyi rjes su 'jug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dngul chu lus can yin du zin kyang gser gyi rjes su 'jug pa lta bu'o //
translated: Silver is material, but it is not resistant.

original: nyi ma'i zer gyis kyang shel phigs nas shing la 'jug par byed pa de ltar na ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma'i zer gyis kyang shel phigs nas shing la 'jug par byed pa de ltar na ma nges pa yin no //
translated: The sun's rays, having penetrated a crystal, enter into wood. Thus the reason is inconclusive.

original: ma mthong phyir yang med nyid min //
analyzed: ma mthong phyir yang med nyid min //
translated: It is not nonexistence because it is not perceived.

original: de ltar ma mthong ba zhes bya ba mi snang ba tsam las kyang med pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ltar na spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma mthong ba zhes bya ba mi snang ba tsam las kyang med pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin pa de ltar na spang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not the case that what is called ‚Äúnot seeing‚Äù is mere non-appearance, nor is it non-existence.

original: gzhan yang lus sems kyi nye bar len par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni gcig gam du mar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang lus sems kyi nye bar len par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni gcig gam du mar 'gyur grang na /
translated: Moreover, if you assert that the body and mind are appropriated, are they one or many?

original: re zhig gcig ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig gcig ma yin no //
translated: First, they are not one.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lag sogs g-yon thams cad dag / lus kyang g-yo ba thob phyir te /
analyzed: lag sogs g-yon thams cad dag / lus kyang g-yo ba thob phyir te /
translated: Because all the left and right parts of the body, such as the hands, are obtained as moving.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not different.

original: de'i gcig g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: de'i gcig g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that one of them moves and the other does not,

original: gcig pa nyid nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would undermine their oneness.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las tha dad pa med pa de ni g-yo pa na g-yo ba yin te dper na rang gi ngo bo nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las tha dad pa med pa de ni g-yo pa na g-yo ba yin te dper na rang gi ngo bo nyid lta bu'o //
translated: The application is this: Whatever is not different from something moves when that moves, like its own nature.

original: rkang pa la sogs pa yang lag pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i bdag nyid can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rkang pa la sogs pa yang lag pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i bdag nyid can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The feet, etc., are not of the nature of the hand, which is different from it. This is a natural reason.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not so.

original: de las bzlog pa ni gang zhig gang g-yo ba na mi g-yo ba de ni de las tha mi dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni gang zhig gang g-yo ba na mi g-yo ba de ni de las tha mi dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The opposite of that is: that which does not move when this moves is not different from it.

original: dper na lha sbyin 'gro ba na mchod sbyin 'dug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin 'gro ba na mchod sbyin 'dug pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when Devadatta moves, Yajnadatta does not.

original: rkang pa la sogs pa yang lag pa g-yo ba na mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pa la sogs pa yang lag pa g-yo ba na mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The feet, etc., do not move when the hand moves. This is a non-observation of a related object.

original: 'gal ba can gyi las ni gcig la mi rung phyir gcig la @38b 'gal pa'i las ni mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gal ba can gyi las ni gcig la mi rung phyir gcig la @38b 'gal pa'i las ni mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: An action that is contradictory is not possible for one thing. The meaning is: an action that is contradictory is not possible for one thing.

original: dper na g-yas dang g-yon gyi lag pa gnyis po dag ni yul tha dad par 'gro bar rung ba ma yin pa lta bu ste //
analyzed: dper na g-yas dang g-yon gyi lag pa gnyis po dag ni yul tha dad par 'gro bar rung ba ma yin pa lta bu ste //
translated: For example, the two hands, right and left, are not suitable to go to different places.

original: lag pa g-yas pa lho phyogs su 'gro ba na /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa lho phyogs su 'gro ba na /
translated: When the right hand goes south,

original: g-yon pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: g-yon pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The same would be true of the left side.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te gang gi phyir tha dad par 'gro ba de'i phyir gcig nyid yin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te gang gi phyir tha dad par 'gro ba de'i phyir gcig nyid yin par mi rigs so //
translated: This is not so, because they move separately, and therefore it is not reasonable that they are one.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur na /
translated: If this were so,

original: yan lag g-yo ba yin gyi yan lag can ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: yan lag g-yo ba yin gyi yan lag can ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: the parts would move, but the whole would not.

original: thal ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub cing bzlog pa ni grub pa pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: thal ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub cing bzlog pa ni grub pa pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In that case, the reductio argument would not be established, and the opposite would be established.

original: gzhan du tha dad grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du tha dad grub par 'gyur /
translated: If they were different, they would be established as different.

original: de ltar na yan lag dang yan lag can tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yan lag dang yan lag can tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the parts and the whole would be different.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang g-yo ba ni bdag nyid mi g-yo ba de ni de las tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang g-yo ba ni bdag nyid mi g-yo ba de ni de las tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever moves but whose self does not move is different from it,

original: dper na chu g-yo ba na snod mi g-yo ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chu g-yo ba na snod mi g-yo ba lta bu'o //
translated: like a moving water pot.

original: yan lag can yang yan lag rnam g-yo ba na mi g-yo ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yan lag can yang yan lag rnam g-yo ba na mi g-yo ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The whole moves, but its parts do not move. This is a syllogism of essential nature.

original: 'di nyid bzlog pa ni gang zhig gang las ldan pa can gyi yul tha dad pa can ma yin pa de ni de g-yo ba na yang mi g-yo ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid bzlog pa ni gang zhig gang las ldan pa can gyi yul tha dad pa can ma yin pa de ni de g-yo ba na yang mi g-yo ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The reversal of this is: Whatever is not a different object from that which possesses it does not remain unobscured when that is obscured.

original: dper na lag pa de nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lag pa de nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the very nature of the hand itself.

original: lus kyang lag pa las ldan pa can gyi yul tha dad pa can ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o gcig bsgribs pa na ste phyogs gcig bsgribs pa na /
analyzed: lus kyang lag pa las ldan pa can gyi yul tha dad pa can ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o gcig bsgribs pa na ste phyogs gcig bsgribs pa na /
translated: The body is not a different object from the hand. This is a non-observation of a pervader.

original: lhag ma thams cad dag bsgribs par 'gyur te tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma thams cad dag bsgribs par 'gyur te tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one part is obscured, all the rest are obscured, because they are not different.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang kho na yin pa de ni de bsgribs pas na bsgribs pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang kho na yin pa de ni de bsgribs pas na bsgribs pa ste /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is that which is obscured when that is obscured,

original: dper na de nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na de nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the very nature of the hand itself.

original: ma bsgribs pa yang bsgribs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa yang bsgribs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The unobscured is also obscured. This is a natural inference.

original: bsgribs pa yang ma yin pa de bas na tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgribs pa yang ma yin pa de bas na tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are different.

original: bzlog pa ni gang zhig gang bsgribs pa ma bsgribs pa de ni de nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni gang zhig gang bsgribs pa ma bsgribs pa de ni de nyid ma yin te /
translated: The opposite is that which is not obscured when something is obscured.

original: dper na ba lang bsgribs pa na rta ma bsgribs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ba lang bsgribs pa na rta ma bsgribs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when a cow is obscured, a horse is not obscured.üîΩAnd when a hand is obscured, a foot is not obscured.üîΩThis is the non-apprehension of the pervader.

original: rkang ba yang lag pa bsgribs pa na ma bsgribs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi yan lag bsgribs pan yan lag can ma yin no zhe na /üîΩde'i tshe ma bsgribs na ji ltar sngar de mthong ba de ltar phyogs @39a * //
analyzed: rkang ba yang lag pa bsgribs pa na ma bsgribs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi yan lag bsgribs pan yan lag can ma yin no zhe na / de'i tshe ma bsgribs na ji ltar sngar de mthong ba de ltar phyogs @39a * //
translated: But even though this is so, when a part is obscured, the whole is not obscured.

original: gcig bsgribs su zin kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig bsgribs su zin kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then when it is not obscured, how can it be seen as it was seen before, when it was completely obscured?

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang rgyu tshogs pa gags byed pa med pa can yin pa de'i skye ba yod pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang rgyu tshogs pa gags byed pa med pa can yin pa de'i skye ba yod pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is a collection of causes without obstruction, its arising exists,

original: dper na rgyu tshogs pa gags byed pa med pa can gyi myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyu tshogs pa gags byed pa med pa can gyi myu gu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, a sprout, etc., whose collection of causes is without obstruction.

original: yan lag can gyi yul can gyi mthong ba la yang rgyu tshogs pa gags byed pa med pa can yod do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi yul can gyi mthong ba la yang rgyu tshogs pa gags byed pa med pa can yod do zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The argument is by nature a proof.

original: gal te rang gi yan lag 'dzin pa'i thabs mthong ba can de la bsgribs pa na mthong ba med pa'i phyir ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi yan lag 'dzin pa'i thabs mthong ba can de la bsgribs pa na mthong ba med pa'i phyir ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the proof is not established because when the possessor of parts is obstructed from seeing the parts, it does not see them,

original: ma yin te yan lag thams can mthong ba mi srid pas na /
analyzed: ma yin te yan lag thams can mthong ba mi srid pas na /
translated: then that is not so, because it is impossible to see all the parts.

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba mthong ba med pa can de nyid mthong bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba mthong ba med pa can de nyid mthong bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is accepted that it sees only the collection of the parts.

original: gzhan yang phyogs gcig tshon gyis bsgyur ba na phyogs thams cad bsgyur ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyogs gcig tshon gyis bsgyur ba na phyogs thams cad bsgyur ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if one part is colored, all parts would be colored.

original: de la tha dad pa yong pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: de la tha dad pa yong pa ni ma yin na /
translated: If they are not different,

original: gang gis na cung zhig bsgyur ba dang cung zhig ma yin /
analyzed: gang gis na cung zhig bsgyur ba dang cung zhig ma yin /
translated: how could one part be colored and one part not?

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang kho na yin pas de ni de bsgyur ba na bsgyur ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang kho na yin pas de ni de bsgyur ba na bsgyur ba nyid yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is that is colored when one part is colored.

original: dper na mtshon gyis bsgyur ba'i rang gi ngo bo lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mtshon gyis bsgyur ba'i rang gi ngo bo lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like the essence of something that is transformed by a weapon.

original: ma bsgyur ba yang bsgyur ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ma bsgyur ba yang bsgyur ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And that which is not transformed is transformed. This is a natural inference.

original: bsgyur ba yang ma yin pa de bas na bzlog pa ni gang zhig gang bsgyur ba na ma bsgyur ba de ni de las tha dad pa yin te dper na la ba bsgyur ba na snam bu ma bsgyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsgyur ba yang ma yin pa de bas na bzlog pa ni gang zhig gang bsgyur ba na ma bsgyur ba de ni de las tha dad pa yin te dper na la ba bsgyur ba na snam bu ma bsgyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: That which is not transformed is different from that which is transformed. For example, when a cloth is transformed, a blanket is not transformed.

original: phyogs gnyis pa yang phyogs gcig bsgyur ba na bsgyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa yang phyogs gcig bsgyur ba na bsgyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The second position is also that when one part is transformed, it is not transformed. This is the non-observation of the pervader.

original: gzhan yang bsgyur ba mi rtogs 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsgyur ba mi rtogs 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, the transformed would not be cognized.

original: bsgyur ba'i phyogs dang ma bsgyur ba'i phyogs dang 'dra bar mthong bar 'gyur te tha dad ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgyur ba'i phyogs dang ma bsgyur ba'i phyogs dang 'dra bar mthong bar 'gyur te tha dad ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The transformed part and the untransformed part would be seen as similar, because there would be no difference.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang kho na yin pa de ni de ma bsgyur ba na ma bsgyur ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang kho na yin pa de ni de ma bsgyur ba na ma bsgyur ba yin te /
translated: The application is this: That which is that very thing is not transformed when it is not transformed.

original: dper na ma bsgyur ba'i rang gi ngo bo lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ma bsgyur ba'i rang gi ngo bo lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the nature of something that has not been transformed.

original: bsgyur bar mngon par 'dod pa yang ma bsgyur ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: bsgyur bar mngon par 'dod pa yang ma bsgyur ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And that which is held to be transformed is just that which has not been transformed. This is a natural inference.

original: lus dang bum pa la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: lus dang bum pa la sogs pa'i //
translated: The body, the pot, and so on,

original: de phyir tshogs pa gcig yong min //
analyzed: de phyir tshogs pa gcig yong min //
translated: therefore, are not a single collection.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: Because of the reason just explained. This is the conclusion.

original: gal te rdul gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis brtsams pa'i yan lag can gcig yod pa ma yin @39b pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te rdul gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis brtsams pa'i yan lag can gcig yod pa ma yin @39b pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the whole that is constructed gradually, beginning with a second particle, does not exist,

original: du ma nyid yin na khas len na yang ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams kyi gnas skabs de sngar dbang po la sogs pa yin na /
analyzed: du ma nyid yin na khas len na yang ji ltar rdul phra rab rnams kyi gnas skabs de sngar dbang po la sogs pa yin na /
translated: then, even if you accept that it is manifold, how is it that the condition of the subtle particles is first the sense faculties and so on,üîΩand later it is just that?

original: phyis kyang de nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: phyis kyang de nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: In that case,

original: sngar bzhin khyad par med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sngar bzhin khyad par med pa'i phyir //
translated: because there is no difference from before,

original: dbang po las 'das pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be beyond the senses.

original: phra phyir de rdul phra mo gang yin pa de dang de dag ji ltar sngar yin pa de ltar tshogs su zin kyang /
analyzed: phra phyir de rdul phra mo gang yin pa de dang de dag ji ltar sngar yin pa de ltar tshogs su zin kyang /
translated: Because it is subtle, it is not coarse.üîΩüîΩ

original: dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin no //
translated: And because they are subtle, they are beyond the senses, just as they were before, even though they have come together.

original: de ltar na mi rtogs pa ste 'ga' zhig shes kyang mthong ba thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na mi rtogs pa ste 'ga' zhig shes kyang mthong ba thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, they are not perceived. Even if one of them is known, the others are not seen.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig dbang po las 'das pa'i ngo bor khyad par med pa de ni dbang po las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig dbang po las 'das pa'i ngo bor khyad par med pa de ni dbang po las 'das pa yin te /
translated: The argument is this: That which is not distinguished as having a nature beyond the senses is beyond the senses,

original: dper na rdul phran rnams kyis sngar gyi gnas skabs lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rdul phran rnams kyis sngar gyi gnas skabs lta bu'o //
translated: just as the atoms were before.

original: phyis 'byung ba'i gnas skabs mthong bar mngon par 'dod pa yang dbang po las 'das pa'i ngo bor khyad par med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i gnas skabs mthong bar mngon par 'dod pa yang dbang po las 'das pa'i ngo bor khyad par med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the later state, which is held to be seen, is not distinguished as having a nature beyond the senses. This is a natural inference.

original: rdul phran gang yin pa de dag ni dbang po las 'das pa yin te gnas skabs snga ma rdul phran dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: rdul phran gang yin pa de dag ni dbang po las 'das pa yin te gnas skabs snga ma rdul phran dag lta bu'o //
translated: Those atoms are beyond the senses, just as the atoms were in the previous state.

original: phyis kyang rdul phran yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyis kyang rdul phran yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid yin no //
translated: The later ones are also atoms. This is a natural inference.

original: gang dang gang dbyer mi nus shing snga ma'i ngo bo las 'pho ba med pa can yin pa de ni lhan cig pa yin du zin kyang mi nus pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang dbyer mi nus shing snga ma'i ngo bo las 'pho ba med pa can yin pa de ni lhan cig pa yin du zin kyang mi nus pa nyid yin te /
translated: Whatever is not divisible and does not change from its former nature, even if it is simultaneous, it is still not capable.

original: dper na long bas nyi ma mthong ba la dbyer mi nus shing lhan cig tu zin kyang mi nus pa yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na long bas nyi ma mthong ba la dbyer mi nus shing lhan cig tu zin kyang mi nus pa yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the blind man sees the sun. Even if it is simultaneous, it is not capable.

original: phyis kyi rdul phra rab rnams kyang dbang po'i rnam par shes pa tha dad ba skyed par mi nus shing /üîΩsngar gyi ngo bo las 'phos pa med pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: phyis kyi rdul phra rab rnams kyang dbang po'i rnam par shes pa tha dad ba skyed par mi nus shing / sngar gyi ngo bo las 'phos pa med pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The later atoms also are not capable of producing a different sense consciousness.üîΩThey do not change from their former nature. This is a natural inference.

original: khyad med mi 'grub ces bya ba 'dis ni gtan tshigs snga ma dang phyi ma ma grub pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: khyad med mi 'grub ces bya ba 'dis ni gtan tshigs snga ma dang phyi ma ma grub pa ston par byed do //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is not established as undifferentiated‚Äù shows that the previous reason is not established.

original: de ltar na de'i gnas skabs de ni snang ba dang nus pa skye ba gzhan nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na de'i gnas skabs de ni snang ba dang nus pa skye ba gzhan nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, the state of the atoms is different from the state in which the appearance and the capacity are produced.

original: gang la 'jig rten bum pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩrdul phra rab dbang po las 'das pa gang yin pa de dag nyid kyang phyis ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang la 'jig rten bum pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug par 'gyur ba'o // rdul phra rab dbang po las 'das pa gang yin pa de dag nyid kyang phyis ma yin gyi /
translated: The atoms are the basis of the conventional expressions of the world, such as ‚Äúpot,‚Äù etc.

original: 'on kyang de dag la brten nas khyad bar can gzhan nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩkhyad par can de rnams /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag la brten nas khyad bar can gzhan nyid skye bar 'gyur ro // khyad par can de rnams /
translated: The atoms which are beyond the senses are not the basis of the conventional expressions, but rather, the special things which are based on the atoms.üîΩThe special things are the basis of the conventional expressions.

original: dbang pos gzung yin de phyir te //üîΩdbang pos gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang pos gzung yin de phyir te // dbang pos gzung bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are perceived by the senses.üîΩThe atoms are not the basis of the conventional expressions, because they are not perceived by the senses.

original: rdul phran min te gtan tshigs gnyis pa yang ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rdul phran min te gtan tshigs gnyis pa yang ma grub pa yin no //
translated: The second reason is not established.

original: @40a * // de'i tshe rdul phran de dag tha snyad kyi yul ma yin no //
analyzed: @40a * // de'i tshe rdul phran de dag tha snyad kyi yul ma yin no //
translated: At that time, the atoms are not the objects of the conventional expressions.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?üîΩThey are the bodies, etc.

original: lus la sogs pa'i tha snyad du bya ba de dag yin te ji ltar snam bu'i gnas skabs can gyi snal ma rnams la snal ma zhes mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i tha snyad du bya ba de dag yin te ji ltar snam bu'i gnas skabs can gyi snal ma rnams la snal ma zhes mi brjod kyi /
translated: Just as the threads which have the state of the cloth are not called ‚Äúthreads,‚Äù but are called ‚Äúcloth,‚Äù so the atoms which have the state of the pot, etc. are not called ‚Äúatoms,‚Äù but are called ‚Äúpot,‚Äù etc.

original: 'on kyang snam bu zhes bya ba yin ba de ltar na /
analyzed: 'on kyang snam bu zhes bya ba yin ba de ltar na /
translated: But if it is the case that the name cloth is applied to the collection of threads,

original: lus la sogs pa'i gnas skabs can gyi rdul phran rnams la yang rdul phran gyi tha snyad du mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i gnas skabs can gyi rdul phran rnams la yang rdul phran gyi tha snyad du mi byed pa yin no //
translated: then the name atom should not be applied to the atoms that have the condition of being a body, etc.

original: bshad ma thag pa mi snang ba nyid spong ba /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa mi snang ba nyid spong ba /
translated: The refutation of the nonappearance just explained

original: des ni sgrib byed la sogs rnams //
analyzed: des ni sgrib byed la sogs rnams //
translated: The atoms are not obstructed, etc.,

original: sogs pas ni thogs pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pas ni thogs pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The word etc. includes being impeded, etc.

original: med pa rnams kyang 'di ltar gal te rdzas gcig mi 'dod pa de'i tshe ji ltar de dag gi snga ma'i gnas skabs kyi rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo sgrib par byed pa dang thob par mi byed pa de ltar phyis kyi yang khyad par med pa'i phyir
analyzed: med pa rnams kyang 'di ltar gal te rdzas gcig mi 'dod pa de'i tshe ji ltar de dag gi snga ma'i gnas skabs kyi rdul phra rab kyi ngo bo sgrib par byed pa dang thob par mi byed pa de ltar phyis kyi yang khyad par med pa'i phyir
translated: If you do not accept that they are one substance, then just as the atoms in the prior state do not obstruct or impede, the atoms in the subsequent state would not obstruct or impede, because there is no difference.

original: sgrib par byed pa ma yin pa dang / thogs par byed par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: sgrib par byed pa ma yin pa dang / thogs par byed par mi 'gyur ba de ltar na bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, they would not be obstructive or impeding.

original: de ltar na snga ma las mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar skyes pa gzhan gang yin pa de nyid ni de ltar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na snga ma las mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar skyes pa gzhan gang yin pa de nyid ni de ltar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, that which is born with a different characteristic from the previous one is just that which does it.

original: rdzas su rtogs pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su rtogs pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to understand it as a substance.

original: gzhan yang gal te rdzas med par ma mthong ba de lta na ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te rdzas med par ma mthong ba de lta na ni /
translated: Moreover, if it is not seen as a non-substance,

original: gser dang dngul chu la sogs 'dres par gyur pa na rdul phra rab kyis chod pa'i phyir ji ltar snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gser dang dngul chu la sogs 'dres par gyur pa na rdul phra rab kyis chod pa'i phyir ji ltar snang bar 'gyur /
translated: then when gold, silver, mercury, etc. are mixed, how could they appear, since they are separated by subtle particles?

original: de la rigs mi mthun pa'i rdul phra rab phrad pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de la rigs mi mthun pa'i rdul phra rab phrad pa nyid yin pa de ltar na /
translated: In that case, since subtle particles of different types come into contact,

original: rdzas rtsom pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas rtsom pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: it is not the composition of a substance.

original: rigs mthun pa phrad de tshogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams kyi rdzas rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa phrad de tshogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams kyi rdzas rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the subtle particles of the same type that come into contact and assemble are the composition of a substance.

original: de med pa'i phyir 'dres pa de ji ltar snang bar 'gyur rdzas med par yang snang ba de ltar na rtogs pa de don med ba can yin no //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir 'dres pa de ji ltar snang bar 'gyur rdzas med par yang snang ba de ltar na rtogs pa de don med ba can yin no //
translated: Since that does not exist, how could that mixture appear? If it appears as a non-substance, then that understanding is meaningless.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni 'o ma dang chu la sogs pa gzhan 'dres pa yang gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni 'o ma dang chu la sogs pa gzhan 'dres pa yang gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the root text includes the mixing of other substances, such as milk and water.

original: rdo tshan la sogs ji ltar snang //
analyzed: rdo tshan la sogs ji ltar snang //
translated: How can a mirage and so on appear?

original: ji ltar ra me'i rdul phra rab rnams dang / shing dang rdo la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun 'dres par gyur pa de ltar na rigs mi mthun ba la rdzas rtsom pa med pa'i phyir rdzas med pas ma mthong ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar ra me'i rdul phra rab rnams dang / shing dang rdo la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun 'dres par gyur pa de ltar na rigs mi mthun ba la rdzas rtsom pa med pa'i phyir rdzas med pas ma mthong ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the particles of a mirage and the particles of wood and stone, etc., are mutually mixed, so too, since there is no composition of substances in heterogeneous substances, they are not seen because they are not substances.

original: gang dbyer mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba la yang /
analyzed: gang dbyer mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba la yang /
translated: In the argument, ‚Äúbecause they cannot be separated,‚Äù

original: khyed kyi 'dod pas ma nges pa yin te /üîΩgang dbyer mi nus shing ngo bo las 'pho ba med pa can yin pa de ni lhan cig pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: khyed kyi 'dod pas ma nges pa yin te / gang dbyer mi nus shing ngo bo las 'pho ba med pa can yin pa de ni lhan cig pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: the meaning is not established by your assertion.üîΩThat which cannot be separated and does not move from its nature is simultaneous.

original: nus pa med par 'dod pa de'i tshe //
analyzed: nus pa med par 'dod pa de'i tshe //
translated: But even if it is asserted that it is not capable of being separated,

original: dbang po la sogs @40b so sor nus med rnams //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs @40b so sor nus med rnams //
translated: then the sense faculties, etc., are individually incapable of being separated.

original: mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang / yid la byed pa bdag nyid kyi ngo bo las 'pho ba mang pa de dag rnams kyi phyis kyang rtogs pa de dag ste /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang / yid la byed pa bdag nyid kyi ngo bo las 'pho ba mang pa de dag rnams kyi phyis kyang rtogs pa de dag ste /
translated: The eye, form, light, and mental activity, which are many, are the causes of the arising of consciousness.

original: shes pa bskyed pa 'jig rten ltar yin no //
analyzed: shes pa bskyed pa 'jig rten ltar yin no //
translated: The arising of consciousness is like the arising of the world.

original: de ltar grub pa yang ma yin na 'dod ngo //
analyzed: de ltar grub pa yang ma yin na 'dod ngo //
translated: If it is not established in this way, then what is it?

original: bde na te lhan cig pa yin du zin kyang de dag nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bde na te lhan cig pa yin du zin kyang de dag nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: If it is pleasure, then even though it is simultaneous, it is still pleasure.

original: 'on kyang de dag gis ldan pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gis ldan pa skyed par byed do //
translated: But it is not pleasure that produces the possessor of pleasure.

original: de pas na gal te de dag lhan cig las shes pa de yin gyi de dag las ma yin no zhe na re zhig ldan pa la yin la yang bla ste /
analyzed: de pas na gal te de dag lhan cig las shes pa de yin gyi de dag las ma yin no zhe na re zhig ldan pa la yin la yang bla ste /
translated: Therefore, if consciousness is produced from the simultaneous union of these, not from them individually, then it is still possible that the possessor of pleasure is produced from the simultaneous union of pleasure, etc.

original: de ltar na yang dbang po la sogs pa yang de'i tshe byed ba po nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang dbang po la sogs pa yang de'i tshe byed ba po nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: But in that case, the sense faculties, etc. are also accepted as the agents at that time.

original: de rnams kyi byed pa po nyid sngar yong pa ma yin pa nyid yin na de gang las yin par 'dod na yang ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi byed pa po nyid sngar yong pa ma yin pa nyid yin na de gang las yin par 'dod na yang ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: If their agency is not prior, then from what are they accepted as existing? They are still unestablished.

original: gzhan yang 'dir thal mtshungs /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir thal mtshungs /
translated: Moreover, here there is a reductio.

original: ji ltar de dag shes pa skyed pa'i phyir sngar nus pa med pa de ltar phyis kyang ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag shes pa skyed pa'i phyir sngar nus pa med pa de ltar phyis kyang ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: Just as they are not previously able to generate consciousness, so too they are not able to generate it later.

original: ldan pa skyed na yang de dag ji ltar na byed pa po yin 'dod pas yang yin pa de ltar na len nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: ldan pa skyed na yang de dag ji ltar na byed pa po yin 'dod pas yang yin pa de ltar na len nyid ma yin no //
translated: If they generate possession, then just as they are asserted to be agents, so too they would be possessors.

original: kho bo yi ni tshogs pa mchod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa can gzhan nyid yin pa gang yin pa de ni nus pa yin pa de ltar na kho na mtho ba med do //
analyzed: kho bo yi ni tshogs pa mchod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa can gzhan nyid yin pa gang yin pa de ni nus pa yin pa de ltar na kho na mtho ba med do //
translated: But for us, the mere collection of eyes and so on is not the possessor, but that which is different from it, the possessor, is the one that is able to generate consciousness.

original: gal te gser dang dngul chu yi //
analyzed: gal te gser dang dngul chu yi //
translated: If you say that the appearance of the mixture of gold and silver

original: ldan pa snang ba yin zhe na /üîΩgser dang dngul chu la sogs pa 'dres par snang ba yin pa'i rdzas ni yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: ldan pa snang ba yin zhe na / gser dang dngul chu la sogs pa 'dres par snang ba yin pa'i rdzas ni yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: is the appearance of possession,üîΩthen we would reply that the substance that is the appearance of the mixture of gold and silver and so on does not exist.

original: 'on kyang rigs mi mthun pa'i rdul phran la brten pa'i ldan pa snang ba 'di ltar na mi snang ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs mi mthun pa'i rdul phran la brten pa'i ldan pa snang ba 'di ltar na mi snang ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: However, the appearance of possession that is based on atoms of different types does exist.

original: gang las ma mthong can rten rtogs /
analyzed: gang las ma mthong can rten rtogs /
translated: If you say that it is not seen, then how is its basis conceived?

original: rdul phra rab de dag rang gi ngo bor mi snang ba yin na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab de dag rang gi ngo bor mi snang ba yin na /
translated: If those subtle particles do not appear as their own entity,

original: ma mthong ba de dag la brten pa'i ldan pa gang yin pa de ni rten ma mthong ba can dbang po las 'das pa nyid kyang yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: ma mthong ba de dag la brten pa'i ldan pa gang yin pa de ni rten ma mthong ba can dbang po las 'das pa nyid kyang yin pa de ltar na /
translated: then the possession that is based on those that are not seen is also the unseen support, which is beyond the sense faculties.

original: ji ltar de mthong ba yin ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar de mthong ba yin ji ltar na /
translated: In that case, how can they be seen?

original: ro gzugs la sogs ldan pa 'gal //
analyzed: ro gzugs la sogs ldan pa 'gal //
translated: It is contradictory that they possess taste, form, and so on.

original: ji ltar btung ba la sogs pa rdzas sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ldan pa ni btung ba la sogs pa'i ming can gyi yon tan yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar btung ba la sogs pa rdzas sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ldan pa ni btung ba la sogs pa'i ming can gyi yon tan yin na /
translated: If the characteristics of possession that possess various substances such as drink are the qualities that are called drink and so on,

original: yon tan rnams kyang yon tan la med pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na de'i ro dang gzugs la sogs pa ldan pa yin /
analyzed: yon tan rnams kyang yon tan la med pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na de'i ro dang gzugs la sogs pa ldan pa yin /
translated: then since qualities do not exist in qualities, how can they possess taste, form, and so on?

original: sogs pa'i sgra smos pas ni dri dang reg bya la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra smos pas ni dri dang reg bya la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes smell, tactility, and so on.

original: rdul phran rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams @41a * //
analyzed: rdul phran rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams @41a * //
translated: The form and so on of those subtle particles

original: rigs mi 'dra bas chod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs mi 'dra bas chod pa'i phyir /
translated: are obstructed by different types.

original: 'bras bu rtsom ba can ma yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyang dbang po las 'das pa yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: 'bras bu rtsom ba can ma yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyang dbang po las 'das pa yin pa de ltar na /
translated: because it is not the creator of the effect, it is also beyond the senses.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin na /
translated: If it does not grasp form, etc.,

original: 'jig rten na btung ba gzugs bzang pa dang btung ba zhim po zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten na btung ba gzugs bzang pa dang btung ba zhim po zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyang mthong ngo //
translated: we see that in the world, there is the expression ‚Äúbeautiful form‚Äù and ‚Äúdelicious drink.‚Äù

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: gal te nyer btags las 'dong na //
analyzed: gal te nyer btags las 'dong na //
translated: if you go by the secondary meaning,

original: rdul phran rnams tshogs pa 'dus pa gang yin pa de dag nyid la ldan pa yang 'du ba yin pa de ltar na don gcig la 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir ldan pa nye bar btags nas ro la sogs pa rdul phra rab kyi chos rnams bstan pa yin
analyzed: rdul phran rnams tshogs pa 'dus pa gang yin pa de dag nyid la ldan pa yang 'du ba yin pa de ltar na don gcig la 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir ldan pa nye bar btags nas ro la sogs pa rdul phra rab kyi chos rnams bstan pa yin
translated: the collection of atoms is the aggregation of atoms. If conjunction is also aggregation, then since conjunction is the contact of two things, the secondary meaning of conjunction is the teaching of the subtle atoms of taste, etc.

original: te / dper na btung ba rnams bzang po zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: te / dper na btung ba rnams bzang po zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúbeautiful drink.‚Äù

original: de la dngos su gzugs la sogs pa'i ldan pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dngos su gzugs la sogs pa'i ldan pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But in reality, there is no conjunction of form, etc.

original: gal te de ltar yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na de'i tshe /
translated: If this is so, then

original: blo yi tha dad yod blo ste //
analyzed: blo yi tha dad yod blo ste //
translated: The cognition of the cow and the cognition of the horse are different cognitions.

original: ji ltar 'o ma la sogs pa la rigs mi mthun pa dang 'dres pa med par dngos kyis ro la sogs pa rtogs pa de ltar btung ba la sogs pa zhim po la sogs pa'i blor mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'o ma la sogs pa la rigs mi mthun pa dang 'dres pa med par dngos kyis ro la sogs pa rtogs pa de ltar btung ba la sogs pa zhim po la sogs pa'i blor mi 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the cognition of taste, etc., in milk, etc., is not the cognition of something delicious to drink, etc., because there is no mixing of different kinds.

original: nye bar btags pa tsam las dngos po de lta bu'i ngo bo can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa tsam las dngos po de lta bu'i ngo bo can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For, it is not the case that the thing itself has such a nature, merely because of the designation.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag dngos dang nye bar btags pa de'i chos can yin pa de dag ni de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi shes pa mtshungs pa'i yul dag ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag dngos dang nye bar btags pa de'i chos can yin pa de dag ni de'i rgyu mtshan can gyi shes pa mtshungs pa'i yul dag ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Those things which are the bases of the real and the nominal are not the objects of a cognition which has a similar reason,

original: khra mo dang yur bu ba dag ni ba lang gi shes pa mtshungs pa'i yul dag ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: khra mo dang yur bu ba dag ni ba lang gi shes pa mtshungs pa'i yul dag ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as the beautiful woman and the canal are not the objects of a similar cognition of a cow.

original: 'o ma dang btung ba la yang dngos po dang nye bar btags pa ro la sogs pa dang ldan pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o ma dang btung ba la yang dngos po dang nye bar btags pa ro la sogs pa dang ldan pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The pervasion is established by the contradictory pervasion: Milk and drink have the nature of the real and the nominal, because they have taste, etc.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: srog chags thams cad la ro la sogs pa'i ngo bo yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo can gyi rtogs pa yod par 'gyur ba de ltar na /
analyzed: srog chags thams cad la ro la sogs pa'i ngo bo yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo can gyi rtogs pa yod par 'gyur ba de ltar na /
translated: Then all living beings would have the realization that has the nature of the correct knowledge of the nature of taste and so on.

original: 'dir bshad pa 'dis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa 'dis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: In that case, what would be the point of this explanation?

original: gang de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: That is not possible in any way.

original: gzhan yang gal te don gcig la 'phrod pa 'du ba las de'i chos nye bar btags nas /üîΩtha snyad byed pa yin no /üîΩji ltar mngar ba'i ring zhes bya ba'i tha snyad ji ltar yin khyed la ring ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te don gcig la 'phrod pa 'du ba las de'i chos nye bar btags nas / tha snyad byed pa yin no / ji ltar mngar ba'i ring zhes bya ba'i tha snyad ji ltar yin khyed la ring ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, if the term long is imputed to a thing due to the contact of one thing with another,üîΩthen the term long would not be imputed to you.

original: 'di ltar bya rnams la brgyus pa ldan pa'i mtshan nyid can nam /üîΩgrangs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'du ba gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid yon tan nyid yin pa'i phyir @41b ring po'i chad kyi ming can gyi yon tan yod pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya rnams la brgyus pa ldan pa'i mtshan nyid can nam / grangs kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'du ba gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid yon tan nyid yin pa'i phyir @41b ring po'i chad kyi ming can gyi yon tan yod pa ma yin zhing /
translated: For example, the term long is not imputed to birds because they have the characteristic of being connected or the characteristic of being a number.üîΩThat which is the characteristic of being connected or the characteristic of being a number is not a quality that has the name long because it is itself a quality.

original: gang la 'du ba dang ldan pa nyid bya rnams la yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang la 'du ba dang ldan pa nyid bya rnams la yang ma yin /
translated: That which has the characteristic of being connected or the characteristic of being a number is not long.

original: ji ltar na mngar ba'i ring po zhes bya bas nye bar btags pas kyang ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na mngar ba'i ring po zhes bya bas nye bar btags pas kyang ston par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be taught by the designation of a long sweet?

original: de bas na don gcig la 'phrod pa 'du ba la de'i chos nye bar btags pas kyang tha snyad du bya ba'i rtogs pa legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don gcig la 'phrod pa 'du ba la de'i chos nye bar btags pas kyang tha snyad du bya ba'i rtogs pa legs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a good understanding of convention to designate the property of one thing that is in contact with another thing.

original: gang la rdzas med pa de la yang gal te ldan pa las snang ba la sogs par rtogs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang la rdzas med pa de la yang gal te ldan pa las snang ba la sogs par rtogs pa de'i tshe /
translated: If, in the case of that which is not a substance, one understands the appearance, etc. of that which is endowed with it,

original: de nyid gzhan la yang yod pa de ltar na /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan la yang yod pa de ltar na /
translated: then that very thing exists for another, and so

original: gzhan yan lag can rtogs pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gzhan yan lag can rtogs pas ci zhig bya /
translated: what is the use of understanding another whole?üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / de ldan rang gi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de ldan rang gi ngo bo nyid //
translated: the nature of that which is endowed with it

original: rdzas kyi ngo bo tha dad pa dang / brjod pa dag las tha dad pa grangs ldan las la sogs pa pa'i snang bar gyur ba'i ngo bo dang blo la snang ngo //
analyzed: rdzas kyi ngo bo tha dad pa dang / brjod pa dag las tha dad pa grangs ldan las la sogs pa pa'i snang bar gyur ba'i ngo bo dang blo la snang ngo //
translated: is the nature of a substance, different from the expression, different from the number, etc. , and is the nature that appears in the appearance, and appears to the mind.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni rnam par phye ba dang / gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa dang spyi la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni rnam par phye ba dang / gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa dang spyi la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the distinction, difference, non-difference, universal, etc.

original: de ltar grangs dang ldan pa rdzas dang sgra las tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar grangs dang ldan pa rdzas dang sgra las tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, number does not exist separately from substance and sound.

original: rdzas nyid yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: rdzas nyid yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Substance itself does not exist.

original: 'on kyang re zhig khas blangs nas de skad du bshad do de bas na gzugs la sogs pa nyid dang sgra 'ba' zhig yin gyi grangs la sogs pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang re zhig khas blangs nas de skad du bshad do de bas na gzugs la sogs pa nyid dang sgra 'ba' zhig yin gyi grangs la sogs pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, we provisionally accept it and explain it in that way. Therefore, only form, etc., and sound exist; number, etc., do not exist in the least.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang med par rang gi ngo bo'i blo la mi snang ba de ni de las tha dad pa med pa'am /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang med par rang gi ngo bo'i blo la mi snang ba de ni de las tha dad pa med pa'am /
translated: The syllogism is as follows: Whatever is not perceived as having its own nature in the absence of something else is not separate from that something else,

original: don gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin te /üîΩdper na gzugs med par mo gsham gyi bu'i ngo bo'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: don gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin te / dper na gzugs med par mo gsham gyi bu'i ngo bo'i gzugs sam /
translated: or it becomes a different object.

original: gzugs de nyid kyi bdag nyid mi snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs de nyid kyi bdag nyid mi snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the nature of the son of a barren woman is not perceived in the absence of form, or the nature of form itself is not perceived.

original: grangs dang ldan pa dang rnam par phye ba dang / gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang / spyi dang las dang rdzas la sogs pa yang gzugs la sogs pa med par blo la mi snang ngo zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: grangs dang ldan pa dang rnam par phye ba dang / gzhan nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang / spyi dang las dang rdzas la sogs pa yang gzugs la sogs pa med par blo la mi snang ngo zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Number, possession, differentiation, sameness and difference, universals, actions, substances, and so on do not appear to the mind in the absence of form, etc. This is a natural inference.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gnyis pa la ltos nas ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: In relation to the second probandum, the contradictory of the pervasion is apprehended.

original: gal te de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa med par brjod pa las gzhan du grangs la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa med par brjod pa las gzhan du grangs la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If that is so, then apart from the expression ‚Äúform, etc. do not exist,‚Äù number, etc. do not exist.

original: bum pa dang gcig dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / chen po dang 'gro ba zhes bya ba nge lta bu la sogs pa'i tha snyad rnam grangs su 'gyur zhing shes pa yang gcig gi yul can du gyur ba yin pa de yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa dang gcig dang yang dag par ldan pa dang / chen po dang 'gro ba zhes bya ba nge lta bu la sogs pa'i tha snyad rnam grangs su 'gyur zhing shes pa yang gcig gi yul can du gyur ba yin pa de yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, such expressions as ‚Äúvase and one are in possession of real unity‚Äù and ‚Äúgreat and goer‚Äù would be synonyms, and cognition would also be a subject having a single object, but that is not so.

original: de'i phyir shes pa la sogs pa de @42a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa la sogs pa de @42a * //
translated: Therefore, that cognition, etc.

original: dag ni don tha dad pa'i yul can yin pa de dag ltar na bum pa la sogs pa dag las grangs la sogs pa don gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: dag ni don tha dad pa'i yul can yin pa de dag ltar na bum pa la sogs pa dag las grangs la sogs pa don gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: If they are subjects of different objects, then number and so on are different objects from the pot and so forth.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las shes pa khyad par can gyi yul du gyur pa de ni de las don gzhan yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las shes pa khyad par can gyi yul du gyur pa de ni de las don gzhan yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is the object of a special cognition is different from that, like the color blue and the sound.
